JobTitle: Outreach Associate, Business Development - Atlanta GA Home Office
Text:
Overview:

Company Summary
If you are searching for a fulfilling place to develop your career and an opportunity to make a difference in helping others, then keep reading on. Here at AAC, we have a progressive culture; we listen to your ideas, value a work/life balance, invest in education, and we foster trust and respect for all individuals. Our exceptional comp and strong benefits include company matching 401K, medical, dental, vision and life insurance. We are looking for our future leaders, who are not only going to fill the qualifications for this job description, but who are going to exceed expectations. Be a part of a team whose mission is to provide quality, compassionate, and innovative care to adults struggling with addiction and co-occurring mental health disorders. Our purpose and passion are to empower patients, their families, and our communities by helping individuals achieve recovery and optimal wellness of the mind, body, and spirit.
Job Summary:
Outreach Associates are responsible for building relationships with qualified referral partners in assigned territory, for the purpose of facilitating admissions to American Addiction Centers Treatment Programs.
Responsibilities:

Duties and Responsibilities:
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily.
The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Identifies, builds, and maintains relationships with key referral partners.
Maintains a regular servicing schedule that organizes a balance of referral partner maintenance and new business development.
Manages all client related communication and CRM remotely, via AAC provided smart mobile devices. Communication may frequently fall outside of regular business hours (including weekends). Occasional overnight travel will be required.
Effectively converts a general inquiry to a rescue by managing the admissions process. Outreach Associates are measured monthly against companywide Key Performance Indicators. (KPI’s).
Has a general understanding of treatment modalities, levels of care, and industry best practices for treating substance use and co-occurring disorders.
Possesses the ability to multi-task, work with minimal supervision and problem solve through a variety of scenarios.
Conducts quality presentations for agencies, hospital staff, discharge planners, and other groups as they are identified.
Builds and maintains productive interdepartmental relationships.
Appropriate dress expected.
Adheres to all expense limitations and guidelines and submits monthly expenses via Expensify by the designated deadline.
Ability to clearly communicate with key members of the team, regarding potential admits and clients in the pipeline.
Ability to assist clinical team with discharge planning – identifying and contacting appropriate facilities for transfer of care when needed.
Knowledge of managed care and insurance- as it relates to mental health benefits- is a plus.
Outreach Associates must have the skills and competency to communicate with people at all levels of the organization; including- executive management, patients, and external agencies.
Qualifications:

Education/Experience:
Four-year degree or equivalent demonstrated experience in addiction treatment marketing field.
1+ years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Organizational skills
Ability to multitask
Ability to travel through an area covering multiple states
Technologically savvy
Ability to create reports outlining weekly visits
Knowledge of the substance abuse industry preferred
Physical Requirements
“AAC is committed to principles of equal opportunities for all employees. The Company will provide reasonable accommodations that are necessary to comply with State and Federal disability discrimination laws”
Ability to sit, use hands and fingers, talk or hear, and smell continually. Ability to stand, walk and reach frequently. Ability to climb or balance, stoop, kneel, or crouch occasionally.
Ability to frequently lift and carry up to 10 lbs. and occasionally lift and carry up to 25 lbs.
Close vision required to see computer monitor, read documents, and operate copy and fax machine. Distance vision required to drive an automobile, if driving is a requirement of the job.
Work environment is indoors and climate controlled. Occasionally exposed to outdoor weather conditions.
Moderate noise levels as found in a business office with computer printers, households with TVs and dishwashers, and driving light traffic.
Certifications and Licenses:
Valid driver's license, and ability pass MVR check.
Other Work Requirements:
Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. Ability to write routine reports and execute general correspondence. Ability to speak effectively before groups of customers or employees of an organization.
Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form. Ability to deal with problems involving several concrete variables in standardized situations
Ability to travel with frequency
American Addiction Centers is an equal opportunity employer. American Addiction Centers prohibits employment practices that discriminate against individuals or groups of employees on the basis of age, color disability, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, pregnancy, veteran or military status, genetic information or any other category deemed protected by state and/or federal law.

JobTitle: Social Media Insights Analyst - North America
Text:
At The Social Element, we are currently looking for a Social Media Insights Analyst to join our Global Team, based in North America, to be responsible for the creation and on-time delivery of high quality social media strategic reports (including monthly, quarterly campaign and crisis) as well as serving as a partner to our clients by offering strategic advice and recommendations based on social media insights.
This is a full time remote position based in North America.
WHAT YOU’LL DO
Deliver social media monthly and quarterly insight reports, competitor analysis, social media campaign reports, review data and provide key insights and recommendations
Setup social media tools, optimize social media data searches and queries
Deliver and present insights presentations on social media results
Meet with key stakeholders to help manage their insight needs and provide innovative recommendations
Quickly respond to ad-hoc report requests, and requests for strategic guidance
Be the expert in social media insights, with ability to articulate and communicate these with authority to clients and staff
Identify innovative ways to present Insights using new technology or methods, while striving to always answer the “so what?” question for our clients on each of our reports
Exceed our clients’ expectations – we work with the biggest and most famous brands in the world and they look to us to lead and deliver an efficient and exceptional experience
Do all you can to ensure that The Social Element maintains its market leader position in social – providing strategic, actionable insights for our clients
WHAT YOU’LL BRING
Experience working in the social media industry, particularly with insights, strategy or analytics
Experience creating social media reports and report design
Solid experience of using and setting up Brandwatch or similar social listening tools e.g. Sprinklr, Khoros
The ability to optimize and work with tables, graphs and resizing or editing of images
An understanding of common social media key performance indicators and social metrics to help brands make decisions
An in-depth understanding of social, processes and tools and the ability to set up tools, interpret data into non-technical language and deliver social media analytics with recommendations
Experience with Powerpoint
A responsive and positive attitude
DESIRABLE
Experience setting up and delivering reporting using Global Web Index (GWI)
Experience with report design
ABOUT YOU
You have the ability to translate technical to non-technical, telling stories with data, and summarizing what is important to our clients along with insightful recommendations
You have the ability to work independently under pressure to meet key client deliverables.
You have strong writing skills which allow you to communicate clearly
You are logical in your thinking but bring creative and holistic problem-solving ideas.
You have passion for social media and keep up with the latest trends and industry practices
ABOUT US
The Social Element is not your typical social media agency. Our number one focus is to help brands build genuine human connections with their consumers. We partner with our clients to find business solutions through human interactions driven by data and insights. We use insights to form strategy, then execute across all areas of social, including community management, listening, content, reporting, and crisis management.
We pride ourselves in having exceptional talent in our business. As the pioneers of social, we stay at the forefront by constantly creating, learning, and guiding. Our relationships with our clients are true partnerships as we become an extension of their team: trusted, committed, leading.
The Social Element values
Do it Well
Be One Team
Do the Right Thing
Keep Pioneering
Make Them Smile
HOW TO APPLY
If all this sounds like you, simply upload your/resume and a cover letter (or a link to your cover letter video if you prefer). *Make sure to include the following details in your cover letter/video, or we won’t be able to process your application:
Details of your personal/professional experience in social media insights, analytics and/or strategy.
Why you are interested in being part of our team at The Social Element
The Social Element is a global social media management agency delivering high-quality, multi-lingual social media management, customer care, social listening, insight, and consultancy. It also offers crisis management training and simulations via its partner brand, Polpeo.

Overview:

Overview: This position is responsible for working with internal and external customers via phone, email, online monitoring, and any other channels. The Customer Service Specialist processes service requests, monitors online conversations and immediately acknowledges, responds and forwards the post to the appropriate division or Advocate, based on content of message received. The consistent focus is to provide an exceptional experience to internal and external customers by being empathetic, reliable, and personable. This position is remote.
Company Overview:At Beazer, we build homes. We also build careers. Driven by a purpose to create durable and growing value, the team behind each home across the country is diverse, ambitious, and dedicated. Together, we shape an environment that encourages learning and community engagement, provides opportunities for advancement, and aligns compensation with performance.
We look for those who believe in the power of choice, teamwork, improvement, openness, and urgency; who approach their work with an attitude of focus, grit, and accountability; and who will be guided by the principles of safety, integrity, respect, and fun.

Primary Duties & Responsibilities:
Monitor social media and assist the Escalation Resolution group (Customer Advocates) who address customer and homeowner concerns via various channels (phone, email, online, social media); continuously seeking to improve the customer experience in all contact points with Beazer Homes.
Engage with homeowners for customer care initiatives via phone, email, and online platforms, both publicly and via private conversation. Platforms include but are not limited to: Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc.
Engage with customers for sales and marketing initiatives via phone, email, and online platforms, both publicly and via private messaging. Platforms include but are not limited to: Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc.
Engage with customers for support throughout the construction experience via phone, email, and online platforms, both publicly and via private conversation. Platforms include but are not limited to: Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc.
Provide customers with support throughout the construction process to improve their overall home building experience with Beazer Homes. The Associate Advocate will provide support via phone, email, and online platforms, both publicly and via private conversation. Platforms include but are not limited to: Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc.
Monitor Social Media focusing on homeowners and potential customers. Provide immediate response, acknowledgement, and deliver the message to the appropriate team member. (Concerns regarding Customer Care, Construction, Land, Sales, etc.)
Collaborate with National Customer Care, Marketing, Customer Advocate, and Social Media leadership to establish and maintain a consistent writing style, voice, and tone, across all communication channels with homeowners, potential customers, and internal partners.
Work with homeowners/customers on non-escalated requests, via phone, email, social media, and other online platforms.
Develop and foment relationships with internal Division teams, corporate teams, field Customer Care Representatives, field operations teams, sales teams, and others as needed, in order to use this rapport to assure homeowner/customer concerns are addressed, whether escalated matters or otherwise.
Build relationships with internal team members and partners, to seamlessly work with and assure homeowner/customer concerns are addressed, whether escalated matters or otherwise.
Develop the skills needed to transition into the Customer Advocate position.
Aid field associates on systems and processes.
Collaborate with and assist the Customer Advocates when needed.
Respond to all incoming homeowners’ inquiries in a timely and thorough manner.
Perform other duties as assigned.
Education & Experience:
1-2 years in customer-centric industry, with experience in providing customer support via inbound phone system.
Desire to work in Social Media.
Knowledge of and passion for the homebuilding industry.
Skills & Abilities:
Highly developed organization and follow-up skills, with the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
Demonstrated ability to balance priorities while finding creative solutions to difficult/complicated situations.
Demonstrated aptitude to make quick and meaningful connections/relationships with both internal and external partners and understand different perspectives.
Demonstrated ability to communicate/work with all personality types, in emotionally charged situations while maintaining a consistently calm and positive attitude.
Determined, perseverant, flexible, and dedicated.
Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively, proactively and reactively, with a clear and individualized message.
Demonstrated ability to treat each interaction (internal & external) with kindness, understanding, positivity, and integrity.
Demonstrated ability to set the correct expectations and educate others by giving timely and effective information.
Technical Knowledge & Experience:
MUST be able to demonstrate strong editorial judgment and writing ability by successful completion of the required assessment tests in person.
Knowledge of social media channels and usual interaction norms on each platform, (Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, blogs, etc.). Experience with Sprinklr, and Salesforce is a plus.
Physical Requirements:
Typical office environment.
Additional Responsibilities

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required. All employees may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed. Additionally, an employee's job duties may change at any time, in the company's sole discretion.

Personal Information Collection Notice for Job Applicants
In order to process your application, we will ask you to create an account and provide us with certain personal information, including your identification data (e.g. name, date of birth, driver’s license number, contact details), education information, and professional and employment history. If you have any questions about our privacy policy or would like to learn more, please visit Beazer.com/privacy, which includes a link to an additional notice for California residents and which link can also be visited directly at Beazer.com/Californiaprivacy.

Join a fast-growing B2B media company on the East Coast/Midwest as a Business Development Rep! Simpler Media Group, Inc. (“SMG”) is looking for an entrepreneurial, collaborative team member to work side-by-side with our VP fo Sales and Midwest Regional Sales Director as a Business Development Representative (BDR).SMG grew out of the CMSWire.com publication, which was launched back in 2003. As a native digital publisher, SMG has rapidly adapted to the evolving customer and employee-facing digital landscapes, and continues to follow the evolution of digital customer experience, the digital workplace and enterprise information management.What You’ll DoResponsibilities include inbound sales, appointment setting, account research and assisting the sales team to achieve revenue goals. Your team will be selling marketing solutions, research services and event sponsorships to the world’s top-tier technology companies.Responsibilities:Identify new accounts for strategic outreachEmail/phone outreach to accounts currently not being worked or unknownResearch industry events and set calendars for attendanceProduce weekly sales reports for strategic outreachHelp manage product marketing collateral and maintain documents with up-to-date sell sheetsPerform Marketo-based research tasks, helping to identify prospects and accountsManage the flow of inbound inquiries and the sync to Salesforce.comHelp with RFPs and sales presentationsWork with delivery teams to manage product inventory and availabilityCoordinate and upload basecamp projects for delivery teamsTravel to trade shows, industry events and client meetingsCompensation:SMG will pay a competitive base salary, sales commissions (% of gross sale) and additional bonuses/incentives (“x” dollars per scheduled call) based on achievement of revenue targets. OTE range - $65k-$85k based on experience and performance.Who You AreRequirements include 1+ years B2B media, marketing and/or event sponsorship sales or related enterprise sales experience, experience with Salesforce, Docusign, Google Docs, Marketo and Slack.Desired Characteristics:Solid understanding of sales processesSelf-sufficient with the ability to work remote with minimal supervisionExperience in working with dynamic teams and collaborating virtuallyDetail oriented and process oriented with an eye for process evolutionHighly-proficient in the latest collaboration and productivity technologiesExcellent customer service skillsAbility to meet revenue and sales quotasAbility to work in a fast paced environmentDesire to grow your career as a sales professionalWho We AreWhatever your role, we bring purpose and new challenges to your everyday life. If you are driven to succeed in the world's best technology market, you’re in the right place. If you’re flexible, ambitious and unwavering, you’ll fit in. If you are excited about a diverse, global culture then SMG is the perfect place for you.Want to know more? Check out our team - https://www.simplermedia.com/about/#teamOur mission at SMG is to inform, inspire and connect our community. SMG serves an online audience of more than 3 million readers spread across the globe, with the majority of our readership located in North America. We produce about 150+ original articles per month, with topics structured around our robust editorial calendar. SMG publishes CMSWire.com, Reworked.co and produces the Digital Experience Summit and Digital Workplace Experience conferences.Job Type: Full-timePay: $45,000.00 - $60,000.00 per yearBenefits:401(k)Dental insuranceEmployee discountFlexible scheduleFlexible spending accountHealth insuranceLife insurancePaid time offProfessional development assistanceRelocation assistanceVision insuranceSchedule:Monday to FridaySupplemental Pay:Commission payEducation:Bachelor's (Preferred)Experience:Sales Experience: 1 year (Preferred)professional work: 1 year (Preferred)Salesforce CRM: 1 year (Preferred)Work Location:Multiple locationsPaid Training:YesManagement:Team LeadKey LeaderCompany's website:https://www.simplermedia.com/Benefit Conditions:Only full-time employees eligibleWork Remotely:YesCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview process

Text: WHAT YOU’LL DOCOACH | A manager at CTC is a coach to their direct reports. As PSeM, you are an extra set of eyes, ears, and hands across all accounts their Paid Search Buyer’s (PSeB) build and buy for. A sounding board for strategy and creativity, offering advice on when and how to scale. Moreover, how to scale effectively and efficiently. This means you are constantly looking for ways to make our PSeB's better. Testing new methods, challenging the status quo, and finding inspiration in building and buying to fuel our PSeB's drive.TRAIN | There is a general way of doing things and then there is the "CTC way." As the PSeM, we're depending on and trusting you to build up and bring out the knowledge, skills and abilities our PSeB’s will need to be successful here at CTC. This directly goes back to the PSeM being in service and support of the PSeBs. You cultivate an ecosystem of learning around creative testing, platform challenges, and workflow management. PSeMs train the PSeB’s to actively be part of the solution to their overall Growth Team's success, ADmission members and Expert Buyer clients.INNOVATE | The PSeM finds ways of expanding platform tools and features across all paid search channels as the driving force to keep CTC on the cutting edge. Search platforms are constantly evolving. That means that staying on top of updates and understanding root cause effects and chain reactions will become your middle name. Taking that one step further, it is your job to educate your PSeB’s (and the rest of CTC) on your keen understanding of cutting edge updates.WHAT SUCCESS LOOKS LIKE Success in Your Day to Day Looks LikeThe PSeM supplies the PSeB’s with the tools, training and insight to drive the best results. They are a consistent support to the buyers and come alongside them in the problems they face while at the same time challenging the PSeB’s to think outside the box and break “foam” walls.The PSeM fosters a culture of continuing growth and collaboration. They encourage the sharing of new learnings, tactics, and resources among the PSeBs and proudly celebrate the wins when they occur. The PSeM finds creative ways to keep the PSeB’s engaged and motivated in a remote environment.The PSeM is liaison between the various CTC departments and the Paid Search Buyers. They work with other department heads to implement company-wide strategies or systems. They are also the voice for the PSeB’s as they communicate with executive management on the challenges and opportunities that they see within the PSeB’s ecosystem.Success in Your First Three to Six Months Looks LikeThe PSeM brings learnings to the entire company and is the leader in paid search strategy. The PSeM is a public voice that not only shares learnings with the company but with other relevant communities helping maintain CTC’s position as a thought leader. The PSeM creates easily digestible learnings for people to share with clients and is always on the forefront of new tactics and strategies.The PSeM is always on the lookout to hire talented buyers and ensure that Growth Teams have buyers they need. They also assist in creating a smooth onboarding process for new PSeBs and set clear expectations of what success in the role looks like.WHAT YOU’LL BRING TO THE TABLE3 + years experience in building and buying Google Ads, preferred.1 + years experience working in a digital marketing agency, preferred.1 + years experience managing a team of talented, driven, and eager to learn individuals, preferred.Proven ability to influence teams and collaborate effectively.Competence in Asana, Google Docs, Google Sheets, Google Drive and Dropbox.Competence and/or experience in Google Analytics, preferred.Perception and understanding when it comes to navigating human relationships, especially when it comes to building trust and effectiveness across teams.Demonstrated ability to assess and resolve challenges independently through good judgement, deliberation, decisiveness, and ability to provide guidance to others.Must have a unique combination of humility (willing to do the dirty work) and ambition (vision for what your future holds).Exceptional written and verbal communication skills.Ability to organize, prioritize and manage multiple tasks with great attention to detail.Ability to complete short-term and long-term goals in a proper manner.An insatiable curiosity, and an inability to leave a problem alone until you’ve found one or many different potential solutions.A desire to take risks - but only after carefully examining the calculus and determining that your chosen course of action is most effective.ABOUT US*We’re storytellers, buyers, builders, designers, coaches, partners, leaders, entrepreneurs of our own lives, and in our hearts, we at the Common Thread Collective (CTC), are dreamers.With an untraditional take on marketing, CTC is an ecommerce growth agency helping entrepreneurs of all stripes achieve their dreams.A job is a job is a job. At CTC we don’t hire you for a job. We believe careers are a catalyst for your future self — because we’re not just interested in who you are, but in who you want to be. Come sell stuff online, tell stories, build websites, shape brands, create processes, scale accounts, and help fellow entrepreneurs turn their dreams into reality.We’ll come alongside you and care for you in your pursuits by offering full-time CTC entrepreneurs:Full health, dental, and vision benefits that fit your lifestyle and goals401k program with a 3% company match (post 90 days employment) to bring out the investor inside you4 weeks of paid time off on top of Holidays, your Birthday, and the week of Christmas paid. Go get your R&R on so when you’re at CTC you’re firing on all cylindersA wellness reimbursement program that inspires 360 degrees of health: mentally, physically, and spirituallyAccess to our Tell Me Your Dreams (TMYD) program where you explore life beyond what’s in front of you with a certified mental health coach. Maybe you’ll dream for the first time, we’re here for it. To top it off, if you opt in, we provide you with resources to realize your dreams through our Dream Fund**To be considered, please provide us with a cover letter on why you are interested in working at Common Thread Collective along with your resume*Job Type: Full-timeExperience:Google Analytics: 2 years (Preferred)Google AdWords: 3 years (Preferred)Managing a team: 1 year (Preferred)Digital marketing agency: 1 year (Preferred)

Position Title: Sales Executive
Reports to: Chief Client Officer
Position Location: Telecommute
Date: 1/17/21
POSITION OVERVIEW:
The Sales Executive will be responsible for using proven ability to drive new business to the organization. Sales Executives are part of a team of sales, service and marketing professionals who leverage the company’s resources to identify, attract and secure contracted business with net new clients. The Sales Executive is the lead salesperson providing strategic and consultative management for a portfolio of new client prospects. Sales Executives are strategic advisors to prospective clients and have in-depth understanding of the client’s business, goals, challenges, trends, and direction. The position requires passion for helping clients meet their business objectives by providing claims, network and other insurance solutions.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Leads and manages the entire sales cycle from lead generation through close.
Secures contracted business with new clients within a specified territory.
Independently creates and cultivates a pipeline of potential clients.
Utilizes the company’s vast resources to create solutions that exactly meet client needs.
Creates selling opportunities by identifying prospects and evaluating their position in the industry, researching and analyzing sales options.
Regularly contacts and meets with prospective clients to understand their buying decisions and needs.
Identifies, pursues, and qualifies growth opportunities for the company.
Establishes and maintains productive peer-to-peer relationships with customers and prospects.
Develops winning strategies, coordinates internal resources and leads communication with prospective clients.
Provides real time updates through sound pipeline management and documentation.
Works closely with business leaders to build client level solutions.
Leverages professional network, colleague industry contacts, conferences and other means to gain access to potential clients.
Skillfully gains access to decision makers, overcomes objections and obstacles.
Embodies the Alacrity Way of Selling throughout all interactions with internal and external stakeholders.
PREFERRED CANDIDATE QUALIFICATIONS:
Demonstrates the ability to quickly gain a firm understanding of company strategic objectives; clearly understands his/her functional responsibility for these objectives; has a track record of successfully implementing goals, strategies and plans essential to supporting overall company strategy.
Strong self-motivation with a pioneering/entrepreneurial attitude.
Proven and successful sales track record with experience in achieving growth objectives.
Experience performing complex sales engagements within the insurance industry.
Demonstrated experience negotiating contract terms and building solutions that meet client needs.
Ability to understand complex business situations and how to provide solutions.
Conveys a sense of urgency and drives issues to closure.
Uses personal creativity to introduce novel, new ideas, concepts, approaches, processes or tools that enhance the business’s strategic goals and business results.
Remains objective, optimistic and enthusiastic toward work and others, despite resistance.
POSITION QUALIFICATIONS AND TRAITS:
Education:
Bachelor’s degree
Experience:
8+ years’ experience in business development, sales, or program management with a solid track record of designing solutions linked to strategic business goals.
Travel:
Ability to travel up to 40%
Required Skills:
Must possess excellent written and oral presentation skills
Ability to successfully and sustainably gain access to decision makers
Must possess solid analytical skills and attention to detail
Must be consultative and solution oriented
Proactive ability to translate market insights into action plans
Demonstrated negotiation competencies with excellent problem solving skills
Strong leadership and consensus building skills
Demonstrated ability to interface with all levels of clientele
Business and financial acumen
Aptitude for selling

Who We Are

Samsara, founded in 2015, is a leader in Industrial IoT and our mission is to increase the efficiency, safety, and sustainability of the operations that power our economy. Our solutions combine hardware and software to bring real-time visibility, analytics, and AI to operations across various industries. Samsara's fast-growing team is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices in San Jose, Atlanta, and London. Our team has raised $930M from Andreessen Horowitz, General Catalyst, Tiger Global, Dragoneer, AllianceBernstein Holding LP, Franklin Templeton, General Atlantic, Sands Capital Management and Warburg Pincus LLC.

At Samsara, we welcome all. All sizes, colors, cultures, sexes, beliefs, religions, ages, people. We depend on the unique approaches of our team members to help us solve complex problems. We are committed to increasing diversity across our team and ensuring that Samsara is a place where people from all backgrounds can make an impact.
About the role:

Samsara is a fast-paced, creative, and customer-oriented tech company with offices in San Francisco, Atlanta and London. We are looking for a highly experienced individual to join our team as a Manager, Accounts Receivable (AR). In this role, you'll need to be a partner to the business and oversee the day-to-day operations of the Company's AR processes and teams. We're looking for a people manager who's capable of driving change, building best in class processes, and developing leading metrics to ensure efficient collection of receivables.

In this role, you will:
Manage our team of billing specialists, handling escalations and ensuring they are supported and meeting SLAs
Oversee collections efforts for specific segments of the business
Hire and train stain staff, ensuring all training and process docs are updated to meet changes in the business
Create reports in Netsuite and Salesforce to assist with reporting and to meet requests of the organization
Developing team, ensuring we are hiring on track and building for the future
Set team expectations, follow-through and hold team accountable for deliverables
Set the customer experience standard and deliver consistently
Collaborate effectively and positively with Sales, Operations and Finance teams across Samsara
Expert in excel, able to quickly manipulate and analyze data to facilitate decisions
Champion, role model, and embed Samsara's cultural principles (Obsess Over the Customer, Build for the Long Term, Growth Mindset) as we scale globally and across new offices
Hire, develop, and lead an inclusive, engaged, and high performing team
An ideal candidate has:
4+ years experience in a AR/accounting role
1+ years experience in a people management role, indirect management (team lead) okay
Bachelor's degree or higher, preferably in finance or accounting
Detail-oriented, high-energy, positive disposition and excellent communications skills
Focused on teamwork and collaboration
Process Optimization/Strategy Experience
Stellar Customer Service Skills - ability to problem solve customer issues to resolution
Experience with large customer interaction volume
Intermediate Excel skills
Proven track record of sound decision making, taking ownership and delivering results in a leadership role
Demonstrated ability to meet deadlines while managing multiple projects
Experience with Netsuite and Salesforce preferred
Experience in a Saas/Subscription based business is a plus

Benefits

Working at Samsara has its perks: for all full-time global employees, we provide private medical and dental insurance plus growth and development opportunities, as well as regular virtual team and company events. In the US we offer flexible vacation time, EMEA employees receive 25 vacation days plus national bank holidays. Post-COVID we'll be back in our global offices with numerous in-office perks.

Regarding COVID-19

With the spread of COVID-19, Samsara's global offices will remain closed until further notice with the exception of employees that require access to hardware and lab equipment.

Our primary concern is for the health and well-being of our employees as well as candidates. We have transitioned all interviews and onboarding to be conducted virtually via Zoom video conferencing. Employees are also able to work from countries and states where Samsara is a registered entity through June 2021, full list of locations here. All employees are expected to return to our offices when they reopen with the exception of field-based and fully remote roles.

If you have any questions or concerns before applying, feel free to contact us at jobs@samsara.com.

Although this is a permanent Work From Home position, applicants MUST RESIDE IN FLORIDA, GEORGIA OR TEXAS.Our Company has an exciting and challenging remote opportunity for a Mid-Level Environment Artist.What We DoWe utilize engines like Lumion and Unreal to create fully visualized construction sequences, high-end renderings, and 3D virtual tours and walkthroughs. This also includes fully interactive first-person, third-person and virtual reality experiences primarily for use on PC and mobile as well as for the HTC Vive, Oculus Rift, and other mixed-reality devices. We are constantly evolving and expanding the menu of virtual and augmented reality services that we offer to our clients and this expansion brings a unique set of challenges with it.ResponsibilitiesWe can easily get long-winded with our job descriptions, but to attract candidates that are a good fit, we’re going to get right to the key functions/competencies of the position:1) Must be very familiar with modeling software and tools like Modo/Blender/Maya and the typical requirements of a game development pipeline for a 3D Environment Artist. If you don’t know what we mean by this, please do not apply.2) Must be a self-starter with a can-do attitude and a strong work ethic. We work in a deadline-driven industry, so if a deliverable is due, it’ll be up to you to manage your time and workflow effectively and efficiently.3) Must have impeccable communication skills. Being a good, effective and respectful communicator is very important. Must also be willing to participate in constant communication with our partners and clients.4) Must have an in-depth understanding of how to push visual quality while maintaining appropriate optimization for run-time performance. This includes, but is not limited to, knowledge of the following:ModelingTexturingLODsShaders and materialsLighting5) Must be willing to learn, experiment with new techniques and implement critiques to improve overall workflow (if you’re not into learning something new every day, this probably isn’t for you).Other QualificationsTrust and integrity are “tops” in our book.Being professional, in every sense of the word, is of paramount importance.Needs to have a positive, can-do attitude (we’re hyper-entrepreneurial, and looking to grow/expand our business – “negative nelly’s” need not apply).Being “personable” is always a great quality to have.Being respectful of other people’s opinions and knowing how to professionally express your opinion is important (we’re hiring for growth, and we want you to know – your opinion matters, and your opinion will always be considered).EducationWe’ve never been big believers that a college degree defines you, what you’re capable of accomplishing, or the value you could bring to our company. That said, if you have a degree in Video Game Design or a similar major, great. If not, it’s cool, just tell us what makes you unique!Additional InformationThis is a salaried, fully remote position.You can check-out our website at Preswerx.comCompensation & BenefitsCompetitive salary that’s commensurate with experience / capabilities / skills.Health benefits.Generous amount of Paid Time Off.Typical holidays off with pay (to be better defined during the interview process).We strive (but can’t guarantee) that we’ll close the office (with pay) between the Christmas and New Year’s Day holiday.Job Type: Full-timePay: $35,000.00 - $45,000.00 per yearBenefits:Dental insuranceFlexible scheduleHealth insurancePaid time offVision insuranceSchedule:8 hour shiftMonday to FridaySupplemental Pay:Bonus payWork Location:Fully RemoteCompany's website:preswerx.com

Itential provides powerful multi-domain network automation software to companies worldwide, ranging across a wide variety of industries. We are committed to building world-class products and being the market leader in network automation. Our corporate headquarters is in Atlanta with additional resources located throughout North America and in both EMEA & APAC!
Named one of America’s fastest-growing private companies by Inc. Magazine in 2020, Itential continues to build, innovate, and dominate the network automation market. Recently, Itential was named a “Progressive Leader in Network Automation” by MarketsandMarkets™ and even further validated in Gartner’s latest Market Guide for Network Automation and Orchestration. Additionally, 451 Research now a part of S&P Global Market Intelligence, released their Market Guide for Networking and mentioned, “Itential is pushing the envelope of network automation and orchestration with products that give enterprise IT the ability to automate complex workflows without writing code, while allowing developers to integrate with Itential’s output.”
Itential is looking to add the role of Client Partner Executive. The role is intended to ensure customers receive the highest level of sponsorship, value, and assistance in leveraging the Itential Automation Platform to realize their strategy for network automation. Specifically the role requires the ability to manage all customer interactions related to quality assurance associated with the ongoing business expansion – service engagements, software renewals, technology roadmap discussions, platform upgrades, and strategy alignment workshops.
Job Description:
The Itential family is driven, energetic and a committed leader in the network automation industry. The Itential culture is important and a reflection of the value we place on the customer, co-worker and mission. Your work here will be important. Our customers are some of the most notable and largest companies in the world. As such, the team will have the confidence and commensurate expectation that you will execute on your responsibilities to continue to build shared success. Additionally, the role is responsible to represent Itential to customers and partners giving them confidence that their business, satisfaction and success is our priority.
Responsibilities and Duties:
Gain solid understanding of the Itential Automation Solution in order to support both the internal Itential teams and customers –understand completely Itential business standards/guidelines
Be self-led, always look for opportunities to learn
Know your competition, partners and their involvement with customers
Build, maintain, support and respect internal relationships (Marketing, Sales, Executive Leadership, Delivery and Customer Success) teams to ensure collaboration when leveraging Itential resources to support business requests
Act as liaison between customer and Itential on necessary business matters, effectively plan to make sure customer and Itential commitments are met, keep things organized and on track
Accept ownership of all post sales activities; this is critical to enable the Sales team to move forward rather than take pause from the sales motion to address post sales efforts
Accept ownership of customer satisfaction and the continued growth of business with customers
Proactively identify any barriers that could impact customer networks and create mitigation and contingency plans
Provide outstanding partnership within Itential with full engagement where applicable, timely responses, have the “run towards the fire attitude”
Work with customers to understand the needs of their business in order to focus on automation solutions to address critical needs to produce successful and meaningful business outcomes
Proactively identify any barriers that could impact customer networks and create contingency and mitigation plans
Provide outstanding quality services and ensure customer satisfaction by addressing customer concerns and queries in a professional, timely and accurate manor
Create meaningful productive customer collaboration meetings i.e. QBR, JPOR, working/whiteboard sessions etc.
Work with customers as appropriate on escalated issues to expedite resolution
Develop appropriate customer communication for alignment on expectations on deals and requests
Qualifications and Skills:
A minimum of 8 years’ experience in Software, Cloud, or Infrastructure such as Computer, Network, Storage, etc.
Proven ability to work effectively with and across all levels of business and IT contacts within very large and complex organizations
Previous leadership experience
Self-starter with a high level of commitment and energy
Highly trusted individual who maintains and expects high standards for self and team
Proven ability to work with all levels of individuals
You hold a strong track record of quota over-achievement
You partner well and are accustomed to working with the channel
You pride yourself on being an excellent communicator, both written and verbal
You are a dynamic presenter with the ability to translate technical capabilities to business outcomes
Experience building demand with cycle times of 6-9 months
Able to work across IT, Ops, Dev/Ops and Line of Business leaders
Location: Candidates able to regularly work in the Atlanta office are preferred, but will consider qualified remote candidates. The Atlanta office has not yet reopened and local candidates will not be required to come to the office immediately.
Benefits and Perks:
A 401(k) plan, partially matched by Itential
Fully stocked soda fridges and snack pantries
Excellent medical, dental, and vision coverage
Flex work time
Volunteer and community engagement opportunities
Find out more at www.itential.com
This is a direct hire position. No third parties accepted. No S-Corp or Corp-to-Corp.

JobTitle: Associate Technical Product Manager - Data Infrastructure, Permanent Remote, US
Text:
As an Associate Technical Product Manager you will be a key member of the team that designs technical, service and content solutions to support Aledade’s various lines of business. The Associate Technical Product Manager works alongside business owners, data analysts, designers and engineers to define project goals, solution scope, implementation approach, and rollout plans. They are the interface between strategic business owners and development and ensure that Aledade creates a high-quality product with the ability to scale.
Your Responsibilities:
Partner with business owners to cultivate a shared vision for the problem space, constraints, priorities and ideal end state, and be able to articulate and advocate for this perspective.
Work with internal teams and end users to develop a deep understanding of requirements, perform thoughtful solution design, use data to test hypotheses, and support teams throughout execution.
Write detailed user stories for new projects, capturing detailed descriptions of business rationale, requirements, and success criteria that are defined by measurable outcomes.
Participate in daily stand ups, demo days, sprint retros and stakeholder coordination meetings.
Develop short- and long-term roadmaps that deliver maximum value with minimum risk and assume ongoing iteration.
Review support issues related to projects and monitor utilization and expected outcomes.
What We Value:
Minimum of three (3) years of product management experience in technology, technology-enabled services industry, or a SaaS product.
Experience using data and primary research to inform solution design and build internal business understanding.
Excellent organizational and communication skills with an emphasis on problem-solving and building subject matter expertise.
Experience with and understanding of the software development lifecycle and software development methodologies. Preferably experience with Agile / Scrum teams.
Product development experience in the context of the development of a healthcare technology product, especially with clinical and administrative end users.
Knowledge of healthcare administrative and clinical data sets, including demographic, financial and clinical data.
Basic understanding of healthcare administrative or clinical workflows for inpatient, ambulatory or ancillary services.
Experience working with EHR, practice management, revenue cycle or population health products.
Experience with clinical quality measurement and corresponding data sets.
Knowledge of SQL, ideally with PostgreSQL experience.
Knowledge of alternative payment models related to primary care such as MSSP ACOs, Pioneer ACOs, commercial insurance shared savings programs, PCMH.
If you are passionate about transforming the healthcare system into one that best serves the needs of patients, doctors, and society, we’d love for you to join us!
Who We Are:
Aledade is a leader in population health that is using innovative, value based solutions to transform the way physicians interact with their patients. We are on a mission to change healthcare for the better and solve complex problems within the healthcare system.
We follow the simple but radical idea that Aledade only succeeds when our partner practices succeed. From our cutting-edge technology platform to practice transformation services, we provide physicians with everything they need to create and run an accountable care organization (ACO), revamping the way they practice and getting them back to where they should be: quarterbacking their patients’ health care!
Our customized solutions help clinicians in communities across America preserve their autonomy, deliver better care to their patients, reduce overall costs, and keep independent physician practices flourishing.
What Does This Mean for You?
At Aledade, you will be part of a creative culture that is driven by a passion for tackling complex issues with respect, open-mindedness, and a desire to learn. You will work with team members that bring a wide range of experiences, interests, backgrounds, beliefs, and achievements to their work, united by a shared passion for public health and a commitment to the Aledade mission.
We’ve recently been recognized as a Top Workplace by The Washington Post, Best Workplace in HealthCare & Biopharma, Top 100 Best Small & Medium Workplaces, Glassdoor Best Places to Work, a Best and Brightest Companies to Work for in the Nation, a Tech Tribune 10 Best Tech Startups in Maryland and Bethesda, Best Tech for Good, Best Workplaces for Millennials, Best Workplaces for Women, Best Workplaces for Parents, and a 2020 Inno on Fire by DC Inno.

That’s because the things that matter to you also matter to us!
In addition to time off to support work-life balance and enjoyment, we offer the following comprehensive benefits package designed for the needs of our team-members:
Flexible work schedules and ability to work remotely available for many roles
Educational Assistant Program
Robust time off plan (21 days of PTO in your first year!)
Paid Volunteer Days
10 paid holidays
12 weeks paid Parental Leave for all new parents
6 weeks paid sabbatical
Health, dental and vision insurance paid at 80% for employees, dependents, and domestic partners
401(k) with up to 4% match
Stock options
Monthly cell phone stipend
Weekly catered lunches
Jeans everyday workplace
Gender neutral bathrooms
And more!
At Aledade, we don’t just accept differences, we celebrate them! We strive to attract, develop, and retain highly qualified individuals representing the diverse communities where we live and work. Aledade is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Employment policies and decisions at Aledade are based on merit, qualifications, performance, and business needs. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth or medical conditions related to pregnancy or childbirth), gender identity or expression, religion, physical or mental disability, medical condition, legally protected genetic information, marital status, veteran status, or sexual orientation.

JobTitle: Tanzu Service Mesh DevOPS - Opportunity for Working Remotely Atlanta, GA
Text:
Tanzu Service Mesh:
Tanzu service mesh is a modern application networking platform deployed by our customers in on-premise and cloud infrastructure to connect, secure and manage modern and legacy apps. We are part of the broader Tanzu portfolio helping customers achieve their application modernization goals.
Responsibilities:
As DevOPS in Tanzu Service Mesh team you will be responsible for Deploying Microservices and Core Infrastructure to support the TSM SaaS platform. You will be working with developers, testers and management to ensure Tanzu Service Mesh is updated and all the pipelines are constantly green.
Responsibilities include:
Build, maintain and monitor automation systems to improve and maintain the availability of SaaS platform.
Champion processes as GitOPS and Infrastructure as Code
Deploy Observability and Tracing infrastructure
Build and Maintain System Testing environments.
Requirements:
Proficient in a common scripting languages: Bash, Python.
Prior SRE/Operations experience - Experience operating, troubleshooting production issues.
Prior experience using Terraform/CloudFormation/Pulumi in production and at scale.
Prior experience using GitLab CI, Argo/Flux in production and at scale.
Excellent knowledge of Kubernetes/Image Building
Experience working with AWS (or Azure/GCP)
Good understanding of micro-services architectures and deployment strategies
Hands on experience in deploying and maintaining observability tools and distributed tracing tools (Prometheus, Grafana, Jaegar, Fluent etc..)
Familiarity with CI/CD tools and practices
Strong communication and interpersonal skills
Preferred Qualifications:
Familiarity with configuration and operation of VMware products a plus - VMware vSphere, VMWare NSX, Avi Load Balancer
Experience in configuration and operations of service mesh technologies is a plus (Istio, Kuma)
Experience working with other Tanzu products - Tanzu Mission Control, Tanzu Kubernetes Grid.

JobTitle: Solution Platform RTM Manager - Opportunity for Working Remotely Atlanta, GA
Text:
Business Summary:
VMware accelerates digital transformation through a software-defined approach to business and IT. The trusted platform provider of choice for more than 500,000 customers globally, VMware is the pioneer in virtualization and an innovator in cloud and business mobility. A proven leader, VMware allows customers to run, manage, connect and secure applications across clouds and devices in a common operating environment.
Our team of 20,000+ people working in 50+ locations worldwide is committed to building a community where great people want to work long term by living our values of passion, innovation, execution, teamwork, active learning and giving back. If you are ready to accelerate, innovate and lead, join us as we challenge constraints and problem solve for tomorrow today.
The Solution Platform RTM Manager will report into the Worldwide Partner and Commercial Organization, working very closely with the Business Units executives and leaders as well as Corporate and field sales functions. You will be accountable for defining and executing go-to-market strategy, plans and activities to enable VMware partners to sell and deliver offerings based on the VMware Cloud Foundation solution to their existing and new customers. You will work with Product Management, Product Marketing, Partner Marketing, Partner Enablement, Partner Operations and Incentives, Education, Support and the Partner field teams to develop an engaged and productive channel go-to-market strategy.
The ideal candidate is an individual with expertise in driving channel strategy and initiatives, profitability models, messaging and have a track record of execution. A deep understanding of how a partner ecosystem works is a key. Outstanding executive communication, organization and people management skills are required to achieve success.
Job Role and Responsibilities
Build the Partner Route-To-Market strategy for VMware Cloud Foundation, connecting the solution to the partner GTM strategies for the underlying products.
Work with cross-functional teams to build and execute on plans in order to meet or exceed product GTM goals with an Integrated Go-to-Market Execution Plan for assigned product areas.
Participate and/or lead cross-functional teams in delivering on the business-critical initiatives identified therein, driving alignment across BU, sales regions and GTM functions in developing and executing integrated end-to-end GTM plan.
Conduct and present analysis to inform decision-making during execution planning and for course correction throughout the execution process.
Identify, analyze and drive strategic and critical initiatives that would help drive plan execution.
Define services strategy for partner profitability.
Develop communication for executive reviews.
Demonstrate excellent collaboration, interpersonal and communication skills, and experienced in communication at the executive level.
Be a trusted advisor to the planning community.
Ensure execution and measurement of results across BUs, sales regions, and functions.
Required Skills
8+ years’ experience in partner GTM, sales strategy, product or product marketing roles
Solid expertise in Storage and/or Virtualization technologies
Proven experience of building and running a Partner Programs, GTM or Sales team across multiple countries, ideally globally.
Deep understanding of the channel and the various partner types
Ability to drive proven sales plays
Able to demonstrate repeated experience of creating business plans which have resulted in growth and achievement of revenues and goals
Worked successfully within a matrix management environment
Ability to interact and communicate with various levels in the organization from individual contributor to senior executives.
High energy and comfort working in a fast-paced, multi-faceted environment
Self-starter and proven team player in a high achievement-oriented environment
Preferred Skills
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
Home Office - Anywhere in the United States
This job requisition is not eligible for employment-based immigration sponsored by VMware.

JobTitle: Entry Level Customer Training Specialist – Traveling
Text:
The Training Department plays a crucial role in connecting our customers to our software. The main purpose of this position is to help our customers make a smooth conversion to the Reynolds and Reynolds system and provide training and customer support throughout the process.
In this position, you will travel approximately 80% of the time and you will typically be given at least 1 month advance notice about upcoming trips. You will travel both individually and with a team installing and converting our software for customers. This requires excellent presentation and communication skills as you will meet with dealership management to understand the needs for each dealership. Based on these requirements, you will customize the system and train key dealership personnel on how to use the solution.
When you are not physically at a customer site, you will support current customers, prepare for future trips, and conduct follow-ups with recently installed customers from your home office. Since you will be working from a home office, we will provide you with a company iPhone, laptop, and printer-scanner-copier equipment.
Requirements:
Ability to travel 80% of the time
Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience
Outgoing, friendly personality
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Training:
Training lasts approximately 2-3 months and includes department observations, classroom instruction, and on-the-job training with a mentor. Classroom instruction includes product training as well as automotive dealership operations. You will focus on one area of the software during your product training and assist experienced representatives with customer set-up and implementation. In addition, you will have the opportunity to see Reynolds’ solutions ‘in action’ by visiting car dealerships that already utilize our solutions on a daily basis.

*Please note that while this role is a remote position, it is required that the candidate resides in the East Region and within 50 miles of a major airport. States included in Yelp's defined East Region include: Pennsylvania, New York, Vermont, New Hampshire, Maine, Massachusetts, Connecticut, Rhode Island, New Jersey, Virginia, Delaware, Maryland, West Virginia, Kentucky, Tennessee, Mississippi, Louisiana, Arkansas, Alabama, Georgia, North Carolina, South Carolina, and Florida.*

Yelp’s mission is to connect people with great local businesses. Yelp’s Midmarket team partners with established and growing multi-location businesses to provide industry leading digital advertising solutions. Yelp has become an essential part in clients’ local advertising mix and the Midmarket team is growing fast.

The Midmarket Account Executive works with multi-location regional and national corporate clients selling Yelp's diverse advertising products. You will develop an understanding of your clients’ needs, educate them on Yelp's platform and develop Yelp Ad campaigns that will help them better connect with their customers and drive in-store sales. We are looking for someone with relevant digital, media, or advertising sales experience and a demonstrated track record of exceeding goals. This role is key to Yelp’s success and offers significant career growth opportunities within Yelp’s Multi-Location Sales team.

#LI-REMOTE

Where You Come In:
You will work across a territory of key accounts at are a strong fit for Yelp’s advertising solutions
You will have ownership and autonomy over the full sales cycle from prospecting to close
You will map out the client organization and build relationships with multiple contacts, with a focus on decision-makers within the organization
You will understand your clients’ business objectives/challenges and align Yelp’s proven advertising solutions to accomplish their goals
You will partner with clients to develop a cohesive local strategy utilizing branding and conversion products, local search campaigns and customer engagement tools
You will partner with Yelp’s customer success and account management teams to ensure strong client experience and program performance post-sale

What it Takes to Succeed:
You have 3+ years selling to Midmarket clients
You have experience selling to franchises (preferred)
You have experience selling digital advertising, media, or SaaS to franchises
You are hungry to grow your career and tackle new challenges with a clear desire to have a big impact on Yelp’s revenue and client set
You have a proven track record of exceeding revenue targets and comfortable closing deals $10,000+
You have strategic selling skills
You have strong time management skills
You are a creative problem solver and self-sufficient worker
You have a solid understanding of online media and metrics
You have successful experience presenting to mid to large size groups over the phone
You are proficient in Powerpoint, Excel and Salesforce
You are fearless, relentless and with an unwillingness to settle for anything less than your best

What You'll Get:
Guaranteed base salary plus uncapped commission
Effective your first day: Full medical, vision, and dental (100% paid employee only coverage)
15 days PTO (accrual begins on date of hire and increases with 2+ years of tenure thereafter), 12 paid holidays, plus one floating holiday
Up to 14 weeks of parental leave
Monthly wellness subsidy
Flexible spending account
401(k) retirement savings plan
Employee stock purchase plan

Description
We are the world’s learning company with more than 24,000 employees operating in 70 countries. We combine world-class educational content and assessment,powered by services and technology, to enable more effective teaching and personalized learning at scale. We believe that wherever learning flourishes so do people.
We are currently seeking an innovative individual for a Senior Research Director position to support the Educational market classroom assessment solutions, most notably, aimswebPlus. AimswebPlus, a leading product within the portfolio, is a universal screening and progress monitoring assessment system for literacy and math. Clinical Assessments, the portfolio’s assessment division, is noted for our gold-standard assessment contributions in cognition, memory, neuropsychology, behavior, personality/psychopathology, achievement, occupational therapy, and speech/language pathology. Noted brands include the Wechsler and Kaufman families of products, the BASC and aimswebPlus.
The successful candidate will have demonstrated experience in academic research, and in creating and building assessment solutions for the education market. This position will report to the Director, Education Portfolio Management and Delivery, and can be remote, or based in our San Antonio, TX, or Bloomington, MN offices.
RESPONSIBILITIES
The Senior Research Director for education portfolio solutions is responsible for working with a team of professionals – Research Directors, Product Managers, Content developers, and Digital Developers – to assist in the development of new assessment solutions. Responsibilities include:
Lead research and development efforts for an established RTI/MTSS assessment solution including the development, standardization and implementation of new literacy and math assessment measures. This may include item development, scope, research and data analysis plans, scoring rules, and working with technology to help prototype digital item delivery approaches

Collaborate with cross-functional and cross-divisional teams in the development and delivery of new digital assessment solutions

Represent Pearson through conference presentations, technical papers, and other scholarly work

Provide technical solutions and contribute to proposals to acquire new business

Travel expected to be approximately 10%, post pandemic

The anticipated starting salary range for Colorado-based individuals expressing interest in this position is 85k-117k. This position is eligible to participate in an annual incentive program. Benefits available to eligible employees can be seen at: https://pearsonbenefitsus.com/
Pearson is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer and a member of E-Verify. All qualified applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.
Qualifications
EDUCATION AND WORK EXPERIENCE
Doctoral degree in educational measurement or a related field from a nationally recognized institution of higher education

Five-Ten years of relevant job experience creating or working on assessment solutions preferred

Demonstrated familiarity with Psychometric Techniques including classical test theory, item response theory, test equating, scaling and linking, and standard setting

Preference given to candidates with experience with RTI/MTSS assessment systems

Self-starter: Ability to work independently

Familiarity with software packages and software development processes

Knowledge and ability to identify implications of relevant national trends in education on assessment solutions

Communication Skills, Technical Presentations, and Client Contact
Has strong communication skills (oral, written, and business) to function effectively in a leadership role with internal and external clients and liaise with other national measurement and research/market experts

A track record of professional achievement through presentations at professional conferences and publications in professional journals or equivalent

Experience engaging with internal and external customers to understand their needs

The anticipated starting salary range for Colorado-based individuals expressing interest in this position is $85k-$117k. This position is eligible to participate in an annual incentive program. Benefits available to eligible employees can be seen at: https://pearsonbenefitsus.com/

JobTitle: Partner Success Manager - Strategic Technology Partnerships
Text:
Company Description

As the world's leader in digital payments technology, Visa's mission is to connect the world through the most creative, reliable and secure payment network - enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive. Our advanced global processing network, VisaNet, provides secure and reliable payments around the world, and is capable of handling more than 65,000 transaction messages a second. The company's dedication to innovation drives the rapid growth of connected commerce on any device, and fuels the dream of a cashless future for everyone, everywhere. As the world moves from analog to digital, Visa is applying our brand, products, people, network and scale to reshape the future of commerce.
At Visa, your individuality fits right in. Working here gives you an opportunity to impact the world, invest in your career growth, and be part of an inclusive and diverse workplace. We are a global team of disruptors, trailblazers, innovators and risk-takers who are helping drive economic growth in even the most remote parts of the world, creatively moving the industry forward, and doing meaningful work that brings financial literacy and digital commerce to millions of unbanked and underserved consumers.
You're an Individual. We're the team for you. Together, let's transform the way the world pays.

Job Description

Reporting directly to the Director of Partner Success, North America, the Manager of Partner Success role is responsible for leading and supporting a portfolio of strategic payment technology partners to execute against growth, retention and innovation objectives. This individual will also act as a technical liaison and serve as the first point of contact for partner servicing needs.

We are seeking a leader with payments industry knowledge, relationship management and solution sales experience to take on this function. This individual will engage and work extensively in partnership with other Business Development and Partner Success Leaders to execute on our growth strategies and directly contribute to the ongoing expansion of the Technology Alliance partner program.

Our ideal candidate will have a breadth of experience including; relationship management, business development, sales, technical/solution-selling, transformation and problem-solving skills. This person will demonstrate exceptional communication, strategic, analytical and program development/execution as well as a proven track record of success in function.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

§ Lead the all aspects of the required partner success management deliverables for the assigned portfolio including, but not limited to : technical servicing needs; relationship development; quarterly partnership performance discussions; implementation and GTM strategies; identification, pursuit and development of opportunities for technology infrastructure, distribution and enablement of both Visa and CyberSource solutions.
§ Lead the formulation of go-to-market strategies across each of the identified strategic initiatives with our alliance partners.
§ Actively engage with leadership and internal stakeholders on execution methodologies for formulated alliance partner go-to-market strategies.
§ Identify, develop and foster relationships with key stakeholders and C-Suite within assigned partner portfolio.
§ Initiate and lead strategic workshops with assigned global technology partners to identify areas of mutual innovation and partnerships to solve the most complex payment and technology challenges facing the industry at large.
§ Lead, initiate and successfully execute complex, global strategic partnership deals spanning multiple solution sets and long-term contractual deal constructs.
§ Proactively identify and assess key market + industry trends that will directly impact + influence the collective business objectives, priorities and results of the business.
§ Develop and engage internal and external stakeholders in solution selling approach with phased implementations against prioritized business objectives.
§ Develop and model pricing constructs that align with identified objectives and position all parties for growth over the life of the partnership agreement.
§ Lead contractual process including the presentment, negotiations and legal aspects surrounding the execution of all required commercial partnership agreements.
§ Engage technology partners and internal stakeholders to create, develop and successfully deploy marketing GTM strategies, including launch plans, priority placement and integrated engagement interfaces to drive awareness, adoption and enablement of Visa and CyberSource solutions.
§ Serve as technical and business SME for various internal initiatives and joint pursuits of the assigned global technology partners.
Promote technology partner/ISV interests & integrated solutions internally alongside Product & Acquiring Solutions stakeholders.
Dedicated Technology partner/ISV functional, field-level liaison aligned to special projects &/or strategic initiatives as defined by leadership.
Work collaboratively with cross-functional teams including; Marketing, Sales-Operations, Technical Sales, FP&A, Product Management/Development to make accurate, informed decisions.
Work collaboratively across Visa’s many functional business units to drive greater awareness, value to portfolio and new, innovative customer experiences alongside assigned strategic partners.
Develop, track and execute against monthly, quarterly and yearly revenue targets (KPIs) & other team and individual performance metrics as per the Annual Operation Plan (AOP).
Identify and analyze key metrics, trends and opportunities to ensure a disciplined approach to the prioritization, investment and decision-making process surrounding all top strategic pursuits.
Understand Visa and CyberSource’s broader corporate strategies to facilitate prioritization of business development initiatives aligned to product roadmap priorities.
Directly contribute to the Partner Success Team success, growth & development by applying and/or reinforcing new disciplines to function.
Provide executive program oversight and ongoing effective, complete and accurate partner communication.

Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications:
4 years of work experience with a Bachelors Degree or at least 2 years of work experience
with an Advanced degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD) or 0 years of work experience with
a PhD degree
Preferred Qualifications:
3+ years of Payment Industry and/or related SaaS/High Tech industry experience
3+ years of success in strategic sales, business development &/or alliance partner function
Strong solution selling skills based on problem identification vs product focused discussions
Customer relationship management experience focusing on global enterprise B2B and B2C partner segments
Experience in engaging and facilitating dialogue with C-level and senior executives at Fortune 1000 businesses
Experience in engaging and successfully commencing large, multi-year enterprise agreements
Experienced in global contractual negotiations
Experienced in internal cross collaboration with multiple internal stakeholders including executive leadership
Experienced in engaging existing partners in the dialog surrounding the technical components required to power global complex payment infrastructures across all acceptance channels
Experienced in the acquiring considerations and impacts of both card present and card not present acceptance environments
Deep understanding of the payments ecosystem and the market forces impacting the various stakeholders in the payment flow
Ability to effectively work independently and remotely by utilizing digital collaboration tools in order to engage and communicate complete, accurate and relevant details tailored to various audiences
Ability to create partner engagement collateral with appropriate messaging to align with the conversation stage, audience and desired outcomes
Ability to prioritize deliverables and projects to meet timelines efficiently, to adapt to changes in priorities quickly, and to structure and manage multiple initiatives simultaneously with focus on a drive to completion and tangible impact
Ability to successfully manage a defined partner portfolio and deliver against assigned target metrics.
Bachelor’s Degree required, MBA a plus
Key Competencies:
Commercial Acumen: Stays abreast of key trends that shape payment industry and markets and capitalizes on emerging business opportunities to develop commercially viable products and services.
Client Mindset: Focuses on discovering and meeting partner needs that result in high impact solutions; keeps portfolio interest at the forefront and continually seeks to add value.
Manage Relationships: Identifies opportunities and takes action to build strategic relationships between teams, business areas, partners and other key stakeholders to achieve business goals.
Innovate: Fosters creativity and takes intelligent calculated risks to deliver solutions that surpass partner’s expectations; challenges status quo. Generates new methods that improve both the “what” and “how”.
Strive for Excellence: Commits to delivering a high standard of results by engaging in entrepreneurial thinking and taking balanced risks to deliver significant improvements.

Accountability: Holds self and others accountable for measurable high quality, timely and effective results. Displays a strong commitment to organizational success.
Manage Complexity: Quickly integrates complex information to identify strategies and solutions, narrows down information to key concepts and isolates core issues.
Global Mindset: Articulates clear goals and expected outcomes when leading activities requiring cross-functional teams to enable vertical and horizontal alignment. Delegates appropriate levels of responsibility and holds individuals accountable. Embraces joint ownership of success.
Collaborate: Actively and collaboratively participates as a member of the senior sales management team; is accessible and easy to approach; a strong team player with a track record of building productive cross-functional relationships to support business strategy.
Communicate: Creates an atmosphere in which timely and relevant information flows up and down organization to improve collaboration and decision making. Able to convey a complex idea in a concise and cohesive manner that is easily understood by others.

Additional Information

Travel Requirements:
This position requires the incumbent to travel for work 20% of the time.
Physical Requirements:
This position will be performed in a remote office setting. The position will require the incumbent to sit and stand at a desk, communicate in person and by telephone, frequently operate standard office equipment, such as telephones and computers, and reach with hands and arms.
EEO Statement:
Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Experience negotiating government and global contracts.
Experience working remotely.
