Product Operations and Transformation
Secureworks® (NASDAQ: SCWX) a global cybersecurity leader, enables our customers and partners to outpace and outmaneuver adversaries with more precision, so they can rapidly adapt and respond to market forces to meet their business needs. Underwriter duties are responsible for validating the accuracy and completeness of loans for compliance with guidelines. These duties include reviewing and evaluating appraisals, income assets and credit, as well as monitoring and tracking conditions for compliance in accordance with guidelines.

Job Responsibilities:
Validate automated underwriting findings, asset, income, and collateral documents while verifying accuracy and completeness
Review appraisal to ensure valuation is accurate and value is supported
Calculate and review the Net Tangible Benefit in applicable states
Communicate with processors, sales management, or processing management as needed to ensure all parties are aware of loan status and any outstanding requirements
Ensure you meet daily, weekly and monthly internally specified requirements surrounding productivity metrics
Ensure the loans in your pipeline are being underwritten with attention to detail, accuracy, and within compliance of current agency, investor, corporate, and RESPA policies
Responsible for finding solutions to challenging scenarios or loan conditions by collaborating with underwriting or processing colleagues
Represent the organization well by providing exceptional communication skills written and orally when interacting with internal and external customers, vendors, members of state and regional government entities, and other organizations
Ensure exceptional customer service by maintaining thorough knowledge of lending programs, policies, corporate procedures, and regulatory requirements.
Demonstrate a commitment to professional ethics, compliance with all Federal and State policies, and adhering to HMDA requirements

Group Communications & Marketing Liaison
Atlanta, GA or Remote
Job Description:
Are you ready to lead the internal communication efforts and act as a liaison to support the development and implementation of a group-wide marketing plan for ICF's most geographically dispersed business group? The Energy Environment and Infrastructure Group is a diverse operating group that partners with utilities, federal agencies, state and local governments, and commercial clients to help tackle their most pressing challenges, including climate adaptation and resiliency, electric vehicle readiness, environmental and regulatory compliance, and energy efficiency. In close collaboration with senior business leadership, you will develop and execute internal strategic communication campaigns from concept to completion. You will take critical information and translate it into simple messages and stories. You will showcase your passion for sharing information, connecting people, and enhancing the EE&I community. Your superior writing and editing skills will be critical as you look for new ways to engage our broad employee spectrum. This is an excellent opportunity for someone with at least four years of professional marketing communications experience who is looking to take the next step in building a long-term career with a global company. This position reports to the Vice President, Group Operations for EE&I.
Key Responsibilities:
Establish a communications vision for the group in collaboration with senior leaders in the group and based on clear and defined communication objectives.
Provides thought leadership, to design new capabilities and offerings, related to internal promotions, social media, creative content, and outreach to the employee population.
Provides clear communication to stakeholders regarding EE&I projects, internal initiatives, thought leadership, culture, and employees.
Demonstrates strong strategic communications skills, including change management communications, and organizational communications.
Measures the effectiveness of communications, through surveys, and other metrics; and monitor progress against goals.
Serves as key member on assigned strategic communications initiatives ensuring that deliverables are of the highest quality and completed on time.
Ensures the implementation and maintenance of assigned communication projects or tasks that support EE&I.
Maintains awareness of current techniques used within the strategic communications industry.
Recommends, and implements (or supports) communications strategies and approaches designed to achieve overall goals and objectives for EE&I.
Works with senior group management and the corporate marketing/communications staff to align group and corporate communications, and prioritize marketing activities, where applicable.
Provides internal group coordination on tactical issues such as prioritizing conference/all hands attendance, assessing the effectiveness of webinar or campaign strategies, and supporting branding efforts.
Plan, prepare, produce, and participate in group wide meetings.
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Communications, Marketing, Public Relations, Advertising, Journalism, or related subject
4+ years of experience in corporate communications, public relations, or marketing
Demonstrated experience in the design, implementation, management, of large-scale communication campaigns for internal audiences
Ability to communicate in varied formats, from web and social media to print and video
Preferred Skills/Experience:
Experience managing multiple communication campaigns from inception to completion with changing priorities in a dynamic, deadline-driven environment.
Track record producing effective communication, including documents and collateral
2+ years of experience in a large organization (1,000+ employees)
Management consulting experience
Professional Skills:
Superior verbal, written, and presentation communication skills and personal interaction skills
Team player with the ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment
Ability to communicate effectively and collaborate with a broad range of audiences
Self-motivated, strategic thinker and problem-solver
Sound business ethics, including the protection of proprietary and confidential information
Enthusiasm and energy around business growth and communications
Ability to effectively compose written content for varied communications tasks
Working at ICF
Working at ICF means applying a passion for meaningful work with intellectual rigor to help solve the leading issues of our day. Smart, compassionate, innovative, committed, ICF employees tackle unprecedented challenges to benefit people, businesses, and governments around the globe. We believe in collaboration, mutual respect, open communication, and opportunity for growth. If you’re seeking to make a difference in the world, visit www.icf.com/careers to find your next career. A Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
10+ years of IT implementation or delivery experience
5+ years working in an IT Professional Services or consulting organization
5+ years of direct people management leading a team of consultants

Are you interested in building out a multifaceted IT consulting team to provide remote support to Amazon’s rapidly expanding global customers and partners? We are seeking a self-motivated and forward thinking leader to work on building our fast growing Global Competency Center remote delivery team. You will be joining a global, trend setting team responsible for resolving complex issues for customers every day.

In this role you will help shape the delivery of AWS Professional Services engagements. Successful candidates will grow, mentor and provide guidance to a diverse team of managers and consultants. Key to your success will be your ability to grow our services, build mechanisms to drive process improvements, and meet challenging SLAs and KPIs. You will be comfortable with a high degree of ambiguity while being able to re-prioritize to meet changing business needs and still maintain delivering projects within scope, time, budget and quality. On the technical side, successful candidates need to understand basic IT principles and aspects of remote delivery.

As this role will be worldwide facing, you will collaborate with your global ProServe peers, partner teams, customer teams, and build strong relationships with your customers. You will need to have the ability to influence others with clear and precise oral and written communication skills. Sound business judgment, analytical thinking and negotiation skills will be needed.

Responsibilities include:
Engage customers - collaborate with enterprise sales managers to develop strong customer and partner relationships and build a growing business in a geographic territory, driving AWS adoption in key markets and accounts.

Coach and teach - collaborate with AWS field sales, pre-sales, training and support teams to help partners and customers learn and use AWS services such as Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2), Amazon Simple Storage Service (S3), Amazon Simple DB/RDS databases, AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM), etc.

Deliver value - lead high quality delivery of a variety of customized remote engagements with partners and enterprise customers in the commercial and public sectors.

Lead great people - attract top IT talent to build high performing teams of consultants with superior technical depth, and outstanding customer relationship skills.

Be a customer advocate - Work with AWS engineering teams to convey partner and enterprise customer feedback as input to AWS technology roadmaps.

Remote Delivery - understand how to manage and measure the delivery of remote consulting services to customers.


Deep understanding of infrastructure-as-a-service (IaaS) cloud computing transition challenges
Demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges
Outstanding customer relationship management experience and collaboration skills
Vertical industry sales and delivery experience of contemporary services and solutions
Experience with design of modern, scalable delivery models for technology consulting services
Business development experience including complex agreements w/ integrators and ISVs
International sales and delivery experience with global F500 enterprise customers and partners
Use of AWS services in distributed environments with Microsoft, IBM, Oracle, HP, SAP etc
Direct people management experience leading a team of at least 20 or manager of manager experience in a consulting practice

Text: Paid Ad Digital Marketing Specialist Digital Media BuyerWe are an industry leading personal development company whose mission is to empower people to create and live a life they love. We are looking for an experienced Digital Media Buyer to join our heart-centered and mission-driven team. Description
Pearson is the world’s learning company with more than 24,000 employees operating in 70 countries. We combine world-class educational content and assessment, powered by services and technology, to enable more effective teaching and personalized learning at scale. We believe that wherever learning flourishes so do people.
The Accessible Materials Specialist will help the Accessibility Strategy & Education team support the mission of the Accessibility Team in School.
The Accessibility Materials Specialist will interact and communicate with internal teams and clients to provide guidance for creating and remediating accessible documentation.
The person hired for this role will report to the Director of Accessibility Strategy and Education and will be responsible for training and facilitating the production of accessible materials and for building internal expertise and capacity to produce accessible documentation.
Major Responsibilities
Serve as a subject matter expert on accessible materials and how to create and/or remediate internal and external documentation.

Facilitate the production and remediation of accessible, client-facing documentation. For example, but not limited to accessible Word documents, PDFs, PowerPoints, Excel documents, and various training and communication materials.

Interpret accessibly guidelines and standards.

Design and deliver training for product teams around best practices for accessible materials creation and remediation for various products in the Assessment line of business.

Advise on style requirements for creating accessible content, including managing the creation of documented alternative text guidelines for images.

Create and maintain thorough documentation on the current accessibly capabilities of Pearson’s assessment products and services.

Collaborate with the accessible quality assurance team to produce test scripts that are accessible to people with various types of disabilities.

Coordinate the production of materials needed by assistive technology vendors to conduct compatibility and usability research of their product(s) with various products in the School line of business.

Participate in project planning discussions related to the production of accessible products and materials.

Collaborate with internal program teams and clients to manage scope of work.

Support multiple complex projects simultaneously.

Other duties as assigned.

Physical Demands/Environmental Factors/ Mental Demands
Frequent use of standard office equipment

Prolonged sitting

Occasional bending/stooping, pushing/pulling, and twisting

Repetitive hand motions (keyboarding and use of mouse)

Occasional light lifting and carrying (less than 20 pounds)

May work prolonged and irregular hours

Occasional out-of-state and statewide travel

Work with frequent interruptions

Maintain emotional control under pressure

Ability to adapt to frequently changing technologies

The anticipated starting salary range for Colorado-based individuals expressing interest in this position is 64k. This position is eligible to participate in an annual incentive program. Benefits available to eligible employees can be seen at: https://pearsonbenefitsus.com/ Pearson is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer and a member of E-Verify. All qualified applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.
Qualifications
Education
Bachelor’s Degree in social science, education or related field, or 3-5 years of equivalent work experience Experience
3-5 years of experience managing multiple projects

3-5 years of experience in adult learning

2-3 years of technical writing experience

3-5 years of experience creating documents with Microsoft Office applications and Adobe Acrobat

3-5 years of experience working with people with disabilities

2-3 years of experience delivering training to adult learners

Special Knowledge and Skills
Familiarity with testing document accessibility using screen reading technology, such as JAWS, NVDA, or VoiceOver

Familiarity with the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines

Functional knowledge of disability categories and the accessible materials and assistive technologies designed to support people with diverse needs

Understanding of the principles of universal design and universal design for learning

Intermediate-level skills in the use of Microsoft Office and Adobe Acrobat applications

Strong written and verbal communication skills

Strong ability to support cross functional teams

Ability to manage multiple, conflicting priorities

Ability to initiate and manage the acquisition of new skills as needed to meet job requirements

Accountant, Shared Accounting Services
Job description, low-code style:
As the #1 low-code application development platform, OutSystems provides customers with everything they need to build apps incredibly fast. So, let’s cut to the chase: we’re looking for an Accountant, Shared Accounting Services. Does the challenge of working with a hot company in a rapidly growing tech market sound exciting?
The longer story:
The OutSystems low-code platform enables customers to facilitate digital transformation through massive efficiency gains in building and supporting enterprise-grade applications. By leveraging automation, artificial intelligence and deep technology integrations, software developers and business users can build applications through an intuitive, visual interface, rather than traditional coding. Customers experience tremendous cost savings and create competitive advantages by developing custom applications in days and weeks versus months and years, despite a shortage of skilled developers.
How you can help us:
As an Accountant, you will make significant contributions to objectives of the Shared Accounting Services team by executing daily accounting processes for OutSystems to deliver timely financial reports for our monthly closing, while achieving compliance with accounting standards, including both US GAAP and IFRS. You will be an effective communicator and team player, collaborating with multiple teams within OutSystems, and external stakeholders.
Responsibilities:
Preparation, remittance and recording payment of customer invoices
Lend support to account managers and lead timely execution of RFIs
Deliver timely support and resolution for customer billing inquiries
Recording and verification of vendor profiles and invoices to ensure proper expense coding
Perform general ledger account and bank reconciliation
Maintain PPE ledger and monthly reconciliation
Audit and reconcile vendor prepaid accounts
Review, analysis and preparation of sales tax ledger
Preparation of ad hoc reports

Skills:
Exceptional time management and organizational skills
A strong adherence to detail
Excellent communication (oral and written) skills
Working knowledge US GAAP and IFRS
Working knowledge of US Sales Tax
Moderate to excellent mastery of excel
Experience with ERP software, specifically NetSuite, a plus but not required

Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in accounting, finance, or related field
MBA or other advanced degree is a plus but not required.
3 or more years of working in a similar capacity with demonstrable experience in monthly closing cycles
Location:
US - Remote (East / Central preferred)

About OutSystems
Our software platform is revolutionizing how organizations build and deliver business-transforming applications. OutSystems is one of the fastest growing B2B software companies in the world, with a base in Lisbon, Portugal, international locations in Atlanta, Boston, London, Amsterdam, Dubai, Tokyo, Sydney, and Singapore, and customers in more than 52 countries.
Recognized as a leader in our market by top analyst firms, like Forrester and Gartner.
Winner of multiple industry awards, including the prestigious CODiE award.
Loved by customers who have voted us the best low-code software platform (Gartner Peer Reviews, TrustRadius, and G2 Crowd).
Working at OutSystems
We don’t have many rules, but we have a lot of common sense. Our commitment to our culture is highlighted in The Small Book of the Few Big Rules, written by our Founder and CEO, Paulo Rosado. This commitment to culture has landed us in the top six Forbes Best Cloud Computing Companies and CEOs To Work For three years running.
Disrupting the status quo is in our DNA. In fact, it’s why our company exists.
We ask “why” a lot. It helps us connect our individual work to the bigger picture, and sometimes even uncover a better way.
Our offices are great places to be, but will never be the stuff of future tech mockumentaries. We’re much more down-to-earth than that.

Job Description
Tosca is currently looking for a Talent Development Manager in Atlanta, GA. This position will serve as the lead talent development resource supporting Tosca’s global learning and talent development initiatives. Activities include strategic planning and execution, facilitation, content development, and engagement survey administration and action planning. Work involves a high level of decision making, collaboration, initiative, and independent judgment. Must “own” the talent function and cultivate new ideas to support a rapidly growing business.

In this role, you will:

Develop and enhance the organizational structure, role definition, success frameworks, and performance metrics throughout the Company
Develop and design programs and initiatives that are tailored to the team’s knowledge, abilities, strengths, and interests to enhance the experience and performance.
Responsibility for the creation and delivery of a learning & development plan and associated programs to support capability development across all levels
Identify organizational talent through succession planning, gap analysis, and skill development training.
Coordinate training delivery with HR Managers and other functional administrators.
Serve as functional owner of all learning and engagement systems including SuccessFactors LMS, SuccessFactors Goals and Performance Management, Reward Gateway engagement platform, and other systems as required.
Develop elements and dashboards to enhance employee engagement; help establish dashboards and metrics for success in all roles; assist with goal setting and tracking; ensure team members are provided ongoing, timely feedback that is beneficial to their continued development
Take ownership and drive Tosca winning culture by soliciting feedback, analyzing that feedback and data, and implementing programs that will enhance the working environment and continue to engage and motivate teams and individuals

Qualifications
5 + years of experience in creating and delivering people-oriented programs, including Learning & Development, Performance Management & Engagement. Working with global teams is preferred.
Bachelor's Degree in a business-related field and/or Human Resources preferred or equivalent combination of experience/education.
Experience working with SuccessFactors LMS and Performance & Goals Management is preferred.
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Strong detail orientation and ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment
Strong dependability with an ability to follow through and meet commitments
Well-developed analytical and problem-solving skills
Able to organize work, engage in a variety of tasks simultaneously and consistently meet deadlines
Ready to be a self-starter and take the initiative to perform duties independently as well as in a team
Maintain a high level of integrity, confidentiality, and professionalism
Ability to travel, on average, 25% of the time
Bilingual in Spanish is preferred

Why Tosca?
Do you want to work in a creative, fun, and exciting team atmosphere? Would you like to work for an established company with an excellent reputation as an employer of choice (Atlanta's Top Workplace Award winner)? Are you passionate about environmentally sound products and practices? Are you ready to take your career to the next level?

Tosca is looking to hire a Regional Sales Manager - Retail Sales. The ideal candidate would have a strong commercial background including sales and/or marketing experience, retail experience, supply chain experience, leadership ability, and a desire to sell emerging products. Candidates will work remotely but should live in Phoenix, Denver, Salt Lake City, Boise, or any other major west coast market.

We pay a competitive annual salary, plus bonus, depending on experience. We also offer generous benefits including medical, vision, short-term disability, dental, a health reimbursement account (HSA), a flexible spending account (FSA), life insurance, an employee assistance program (EAP), a 401(k) plan with a 6% match with immediate vesting, paid holidays, gap holidays, paid time off (PTO), paid maternity and paternity leave, a fitness reimbursement program, education reimbursements, referral incentives, performance recognition, company parties, and more. If this sounds like the perfect opportunity for you, apply today!

Ready to Join the Tosca Team?
We understand your time is valuable, and that is why we have a swift and easy application process. If you feel that you would be right for this role, please fill out our initial 3-minute, mobile-friendly application. We look forward to meeting you!

Neptune Retail Solutions is the nation’s premier retail marketing services company. We are experts at influencing buying behaviors through our disruptive, innovative, and results-oriented solutions, including in-store, home-delivered, and online media tactics combined with rich data and insights. Our powerful advertising and promotion programs are relied upon by the country’s largest consumer packaged goods manufacturers for an unparalleled consumer reach.
We are seeking a Program/Sales Coordinator to join our team. As a Program/Sales Coordinator, you will be supporting our sales team from a home office. You will play an important role in ensuring all program/campaign executions are successful, keeping things organized, providing customer service to our clients, and contributing to the overall success of the team through effective communication, relationship building, and account management. This is a remote, work from home position but must be in the east coast/eastern standard time.

Responsibilities include:
Coordination of in-store and digital programs/campaigns in regards to advertising execution materials once the client has approved a sales contract.
Act as a liaison between clients and internal departments.
Generate and manage program timing in accordance to standard timing deadlines.
Collect and present internal executional data to the sales teams as part of presentation preparation. For example, collecting program restrictions such as available tactics and store counts.
Reviews finance system generated invoices for accuracy based on nonstandard payment terms and contract accuracy. Follow up with clients to ensure invoices are received and payments are submitted to the company by the due date. Escalates all past due invoices to Account Directors.
Proactively schedules calls with the sales team and clients to ensure implementation/materials are in order to maximize the success/program completion. For example, working with the client to kick off program details such as providing artwork specifications, store lists, and time lines of all due dates.
Requirements:
2 -3 years of experience in a coordination/account management role supporting multiple sales professionals in a team environment.
Very strong attention to detail and extremely organized.
Ability to manage competing deadlines and priorities.
Proficient in Office (Excel/Word/PPT), Salesforce experience is an asset.
Ability to multitask and work in a fast pace environment.
Strong interpersonal and professional skills.
Ability to work independently and to adapt in a continuously changing environment.
Neptune Retail Solutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer and provides reasonable accommodations to qualified
individuals with disabilities.

Applicant Privacy Notice:
Your personal information will be collected and used by Neptune Retail Solutions and/or its affiliated companies to process and respond to your application, contact you regarding current and future employment or internship opportunities, and as otherwise set out in our Applicant Privacy Notice available here: Applicant Privacy Notice

The Training Department plays a crucial role in connecting our customers to our software. The main purpose of this position is to help our customers make a smooth conversion to the Reynolds and Reynolds system and provide training and customer support throughout the process.
In this position, you will travel approximately 80% of the time and you will typically be given at least 1 month advance notice about upcoming trips. You will travel both individually and with a team installing and converting our software for customers. This requires excellent presentation and communication skills as you will meet with dealership management to understand the needs for each dealership. Based on these requirements, you will customize the system and train key dealership personnel on how to use the solution.
When you are not physically at a customer site, you will support current customers, prepare for future trips, and conduct follow-ups with recently installed customers from your home office. Since you will be working from a home office, we will provide you with a company iPhone, laptop, and printer-scanner-copier equipment.
Requirements:
Ability to travel 80% of the time
Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience
Outgoing, friendly personality
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Training:
Training lasts approximately 2-3 months and includes department observations, classroom instruction, and on-the-job training with a mentor. Classroom instruction includes product training as well as automotive dealership operations. You will focus on one area of the software during your product training and assist experienced representatives with customer set-up and implementation. In addition, you will have the opportunity to see Reynolds’ solutions “in action” by visiting car dealerships that already utilize our solutions on a daily basis.

Duties
Summary
This position is located in Department of Labor, Employment and Training Administration (ETA). The position requires the performance of a variety of program-related assignments in one or more front-line, core unemployment insurance program lines of work. Assignments are heavily influenced by ETA's one-stop, customer service philosophy and the focus and direction flowing from workforce legislation.

** THIS POSITION IS INSIDE THE BARGAINING UNIT **

Responsibilities
MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Agency Expert

Develops expert knowledge of ETA programs and applicable statutes, regulations, policies, and ETA standard operating procedures.
Serves as an agency expert on unemployment insurance programs pertaining to a full range of issues, including highly complex and unusual issues, and is recognized as a subject matter expert in the field. Provides authoritative advice and consultation to ETA officials and customers on highly complex unemployment insurance issues and concerns.
Serves as a Regional Program Lead for one or more unemployment insurance programs or functions. Provides leadership to individual unemployment insurance specialists and/or teams or groups of specialists. Develops and delivers training and on-the-job training for Federal staff.
Prepares and conducts briefings for ETA officials and other stakeholders on unemployment insurance guidance and policy. Reviews draft policy guidance for impact on the organization and the program.
Serves in a senior capacity in development and coordination of various unemployment insurance programs within the agency and with other Federal agencies in the coordination of program activities.
Reviews State unemployment insurance legislation for conformity with Federal requirements.
Reviews the administration and operation of Federal and State unemployment insurance programs and systems, with a primary focus on agency internal operations including the planning and development of automated benefit and tax systems.
Establishes and maintains systems for the assessment of unemployment insurance program accuracy and quality (i.e, BAM peer review, TPS peer review, BTQ peer review, appeals peer review).

General Grant Management

As a Liaison, manages a grant portfolio within assigned program area(s) of high complexity, scope, and impact, and conducts the day-to-day grant management for the grants within his/her grant portfolio. Performs analyses of grant-related data, policy and program issues, and applies problem-solving techniques to address issues.
Works collaboratively with administrative, program, and performance offices that play a role in the administration of ETA grants.
May carryout activities in the pre-award phase, such as review grant funding applications or state plans, negotiate performance goals, and make funding recommendations to the Grant Officer.
Prepares and delivers presentations to various internal and external audiences (e.g., internal: ETA leadership and colleagues; external: grantee community and other workforce system stakeholders) on unemployment insurance programs.
Serves in a senior capacity in the development of internal standard operating procedures, policy guidance and technical assistance resources for ETA grantees and workforce system stakeholders.

Provides Compliance Assistance

Communicates Federal and grant award requirements to grantees to ensure understanding of grant requirements.
Ensures that grantees deliver agreed upon products and services, achieve negotiated performance outcomes, and operate in accordance with programmatic, administrative, and budgetary requirements.
Works with grantees to interpret federal requirement and procedures and to identify potential issues and conducts research on policy guidance and legislation. Reviews policy and guidance for application. Provides guidance to grantee(s).

Conducts Oversight

Conducts risks assessments of assigned grants. Conducts quarterly desk reviews of assigned grants (i.e., in-depth performance analysis of grantee quarterly progress and fiscal reports).
Leads and conducts on-site compliance monitoring reviews and Enhanced Desk Monitoring Reviews (EDMRs) of grantees to: evaluate the grantee’s progress towards meeting the goals specified in the grant agreement with DOL ETA; assess the quality of the program and services; ensure that grant activities are being conducted in compliance with the grant agreement and applicable Federal regulations.

Provides Technical Assistance

As an agency expert, participates in development of major technical assistance events and development and delivery of training for grantees and other stakeholders.
Leads and provides technical assistance to grantees to assist them in accomplishing the goals and objectives of the grant by applying problem solving techniques to address deficiencies.
Leads and conducts on-site technical assistance (TA) visits to grantee sites.
Provides technical assistance to grantees on a full-range of grant management areas, including but not limited to: the development and submission of grant modification requests; the development of Corrective Action Plans (CAPs); grant close-out, evaluations or audits.

Maintains Grant Records

Effectively utilizes electronic grant management systems in accordance with established guidelines and protocols.
Maintains grant files and adheres to grant management documentation requirements established in Employment and Training Orders (ETOs).
Travel Required
25% or less - Travel for work meetings and site visits.
Supervisory status
No
Promotion Potential
13 - This is the full performance level for this position.
Job family (Series)
0106 Unemployment Insurance
Requirements

Requirements
Conditions of Employment
Must be at least 16 years old and a U.S. Citizen.
Appointment to this position may require a background investigation.
Requires a probationary period if the requirement has not been met.
Applicants must meet all legal and regulatory requirements. Reference the "Required Documents" section for additional requirements.
Qualifications
The Unemployment Insurance Program Specialist Series, GS-0106, has basic requirements described in the Individual Occupational Requirement (IOR) and must be met in conjunction with the (1) year specialized experience equivalent to next lower grade GS-12.

Basic Requirements:

Education
Undergraduate Education: Major study - economics, industrial relations, law, sociology, political science, public administration, or other related fields. Courses in statistics or mathematics applicable to the social sciences are creditable up to a maximum of 12 semester hours.

Graduate Education: Major study - one or a combination of the social sciences that included social science research methodology and techniques, and provided a knowledge of the history, concepts, methods, and techniques of social insurance and/or the social and economic conditions under which social insurance programs operate.

OR

Experience

General Experience (for GS-5 positions): Experience in social science or related fields such as economics, sociology, political science, public administration, or industrial relations, or in the application of statistics or mathematics in these fields.

Specialized Experience (for positions above GS-5): Experience related to social insurance. This includes experience applying statistics or mathematics to the social insurance field. Specialized experience must have demonstrated:
A knowledge of current social and economic conditions under which social insurance programs operate, and the principles of Federal/State/local relationships;
The ability to extend and modify existing techniques and methods or to develop new ones to identify, isolate, and resolve special problems; and
The ability to develop effective collaborative relationships with personnel in other fields and with groups having conflicting objectives.
In addition to the Basic Requirement you MUST met the following:

GS-13: One (1) year of specialized experience equivalent to GS-12.

Specialized Experience: applicants must possess 52 weeks of specialized experience at the next lower grade level, GS-12, in the Federal Service or equivalent. Qualifying specialized experience may have been gained through work in the following or similar types of programs: unemployment insurance; old age and survivors' insurance; workers' compensation; disability compensation; or other public or private programs covering common social insurance risks.

Examples of specialized experience include ALL of the following:
Experience interpreting workforce development or publicly-funded social service legislation, policies, programs, and regulations.
Experience providing policy advice and delivering technical assistance and training on issues related to programs.
Experience reviewing documents for conformity, program accuracy and quality in accordance with federal, state and local requirements.
Experience working collaboratively and maintaining professional networks with officials in federal, state, or local government agencies or public entities.
Experience writing or editing reports and providing guidance to junior personnel and management, state or local government agencies.
Experience providing oversight for data collection, data analysis, and the development of performance reports that compare the baseline and actual data.

IN DESCRIBING YOUR EXPERIENCE, PLEASE BE CLEAR AND SPECIFIC. WE WILL NOT MAKE ASSUMPTIONS REGARDING YOUR EXPERIENCE.
Education
Any applicant falsely claiming an academic degree from an accredited school will be subject to actions ranging from disqualification from federal employment to removal from federal service.

If your education was completed at a foreign college or university, you must show comparability to education received in accredited educational institutions in the United States and comparability to applicable minimum course work requirements for this position. Click Evaluation of Foreign Education for more information.
Additional information
DOL seeks to attract and retain a high performing and diverse workforce in which employees’ differences are respected and valued to better meet the varying needs of the diverse customers we serve. DOL fosters a diverse and inclusive work environment that promotes collaboration, flexibility and fairness so that all individuals are able to participate and contribute to their full potential.

Employee participation in telework on a routine or situational basis is determined by management primarily based on business needs. Employees participating in telework are subject to the terms and conditions of the Department of Labor’s Telework Program.


How You Will Be Evaluated
You will be evaluated for this job based on how well you meet the qualifications above.
If you meet the minimum qualifications, you will be evaluated against the evaluation factors below and will be placed into a category based on your vacancy question responses.

Categories:

Category A - Meets the basic qualification requirements for the vacancy and has successful experience in the same or similar job that has demonstrated superior proficiency in applying critical competencies required by this position.

Category B - Meets the basic qualification requirements for the vacancy and demonstrates satisfactory proficiency in the critical competencies required by this position.

Category C - Meets the specialized experience described in the minimum qualifications requirements section of this announcement and demonstrates proficiency in the basic competencies.

Evaluation Factors (Competencies) - All qualified applicants will be evaluated on the following key competencies:

Unemployment Ins. Program Knowledge: Development, promotion and evaluation of unemployment ins. programs administered under the Federal-State joint arrangement including history, concepts, methods, and techniques of social insurance under which the program operates.

Oversight & Technical Assistance: Reviews assigned area or segment of programs and provides technical guidance to workforce development personnel and other subject matter professionals.

Problem Solving: Identifies problems; determines accuracy and relevance of information; uses sound judgment to make recommendations.

Legal, Government, & Jurisprudence: Knowledge of laws, legal codes, court procedures, precedents, legal practices and documents, Government regulations, Executive orders, agency rules, Government organization functions, and the democratic political process.

Written Communication: Uses correct English grammar, punctuation, and spelling; communicates information in a succinct and organized manner.

Oral Communication: Expresses information to individuals or groups effectively, taking into account the audience and nature of the information; makes clear and convincing oral presentations; listens to others, attends to nonverbal cues, and responds appropriately.

Mortgage Closer
Our company is pioneering a fresh approach to todays mortgage lending challenges, offering a breadth of innovative lending products to meet a home buyers mortgage needs. A highly entrepreneurial organization that embraces a strong service-based culture, we've been named a Top 150 Workplace by the Atlanta Journal Constitution the past six years.


We are actively looking for remote Mortgage Closers to join our team.
Top Reasons to Work with UsJoin Top 150 Workplace by the Atlanta Journal Constitution
Our company offers multiple opportunities to join our retail or consumer direct modelBonuses per file
What You Will Be Doing
Overview:


Oversee closing and disbursement of mortgage loans while ensuring compliance with federal, state, and investor requirements.

Principal Accountabilities:

Prepares Loan Packages in accordance with State, Federal, and Investor Lending Guidelines
Perform audit of RESPA/TILA requirements as it pertains to the issuance of the Closing Disclosure
Final compliance review of the loan to ensure adherence to high cost tests, TILA, RESPA, HOEPA requirements
Acts as the main company point of contact for closing/disbursement questions and/or concerns as it pertains to assigned files
Communicate with title companies to gather all necessary information for accurate document preparation and coordinate delivery of the documents
Understanding fee tolerances, how to handle tolerance violations and any bona fide change in circumstances
Calculate closing figures and coordinate loan funding with wire team
Reviews and approves the Closing Disclosure
Review of executed loan documents to ensure accuracy and proper execution prior to issuance of funding authorization

Minimum:

2 years experience in closing since January 2018
Experience in closing various loan programs Conventional, FHA, VA, USDA, DPAs
Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously, maintain a high level of accuracy, and at the same time meet absolute deadlines
Ability to read, analyze and interpret the most complex documents.
Ability to respond effectively to the most sensitive inquiries or complaints.
Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.
Working knowledge of regulations of TRID
Knowledge of or ability to learn Encompass

Preferred:

Ability to satisfy any specific certifications as required by law

JobTitle: Product Line Manager - Tanzu Mission Control, Data Services - Opportunity for Working Remotely Atlanta, GA
Text:
The Elevator Pitch: Why will you enjoy this new opportunity?
The Tanzu Mission Control team at VMware is seeking a Product Manager to help define product strategy and advance our mission to make Kubernetes accessible to any enterprise. The Tanzu Mission Control team is focused on helping customers more easily manage Kubernetes and operate modern, containerized applications across multiple clouds and clusters. You will play a pivotal role defining compelling and competitively differentiated capabilities, communicating our roadmap to internal and external stakeholders, understanding our customers deeply, and collaborating with marketing and sales to bring Tanzu Mission Control to market. The team is a fast-paced, startup-like environment where you will have the opportunity to build a new business from the ground up while developing skills in cutting-edge technologies.
What is the primary need, technical challenge, and/or problem you will be responsible for?
In this role, you will be responsible for defining the product strategy to evolve Tanzu Mission Control into a rich, extensible data platform for the entire VMware Tanzu portfolio. Enterprise Kubernetes clusters are packed with data of interest to many stakeholders across the organization. The goal of the data platform is to make it easy for customers to discover and use the data streams they care about, aggregate and query data across fleets of Kubernetes clusters, and enable partners to integrate their own data sources and sinks to provide their unique value to VMware Tanzu customers. Your impact will enable powerful end-user experiences, more integrated experiences across the Tanzu portfolio, and provide the extensibility and pluggability for a robust ecosystem of partner and community integrations.
Success in the Role: What are the performance goals over the first 6-12 months you will work toward completing?
Success in the first three months means charting new territory for Tanzu Mission Control and clearly articulating that vision to internal and external stakeholders
Success in the first six months means partnering with engineering to deliver an initial set of capabilities that enable VMware customers to experience an integrated product portfolio of data streams and insights.
Success in the first year means enabling our partners and community to extend Tanzu Mission Control by integrating their technologies and services, providing choice and seamless experiences to customers.
What type of work will you be doing? What assignments, requirements, or skills will you be performing on a regular basis?
You will own the short- and long-term strategy for an extensible data platform in Tanzu Mission Control based on a deep understanding of customer needs, market trends, and competition. Experience defining and prioritizing product features in a complex technical context will serve you well.
You will collaborate with other Tanzu teams, as well as partner and community developers, to plan and deliver integrated experiences across the portfolio. An ability to navigate complex decision making and effectively communicate across teams will be critical to success.
You will partner with engineering to drive successful product releases. You will be engineering’s connection to our customers and partners and will be responsible for bringing them along for the ride.
You will engage frequently with customers and partners to learn about their needs, and occasionally support the sales and partner channels along with key engagements in a pre- and post-sales capacity.
What is leadership like for this role? What is the structure and culture of the team like?
The hiring manager for this role is Scott Van Woudenberg, Group Product Line Manager, leading Tanzu Mission Control’s SaaS Platform product team. Scott joined VMware from Google, where he helped build Google Compute Engine from launch into a multi-billion dollar business. The Tanzu Mission Control product management team is made up of individuals with diverse backgrounds who are excited about delivering a new SaaS offering to enable Tanzu’s largest customers to build, run, and manage modern applications.
What are the benefits and perks of working at VMware?
You and your loved ones will be supported with a competitive and comprehensive benefits package. Below are some highlights, or you can view the complete benefits package by visiting www.benefits.vmware.com.
Employee Stock Purchase Plan
Medical Coverage, Retirement, and Parental Leave Plans for All Family Types
Generous Time Off Programs
40 hours of paid time to volunteer in your community
Rethink's Neurodiversity program to support parents raising children with learning or behavior challenges, or developmental disabilities
Financial contributions to your ongoing development (conference participation, trainings, course work, etc.)
#TeamTanzu

ResponsibilitiesThe candidates will be reviewing residential real estate defaults ranging in complexity from a single family home to co-ops, multi-family homes, vacant land appraisals, manufactured homes etc.They will complete the review, check for completeness, look for red flags, maintain compliance, review photos, and review risk factors.In addition they will work files that require a closer review and an enhanced scope of work.Will use internal client tools, access public records, google maps, use alamode, MLS data etc.This position is MUCH different than your typical appraisers working on the origination side.The increase in volume is due to the pandemic as this team only reviews defaults.Often times appraisers with origination experience will struggle because as you imagine defaulted real estate is not always as well maintained or cut and dry as new real estate. Meaning, they may have to review appraisals for homes that are not in the best condition and need extensive rehab.Candidates on the origination side are also placing the value whereas this team is reviewing the appraisal that was provided and reviewing all appraisal documents to provide their “stamp of approval” on the value and not performing the actual appraisal.Reviews are completed at one at a time, and 12-15 reviews completed daily is a good KPI to shoot for.QualificationsMust have experience with BPO formsMust have an Active Appraiser License/Certification (in good standing), and experience not only appraising but also reviewing appraisals.This is a desk job; you will not be traveling to the field at allCandidates with Alamode is a good application to look for on candidates resumes.Candidates will need to be equipped to make a clear decision on approval of appraisal with minimal supervision.Since they will not be providing the standard pre-review that most appraisers do, they do not have to have geographical competency as they will be reviewing properties across the US.Candidate must be able to adapt to technology and work independently.They use various proprietary systems, but Outlook and Skype is a must.They are 100% a paperless environment, so again, technology is keyJob Types: Full-time, ContractPay: $29.00 - $31.00 per hourBenefits:Health insuranceSchedule:8 hour shiftEducation:Bachelor's (Preferred)Experience:Microsoft Excel: 1 year (Preferred)Analysis Skills: 1 year (Preferred)Contract Renewal:LikelyWork Location:One locationBenefit Conditions:Waiting period may applyWork Remotely:Yes

*Please read the full job description before submitting an application to ensure qualified applicants.*College counseling experience required. __**Role: The college counselor assists students in grades 9-12 with all aspects of the college preparation, search, and application processes. This is a part-time, remote position. The counselor will use desktop sharing to work with students. This position provides the opportunity to counsel students and their parents, manage individual projects, and work as part of a highly motivated and dynamic team.This is a 1099 position (independent contractor)Responsibilities: Assist in all aspects of the college application process including college selection, essay development, and help to complete applications.Work with younger students in grades 9-11 to obtain job shadowing positions, internships, applications to competitive summer camps, and other activities to help strengthen their student profile.Ability to jump in and help with the business side of college counseling: hosting webinars, article writing, blog posts, creating eBooks/manuals, outreach, partnerships, PR.Requirements: The ideal candidate possesses the following:Bachelor's degree required. Advanced degree a plus.A minimum of 3 years of direct experience in either an undergraduate admissions office or in college counseling at a selective high school.Strong writing/editing skills, mastery in the narrative form of writing. Essays are a huge piece of the college application; counselors must be strong writers and have the ability to guide students in telling their story. Our editing process is detailed and goes beyond adding a few commas.Tech savvy - Google Docs, Google Drive, Zoom required.Ability to work independently and as part of a team. The team has group calls where counselors learn from each other and discuss strategies for our students; an openness to learn and grow is needed.The ability to frequently stay on top of email communication and respond to student/parent inquiries in a timely manner, weekends included. If you check email once every 2 or 3 days this is not the job for you. If you do not do email on the weekends, this is also not the job for you.Flexibility: nights and weekends are required. Counselors often work weekends and evenings to advise students. This is not a 9-5 job. This job has a great deal of flexibility, however, counselors must work around the student's schedule. The busiest time is the fall/winter and the counselor must be available around the holidays. Peak season is often 25 hours per week, and there a slower months with less than 10 hours per week. If applicants intend to have an additional job, they must be able to accommodate this varied schedule.Strong project management/communication skills.Confidence, resourcefulness, accountability, and a high degree of integrity and ethics.The counselor must not have their own independent counseling business or work for a competitor. A non-compete must be signed prior to joining the team.Note: All candidates will be required to submit writing samples before being interviewed. Since a large part of this job involves essay editing, the ideal candidate will have numerous examples to share, including:A before/after essay edit (2-3 examples)A writing sample (can be a letter of recommendation you wrote for a student, blog post, newsletter, article, etc)*Bonus: Willingness to participate in webinars. We use this as a marketing tool for prospective students. Each of our webinars attracts hundreds of students. Articles + Infographics.Social media marketing (Familiarity with Facebook, Instagram, Twitter)A can-do attitude - we are a small team and many of us wear numerous hats. A willingness to learn new things/software/processes is essential.The best part of this job: Flexibility - each counselor on the team has a different student caseload. Counselors have the ability to take on more/fewer students.Remote - work in your pajamas. We do not have a physical office. Since inception, our team has worked remotely. Our counselors are located all over the U.S. - the same for our students.Our counselors love their job. Really, we do. We all put our students first and we work hard for our families. This is more than a job for us. The Care Advisor serves as a point contact (phone, email, SMS) for patients to provide resources and assistance with accessing clinical and supportive care activities offered for the program. The Care Advisor provides patients with education and information to understand product and their disease, to educate patient about side effect management, and support patient adherence to prescribed therapy. The Care Advisor will offer only approved services and program materials.
Additional CARE ADVISOR Duties:
Respond to inbound calls and make scheduled outbound call for patients. Interactions utilize scripts and approved FAQs.
Provide patient support information for patients on prescribed therapy
In conducting calls with patients, the Care Advisors will identify potential barriers to treatment; may utilize approved assessments or other approved techniques to help mobilize patients to access Patient Services.
Care Advisors will use proprietary CRM and telephony to maintain information and track patient progress and to trigger calls, correspondence, or other program directed activities.
Provide education to help patients better communicate with their respective health care providers.
Education to support prescribed therapy consistent with FDA approved indication and dosing: disease state information, side-effect management.
Any additional duties as assigned by program management.

Associates degree required; Bachelor’s degree Preferred
Licensed Clinical Social Worker preferred
Direct patient education/patient support experience required
Experience in remote/virtual call center providing patient education and support preferred
Experience in case management or AIDS Service Organization (ASO) highly preferred
Knowledge of HIV patients and issues required
Experience in motivational interviewing preferred
Demonstrated time management skills; planning and prioritization skills; ability to multi-task
Demonstrated ability to work with enthusiasm
Demonstrated ability to effectively build positive relationships
Demonstrated ability to be adaptable to changing work environments and responsibilities
Fully competent in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
Flexibility to work evenings
Dedicated home workspace
Bilingual on English/Spanish preferred

Bay Equity is a full-service retail mortgage lending institution headquartered in Corte Madera. In 2011 and 2012, San Francisco Business Times named Bay Equity among its "Top 100 Fastest-Growing Private Companies" in the Bay Area.

We are hiring for a Loan Resolution Associate to work remotely for our Operations Center.

Job Summary:

This position is to work as a liaison between Branches, Borrower(s), Escrow, Title, and Investors. Ensure loans are purchased off our warehouse line within 17 days from the loan funding. In addition, the Loan Resolution Associate is to conduct them self in a professional manner and deliver satisfactory customer service internal and external on a daily basis.

Duties and Responsibilities:

Monitor investor suspense reports hourly for new suspended loans to pull and work as well as revised items the investor may have posted
Obtain requested items directly when possible. Obtain directly from the source to avoid delays, eliminating numerous follow up e-mails
Follow up on any items requested from the Branches, Escrow, Title, Borrower, etc. within 24 hours of request
Follow up with investor within 24 hours on items submitted to clear suspensions that are not resolved
Bring any loans not able to be cleared within 72 hours to Managers attention
Ensure integrity of loan in Encompass is followed through at every stage. This includes all dates, notes and suspense codes
Daily Suspense Check via Investor portal to ensure loans are reflected with current status
Review/analyze for compliance with TRID requirements
Help other team members who may need assistance
Log In to each Investor’s Website with access to suspense reports and Loan Level Detail Reports
Pull and organize suspended loans into suspense categories and by commitment expiration/aged shipped
Knowledge of all loan types, i.e. FHA/VA/USDA/Conventional
Run and interpret Encompass Reports for loans in Shipped Status to ensure timely workflow of loan files
Research and analyze Bay Equity internal Guidelines and Investor Guidelines
Prepare correspondence to borrowers requesting additional items
Prepare Check Request and Correspondence to Borrowers/Escrow for refunds

 Minimum Requirements:

High school diploma or equivalent
2 plus years of mortgage banking experience
General knowledge of residential mortgage and previous experience
Familiar with Processing, Funding, and/or Underwriting knowledge
Self-starter with good written and oral communication skill as well as good follow up and organizational skills
Ability to maintain accuracy and expediency while working in a fast-paced environment
Detail and results oriented
Strong organizational, problem solving, and analytical skills
Ability to multi-task and handle highly stressful situation and customers
Versatility, flexibility, and a willingness to work within constantly changing priorities with enthusiasm
Knowledge of the fundamentals of quality customer service
Ability to collaborate with others in a team setting

We offer a comprehensive benefit package including; medical, dental, vision, life insurance, 401k, and paid time off. Compensation based on experience. Please see our website www.bayeq.com for more details on our company. This is a full-time position with enormous growth potential in an expanding company.

Wholesale Mortgage Underwriter - REMOTE
Leading national Wholesale Mortgage firm with offices nationwide is in growth mode and seeking several talented, Sr. Level Wholesales Underwriters for immediate hire. These are 100% REMOTE positions where you will get the opportunity to work with a cohesive, talented team that is fun and fast-paced.

We truly empower both our teams and customers by having all the resources of a large firm and offering education/guidance of a small team grounded in trusted values.

Please read on or apply today if interested!
Top Reasons to Work with Us
- 100% REMOTE opportunity
- Best in class compensation offered
- Strong benefits, PTO, paid training and 401K match
- Excellent growth opportunities offered for highly qualified and productive individuals
What You Will Be Doing
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
" Performs a thorough analysis to ensure the quality of each loan and to determine compliance with Company and Investor guidelines.
" Performs a thorough analysis of collateral to ensure property meets investor guidelines and the appraisal quality and completeness is acceptable.
" Applies and interprets company underwriting guidelines and makes sound credit decision.
" Completes credit, analysis of income, analysis of property, ensures proper audits are completed and verifies consistency of loan file information.
" Identifies risk factors within each loan and utilizes resources, tools and documentation to detect red flags and clear inconsistencies.
" Reviews and evaluates credit information on mortgage loan documents to determine acceptability for specific loan programs.
" Determines any conditions, stipulations or pre-funding requirements.
" Reviews and clears underwriting conditions, stipulations or pre-funding requirements received.
" Communicates with clients, sales teams and operations teams to resolve outstanding issues as they arise.
" Assists departmental support staff when necessary.
" Resolves and responds to post closing credit exceptions received from investors and auditors when required on loans underwritten.
" Maintains ongoing knowledge of investor guidelines, updates and trends as applicable to underwriting position.
" Completes second signature underwriting review on loan files underwritten by junior underwriters and within designated authority as needed.
" Performs other duties as assigned.
What You Need for this Position
" A thorough knowledge of mortgage loan underwriting.
" Maintains highly confidential information concerning loan applicants.
" Requires high level of organizational skills and ability to work on several tasks simultaneously.
" Constant contact with Loan Officers and internal office staff.
" Significant coordination of various duties required.
" Office machines such as computer, copiers, fax machines and the telephone.
" Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.
" Ability to handle detailed assignments.
" Strong customer service skills.
" Ability to organize and prioritize workload and meet deadlines.
" Excellent computer skills and working knowledge of Microsoft Office products.

EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE AND/OR LICENSES:
" 5+ years of mortgage underwriting work experience.
" Paperless Loan Origination System experience preferred.
" FHA Direct Endorsement designation and/or VA SAR designation is a plus
" DU and LP experience required.
" Experience working in a paperless environment preferred.
Sr. Wholesale Underwriters are encouraged to apply ASAP or you can send your resume to me directly at: Chuck.Cooke@CyberCoders.comApplicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.
CyberCoders, Inc is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer


All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.


Your Right to Work – In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.

JobTitle: Sales Manager – Electronic Equipment Returns Services
Text: We are a growing force in the Third-Party Logistics (3PL) industry, focused on helping our customers manage returns of electronic equipment. A large portion of our business involves managing RMA returns and testing and refurbishing the equipment returned to us, which helps our customers achieve demonstrable savings vs. traditional methods of managing returns. Our target customers include Asian electronics manufacturers, retailers, distributors, wholesalers, system integrators, commercial and institutional real estate management companies, and other bulk buyers and sellers of electronics.Sales Manager Job Responsibilities:Identifies new markets and major entities in new and existing markets.Establishes sales objectives by forecasting and developing annual sales quotas by industry and program; and projecting expected sales volume and profit for existing and new accounts.Implements national sales programs by developing field sales action plans.Maintains sales volume, services mix, and selling price by keeping current with supply and demand, changing trends, economic indicators, and competitors.Prepares sales and marketing reportsEstablishes and adjusts selling prices by monitoring costs, competition, and supply and demand.Prepares sales contracts and SOWsMaintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops, reviewing professional publications, establishing personal networks, and participating in professional societies.Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.Our Corporate location is in Atlanta, with near term expansion plans in El Paso, Las Vegas, and Indianapolis. Preferably you would live near one of these cities, but this position could be established as a remote work position for the right candidate. Post-COVID, you can expect 25% travel domestically and to Asia. The position offers a solid base pay plus a generous commission structure.As a QGistix employee, you would be eligible to participate in all benefits currently offered to QGistix employees. After 60 days of service, you would be eligible for medical and voluntary benefits. After 90 days of service, you would be eligible to enroll in our 401K retirement program. QGistix will match 50% of your contributions up to 3% of your salary. After 1 year or 1,000 hours of service you would be fully vested into your plan. Paid time off is available after the completion of six continuous months of service.Sales Manager Qualifications/Skills:Strong communication skillsCreating and implementing a sales planMeeting sales goals by monitoring progressPresentation skillsManagement and leadership skillsDeveloping budgetsEducation and Experience Requirements:Bachelor’s degree in marketing, business administration, accounting, or a STEM field.MBA preferredTwo to three years of experience as sales managerTen+ years of sales experienceStrong existing industry relationships, especially with Asian electronics manufacturersProven track record of positive sales performanceExperience in sales of services is a plusExperience selling to or for Asian companiesMandarin Chinese, a big plusJob Type: Full-timePay: $68,000.00 - $93,000.00 per yearBenefits:401(k)401(k) matchingDental insuranceHealth insuranceLife insurancePaid time offVision insuranceWork from homeSchedule:Monday to FridaySupplemental Pay:Commission payEducation:Bachelor's (Required)Experience:Sales Experience: 10 years (Required)Willingness To Travel:25% (Preferred)Work Location:Multiple locationsThis Company Describes Its Culture as:Detail-oriented -- quality and precision-focusedInnovative -- innovative and risk-takingAggressive -- competitive and growth-orientedOutcome-oriented -- results-focused with strong performance cultureCompany's website:www.QGistix.comBenefit Conditions:Waiting period may applyOnly full-time employees eligibleWork Remotely:YesCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processPersonal protective equipment provided or requiredTemperature screeningsSocial distancing guidelines in placeVirtual meetingsSanitizing, disinfecting, or cleaning procedures in place

The RoleThe Sales Development Representative role holds an essential position in the growth and development of our sales pipeline, having a direct impact on the business. You are excited about prospecting to potential customers while maintaining a fun and rewarding atmosphere.In This Role You WillSource new sales opportunities through lead follow-up, outbound calls, and emails.Proactively seek new business opportunities in the market.Set up meetings between prospective customers and Account Executives.Develop sales approaches and pitches that speak to the customer’s needs, concerns, and objectives.Effectively communicate our value proposition and develop professional relationships with prospects.Document all sales activity in our CRM system (Salesforce).Participate in ongoing training and stay up-to-date with new products and services.Understand Telnyx’s goal and purpose to continually enhance the company’s performance.You May Be Fit For This Role If You HaveCommercial experience in sales or marketing (SaaS experience a benefit).Excellent verbal and written communication, listening, and interpersonal skills.A strong phone presence with a knack for building rapport quickly and establishing trust.Hands-on experience with outbound sales techniques (prospecting, cold calling, emailing, etc.).Technical aptitude to quickly assimilate the technical knowledge.Previous experience telemarketing, cold-calling, and setting appointments/closing sales via telephone is preferred.Strong desire to grow your career within a nimble and hungry environment.What It Is Like To Work At Telnyx Telnyx is a complex machine with a simple purpose: connect people. We are an intelligent telephony engine, the beating heart of the Telnyx service that routes data along the pathways of our global, private network. We are drop-in APIs for hooking applications into our products, and an administrator portal that puts unprecedented control of configuring and orchestrating the Telnyx service into our customers’ hands.We’re also an organization of industry experts and engineers focused on solving problems and building solutions. We’re a concierge customer success team and a 24/7 support team. We’re a communications partner, focused on agile and endless innovation, not a telecom slogged in antiquated processes and anti-competitive regulation. We keep the conversation going: the always-on, omni-channel, enriched conversation that the modern world demands.Communications are coming untethered from devices, and more and more, they’re migrating into our everyday platforms: our social media, our work applications and our collaboration tools. But, that move started before there was infrastructure to support it—the modern internet will never offer the speed and consistency that real-time communications require. So, we built a network that does and a cloud platform tuned for real-time communications at every layer.Telnyx is the connective matrix, a worldwide nervous system, a high-speed rail tunnelling through the information superhighway. We’re the foundation for calls, texts and messaging today, for the internet of things, augmented reality and “communitainment” tomorrow, and for whatever enterprising imaginations can dream up after that.We’re Telnyx. We’re the future of communications.At Telnyx, we're looking for people with passion, grit, and integrity. You're encouraged to apply even if your experience doesn't precisely match the job description. Your skills and passion will stand out—and set you apart—especially if your career has taken some extraordinary twists and turns. At Telnyx, we welcome diverse perspectives and people who think rigorously and aren't afraid to challenge assumptions. Join us.Job Types: Full-time, CommissionWork Remotely:Yes

Company Description
ClientSolv Technologies is an IT solution firm with over a decade of experience serving Fortune 1000 companies, public sector and small to medium sized companies. ClientSolv Technologies is a woman-owned and operated company that is certified as a WMBE, 8a firm by the Federal government's Small Business Administration.

Job Description
This is a remote role, however, you need to be local to the greater Atlanta area to be able to commute into the office in a moments notice in case of emergency.
The Systems Administrator will design, deploy, manage and troubleshoot core windows services such as: AD Sites and Services, DNS, Group Policy Objects, DHCP, User and Computers, AD Permission delegation using the least privilege methodology, AD Groups (both Dynamic and Static), AD Replication, and other Domain services.
Additional responsibilities include:
Implement, troubleshoot and remediate 3rd Party Multi-tiered applications deployed to Windows systems utilizing windows system logs, logs generated by the application, and utilizing various tools such as WireShark, etc.
Ensure that industry best practices are followed for Windows Server implementation.
Oversees the installation, configuration, and support to a local area network, wide area network, internet system, computers, desktops and/or mobile devices.

Qualifications
Working experience with Windows Server 2012 and later.Must be able to manage multiple tasks/projects that are assigned.Administrator Experience in work environment with SSO implementation/infrastructureAdministrator Experience in work environment with Ansible, Foreman, and/or other automation tools.Administrator Experience in work environment with Microsoft System Center suite of productsAdministrator Experience in work environment with Microsoft IntuneAdministrator Experience in work environment designing, deploying, and supporting hybrid cloud
 infrastructure (VMWare, Microsoft Hyper-V and Microsoft Azure)Experience writing and modifying PowerShell scripts
Additional Information
Contract role.

You will be leading a team of SEO analysts and strategists responsible for content SEO, technical SEO, and hyperlocal business listings for national brands.
You’ll be joining an Ad Age 2019 A-List Agency. Blurring the lines between a creative agency, a digital agency and a management consultancy, we are one of the largest and fastest growing independent agencies in North America. Our digital offering is married to the discipline and rigor of our Effie-winning strategists and Cannes Lion-winning creative directors. We are united by our philosophy: Connecting Data & Creativity for Business Results®.

We’re a nationally recognized team of elite performance marketing specialists. At this year’s 2020 US Search Awards, Tombras broke records winning more categories than any other agency or brand in the history of the awards:

Best PPC Campaign

What you’ll be doing:

Architect comprehensive SEO strategies and tactics for national and international brands, including multi-location clients.
Exceptional analytical capabilities paired with effective client communication skills
Deep experience in hyperlocal SEO, including location business listing management across dozens of online directories with enterprise level software (Yext, Reputation.com, BrightLocal, etc.)

Technical SEO expertise: hreflang, canonical URLs, XML sitemaps, robots.txt, 301 redirects, schema markup, internal/external linking strategies, international CMS website architectures, country/language URLs, title tag optimization, and more
Work with the Director of SEO to develop new SEO client initiatives and team training
Work with the Director of SEO to manage tasks, workloads and projects across a large SEO team
Exhibit confident communication skills to effectively present tactical plans and SEO performance to clients
Proactively identify new keyword opportunities, then recommend detailed action to capitalize on them – pushing ideation, execution, and all the way to completion
Maintain a constant pulse on the organic search engine health across clients at an aggregate level, as well as hyperlocal-level

You should have intimate experience with site crawling tools, enterprise-level SEO software, listings management platforms, and international website architecture best practices
 In addition to strategy, you will be responsible for owning weekly status meetings, project reporting, and ensuring performance is meeting client objectives
6+ years experience in online marketing, including a minimum of 4+ years leading SEO initiatives for enterprise-level brands
Proven track record of successful client relationship development
Proven success at improving organic rankings for international websites

SEO platforms (examples: BrightEdge, Conductor, Searchmetrics, Majestic SEO, etc.)

Experience with Listings Management platforms (examples: Yext, Moz Local, Reputation.com, etc.)
Intimate experience of Google Search Console, Google Analytics, and Bing Webmaster Tools
CMS such as Adobe Experience Manager, WordPress, Joomla, Drupal, etc.
Language translation and localization platforms and processes
