JobTitle: Integrity-Driven Sales Position for Boutique Coaching Co. 100% Remote
Qualifications: High school or equivalent (Preferred)Sales Experience: 1 year (Preferred)
Text: Hi! Our company, Introverted Alpha, helps smart introverted men attract women naturally by bringing out their own unique best. We've been around for over six years, and we are a remote team across the country.*The position we're hiring for is an Alpha Advocate: a name born of ours (Introverted Alpha) and your role: an advocate for “our guys,” as we affectionately call them.**Position Summary: ROLE:  To help clients along the way of enrolling in the right program for them. They reach out to us for support, and as an Alpha Advocate, you simply talk through their options with them on the phone, options they are already aware of: Launch Your Dating Life, Become A Benevolent Badass, and others.LOGISTICS:  This is a remote part-time contractor position, paid on a commission basis. You’ll be taking calls with our guys in the afternoons and evenings during launches (concentrated sales times for a couple of weeks at a time, a handful of times per year), and you may get an appointment here or there when we are not having a launch.COMPENSATION:  Our programs range from $1,800 to $7,000. You’ll be paid on a commission basis: 15% per client enrollment to start, then 17%. This compensation includes surrounding admin and email follow-up.IMPORTANT:  We are hiring for attitude and disposition, not sales experience, as we will train thoroughly in our own ways.Who You Are: These are words that describe you well: warm, insightful, and poised. As such, you feel relaxed and confident in your communication.You compassionately see the best in people. You’d love to support intelligent, kind, good-hearted men, helping them become successful with dating and life in general. You’re pragmatic, and you have a warm and caring nature. You are articulate and well-spoken, and you love to learn.As far as your day-to-day, you’d love to devote the latter part of your day to supporting and talking to people for two weeks at a time every two months, and you are typically available for this in the afternoons and evenings (about 3 or 4pm to 7 or 8pm).Who Is Introverted Alpha: I founded Introverted Alpha in June of 2014, and it has been wonderful to see it become a stable, mature, and a trusted source of wisdom and direction for introverted men.I’ve grown the business substantially each year, and I am very excited for the coming years ahead. It is an adventure every day! There is so much to learn about business, and so much to love about the special men we serve.Our Direction: Right out of the gate back in 2014 and 2015, we were approached by leading experts in the industry asking to get to know us and entail our support and wisdom.We get emails daily from our readers, colleagues, and clients THANKING US from the bottom of their hearts for being here, for making such a difference in their lives.It is an honor to be making an indelible impact in the market, and we look forward to flourishing together in years to come: you, me, our growing team, our clients, readers, and everyone who is positively influenced by the work we’re doing.We are full of positive energy and strategic curiosity over how to support our guys better every day. Joy is what this company runs on, and we are very grateful for that.Who Are Our Clients?They are smart, introverted men who value integrity, adventure, connection, and fun. As entrepreneurs, engineers, outdoorists, foodies, leaders, and wanderers, they are thoughtful, patient, kind, and strong.They are ready to grow and develop to the next level with dating, social leadership, confidence, and more. Many times, they just haven’t found the resources or guidance to do that in a way that feels honest and true to them until they find US.That’s where you come in: helping bridge the gap between them finding us and working together. If it’s a fit. you’ll help them take that step into the best program for them, and along with that, the 1:1 care of a devoted IA Coach.Introverted Alpha is founded on LOVE for these men: genuine love and respect. We are focused on the holistic life-cycle of the client, so nurturing them at every touchpoint is crucial.Your Tasks: 1:1 calls:  This is where you’ll help our potential clients see if this is a fit to work together. Calls take place during the afternoons and evenings. (I will give you lots of guidance and a solid framework for these fun calls and your emails too!)Email and admin:  Before and after each call, there will be some admin and email follow-up. You’ll be following up with potential clients after your calls, as you might have more than one call per potential client.Logistics of expected workload:  It’s important that you’re available in a very quiet, peaceful place for the exploration calls and that you’re able to check and respond to emails a few times daily on weekdays.Your Strengths & Background: You’re a critical thinker and a problem solver. You get to the heart of the matter and ask great questions.You help people feel comfortable to open up and at ease around you.You are professional and clear with your communication.Also, you love helping people. You love handling things with genuine care, clearing their concerns, and supporting them to actualize on the goals they’ve set for themselves.HOW TO APPLY: Visit our website to get a sense of us (introvertedalpha.com).If you like what you see and what I’ve said here, email me with the following email structure:(1) A brief hello / introduction,(2) Your answers to these questions:1. What do you most resonate with about the company?2. What excites you most about being our Alpha Advocate?3. What are your career / life / holistic goals?4. Why do you love people so much?5. What is your greatest strength, and what do you get complimented on most?6. What was/is your biggest challenge in supporting people in a professional capacity (if applicable, otherwise a personal capacity), and what have you done to address that?7. What do you see as the biggest reward of coming to join us?(3) Your CV, attached.Thank you. I look forward to hearing from you!*Job Type: Part-timePay: $1.00 - $31,000.00 per yearCOVID-19 considerations:This is a fully remote position, so no personal interations will take place face-to-face.Education:High school or equivalent (Preferred)Experience:Sales Experience: 1 year (Preferred)

JobTitle: Sales Rep. for Outsourcing Service Provider
Text: Company Name:  Remote OwlWebsite:  www.remoteowls.comLocation:  Cairo, EgyptAbout Us: We have been around Since 2018, we are located in Cairo, Egypt.We have essentially been working with small to mid-size real estate businesses in USA Providing a variety of different services.And currently, we have about 80 Clients and have a staff of 320 Employees, a steady funnel of new Clients & Fresh Applicants Ready to JoinBut as of now, we are looking to expand our portfolio and branch out to different Industries. Because Prior to finding our success in The real-estate field we have worked in more than one industry such as Customer Service and Medical BillingAnd now what we are looking forward to Building a path for us to come back to Projects That we are not just good at executing but actually projects we are passionate about.That is our strongest Suit and that is why we started this opportunity.We are looking for someone that can see the value Proposition and see the extent of our expertise and services and Pitch for us. Help us get our foot in the door where we can have a Conversation with Prospects because we can Provide Corporate Level Services at less than the minimum wage Rate.but at this point, it’s a matter of Would this be something you are interested to be a part of?Job Description: You will be responsible for full lifecycle sales efforts, from Identifying potential clients to the initial call through contract execution. This role requires a background in the Healthcare industry and Revenue Cycle Management or B2B Sales.We are looking for someone with industry knowledge, strong communication skills, excellent problem-solving skills, as well as the ability to start, develop, and nurture relationships.Technical acumen is essential to the success of this role. This role can be located anywhere in the United States.Having a pre-existing and established network in the Healthcare industry is a BIG PLUS.Payout Structure: This is commission-based pay.Per client, you will receive a cut of the profit (after expenses) on monthly basis as long as the client’s account is active.After successfully signing the first 5 clients you receive an extra bonus of $2000.Afterward a $3000 bonus for every 10 clients.*This is would be a contract-based job*Key Strategic Objectives: Generate leads through professional networking and cold calling techniquesInitiate and build prospect relationshipsAbility to understand unique prospect needs within the context of the healthcare industry and effectively communicate the value propositionCoordinate and schedule online and onsite meetings of key decision-makers (If need be)Develop prospect account strategy and planTrack record demonstrating strong “closing” skills and revenue growthMonitor customer, market, and competitor activity and provide feedback to the company leadership team and other company functionsManage key customer relationships and participate in closing strategic opportunitiesTravel for in-person meetings with customers and partners and to develop key relationships (If need be)Experience Requirements: 1+ year B2B sales experience; proven ability to identify and develop new business with prospects and existing accounts, build/maintain relationships with the decision-makersExperience in selling platforms and services.Demonstrated record of success at both large, complex organizations and in mid-sized environments is a plus.Part-time hours: 20-40 per weekJob Types: Full-time, Part-time, CommissionSalary: From $2,000.00 per monthWork Remotely:YesCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processVirtual meetings

Reynolds and Reynolds is seeking a motivated and hard-working Outside Sales Representative Trainee to join our growing team. The goal of this position is to prepare you for your own sales territory in our Marketing and Business Solutions team. Reynolds provides over 5,000 different types of promotional, branded, and printed business solutions to the automotive dealership market.
Once you complete the training period and a territory becomes available, you will be required to relocate to the open territory and take over selling documents and promotional products to existing customers as the territory’s assigned Sales Representative. Relocation assistance to this new territory will be provided by the company. In this role, you will also develop and maintain new customers throughout your specified territory. You are eligible to receive a company car for both business and personal use. In addition, as a Sales Representative (and Trainee) you will have a home office and will be provided a company cell phone, laptop, and other office equipment.
Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
Must be a self-starter with the ability to schedule time effectively
Ability to create and maintain strong relationships
Must be willing to relocate upon completion of training
Training:
As a Trainee, you will enroll in our world class training that includes on-the-job training in your training territory as well as classroom style workshops. The workshops cover training on products, processes, sales skills, and automotive dealership operations. Through the on-the-job training, you will assist your mentor in all aspects of the sales cycle within various accounts and territories.

JobTitle: Bilingual Sales Development Advisor - March Start
Text:
Are you interested in an opportunity to join the fastest growing organization with a one-of-a-kind culture? SelectQuote is looking to hire individuals for our Bilingual Sales Development Advisor ("SDA") team within Inside Response, where team members are responsible for handling all of SelectQuote's insurance product inquiries. The SDA team will work with consumers on understanding their needs and triaging them to a licensed agent. We have a fun, comfortable, and fast-paced working environment where our employees are rewarded for their achievements. This is a fantastic opportunity for someone wanting to expand into sales.
We encourage you to apply if you are interested in building an inside sales career! After applying, you will speak with our recruiting team to learn more about Inside Response, a SelectQuote company, and this inside sales position.
The Day-to-Day:
Paid training; we will give you all the tools you need for success
Responsible for creating a positive 1st impression of SelectQuote by having a positive tone of voice and conversational energy on a consumer's 1st interaction with the company.
Outbound dialing sales prospects who have expressed interest in receiving quotes for SelectQuote's insurance product suite.
Execute transfer of potential customers to a licensed insurance agent
Educate consumers on SelectQuote's value proposition of "We shop, you save" through our 20+ A-Rated carrier comparison shopping technology, and further sell them on the importance of talking to our best-in-call agents.
Intense focus on handling and overcoming consumer objections and stalls in order to get them the help they need in their shopping experience.
Willingness to receive improvement coaching, implement those suggested actions and show demonstrated improvement.
Meet and exceed specified monthly goals for transfer rates and contact to transfer to increase sales agent conversion.
Become a part of a competitive team atmosphere and great culture that rewards performance.
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
Bilingual in English/Spanish
Excellent oral communication with strong interpersonal skills
Strong conversational phone skills
Ability to take feedback and implement to improve performance
Excellent time management skills
Ability to learn and adapt to changes quickly
Competitive personality & an internal motivation - You need to have the drive to overcome customer objections and compete with yourself and other agents to succeed and hit new goals.
Ability to follow instructions and have proficiency with technology, especially computers, software applications and phone systems'
Demonstrated professionalism in conduct and behaviors
Hardwired high-speed internet connection with a minimum download speed of 30mbps and upload speed of 20mbps
Training and Experience:
High school diploma or equivalent is required.
Associates or bachelor's degree preferred.
Preferred 1 year or more experience working in a contact center environment
Previous work experience centered around customer service or sales required
Proven track record of exceeding goals in past positions
What We Can Offer You:
Base pay plus bonus potential
Opportunities for upward mobility in a growing organization for those who exceed expectations
Benefits – Full-time employees are eligible for medical, dental, vision, voluntary short-term disability, company-paid long term disability, company-paid life insurance and accidental death & dismemberment (AD&D), 401(k) + company match and 100% vesting after 4 years, discretionary profit sharing, employee stock purchase program (espp), paid time off, floating holidays, paid maternity leave, paid parental bonding leave, tuition reimbursement, jury duty pay, work from home stipend, and other paid leaves vary based on work location
Daily/weekly/monthly prizes, including TV's, gift cards, and more!
Fun and energetic company culture with team-inspired competition

Atlanta, Georgia, USA
ThoughtWorks is a global software consultancy with an aim to create a positive impact on the world through technology. Our community of technologists thinks disruptively to deliver pragmatic solutions for our clients' most complex challenges. We are curious minds who come together as collaborative and inclusive teams to push boundaries, free to be ourselves and make our mark in tech.

As consultants, we work with our clients to ensure we’re evolving their technology and empowering adaptive mindsets to meet their business goals. You could influence the digital strategy of a retail giant, build a bold new mobile application for a bank or redesign platforms using event sourcing and intelligent data pipelines. You will use the latest Lean and Agile thinking, create pragmatic solutions to solve mission-critical problems and challenge yourself every day.

Our Product Managers lead the ideation and delivery of some of the best digital products in the market today. They help orchestrate business strategy, design and technology disciplines to drive solutions for our clients that provide significant business results through delivering highly effective customer engagement. Thoughtworks Product Managers work with some of the most senior-level executives at our clients to drive alignment around the solutions we build and the value they deliver.

Outcomes you’ll be driving as a Lead Product Manager:

You will develop a customer-focused understanding of the value and purpose of a solution based on users’ needs
You will build a shared product vision and roadmap and execute on it
You will cultivate meaningful relationships with client stakeholders and develop a deep understanding of their strategy, structure and business model
Ensure ongoing buy-in and support from product stakeholders, bring in external research to validate what good looks like for the product direction
Lead customer focus and product emphasis to encourage a high performing team
Serve as a key point of contact to get information for the team, such as goals, problems, and the measure of success for each feature. Support members of the team by removing blockers and supporting account strategy at a tactical level
Drive the overall product delivery lifecycle and continuously deliver undeniable value to our clients across a portfolio of products
Own the product backlog and constantly evolve it based on the latest changes in the business
Contribute to the growth and scale of our evolving business through taking an active part in recruiting, community building, mentorship, identifying and driving best practices and market trends.


Here’s what we’re looking for:

You can take a product vision and translate it into a roadmap with clear measures of success
Assure effective collaboration between ThoughtWorks’ and the client’s teams, encouraging open communication and advocating for shared outcomes
You naturally empathize with your product’s user, keeping them in mind throughout all stages of the product management lifecycle
You have a knack for prioritization, obtaining buy-in from stakeholders, and resolving conflicts as they arise
You have a track record of managing the scope and shape of programs of work
You love facilitating workshops with business stakeholders to outline your product roadmap and a project release plan
You’re able to clearly define a value proposition and seamlessly articulate it, generating support and buy-in from all relevant stakeholders
You’re analytical: you know that your product must provide tangible business value and can gather the right requirements and analysis to support your work
But you’re right-brained, too: you know the power of effective storytelling and can easily synthesize data and insights into clear, impactful messaging
You’ve been exposed to service design and have user needs research experience
Experience in Healthcare or Public Sector or Finance industry is a plus
A few important things to know:
While we’ve traditionally been a traveling consultancy, travel is not required for this role at the moment. We anticipate the need for travel to our client locations in the future when it’s deemed safe.
Candidates must possess work authorization that does not require H-1B visa sponsorship by ThoughtWorks or dependent EAD.


Not quite ready to apply? Or maybe this isn’t the right role for you? That’s OK, you can stay in touch with AccessThoughtWorks, our learning community (click "contact me about recruitment opportunities" to hear about jobs in the future).

It is the policy of ThoughtWorks, Inc. to provide a work environment free of discrimination. The Company will take affirmative action to ensure applicants and ThoughtWorks employees are treated without regard to race, color, religion, sex/gender, national origin, ethnic origin, veteran or military status, family or marital status, disability, genetic information, age, sexual orientation, gender expression or gender identity. This also includes individuals who are perceived to have any of the aforementioned attributes. ThoughtWorks will adhere to all federal, state, and municipal laws and regulations governing employment.

Product ManagementSaaSProduct RequirementsPrior experience working on Ad-Tech or Mar-Tech products is strongly preferred

You are responsible for:
Provide solution and technical support for DN Retail Portfolio of POS and SCO for DN Americas including
Solution Definition and Positioning
Go to Market Strategy and Approach
Configuration Validation including local specification
Feedback to Global product management on local roadmap requirements

StressOS (https://stressos.com/) is an interactive stress management program that helps people assess and create personalized stress reduction plans that are just right for them. It helps people and organizations identify toxic stress then use relevant, focused resources to reduce it.
So much of our world is different right now, particularly in the workplace. All of the sudden normal workplace stress is piled on top of stress we feel at home from roommates, spouses, children, chores, animals, etc. Businesses that value and invest in their employees’ physical and mental well being have not only a happier workforce, but one that shows increased productivity and profitability over time.
This is an opportunity to be a part of a 100% commission sales team that is hungry and driven to pursue a market that is not only expansive, but continuing to grow, while reaping the benefits of uncapped commission and autonomy.
The sales process we use was created by life-long salespeople, not a CPA or CFO. Our sales coaches are dedicated to your success and will work with you to give you all of the knowledge and tools you need to reach your financial and career goals (realistic path to make 100K+ in the first year!).
Our #1 goal for you as a salesperson is to help you live your ideal life, including:
Uncapped Earning Potential- We want you to make so much money you don’t know what to do with it.
Time Freedom- You need to have time to enjoy your financial freedom. What good does it do to make a bunch of money but have no time to enjoy life?
Flexibility- We don’t believe in sales managers, we believe in mentors! You will have your own performance coach, accountability coach and onboarding specialist who will be there to support you as you grow. Get things done on your schedule. No more punching a time clock.
We have a ridiculous amount of support for our sales team including:
Personal and group coaching designed to take your skills and abilities to the next level.
Technology, tools, and automation created to get rid of the mundane, repetitive tasks that bog down most salespeople.
The time to dominate this market is now, and it’s time for you to come and show off what you can accomplish!
Key Responsibilities
Initiate outbound efforts (call, text, email, LinkedIn) each day to prospects.
Qualify prospects, gauge interest, and schedule sales calls.
Respond in a timely manner to all leads.
Collaborate with the team on improving prospecting strategies.
Identify & source information on prospective clients.
Oversee demo requests and fulfillment.
Participate in negotiations of contracts.
Qualifications
Strong company culture fit.
Strong listening skills and excellent phone demeanor.
Technologically proficient; not necessarily an expert, but knowledgeable.
Excellent written and verbal communication.
Web-Cam enabled computer or laptop, Ability to receive inbound and make outbound phone calls via cell or internet (wired ethernet), in a quiet environment without interruptions.
CRM experience is a HUGE plus.
Other Information
Compensation: 100% commission - High Six Figures is achievable ($160K+), anything less than Six Figures would be considered a failure. There is no ceiling to your compensation plan.
Work from anywhere in the world.

Job Description:
Fidelity Investments’ Racial Equity & Diversity Pledge
“Fidelity believes in, and is committed to, fair and consistent treatment for every associate and customer, and to creating a safe and respectful environment, in which everyone is treated with kindness, compassion and respect.” Abby Johnson | Chairman & CEO Fidelity Investments.

High Net Worth Representative

We have a new and exciting opportunity for a Remote Licensed High Net Worth Service Associate in the Greater Atlanta, GA area! The position is remote and requires that you reside in the Greater Atlanta, GA area. We offer virtual interviewing and onboarding, as well as access to our virtual training and support. Full access to work from home capabilities to support our clients remotely.

You work hard every day to help Fidelity’s customers through some of the most complex and difficult decisions of their lives. Our interactions help customers feel more confident to make better decisions and achieve their own financial dreams.

The Expertise We’re Looking For
Series 7 required
Series 63 preferred (paid training & support provided)
Ability to work 100% percent remotely
Bilingual in Spanish and English is a plus
2-3 years of previous experience working in the financial services industry
Entrepreneurial spirit: comfortable working independently, within the infrastructure of a large organization
Strong technological acumen and comfort with learning how to use new tools
Excels in paperless work environment by leveraging technology

The Purpose of Your Role

As a High Net Worth Representative, you will be an integral part of a fast-paced, team oriented environment that is focused on enhancing relationships with our high net worth clients who have assets of $250,000 to $1 million and therefore have complex service and investment needs. In this role, you will help us to increase customer loyalty and drive business development opportunities.

While every Fidelity location has distinctive regional characteristics, each one embodies the core values that have been instrumental in building our proud past. Putting the customer first, respect, integrity, honesty, innovation and improvement as well as competitiveness are values shared across the organization. These simple but powerful values set us apart from our competition.

The Skills You Bring
You have abroad based knowledge and understanding of general financial planning concepts
Proven customer service, client support and problem resolution skills
You possess exceptional verbal and written communication skills
Ability to effectively influence others and use consultative skills to enrich the customer experience
Your robust time management and organizational skills

​Our Investments in You
We believe that a holistic approach to life is important. Our benefit programs are designed to help you and your loved ones strike the perfect balance. Sound too good to be true? See for yourself and learn more about our benefits offerings:
Click to hear from a few of our associates about the outstanding benefits Fidelity offers: Benefits at Fidelity Investments
Click here for a story about how we are helping our employee’s payback their student loan debt

The Value You Deliver
Engaging with customers, via inbound calls, responding to their inquiries, and providing product and service level guidance,
Processing customer requests to include options, equities, mutual funds and fixed income trades and other specialized monetary requests
Delivering efficient and responsive resolutions for various client situations, researching the issue and communicating the solution to the client
Uncovering opportunities and identifying products and services that will enhance the client’s financial success and partner with the Financial Consultants to discuss potential business opportunity leads.
Collaborating with internal business partners to research and resolve complex client requests
Conducting pro-active outbound calls to communicate resolution to the client or secure additional information to close out the request
Certifications: Series 07 - FINRA

Company Overview

At Fidelity, we are focused on making our financial expertise broadly accessible and effective in helping people live the lives they want. We are a privately held company that places a high degree of value in creating and nurturing a work environment that attracts the best talent and reflects our commitment to our associates. We are proud of our diverse and inclusive workplace where we respect and value our associates for their unique perspectives and experiences. For information about working at Fidelity, visit FidelityCareers.com.

Fidelity Investments is an equal opportunity employer.

Fidelity will reasonably accommodate applicants with disabilities who need adjustments to complete the application or interview process. Please email us at accommodations@fmr.com or 800-835-5099, prompt 2, option 2 if you would like to request an accommodation.

Who We Are:

Committed to performance. Committed to excellence. We are Nutrabolt, a fast-growing nutritional life science company located in beautiful and bustling Austin, TX. Our marquee brands, Cellucor®, C4®, and XTEND®, are among the world's leading sports nutrition and performance energy product lines. You can find C4®, America's #1 pre-workout and fastest-growing performance energy drink brand, plus XTEND®, the world's #1 BCAA brand, in a wide variety of online and physical retailers around the globe.

As a "Top 100 Best Company to Work for in Texas," we're proud to work on category-captain brands that are changing the shape of the sports nutrition industry and owe our success to the passion-fueled individuals that power our organization.

We are committed to creating a workplace built on trust, teamwork, and a successful track record that speaks for itself. Because at the end of the day, our mission is about innovating, inspiring, and making products that maximize human potential accessible to all- and that starts with our team members.
Note to applicants: This role is a remote, field-based position that will require traveling around the greater Atlanta, GA area.

Who You Are:

As our Field Representative on the beverage team, you will spend your time working in the field to support and execute sales. This will include partnering with our Area Sales Managers and distributor partner(s) to ensure that our products and presence in store are up to date. You will also assist in educating the distributor salesperson(s) on our brands and shelf standards.

What You're Good At:

Fostering account relationships within your territory by establishing good rapport with stores managers and following up regularly
Ensuring accounts have product in stock and ensuring C4 looks organized and presentable on the shelves
Building and maintaining in-store displays, cooler placements, marketing point of sale (POS), etc.
Selling our product and product expansions to local stores once available with our distributors
Supporting customers in providing samples and conducting product demos at local events when applicable
Working closely with Distributor Salespeople to educate them on our brand and assist selling in store
Tracking your progress in stores through our CRM tool, Repsly
Supporting both Distributors, National & Regional chain accounts with any resets in your territory
Participate in Distributor sales meetings and market blitz/crew drive activities in your market and possibly others as needed

What You Contribute:

1+ year of experience in the beverage industry and/or in a sales related position is preferred
Excellent customer service skills
Proven track record of being dependable and results driven
Ambitious, outgoing, and ability to build relationships
Effective organizational and administrative skills
Some travel to other regions may be requested to support adjacent territories
Must be able to use a personal vehicle during business hours
Valid Driver's License, current vehicle liability insurance, and driving record within Nutrabolt's MVR policy guidelines

Why Nutrabolt?

We offer unlimited vacation time, to show our appreciation for our employee's hard work.
We celebrate new families through our paid maternity and paternity leave.
We value the importance of work-life integration by offering a monthly childcare stipend.
We support our employee's wellness journey by providing a monthly fitness allowance.
We provide employee discounts on Cellucor and XTEND products and swag.
We are committed to our employee's continued personal and professional development.
We offer competitive health/dental/vision insurance including options such as HSA and flexible spending accounts.
We invest in our employee's future by committing to 401K matching.

For questions about your application, you may email careers@nutrabolt.com.

HireArt is helping a healthcare technology and services company find a Talent Acquisition Sourcer, Diversity to help build diverse teams that will further its mission to impact more lives and deliver better outcomes for patients.
As a Talent Acquisition Sourcer, you’ll bring your expertise in diverse talent acquisition to support our client's needs and provide talent acquisition partners by developing a pipeline of candidates with the goal of diverse representation across all levels of roles.
This is a full-time (40 hours per week), 8-month contract position with the possibility of extension and will be fully remote.
As Talent Acquisition Sourcer, Diversity, you will:
Develop candidate pipelines for recurring and one-off hiring needs.

Partner with talent acquisition partners to analyze job requirements and identify candidate profiles to target.
Create and execute sourcing strategies that leverage your knowledge and networks, as well as industry best practices to attract underrepresented talent.
Screen, advise, and present candidates to talent acquisition partners and hiring managers.
Engage with a network of potential candidates by building a rapport and advocating for candidates throughout the hiring process.
Analyze sourcing and conversion data to drive sourcing strategy improvements.

Experience recruiting for software engineers, IT, product managers, data scientists, or technology-oriented roles a plus
An ability to proactively come up with creative sourcing strategies
Exceptional dedication to the candidate experience
Passionate about networking, leveraging, establishing professional relationships and existing relationships with a professional network and affinity groups a plus
Must be detail-oriented and autonomous
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Dedication towards diversity and inclusion
Commitment: This is a full-time (40 hours per week), 8-month contract position with the possibility of extension through HireArt and will be fully remote.
HireArt values diversity and is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are interested in every qualified candidate who is eligible to work in the United States. Unfortunately, we are not able to sponsor visas.

The Analytic Consulting Group partners with internal and external clients and data providers, leveraging predictive analytics and advanced statistical techniques to drive strategic thought process and effective decision making. As the Lead Analytic Consultant, you’ll aid in analyzing client data to presenting findings or recommendations to helping to steer the strategic direction in solving a variety of business problems.
Responsibilities:
Use your analytics and machine learning expertise to research and recommend the best analytic approaches to solving the marketing problems facing our clients
Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to understand the client’s business situation and develop data driven insights that can be understood and implemented to drive marketing strategies
Conduct analysis by qualitatively and/or quantitatively preparing data and analyzing data/information. Prepare reports and analyses, uncovering insights and developing business recommendations based on data findings
QA/QC data and report or analyses output to ensure accuracy
Create compelling presentations that provide actionable insights and recommendations
Present analyses/ reports to key internal and external stakeholders, effectively communicating the key findings and recommendations
Assist in the development of project requirements, analytic plans, project timelines, and other related materials for the management of deliverables
Support sales process by assessing prospective clients’ needs and crafting/ presenting proposals that meet those needs; Explore and capitalize on opportunities to cross-sell and up-sell existing clients
Communicate and engage with key internal business partners and Epsilon clients to collaboratively solve business problems. Collaborate with leadership to devise strategic direction
Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor degree in a quantitative discipline (statistics, economics, mathematics, computer science, electrical engineering, or a related scientific discipline)
5+ years of experience manipulating large data sets, both structured & unstructured, with natural curiosity for exploring data and finding the untold story
Strong understanding of statistics, modeling and machine learning techniques
Able to present advance analytic concepts, algorithms and approaches to variety of audiences
Possess exceptional technical skills in one or more the following programming languages: Python, R, SQL, SAS. Familiarity with cloud based, open source computing environment a plus
Exposure with distributed computing, such as Hadoop, Spark, AWS or related technologies
Desire to work in a highly collaborative environment and highly motivated
Solid planning, priority setting, and project management skills with experience managing multiple projects and resources concurrently
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to display data visually, creating powerful presentations which effectively demonstrate the value of analytic deliverables
Desirable Qualifications:
Advanced degree (Masters) in Statistics, Economics or other quantitative discipline
Experience in marketing analytics field, with strong understanding of quantification of consumer behavior, marketing measurement process, tools and statistical algorithms (e.g. lifetime value, customer segmentation, control groups, A/B testing, multi-variate testing, time-series, media mix modeling, paid media optimization, predictive analytics, supervised/ unsupervised learning)
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and strong ability at developing relationships across diverse teams (including statistical, technical, and marketing resources)
Mastery programming experience in Advanced SQL, R, Python or related language (SAS, PySpark, knowledge of statistical packages for statistical modelling, parsing large quantity of data, AWS)
Visualization experience in Tableau preferred
Additional Information
Great People, Deserve Great Benefits
We know that we have some of the brightest and most talented associates in the world, and we believe in rewarding them accordingly. If you work here, expect competitive pay, comprehensive health coverage, and endless opportunities to advance your career.
Epsilon is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Epsilon’s policy is not to discriminate against any applicant or employee based on actual or perceived race, age, sex or gender (including pregnancy), marital status, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, mental or physical disability, religion, creed, color, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression (including transgender status), veteran status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local law. Epsilon also prohibits harassment of applicants and employees based on any of these protected categories.
Epsilon will provide accommodations to applicants needing accommodations to complete the application process.

Applicants with criminal histories are welcome to apply.

Text:
Surgical Sales Specialist - Southeast US Region
Caldera Medical’s Mission - To Improve the Quality of Life for Women!
Message from the Hiring Manager :
As a Surgical Sales Specialist, you will act as an interim sales representative for vacant territories in the Southeast US Region. We are looking for an energetic, hungry sales professional who desires to develop a sales career and is looking to break into Caldera Medical and the competitive arena of medical device sales.
Duties and Responsibilities:

Act as an interim sales representative for vacant territories. Territories may be vacant for a variety of reasons, including resignations, promotions, terminations, maternity leave, etc.
Travel 80% in order to:
Maintain all existing revenue in given territory
Attend surgical cases in the operating room
Continue pipeline momentum created by the prior representative
Secure hospital approvals and surgeon support
For territories that do not have existing revenue, achieve initial sales targets

Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

Bachelor’s degree
0-2 years experience in a sales, business, marketing, or related role
Demonstrated leadership and teamwork experience (i.e. athletics, extracurricular activities, etc)
Strong relationship orientation and strategic thinking skills
Strong oral and written communication skills
Demonstrated ability to effectively collaborate with internal colleagues
Ability to prioritize work and meet deadlines
Working knowledge of Microsoft Office software including Word and Outlook
A self-motivating, can-do attitude
Demonstrated flexibility and willingness to be coached and developed
Ability to travel 80% of the time
Who is Caldera Medical?
Caldera Medical is a growth stage medical device company dedicated to improving the quality of life for women! In 2018, Caldera was ranked one of Inc 5000’s fastest growing private companies in the United States and #38 fastest growing private company and #3 fastest growing Healthcare company in Los Angeles by the LA Business Journal. We develop and market differentiated surgical implants specifically for the treatment of Stress Urinary Incontinence and Pelvic Organ Prolapse. Our products are used by Urogynecologists, Gynecologists, and Urologists worldwide.
 “Our emphasis on collaborative problem-solving focuses team accountability towards developing solutions rather than fixating on individual obstacles. The result is a workplace teeming with positivity!”Ryan Neimy, Sr. R&D Engineer
Our Culture- Where Career and Passion come together!

A Culture of family and team… not a corporate goliath where you’re just another number
All employees get a seat at the table and have influence with management
We care about giving back to the community. Our team donates time to helping local charities throughout Southern California.
The Women’s Health Initiative is the heart of what we do, every day we put underprivileged women first.
Our goal is to treat 1 million women suffering from incontinence by 2025!

Competitive Compensation, Comprehensive Benefits, and more!

Medical and Dental Benefits – 75% paid for employee and family members
Vision Coverage
401(k) with 4% matching contributions after 90 days of employment
Basic Life and AD&D
Unlimited Vacation Policy
6 Weeks Paid Maternity Leave
10 paid holidays- including your birthday!
Being surrounded by amazing people!

Hear it from our very own! Learn more about Caldera on Glassdoor
Caldera Medical is an equal opportunity employer and considers all candidates for employment regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, citizenship, age, disability, marital status, military or veteran's status (including protected veterans, as may be required by federal law), sexual orientation, gender identity or any other category protected by law.
This is a remote position.

About Us

Our mission is to make hourly work easier for local businesses and their employees. Homebase currently serves more than 100,000 small (but mighty) businesses with everything they need to manage their hourly teams: employee scheduling, time clocks, team communication, hiring, onboarding, and compliance. We are not Human Capital Management. We are not HR Software. We're tools built for the busiest businesses, so owners and employees can spend less time on paperwork and more time on what matters. The Homebase team brings small business expertise from Intuit, Square, OpenTable, Yelp, Gusto, and First Data. Based in San Francisco and Houston, Homebase is backed by leading venture investors Bain Capital Ventures, Baseline Ventures, Cowboy Ventures, and Khosla Ventures.

You

You're a self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced and changing environment. You love talking to people and always put the customer first - whether it be via email, chat, or phone, your people skills and empathy shine through. You set big goals for yourself and work hard to accomplish them and you thrive in a performance-driven environment where your contributions are recognized.

The Job

At Homebase, we value all of the businesses that sign up for our services. As our Key Account Representative you will work one on one with some of our most valuable accounts. You will be their dedicated representative for training, billing, and ensuring that we are deeply ingrained into their day to day. You will be responsible for providing the purple standard to interested leads, existing accounts, and self sourcing leads when needed. Your partnership with the Marketing, Business Analytics and Product team is critical. These business partners not only support us in ensuring success for our customers, but also rely heavily on you to provide actionable insights.

Your overall objective is to grow both our existing base of franchises and multi location users, but also bring on brand new users. Goals will be set in the beginning based on historical data. As we progress through, we will make adjustments to how we view success including locations added, plan value (MRR) and expansion of existing account spend.

Responsibilities

Foster customer relationships through ongoing communication with contacts to ensure repeat business and referrals
Develop new accounts, expand existing accounts (adding locations), and handle all downgrades
Manage all assigned leads with the utmost sense of urgency and in accordance with the company's lead response time standards
Work collaboratively with marketing team to send mass communications
Work closely with product team to provide actionable feedback
Proactively engage in outbound sales activities and strategies
Be open and eager to learn and adapt to changes
Meet or exceed personal goals that will be set by the Business Operations team

Must Have

2+ years of experience growing a book of business
2+ years of experience selling software as a service
Proven track record of pipeline development and management
Proven success in the SMB space with a focus on those with hourly workers including but not limited to Hospitality, Healthcare and Logistics
The ability to walk us through your process. Go from discovery to close and show us how you navigate ensuring the customer makes an informed decision.
Strong outbound dialing ability. Email is great, however dialing the phone still works best

What We Offer You

Generous accrued PTO
Health, Dental & Vision Insurance
Stock Options - Everyone is an owner
Internal promotion opportunities
A dynamic, well-connected, productive team that is thriving while working from home and who have found new ways to connect and have fun despite social distancing

At Homebase, we value our differences, and we encourage all to apply. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Homebase is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and participant in the U.S. Federal E-Verify program.

Job ID: 211832
Location: REMOTE WORK , GA , US
Date Posted: 2021-02-09
Category: Cyber
Subcategory: Cyber GRC
Schedule: Full-time
Shift: Day Job
Travel: No
Minimum Clearance Required: Secret
Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain: Secret
Potential for Remote Work: Yes
Description
The ideal candidate has the ability to lead a team that implements, configures, monitors and maintains a DoD-approved enterprise SIEM tool to monitor, detect, and respond to threats on all USACE-supported networks and enclaves. The SIEM shall provide real-time analysis of security alerts generated by applications and network sensors, hardware, cyber tools, Government-approved threat intelligence feeds and threat detectors, and be capable of automatically forwarding incidents and events to the incident response team and USACE OCIO/G-6 based on severity level. The SIEM shall be configured to support classification level of data. Additional duties include:
Automated incident response capabilities.
Performing data correlation and analysis reporting for all sensors and defense capabilities at an enterprise level.
Providing the Government access to the SIEM systems, including the functionality to establish use cases and run queries.
Providing immediate notification for unplanned sensor-fed outages exceeding 24 hours, and providing an AAR identifying root causes for the outage .
Maintaining documentation for all feeds, sensors, and connectors in the SIEM and providing reports to USACE OCIO/G-6 .

Other general duties include: Provide correlation and analysis of cyberspace incident reports derived from reliable sources, network sensors, vulnerability management devices, open source information, and Industry/ Government provided situational awareness of known adversary activities. Applies expert knowledge of Named Areas of Interest (NAI) and advanced persistent threats to review, analyze, and maintain the content of an indicator database to aid in the detection and mitigation of threat activity. Utilize COTS/GOTS analyses tool and expert knowledge to provide threat detection analysis and monitoring, correlation, and prevention of cyber threat activity targeting the customer network. This task requires technical knowledge on the utilization of government and industry capabilities, best security practices, advanced log analysis, forensics, network monitoring, network flow analysis, packet capture analysis, network proxies, firewalls, and anti-virus capabilities. Additionally, this task requires technical knowledge of forensics analysis to determine adversary methods of exploiting information system security controls, the use of malicious logic, and the lifecycle of network threats and attack vectors. Must produce reports on the unique TTPs utilized and conduct incident handling/triage, network analysis and threat detection, trend analysis, metric development, and security vulnerability information dissemination. Must be able to assist the customer with developing metrics and trending/analysis reports of malicious activity and develop signatures for threat detection. (It should be understood that this is not intended to be a detailed nor comprehensive description of any individual employee's job content. Managers set the specific duties and responsibilities for each employee). SCOPE: N/A LEADERSHIP AND MANAGEMENT: N/A KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS AND ABILITY: Complete understanding and wide application of technical principles, theories, and concepts in the field. General knowledge of other related disciplines. Receives assignments in the form of objectives and establishes goals to meet outlined objectives. Provides direction to employees according to established policies and management guidance. Work is reviewed by management to measure whether objectives have been met. PROBLEM COMPLEXITY: Provides technical solutions to a wide range of difficult problems where analysis of data requires evaluation of identifiable factors. Solutions are imaginative, thorough, practicable and consistent with organization objectives. FREEDOM TO ACT: Works under only general direction. Independently determines and develops approach to solutions. Work is reviewed upon completion for adequacy in meeting objectives. Demonstrates good judment in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions. IMPACT: Contributes to completion of specific programs and projects. Failure to obtain results or erroneous decisions or recommendations would typically result in serious program delays and considerable expenditure of resources. LIASON: Frequent inter-organizational and outside customer contacts. Represents organization in providing solutions to difficult technical issues associated with specific projects.

Qualifications
EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE: Bachelors and five (5) years or more experience; additional 4 years experience in lieu of degree
CLEARANCE REQUIREMENT: Must have or be able to obtain a Secret clearance

Target salary range: $115,001 - $125,000. The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position based on experience and other factors.

JobTitle: Associate Academic Research Scientist – School of Medicine
Text:
Discover Your Career at Emory University:

Emory University is a leading research university that fosters excellence and attracts world-class talent to innovate today and prepare leaders for the future. We welcome candidates who can contribute to the diversity and excellence of our academic community.
Description:

The Associate Academic Research Scientist performs a wide range of highly technical and complex research duties and has documented scientific achievements and increasing technical, management, leadership, and professional expertise necessary to advance basic and/or translational research programs.
We are seeking a highly motivated candidate to join our team as a staff Scientist in Dr. Wrammert’s laboratory, within the Department of Pediatrics, Infectious Disease. The laboratory is focused on understanding the generation and maintenance of antiviral humoral immunity to a number of human pathogens, such as SARS-CoV-2, Dengue, Zika and Influenza.
The successful candidate will receive training as needed in a broad array of cellular and molecular techniques, such as ex vivo B cell assays, flow cytometry and cell sorting, single cell expression cloning, 10x analyses and various protein expression and purification approaches. Prior experience with any of these specific assays would be considered a major plus.
JOB DESCRIPTION:
Demonstrated knowledge of research and experimental platforms for analyzing, design and interpreting results Investigates and recommends potential alternative approaches to improve the quality of results of basic and/or translational research.
Demonstrates increased responsibility through management of teams and leadership of scientific projects by applying advanced knowledge, skills, and input necessary for protocol development, as well as facilitating in some training aspects of other team members.
Aids in writing IACUC, IRB, Biosafety and other approval documents.
Oversees quality assurance of research conducted by other team members.
May assist in grant and other funding applications as necessary and appropriate, or with approval of the responsible faculty director, may have their own research projects and/or have full responsibilities for specific areas of instrumentation or methodology development and user support.
With the approval of the responsible faculty director, may be principal investigators on funded proposals.
Performs other responsibilities as required.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
PhD or MD and five years of professional level experience OR Master's degree and ten years of professional level experience in a technical or research lab.
Laboratory experience will be based on area of assignment.
Internship experience or experience prior to attaining the qualifying degree is not considered eligible work experience for this job classification.
NOTE: Applicants applying with a M.D. or equivalent degree must be eligible for a Georgia medical license to meet the minimum qualifications.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:
PhD and an educational background in biology, immunology or molecular biology.
Previous lab experience, particularly in molecular biology or immunology techniques as noted above is preferred.
NOTE: Position tasks are generally required to be performed in-person at an Emory University location. Remote work from home day options may be granted at department discretion. Emory reserves the right to change remote work status with notice to employee.
Emory Supports a Diverse and Inclusive Culture:

Emory University is dedicated to providing equal opportunities and equal access to all individuals regardless of race, color, religion, ethnic or national origin, gender, genetic information, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, and veteran's status. Emory University does not discriminate in admissions, educational programs, or employment on the basis of any factor stated above or prohibited under applicable law. Students, faculty, and staff are assured of participation in University programs and in the use of facilities without such discrimination. Emory University complies with Executive Order 11246, as amended, Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, the Vietnam Era Veteran's Readjustment Assistance Act, and applicable executive orders, federal and state regulations regarding nondiscrimination, equal opportunity and affirmative action. Emory University is committed to achieving a diverse workforce through application of its affirmative action, equal opportunity and nondiscrimination policy in all aspects of employment including recruitment, hiring, promotions, transfers, discipline, terminations, wage and salary administration, benefits, and training. Inquiries regarding this policy should be directed to the Emory University Department of Equity and Inclusion, 201 Dowman Drive, Administration Building, Atlanta, GA 30322. Telephone: 404-727-9867 (V) | 404-712-2049 (TDD).
Emory University is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities upon request. To request this document in an alternate format or to request a reasonable accommodation, please contact the Department of Accessibility Services at 404-727-9877 (V) | 404-712-2049 (TDD). Please note that one week advance notice is preferred.

Position Overview

This can be a "remote" role. The Real Estate Sales Training and Support Manager role is one that will help our Field Sales team succeed! If you are ready to think big, love problems not solutions, immerse yourself in sales acumen, teach others virtually and/or in person, and have the passion and talent to build learning programming from scratch, this position is for you! This position is responsible for improving the productivity of our new and existing sales associates, as well as implementing, coordinating and presenting ongoing associate development in sales by partnering with the field leadership team. You will provide key input into, organize deliver - or support others in the delivery of - the development of materials to meet specific training needs. This may also include end-to-end ownership of special field projects and pilot programs.

Job Responsibilities

Develops and delivers learning activities for associates as part of the New Hire training program

Maintains training calendar for training classes

Facilitates various classes each month (in-person or remote)

Partners with the Learning and Organizational Development team to measure training program impacts through feedback collection and analysis of results; reports analysis to the leadership team and evolves programs accordingly

Reviews supplied materials from new associates to identify patterns of behavior and identify trainee challenges and opportunities and communicates with relevant leaders regarding training needs and the performance of individual associates

Leads peer-to-peer learning program, including identifying, developing, and monitoring associates capable and willing to provide peer-to-peer learning support

Plans, organizes, facilitates, and orders supplies for associate training programs

Provides training at all levels (basic to expert) in the field to associates

Maintains communication with other regional training managers to gain broad perspective of market, as well as design and incorporate innovative initiatives

Communicates and coordinates with the IT, Training, and L&OD Departments regarding the usage and issues relating to tools/training and designs and delivers relevant training programs as needed

Collaborates with Sales Solutions Manager to develop field support plan for all RE Sales and Marketing Solutions, incl Salesforce, Power BI/Looker, B2B, WarrentyLink, Navigator, On Mark Pro and third-party transaction management platforms.

Develops and maintains training materials/programming on Sales and Marketing Solutions for new Sales associates

Fields and responds appropriately to questions/requests from the field related to troubleshooting of Sales Solutions

Develops user guides and other reference tools for RE Sales and Marketing Solutions

Works in close partnership with the Learning and Organizational Development team to ensure consistent content development and delivery best practices

Job Requirements

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience required

5 years of training experience, including content development and delivery, required

1-2 years supervisory experience preferred

Knowledge of training practice and methods

Presentation and meeting management skills

Skill and ability to facilitate and conduct instructor-led classroom and/or virtual training to support knowledge/learning transfer

Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, or government regulations

Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals

Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers and the general public

Skill in Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook software applications

Strong verbal and written communication skills

Willingness to travel

Physical Demands and Working Conditions

The physical demands are representative of those that must be met by an employee to perform the essential function to this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Incumbent must be prepared to:
Move up to 10 pounds occasionally, by lifting, carrying, pushing, pulling, or otherwise repositioning objects.

Sitting for long periods of time while using office equipment such as computers, phones and etc.

Fingering and Repetitive motions; such as movement of wrists, hands and fingers while picking, pinching and typing during your normal working environment.

Express or exchange ideas with others through the use of spoken word, quickly, accurately, and at an easily audible volume, and receive detailed information through oral communication at usual speaking levels without correction, and/or make fine discriminations in the nature of sounds in the environment.

Incumbent is required to have:
Close visual acuity to perform detail oriented activities at distances close to the eyes, as well as visual acuity to perform activities at or within arm’s reach with skill, control, and accuracy, such as preparing and analyzing data, viewing computer screen and expansive reading.

Incumbent will be subject to:
Inside working conditions: The change of building environment such as with or without air conditioning and heating.

Tucows (NASDAQ:TCX, TSX:TC) is on a mission to make the Internet better by providing people everywhere with online access to be empowered to make individual contributions. As a company, we embrace a people-first philosophy that is rooted in respect, trust, and understanding to encourage freedom, inspire innovation, and promote inclusivity; creating an environment for everyone to thrive!
Tucows has been working on the Internet since the days when people ironically called it the Information Superhighway. We are a 25-year-old global start-up embracing agility and creativity in order to continually seize opportunity for growth. We have evolved from a start-up domain service provider to becoming the second-largest domain wholesaler in the world while expanding our business with Ting, an Internet services company partnering with towns and cities to change what customers expect from their Internet Service Provider. We are building fiber networks across the US and have already launched Gigabit speed service in Maryland, Virginia, North Carolina, Colorado, Idaho and California, laying the groundwork for rapid scale.
Our growth has been incredible, smart, and measured, built on a solid technical and financial foundation. We have doubled our workforce in the last 4 years and continue in rapid expansion mode, providing services to millions of customers around the world.
Role description
The Strategic Sourcing Manager will lead and support the development, implementation and management of material and labor strategies to provide the Ting Internet fiber network with best-in-class cost, flexibility and unmatched delivery and availability performance. Working closely with the OSP Engineering, finance, and our field teams, as well as lead materials and labor sourcing in support of the various build strategies across our growing footprint.
What you'll be doing:
Actively and consistently support, simplify and improve the customer experience
Strategic Sourcing and Negotiation
Lead and coordinate all efforts to survey, audit, assess and qualify new suppliers
Partner with Ting Networks team to coordinate suppliers and review supplier technology and services roadmaps.
Identify key benchmark suppliers in RFx efforts. Partner to identify evaluation criteria, expected bid price ranges, and provide relevant data back to the internal Networks team.
Lead the business negotiation process with internal partners and suppliers. from the complete cycle; to integration and everything in between,
Own and lead the supplier interface for all RFI, RFP and RFQ services. Partner with appropriate internal stakeholders. Present RFx results to the team and drive the closure of a sourcing decision.
Identify, qualify and formalize which suppliers are on Ting Internet’s preferred supplier list. Partner with internal stakeholders to ensure alignment.
Supplier Performance Management
Measure, manage and improve supplier actual performance against negotiated SLA.
Own and provide industry and actual unit and service cost data which feeds into TCO and RFx. Drive continual improvement of proficiency.
Measure, report and action cost efficiency as a function of market pricing.
Lead the measuring of supplier performance, root cause issues, and driving improved performance. Conduct and report on QBR’s for strategic suppliers.
Willing to travel about 10% of the time and work across various time zones.
The experience you will bring:
Ability to effectively communicate with employees, customers and suppliers,
Knowledge of company products and services
Advanced knowledge of FTTH material and labor vendors
Negotiation experience with commercial contracts and focus on maintaining long term partner relationships and handling total costs of ownership.
Ability to balance multiple projects and tasks
Ability to make decisions and solve problems while working under pressure
Ability to supervise and motivate others
Ability to use personal computer and software applications
Organizational and Strategic Agility
5+ years material or vendor sourcing experience
5+ years experience with project management and/or complex negotiations
Bachelor's degree in business, finance or related field, or equivalent experience preferred
Industry and vendor-specific knowledge is preferred

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

As the only global provider of commercial solutions, IQVIA understands what it takes to deliver nationally and internationally. Our people help biopharma get their medicines to the people who need them. A significant part of our business is acting as the biopharma's sales force to physicians or, providing therapy area educational input to physicians and patients. With the right experience, you can help deliver medical breakthroughs in the real world.
Virtual Sales Professional – Cardiology
IQVIA is looking for high performing, results-oriented sales professional with a track record of success to join our team as a Virtual Sales Professional. This role is responsible for selling Biopharmaceutical products directly to cardiologists and working collaboratively with a field-based sales team on behalf of our client, AstraZeneca.
The Virtual Sales Professional (VSP) engages health care professionals (HCPs) in virtual discussions to promote assigned client products, maximize the products’ selling potential and meet program and Client objectives. The VSP achieves this by developing and maintaining relationships with HCPs and educating them about product features, benefits, safety profile and approved indications to ensure appropriate patient use. The VSP utilizes approved tools and resources for product promotion and maintains a competent level of product, territory and customer activity knowledge.
Responsibilities:
Create and implement strategically sound business plans and tactical strategies within the assigned customer base to achieve individual and company goals for sales, market share, call metrics, appropriate sample distribution, etc.
Manage daily sales call activity according to defined expectations, with the purpose of influencing customers and increasing product sales:
On behalf of Client, promote Client's products via virtual interactions with assigned HCP targets, engaging them in in-depth program.
Profile and manage a list of HCP targets and provide value-added benefits to grow product volume.
Maintain call productivity and metrics that are required by program.
Manage promotional budget.
Maintain thorough knowledge of AstraZeneca’s products and programs.
Fully comply with all laws, regulations and Supplier Policies, Code of Conduct, all privacy and data guidelines, relevant state and federal laws and regulations, and terms and conditions prescribed in the Sample Administration Agreements and PDMA Guidelines.
Participate in teleconference and live National, regional and district meetings and training sessions and represent client at National and/or local conventions when requested.
Requirements:
Results-oriented with a track record of success.
Bachelor’s degree required.
1+ years sales experience required with:
Experience in inside sales/ contact center required
Pharma/biotech and/or B2B sales experience preferred
Demonstrated success in prior roles i.e. sales rankings, awards & achievements
Superior verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills
Ability to clearly articulate via phone in a professional and grammatically proficient manner, with the ability to adapt tone, volume, and pace to most effectively communicate
Ability to travel to work related meetings and functions (including overnight and/or weekend).
Must be able to successfully complete client training and meet training expectations in order to proceed to servicing client’s customers within the parameters of the program.
Qualifications, Skills and Abilities:
Results-oriented with a track record of success.
Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills.
Clear, articulate and grammatically sound speech and professional appearance.
Strong rapport building skills and active listening skills.
Excellent selling, closing, persuasion and presentation skills.
Ability to learn, understand and communicate complex technical/medical terminology and to maintain the required technical expertise including competitive product knowledge.
Self-motivated and disciplined.
Good organizational and planning skills, strong attention to detail and accuracy.
Demonstrated technical aptitude with computer technology and devices (e.g. iPad, apps).

**MUST RESIDE IN THE ATLANTA, GA AREA** Work at home opportunity
Content Marketing Strategist - Full-time
BELAY is a growing and vibrant, Atlanta, GA based company that offers virtual staffing solutions in areas of Virtual Assistants, Virtual Bookkeepers, Website Specialists, and Social Media Strategists. We are a fast-paced team of high performers that work extremely hard, but also know how to have a great time. Culture is a top priority and our values are lived out daily. Enjoy a recap of one of our company-wide Summits to get a sneak peek into our award-winning culture. The position requirements are listed below.
Job Purpose
The focus of this role is to lead the marketing efforts for BELAY content creation for courses, ebooks and the recruiting efforts for our Virtual Assistants, Bookkeepers, and Social Media Strategist contractors. This person will be a member of a top-notch, in-house Marketing team which moves fast, thinks smart, works hard, learns & leverages new methods, crushes deadlines, and gets a ton of marketing magic done in the blink of an eye. The goal is to grow BELAY’s content revenue stream, increase brand authority through long-form and innovative content creation, and provide content to grow BELAY brand awareness as an opportunity for contracted remote work.
As a member of the BELAY Corporate Team, you are expected to participate in phone calls and meetings (virtual and onsite), while serving as an example of the company’s mission: BELAY exists to glorify God by providing solutions that equip our clients with the confidence to climb higher.
Duties and responsibilities
Represent BELAY in a positive and professional manner
Exemplify our Core Values and Mission Statement to live out BELAY’s culture each day.
Be a good steward of our Vision: “Our vision is to help you achieve your vision”.
Collaborate with and help teammates while maintaining a positive and professional attitude; fostering teamwork.
Content Strategy
Partner with Marketing Director, Creative Marketing Manager, and the rest of the Marketing Team to develop content for course creation and the funnels to sell the products. Meet course sales quotas and stay within budget allocations.
Own pulling and analyzing monthly reports and dashboards, utilizing whatever tools necessary to build and develop insights based on the data, and to further refine strategy.
Manage vendors used in content creation efforts, ensuring goals and deliverables are being met.
Own other content creation such as ebooks, books, webinars, and long-form content
Partner with the BELAY Marketing Team to maintain consistent branding in all written content.
Responsible for the execution of content created into Pardot or Salesforce, leveraging the team and contractors as needed.
Stay updated in marketing best practices and industry trends in content and brand marketing.
Assist with additional marketing projects and initiatives as assigned.
Recruiting Content Strategy
Work with Talent Acquisition Manager and team to determine what priorities are needed for content.
Work with Corporate Human Resources Coordinator to determine what priorities are needed for content.
Own the ideation, execution, and monitoring of BELAY content for contractor recruiting efforts
Own pulling and analyzing reports and dashboards, utilizing whatever tools necessary to build and develop insights based on the data, and to further refine strategy.
Qualifications
The ideal candidate is a specialist in content: has a broad width of marketing knowledge overall, yet a deep understanding in a few key areas around content creation. This person is a technology maven - with an intense desire (and ability) to learn new software tools, think outside the box to be ahead of the industry curve, and lead with a strategic vision.
BA/BS degree or equivalent work experience.
Three or more years experience in content creation for a brand. Course, webinar or ebook creation experience preferred.
Experience owning deliverables of outsourced talent and vendors.
Attributes of flexibility, creativity, self-discipline, strong organizational skills, and action-orientation are essential for this role.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Team player who is willing and able to “roll-up the shirt sleeves” to get a project done when needed.
A high degree of autonomy with the capability of working remotely.
Working conditions
BELAY Corporate, as a virtual company, offers you the ability to work from home full-time. As such, a dedicated and secure workspace, free of distractions is required. Our standard business hours are Monday-Friday. Some roles will require travel.
This role is a full-time, exempt, W-2 role with our company. BELAY is a top-notch company with a world-class reputation. Expect to work hard & play hard. Expect to laugh. Expect to grow and change. Expect to have fun while being on the front-end of a growing, vibrant company.
Physical requirements
This position does not have any physical requirements at this time.
