Job Title: National Account Manager – Automotive Team (Factory Automation)
***This is a remote, field based sales position. The ideal candidate can be located in the South Eastern Region of the US (South Carolina, North Carolina, Tennessee, Alabama, or Georgia.) They will work out of their home office and manage “Key Accounts” in the Automotive Industry in that region.
ABOUT SICK:
SICK is one of the world’s leading manufacturers of sensors, safety systems, and automatic identification products for industrial applications. Whether automating factories or optimizing distribution centers, SICK provides cost-effective solutions. We have been a technology leader for more than 70 years and with more than 50 global subsidiaries, SICK has a presence all over the world. Leveraging a history of innovation, our company has pioneered a long line of industry firsts – such as the first safety light curtain, the first color sensor, and many more.
POSITION SUMMARY:
This position has the primary responsibility for supporting profitable SICK sales, and growing market share at Key Accounts in the Automotive Industry. Key Accounts will include Hyundai, KIA, Nissan, and potentially others in the South East region of the US. Automation solution selling experience in the Automotive Industry is required.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Provide a leadership role developing elements of the growth strategy and mid-term plan for the stated Strategic Industry. Proficiently present, communicate, and support the complete strategy to all stakeholders, as needed.
Use CRM system for all customer and sales process data to ensure proper documentation and retention.
Provide leadership and coaching to execution of the growth strategy and mid-term plan, ensuring timely, consistent, and thorough completion by the entire SI sales team.
Provide leadership to customer adoption on new SICK products, solutions, systems, and Lifetime Services. Agree and execute aggressive growth goals for new product introductions, against a documented plan.
Provide leadership and coaching to colleagues to implement SICK standardized sales processes for Territory, Account, Opportunity, and Call Management to support planning to optimize sales performance. Champion utilization of CRM tools.
Provide leadership and coaching to an account sales team to provide exceptional coverage for accounts with multiple plant locations. Ensure the account team is high performing; collaborating to develop an account plan and strategy, facilitate plant coverage planning for all plants. Establish KPIs for the account team performance and provide reporting on these KPIs.
Develop direct customer relationships using deep understanding of customers business needs, production applications, and technical language utilized in their industry. Provide consultative sales techniques, based on SICK Sales Power (SSP) to uncover customer needs and solve difficult applications. Provide solutions that are differentiated to improve customer production quality control and production efficiency.
Introduce and sell SICK products and Lifetime Services to both existing and new account prospects to achieve established goals and grow market share.
Provide amazing customer service by managing customer communications and SICK customer relationship with named accounts. Ensure velocity and accuracy to all customer communications.
Identify and properly qualify business and customer opportunities and/or threats; understand the account potential, competitors, and position in the market and requirements for doing business.
Responsible for new market discovery and potential opportunities for new and diverse product applications.
Pursue Sales Excellence, developing skills, knowledge, and competencies to continuously improve performance. Complete annual performance objectives and performance reviews with Supervisor. Capitalize on development and training opportunities to position yourself for highest levels of performance recognition and continued career development.
Provide accurate and timely sales reports. Track and measure sales results.
Keep abreast of market and competitive activity; recommend actions in areas where competitor activities are having a negative impact on sales goals.
Participate in trade shows, prepare and give marketing/sales presentations to technical societies, etc.
Manage Local and Global Pricing Agreements with Key Accounts
Carry out other duties and responsibilities as may be assigned or required.
QUALIFICATIONS:
Education and Experience:
Four-year degree in a technical field with either an academic or experiential orientation toward technical sales.
Prior sales experience involving sales of high technology industrial control products through direct sales and/or regional distributors is required.
Prior Sales Experience with complex system sales
Automotive Industry / Supply Chain Launch Experience
Experience Managing Key Accounts with Foreign Automotive Companies
Experience in driving Long Term Specifications at large Key Accounts
Advanced Manufacturing Experience
Lean manufacturing / Six Sigma a Plus
Other Qualifications:
Ability to travel regionally up to four days a week.
High degree of direct sales management skills and the implementation of account sales plans through a network of direct and indirect sales channels.
Ability to manage consistently to a common plan, providing sales leadership in the implementation of corporate sales strategies.
Fundamental leadership in sales management, opportunity assessment, and excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability and willingness to work alternative schedules including weekend, and on-call hours as needed.
Legally permitted to work in the United States.
Ability to work in a general office environment.
CORE COMPETENCIES:
Ethics and Integrity Personal Growth and Learning, Customer Focus, Personal Accountable, Building Effective Relationships
If you thrive in a fast-paced, team-oriented work environment that offers challenges and the opportunity for growth, we are the place for you! SICK has several locations throughout domestic US and offers competitive wages and an excellent benefits program. Qualified candidates can apply online by clicking the Apply online button. Visit us at www.sickusa.com.

The WarnerMedia Story
WarnerMedia is a leading media and entertainment company that creates and distributes premium and popular content from a diverse array of talented storytellers and journalists to global audiences through its consumer brands including: HBO, HBO Max, Warner Bros., TNT, TBS, truTV, CNN, DC Entertainment, New Line, Cartoon Network, Adult Swim, Turner Classic Movies and others. The organization also includes Xandr’s suite of advanced advertising solutions designed to help to improve advertising for brands, publishers, and consumers.

The Job
The Digital Platforms team manages several of WarnerMedia's websites as well as other digital platforms. We work with design, editorial and photography teams to ensure content and look of our sites are up-to-date and on-brand. We are the team who thinks both creatively and technically.

The Daily
Assist the Digital Platforms Specialists, Manager and Product Manager with updating content on WarnerMedia’s internal and external websites.
Assist team with scheduling of messaging on internal facing digital boards.
Assist with drafting, testing and QC of corporate email communications through email client.
Administrative support as necessary.
The Essentials
Experience with content management systems and similar web applications
Detail-oriented and organized
Open-minded with the desire to learn new skills
High-level verbal, visual and written communication skills
Familiarity with WarnerMedia and its content
Internship Program
Students must be currently enrolled in a college degree program for full duration of the internship.
Summer 2021 program dates are June 7th – August 13th; must be available for full program duration.
Must be able to accommodate full-time schedule (40 hours/week) for full program duration.
Fully remote/virtual experience; company owned laptop provided for the duration of the internship program.
Salary based on office location; relocation is not provided.
This position is targeted toward upperclassmen and graduate students.
The Perks
Hands-on work with passionate, talented team members in your field
Networking opportunities with industry-leading professionals
Engaging events including executive speakers sessions, professional development workshops, and more
Opportunity to join the WarnerMedia family of powerhouse brands

About the team
Zillow Group's people org is here to identify, support and develop our workforce comprised of fun people who enjoy working in a collegial environment within an innovative, fast-paced company! The Revenue Recruiting team supports the Sales Organization, Revenue Strategy & Operations, and the Finance and Accounting teams.
About the role
Are you ready to be a part of our amazing Recruiting team at Zillow Group? We want you to put to use your amazing people sleuthing skills to identify the best of the best, active and passive to join the ranks of ZG! You are an exceptional listener, curious about people, creative problem-solver and cultivator of lasting relationships. Simply stated, you are known as a connector.
From generating pipeline to maintaining a successful offer acceptance rate, you manage the entire candidate process. By demonstrating your knowledge of our clients' hiring needs and search requirements, you optimally match candidates with the roles in which they will be most successful. It's a fast-paced role on a fun and cohesive team where thinking about things in new ways is strongly supported.
Naturally, you are a relationship builder. You understand the necessity of building strong relationships with hiring managers and your team.
You are resourceful. You design and execute recruiting strategies to attract and hire top talent
You own it. You want to take ownership for the entire recruiting process. You uncover the needs of your hiring managers, create a clear profile, execute a sourcing plan and deliver the talent they need to help their organization excel.
You are coachable. You know enough to recognize there is still more to learn and you desire to be part of a culture of learning.
This role has been categorized as a Remote position. “Remote” employees do not have a permanent corporate office workplace and, instead, work from a physical location of their choice which must be identified to the Company. Employees may live in any of the 50 US States, with limited exceptions. In certain cases, an employee in a remote-designated job may need to live in a specific region or time zone to support customers or clients as part of their role.
Who you are
5+ years’ experience as a full life-cycle recruiter
Demonstrable track record of crafting and executing successful sourcing strategies with an emphasis on diversity sourcing
Excels as a listener and is able to craft thoughtful questions
Demonstrates an ability to comprehend the nuances and responsibilities of each job description and effectively ask questions to vet candidate viability
Accountable to self and team with a sense of humor
Think Big. Move Fast. Thrives in a fast-paced and fluid environment.
Previous corporate experience supporting the recruitment of high-volume, sales, finance, accounting, and business strategy and operations strongly preferred
Possesses a strong ability to utilize technology and technical tools to successfully recruit talent and partner with client groups and cross functional partners in a virtual environment
Get to know us
Zillow Group, the largest portfolio of real estate brands on mobile and the web, is building a safe, on-demand real estate experience. Whether selling, buying, renting or financing, customers can turn to Zillow's businesses to find and get into their next home with speed, certainty and ease.
We are on a mission to help people unlock their next chapter and are building transformational tools and services that create an on-demand real estate transaction experience. Millions of people visit Zillow Group sites every month to start their home search, and now they can rely on Zillow to help them finish it — and no matter what job you're in, you will play a critical role in making this vision a reality.
At Zillow Group, we're powered by our inclusive work culture, where everyone has the support and resources to do the best work of their careers. Our efforts to streamline the real estate transaction is supported by our passion to empower people and enrich lives around everything home, a deep-rooted culture of innovation, a fundamental commitment to Equity and Belonging, and world-class benefits. But, don't just take our word for it. Read our reviews on Glassdoor and recent recognition from multiple organizations, including: Human Rights Campaign (HRC) Corporate Equity Index, Fortune Best Workplaces for Technology, Fortune Best Workplaces for Millennials, Fortune Best Workplaces for Parents, Fatherly's Best Workplaces for New Dads, JUST Capital 100 Company, and the Bloomberg Gender Equality Index constituent.
Zillow Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. Therefore, we provide employment opportunities without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law. If there are preparations we can make to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know.
See what information we collect about you.

Requisition ID: req12285
Job Title: Employment and Financial Empowerment Specialist
Sector: Employment
Employment Category: Fixed Term
Employment Type: Full-Time
Open to Expatriates: No
Location: Atlanta, GA USA
Job Description
The Employment and Financial Empowerment Specialist assists newly arrived refugees and other qualified immigrants to attain self-sufficiency through employment by guiding them through employment preparation, coordinating job placements, financial coaching, and other career advancement services.
Major Responsibilities:
Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Conduct intake, assessment and provide program orientation to clients eligible for employment services. Develop comprehensive employment plans and budget strategies for each employable adult. Provide job readiness and job search coaching and connect clients with job opportunities.
Develop and cultivate long term relationships with area employers and staffing agencies to identify appropriate employment opportunities for clients.
Work one-on-one with clients to complete a detailed, individualized financial assessment.
Work with clients to develop household budgets and provide strategies for effective budget management.
Assist clients and employers as necessary with post-placement issues and continuing employment needs.
Monitor client job performance, wage levels, and related metrics.
Detail each client interaction in accordance with program requirements. Input client information in database(s) and assist with tracking and reporting as needed.
Collaborate effectively with coworkers and partner organizations. Build and maintain relationships with area service providers for the benefit of clients.
Use personal, insured vehicle and/or public transportation (where available) to travel and transport clients and materials as needed throughout the service delivery area.
May train and lead the activities of support staff, volunteers, and interns.
Other duties as assigned.
Qualifications
Education: Bachelor’s degree in social work or related field of study preferred.
Work Experience:
Relevant professional experience in workforce development field required; minimum of 2 years’ experience strongly preferred.
Experience working with refugee and/or immigrant populations strongly preferred.
Experience with job placement and job readiness training a plus.
Demonstrated Skills & Competencies:
Strong relationship building, diplomacy, and networking skills; ability to effectively build internal and external relationships.
Demonstrated experience and strong understanding of personal finances and ability to effectively counsel clients in budgeting and goal setting.
Demonstrated success working and communicating effectively in a multi-cultural environment.
Self-starter with excellent problem-solving skills combined with the proven ability to multi-task, prioritize duties, and manage time effectively.
Attention to detail and accuracy in work product.
Proficient in English, both spoken and written; proficiency in language(s) spoken by client group is desired.
Proficient in Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, Outlook); ability to use the internet and other digital tools for data entry, research and problem-solving purposes.
Valid driver’s license and access to a personal, insured vehicle.
Working Environment:
A combination of standard office environment, remote work, and ‘field’ time within the service delivery area to perform the above outlined responsibilities.
May require occasional weekend and/or evening work.
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Jr. Product Specialist – Software / Feature Configuration
W-2 Salaried Position
Brandt Information Services, the leading provider of SaaS technology for state wildlife and recreational agencies, is seeking a Jr. Product Specialist. This position will have a strong understanding of the Go Outdoors platform features and functionality and assist project teams with configuring various features within the system. The specialist will participate in designing creative, flexible, and innovative designs for web-based software products used by millions of the customers and participate in the design and delivery of new platform features. This team members will learn to master the Go Outdoors platform and provide platform expertise to various project team roles and external clients.
Responsibilities/Deliverables Include:
Participates in client / project team requirements gathering sessions as a representative of the product division. Assists with the documentation of requirements, design workflows, and proposes scope using established design patterns.
Participates in client demonstrations of new features to gather and document feedback. Works with Product Owners and leadership team to identify required changes to finalize the request and fulfill all requirements.
Reviews requirements and development requests from multiple project team to assist with user story / requirements development, design, and integration.
Translates business requirements into functional requirements and serves as an expert of the Go Outdoors system to assist with platform configurations and settings to accommodate client specific business rules.
Regularly monitors overall system quality, reports defects and proposed enhancements, and assists with issue prioritization.
Works with project teams to prepare test cases and feature documentation.
Assists with workflow design and requirements gathering during the implementation phase of new projects.
Documents and maintains system / features documentation that can be leveraged by project teams to configure and support various components of the system.
Develops wireframes and mockups for new features / enhancements and assists with the development of new schemas and basic technical scope.
Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree
Design experience with web / mobile solutions
Ability to interface with client and development teams and accurately translate complex business requirements into functional system design requirements
Basic to intermediate understand of software design and relational data models
Willing to travel and meet with clients

Location:
Remote work may be available, however it is expected that the selected candidate will need to travel to and work out of one of Brandt’s offices located in Tallahassee, FL or Atlanta, GA or to a client location with advance notice. Relocation assistance will be considered. The selected candidate will be issued company equipment to perform all job responsibilities.

Why Brandt:
Brandt Information Services celebrates over 35 years of innovation and is looking for intelligent and motivated people to support our constantly growing operations and maintain best in class solutions in a work hard/play hard environment. Be a part of a team that values your ideas and gives you the tools and resources to design and implement your best innovations and concepts! Brandt is a place that values the diversity of our areas and our people. Brandt offers a generous benefit package including paid-time off, maternity/paternity leave, health and dental benefits, 401K, sick leave, life insurance, long-term disability insurance, laundry service, plus other perks throughout the year to support our work hard/play hard environment.
Brandt Information Services is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer and welcomes all qualified applicants. Applicants will receive fair and impartial consideration without regard to race, sex, color, religion, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic data or other legally protected status.

JobTitle: Competitive Technical Marketing Manager - End User Computing - Opportunity for Working Remotely Atlanta, GA
Text:
Sr Competitive Technical Manager – End User Computing
VMware is the leader in virtualization and cloud infrastructure solutions that enable our more than 350,000 enterprise and SMB customers to thrive in the Digital Workspace Era. Our team of 20,000+ people working in 50+ locations worldwide is committed to building a community where great people want to work long term living our values of passion, innovation, execution, teamwork, active learning and giving back. If you are ready to accelerate, innovate and lead, join us as we challenge constraints and problem solve for tomorrow today. In End-User Computing at VMware, we are leading the transformational journey to the digital workspace, helping our customers deliver on the productivity and user-experience promise of the next-generation of workspace technologies.
Job Role and Responsibility
The End User Computing Competitive team is seeking a talented, results-driven technical marketing manager, technical account management, solutions architect, or product management professional with a good understanding of the Digital Workspace technology and market dynamics. You will work closely with our product management, product marketing, engineering, and field teams to build and communicate a clear view of our competitive market positioning. Your main responsibility will be to provide technical comparisons and create differentiated technical sales tools against the competition. You will deliver timely technical analysis of competitive products and announcements with recommendations for VMware responses and strategy. You will also design and craft high quality technical assets for use by customers, VMware field technical teams and partners. This is a dynamic role with rapidly moving boundaries that requires a deep understanding of the underlying technology elements. You will need to interact with our customers and global teams, which will require some travel.
In this role, you will work independently and as a member of a team to design and craft content that helps our field teams and partners communicate our market-leading capabilities to customers. You have the ability to work in a fast pace environment demonstrating autonomy in conforming to strategic intent while adhering to team values. The successful candidate is a person who can:Impact and influence othersCreate compelling value propositions that technically differentiate our offerings in the digital workspace, end user computing and enterprise mobility management marketsTranslate your understanding of the digital workspace market into compelling value propositions differentiating our solution in the marketCreate customer-facing materials including technical teardowns, web content, whitepapers, webinars and training materialsCollaborate with product management, product marketing, engineering, sales, and sales engineering teams to help drive competitive take-out strategiesCreate and deliver technical sales enablement contentSupport and report back on competitive events and conferencesThrive in a dynamic and fluid environmentTravel up to 10% of the time
Required Skills:5-10 years successfully supporting global field teams by providing compelling competitive product differentiatorsEngineering, computer science or other technical degree; MBA a plusExcellent people and communication skills, written and verbal (writing samples will be requested)Ability to provide an impartial technical evaluation of competitor’s products compared to VMware’sAbility to deliver concise communication assets that support others in detailed conversations with customers that accurately and positively describe VMware’s unique value propositionExperience developing product marketing and technical marketing content to support competitive positioning campaignsProven track record of working with customers and partners, and ability to influence their decisions with timely evaluationsDemonstration of an understanding of digital workspace technologies, including EMM/UEM, VDI/RDSH and Identity managementEstablished knowledge of the end-user computing market and the competitive landscape
Preferred Skills:
Our team looks for individuals who embody our values of humility, empathy, collaboration above isolationism, respectfulness, trustworthiness, and good-natured fun. Additionally, we would like you to have:Proven grasp of the challenges faced by customers in digital workspace transformationExperience of agile development environmentsDemonstrated ability to work successfully across business units and with high-level executives
Category : Marketing
Subcategory: Product Dev Marketing
Experience: Business Leadership

Key Responsibilities
. Responsible for supporting the product roadmap for the system.

. The successful candidate will report to the Senior Product Manager and is also responsible for conducting market research to define market trends for usability of such products; competitive assessment, and gathering customer requirements.

JobTitle: Manager, Competitive Intelligence - Opportunity for Working Remotely Atlanta, GA
Text:
Business Summary:
VMware accelerates digital transformation through a software-defined approach to business and IT. The trusted platform provider of choice for more than 500,000 customers globally, VMware is the pioneer in virtualization and an innovator in cloud and business mobility. A proven leader, VMware allows customers to run, manage, connect and secure applications across clouds and devices in a common operating environment.
Our team of 20,000+ people working in 50+ locations worldwide is committed to building a community where great people want to work long term by living our values of passion, innovation, execution, teamwork, active learning and giving back. If you are ready to accelerate, innovate and lead, join us as we challenge constraints and problem solve for tomorrow today.
This individual will develop market and competitive intelligence, critical insights, and recommendations to positively influence strategic decisions with VMware’s executive team, senior leaders and key business stakeholders. The role reports to the Director, Corporate Intelligence.
Job Role and Responsibilities:
Develop competitive intelligence, critical insights, and recommendations to positively influence strategic decisions with VMware’s executive team and key business stakeholders.
Build in-depth studies analyzing top competitors (e.g. Microsoft, Cisco) and assess strategic, go-to-market, and technological gaps.
Compare and contrast VMware vs the competition in order to provide impact assessments and recommendations to improve VMware’s position in the market.
Develop market evolution hypotheses and anticipate competitive dynamics, including the identification of emerging competitive threats.
Evolve competitive program engagement model, with a focus on broadening internal customer base across VMware business units and increase frequency and depth of touch points throughout the year.
Forge strong relationships with business leaders to understand strategy and pain points, and ensure competitive content is strategically aligned and impactful.
Engage industry analysts to ascertain relevant research, scope custom projects, and build RFPs.
Become embedded in business unit strategy and planning processes, including long range planning, fiscal year planning, worldwide sales kickoff, and other strategic initiatives throughout the year.
Track major competitive announcements and proactively build awareness of key competitor moves (e.g. AWS shift toward distributed cloud model)
Develop detailed project plans, clear process for engagement with stakeholders, clarify intent and goals, establish strategic imperatives, etc.
Present competitive studies and key insights and align with VMware senior leaders on recommendations and areas of focus. Measure level of engagement and meaningful use of competitive content throughout the year.
Required Skills:
Executive level presentation skills. Capable of articulating recommendations clearly, handling objections, and switching between big picture thinking and detailed requirements.
Exceptional technical depth with competence to explain and debate at the architectural level. Consistent knowledge builder with an eye on leading edge technology and business models.
Ability to collaborate within a small team environment. Precision PowerPoint development required, with high attention to detail and format.
Self-starter with a bias for action and results orientation. Able to prioritize, focus, and execute through obstacles. Innovative thinker with analytical problem-solving skills.
Degrees in engineering, computer science and MBA preferred
This job requisition is not eligible for employment-based immigration sponsored by VMware.

Opportunity and ImpactMetaSpark is looking for a valuable 100% commission sales representative to join our team! We are looking to expand exponentially this year with an outside sales team who share our drive and motivation as well as our desire to serve our customers with the highest level of service.We are creating our 100% commission outside sales team who can work from anywhere in the world...We invite you to apply.We're growing like crazy and we need motivated and driven, take-charge salespeople to expand on this success.Our 100% commission-based team has a very clear and realistic path to make $100K+ per year ($80K+ in your first year); with a product that almost sells itself. This salesperson model has been created by life-long salespeople, not a CPA or CFO. Together, our team carefully crafted this role and designed it based on creating “the dream” sales role that you’d want to stay in forever.Our #1 goal for you as a salesperson is to help you live your ideal life, including:Uncapped Earning Potential- We want you to make so much money you don’t know what to do with it.Time Freedom- You need to have time to enjoy your financial freedom. What good does it do to make a bunch of money but have no time to enjoy life?Flexibility- We don’t believe in sales managers… We believe in mentors!!! You will have your own performance coach, accountability coach and onboarding specialist who will be there to support you as you grow. Get things done on your schedule… no more punching a clock.Industry and CompanyMetaSpark is on a mission to address inefficiency in the workplace but our end game is to address pay inequitably in the workplace and drive diversity and inclusion at every company worldwide. We revolutionize how employees work through AI technologies and bringing new levels of efficiency, compensation and motivation to every employee that uses the system.MetaSpark is a groundbreaking platform that addresses many complex issues in the enterprise and its already a hit with customers like Technicolor, Warner Media and Milbank.We have a ridiculous amount of support for our sales team including:Personal and group coaching… designed to take your skills and abilities to the next level.Technology tools and automation created to allow you to get rid of the mundane, repetitive tasks that bog down most salespeople.The time to dominate this market segment is now, and it’s time for you to come and show off what you can accomplish!Key ResponsibilitiesRespond in a timely manner to all leads.Initiate outbound efforts (call, text, email) each day to prospects.Qualify prospects, gauge interest, and schedule sales calls.Collaborate with the team on improving prospecting strategies.Ability to identify & source information on prospective clients.QualificationsStrong company culture fitAbility to receive inbound and make outbound phone calls via cell or internet (wired ethernet) in a quiet environment without interruptions.Strong listening skills and excellent phone demeanor.Technologically proficient; not necessarily an expert, but knowledgeableExcellent written and verbal communicationCRM experience a HUGE plusOther InformationCompensation: 100% commission - High Six Figures is achievable ($160K+), anything less than Six Figures would be considered a failure. Woodgrain Millwork is proud to be a family owned and operated manufacturer with over 60 years of product innovation, quality service and business growth. Our strategy of vertical integration allows our company to bring high-quality products to market competitively. Woodgrain Millwork’s diverse product offering includes wood moulding, decorative trim, wood door shop parts and products, as well as many branded products. Woodgrain is a worldwide manufacturer and is proud to be one of the largest millwork operations in the world.
Day-to-Day:
Learning and performing in-store service, managing inventory replenishment (ordering and stocking), generating weekly credits and providing exceptional customer service within a defined territory inside high volume national account stores.
Cover service calls when regular service representatives are on away on vacation.
CLEANING: Recovering the proper condition of that aisle since the last service.
STOCK: Restocking messy bins or displays and resolving bin contamination.
CULLING: Removing damaged/unsellable material and issuing credit electronically.
MERCHANDISING: Maintain signage and pricing to best practice.
ORDERING: Replenish inventory according to published guidelines.
CUSTOMER INTERACTION: Build strong and dependable relationships with store management and associates.
PROJECTS/TASKS: Complete tasks, projects and resets of Woodgrain products in stores as assigned by the Area Manager.
The Fun Stuff:
SHIFT WORK: Primarily M-F days. Overtime may be required based on territory demands.
TRAVEL: This is a remote position with required travel to stores daily. This isn’t a desk job!
BENEFITS: Full time employees receive a comprehensive benefits package that includes medical, dental, life insurance, 401k, vacation, and paid holidays, AND a quarterly incentive! See your hard work pay off!
Pay: $605.00/week
Requirements:
Must have a valid driver’s license, proof of auto insurance and your own vehicle.
High school level education plus one to three years’ relevant or prior experience.
This position is very labor intensive and requires the ability to lift/move up to 50 lbs.
Woodgrain is an EEO employer that maintains a tobacco and drug free work environment.

Company Description
JumpCrew is a customer acquisition platform that integrates sales and digital marketing to help clients grow brand awareness, leads, and revenue. JumpCrew is the perfect place for self-driven, dynamic people who want to learn and help businesses grow. If you take an entrepreneurial approach to problem-solving, work well in a high-growth, fast-paced environment, and are brave enough to not wear a seat belt in a rocket ship so you can lean closer to the stars; then JumpCrew could be the place for you!
Job Description
JumpCrew is seeking a Content Specialist to join our Marketing Team. This person will be directly responsible for building and delivering content for our clients, including (but not limited to) various web properties, blogs, white papers and sales collateral pieces. Our marketing strategy is focused on creating valuable, relevant, and consistent content that attracts and retains a clearly defined audience and augments the SEO strategy of our clients.
Responsibilities
Craft compelling content for our clients’ digital marketing properties.
Responsible for writing copy of ads, land pages, marketing and sales material.
Incorporate SEO with content creation- we’re looking for somebody who enjoys doing topic research prior to writing, seeing what is ranking on search engines, keyword usage within the post, meta descriptions, blog URL slug creation.
Help develop product positioning statements and supporting materials including collateral, case studies and videos.
Responsible for gathering and analyzing metrics to gain insight to assess against goals and make recommendations to drive improvement and identify new opportunities.
Occasionally interact directly with clients, providing strategic direction and guidance driven by analysis of clients’ key metrics, review of client strategies, and command of industry best practices around content design and development.
Qualifications
2+ years digital marketing experience, with a focus on creating and delivering great content.
Strong writing skills and excellent communication skills.
Working knowledge of Wordpress a plus.
Ability to implement best SEO practices in relation to content creation.
Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.
Strategic mindset combined with pragmatic, can-do approach.
Ability to manage relationships with team members from different functional areas and professional backgrounds.
Ability to manage external (i.e., freelance) resources effectively.
Ability to pivot often and adapt quickly.
Creative individual who can dream up unique and engaging content ideas
Strong time management skills.
Solid, well rounded knowledge of overall digital marketing best practices.
Additional Information:
The Perks
Location: Remote
Unlimited PTO
9 company holidays
Healthcare benefits
401k
Learning and career growth opportunities
About JumpCrew
JumpCrew is on a mission to help good businesses grow into great companies. The key to this transformation is the careful application of digital marketing and sales. This is a gradual process, and each of our products represents a step in the journey to building a thriving enterprise.
Whether it’s driving awareness on social media, producing more leads from marketing, or getting sales to close more deals, JumpCrew has a solution to help businesses move forward.
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Description
Job Description:
No two career paths will ever look the same. At Leidos, we know the most talented and diverse IT and engineering professionals will always have a multitude of career choices; your time at Leidos will be a wise investment in your career and in yourself.
Our Civil business is helping to modernize and manage infrastructure, systems and controls, and cybersecurity for civilian agencies and commercial clients around the globe. With core competencies in information technology, energy and environment, complex logistics, and specialized engineering, we solve technical challenges and implement newfound efficiencies on a number of programs!
LEIDOS is searching for Airport Site Leads and has openings in multiple locations for Airport Site Lead/Project Manager(s) to provide technical, and project management support to TSA Contracting Officer Representative (COR) for the Security Equipment Deployment Services (SEDS) for the Deployment and Logistics Division (DLD).
This position encompasses the full project lifecycle management as the site lead / project manager. The position involves initial planning, site surveys/validations, risk identification and mitigation, coordination, communication, report development, drawing review/comment, construction management / oversight, schedule development and tracking, applying for and closing out local/state construction permits, subcontractor oversight, installation oversight, test witness, and project sell-off / close-out of security systems related to the checkpoint equipment deployments at federalized airports throughout United States. The position will support the TSA SEDS program to maintain, upgrade, and move the established airport security system to the next generation of capability.
NOTE: This position is contingent upon award from the government customer. We'll move forward with the interview process upon notification of Leidos securing this contract award.
This position will allow for telecommuting and remote work when not traveling.
PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:
The successful candidate will be responsible for project management at assigned airports, including coordination, site survey/validation, design support, communication, developing statement of work bid packages, construction oversight, site/equipment layout evaluation, witness test/checkout, site clean-up and restoration.
The candidate will be responsible for managing up to 5 - 7 projects at various life cycle stages concurrently.
The candidate may be required to guide or direct the daily activities for geographically assigned teams ranging in size from 2-10 consisting of site technicians, including subcontractors, vendors, suppliers, and/or local general contractors.
The candidate will be responsible for facilitating communications and coordination between TSA HQ, local TSA, airport stakeholders, operations management, general subcontractors, other TSA Vendors, airport authority representatives and state/ local government officials.
The candidate will exercise expert judgment and assess project, construction, and equipment installation best practices to conduct requirements analysis; review design drawings, specifications, and deliverables; support connectivity construction, installation, and acceptance testing; and oversee site clean-up and remediation.
The candidate will successfully monitor the project schedule and keep the team appraised of any possible delays or modified plans to avoid any unnecessary costs to the customer.
The successful candidate will be a self-starter with high energy and initiative to easily adapt to dynamic, fast-paced work environments.
Physical work locations may vary depending on the assigned airports and the deployment schedule. This position requires up to 50-75% travel to airport locations as assigned. Some work may require non-standard work shifts (during evening or weekends) to accommodate TSA requirements for minimal disruption to airport operations.
Develop agendas and lead conference call meetings including ad hoc (periodic as requested by TSA or Leidos), weekly, integrated project team (IPT), and installation readiness (so called Go / no go”) meetings.
Be well organized, take meeting minutes and disseminate to the team as required.
Be able to multi-task in a fast paced, exciting environment.
Be very responsive to Leidos, TSA and other stakeholders request for information, schedule updates, status reporting and forward planning.
Be proactive and look forward in time to be fully prepared for future activities.
Punctuality is mandatory; always be on-time or ahead of schedule as the site lead is typically the lead for various elements of their projects.
MINIMUM REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:
All Airport Category – 3 years of Project Management (preferably construction management), 2 years of which occurred in an airport.
Requires a BA degree and 2 – 4 years of prior relevant experience or Masters with less than 2 years of prior relevant experience.
Demonstrated experience as a Project Manager (preferably construction management) with on-time, on-budget projects, taking into consideration complexities and schedule history for comparable projects.
Experience working with multiple stakeholders on a single project.
Experience in planning and formulation of design alternatives and solutions for construction projects.
Management experience on work performed by field staff and subcontracting firms.
Experience in resolving compliance issues with federal, state and local authorities on design specifications.
Thorough understanding of airport construction practices, processes, standards, and their impact on project activities. Including understanding of floor loading, electrical infrastructure, seismic requirements, and rigging complexities;
Familiarity with the Checkpoint Requirements Planning Guide for Checkpoint operations
Knowledge of MS Excel & Word are required.
ADDITIONAL DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS:
TSA experience in the field at a checkpoint, baggage or security outpost.
Spanish speaker is a big plus.
Professional certifications (i.e., Licensed PE, PMI® PMP, or General Contractor License is a plus).
Knowledgeable of MS Project or other scheduling tools.
Demonstrative ability to effectively work with, coordinate/make assignments, and manage multi-disciplined teams of technical and project management professionals and interact as the liaison with the customer and stakeholders.

Leidos is a Fortune 500® information technology, engineering, and science solutions and services leader working to solve the world’s toughest challenges in the defense, intelligence, homeland security, civil, and health markets. The company’s 38,000 employees support vital missions for government and commercial customers. Headquartered in Reston, Va., Leidos reported annual revenues of approximately $11.09 billion for the fiscal year ended January 3, 2020. For more information, visit www.Leidos.com.
Pay and benefits are fundamental to any career decision. That's why we craft compensation packages that reflect the importance of the work we do for our customers. Join a global team of highly engaged and collaborative software and marketing experts to help drive our continued growth in the analytical science markets. The eCDS product marketing team promotes Chromeleon through impactful marketing programs, sales enablement activities and regularly interactions with customers through seminars or targeted 1:1 activities.
We are looking for a marketing specialist for Chromeleon’s quantitative MS/MS software capabilities to expand our eCDS team. This role is fully remote based from Western Europe or Eastern/Central United States.
The ideal candidate
Has practical experience with ThermoFisher Scientific’s GC-MS or/and LC-MS QQQ instruments in the Food Safety, Environmental or Pharma Contract Testing Lab applications.
Is willing to travel up to 25% of their time
Is self-motivated and used to work towards challenging goals
Enjoys collaboration and interaction with their team and peers
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Market and promote Chromeleon capabilities for quantitative MS/MS analysis in Analytical Science markets to internal and external customers:
Create Value-Add Chromeleon marketing collateral for Analytical Science segments in Environmental, Food Safety and Contract Testing Labs
Develop and deliver agreed sales tactics on time as defined in the annual marketing plan and the rolling Marcom planning calls
Marketing product expert/champion for sales & marketing, distribution channel, customers, and press, media and industry analysts on quantitative MS/MS analysis in Analytical Science
Conduct sales enablement activities (remote, f2f and recorded/eLearning) for the commercial Account Manager and eCDS Specialist channels
Identify promotion opportunities and drive value-add promotions around Quan MS/MS Software
Support commercial teams in their sales activities for Chromeleon
Become the primary interface for Quan MS/MS software related interactions to sales and BU peers
Reply to written or phone requests for sales support activities from commercial contacts
Closely work with the eCDS and CoE pre-sales channel to educate them on best practices how to demo Chromeleon software, create scripts and pre-recorded short, canned demo versions with pre-configured systems
Head regular remote and if necessary f2f meetings with the pre-sales channel to enable sharing of best practices, collect feedback and drive continuous education
Assist eCDS sales channel to drive generalist and specialist training
Conduct joint remote and f2f visits with commercial at key customers or for key deals
Provide market insights, application understanding and Sales Messaging for WiAS segment:
Be the key subject matter expert and “go-to” person to eCDS BU peers on all quantitative MS/MS market and application topics
Understand, document and share MS/MS quantitation market and customer needs with software product management and peer Bus
Understand market/customer dynamics to suggest portfolio adjustments
Provide feedback to Product Managers and Core team regarding key customer criteria for successful future product roadmap and feature enhancements
Develop competitive position and (software) winning points for Chromeleon as MS/MS application software
Requirements:
University degree in Analytical Science, Chemistry, Chemical Engineering or similar sciences OR minimum of eight years practical experience with MS/MS instrument operation using ThermoFisher or competitor instruments. Optional marketing degree would be a bonus
Minimum of five years practical experience operating MS/MS instrumentation
Of which a minimum of three years practical experience in Pharma CTL, Environmental or Food safety applications/markets
Detailed product knowledge on MS/MS quantitation Software
Minimum of two years practical experience with Chromeleon
Excellent written and oral presentation skills
Fluency in English language
Advanced communication skills
Highly desirable:
Practical experience with TraceFinder Software
Understanding of (regulatory) requirements of the Pharmaceutical and Food Safety Industries
High-level understanding of market drivers and applications in adjacent markets (Chem/Petro, Environmental)
High degree of personal initiative and self management
Ability to influence others without direct control (Matrix management)
Ability to connect with customer base, determine business issues, and devise innovative solutions.

In the race for ideas, we never want our customers to compromise the speed of innovation nor the safety of their data. We are proud our insider threat solution has been honored with a number of national awards. This includes Globee, IT World, Black Unicorn and Stevie Awards, as well as Cyber Defense Magazine InfoSec Awards, Cybersecurity Excellence Awards and an Info Security PG’s Global Excellence Award.
You belong at Code42 if you crave being a part of a transparent and collaborative culture, you want to drive innovation, and security is always top of mind. We look for authentic people who are inquisitive, enjoy solving complex problems, think creatively and provide diverse insights to help us think differently and thrive together. Don’t wait. #BeCode42

Own assigned individual projects and be responsible for final output
Collaborate with peers on larger team projects

Pursuing a bachelor’s degree with at least two years of coursework completed
Excellent oral and written communication skills, strong attention to detail
Organized approach to the design and implementation of all deliverables
Self-starter, able to work independently
Experience with project management, including managing timelines, establishing priorities, and producing deliverables

WHY #BECODE42:
At Code42 we believe our Interns bring a unique and fresh perspective to our product and culture. We treat our interns like full-time employees. You’ll get the opportunity to partake in company events, meetings, benefits and other perks. If you want to have your ideas heard, grow in a professional environment and be a part of a robust and hand-on experience, you want to be at Code42.

Syniti is an innovative, global leader in Enterprise Data Management. With smart and powerful resources like our award-winning software platform and premier consultants, Syniti helps the world’s top enterprises create unique advantage and value with their data. Whether the goal is bringing new products to market faster, accelerating time-to-value for a new ERP system or corporate acquisition, powering new AI/ML initiatives, or increasing profitability by eliminating inefficiencies, Syniti ensures your business’s data is a high-performing and trusted asset. Syniti is also a preferred data solution used by the world’s top system integrators, and a portfolio company of BridgeGrowth Partners LLC. Headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts with offices in 25 countries around the world, Syniti operates in all global regions and industry verticals, and maintains a 100% client success rate across thousands of complex data projects and initiatives.
POSITION SUMMARY
The Sales Operations Analyst will be responsible for managing sales data and analytics globally, including analyzing the health of the sales process, analyzing and evaluating performance metrics and managing metrics against Syniti’s sales goals to ensure alignment and focus. The position will also be the owner of our dashboard and reporting tool, InsightSquared.
This role has been designated as a Remote position allowing qualified talent throughout the listed country to be considered for the opportunity.
PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES
Implement and manage reports and dashboards globally in InsightSquared ensuring sales reps and leaders have access to key data required to successfully manage the business
Provide first level support and recommendations for improvements in InsightSquared from Global and Regional Leadership and Sales Operations
Recommend revisions to existing reports/dashboards or assist in the development of new reporting tools as needed
Assess business needs and identify the best approach to develop standard dashboards/reports either through Salesforce or Insight Squared
Provide insights to support the decision making and strategic planning of the sales organization
Provide regular reporting to senior leadership on quarterly and annual performance as well as key KPIs from Business Stakeholders such as win/loss, sales performance and pipeline coverage
Analyze data over time to forecast sales trends and determine trends in productivity
Recommend and present actionable insights to sales and company leadership
Maintain reporting on sales opportunity stage KPI’s which include duration, milestones, content usage insights and alignment with Salesforce usage best practices
Manage all documentation supporting the defined policies and processes within the sales organization developed by Sales and Operations Leadership
Assist with managing certain activities in Salesforce such as account hierarchies, validating and closing software opportunities, etc.
QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s Degree
3-5 years of experience in sales support or related field
Experience with Salesforce.com/ Insight Squared or similar CRM system required
Advanced skills with MS Office (Excel, Power Point, Word and Outlook)
Strong quantitative and qualitative analytical abilities
Ability to adapt quickly and efficiently to changing environments and initiatives and learn new skills quickly
Ability to meet tight and sometimes competing deadlines
Creative and analytical thinker with strong problem-solving skills
Detail oriented, organized and an ability to multi-task
Strong work ethic; hands on style
Ability to complete assignments independently with little supervision; ability to anticipate and manage unexpected situations
Strong written and verbal skills with proven ability to effectively communicate with all organizational levels within the company
If you are interested in this or any one of the exciting career opportunities at Syniti®, please go to www.syniti.com and view our Careers section, where you should complete the on-line application process.

Requisition ID: req12283
Job Title: Employment Specialist
Sector: Employment
Employment Category: Fixed Term
Employment Type: Full-Time
Open to Expatriates: No
Location: Atlanta, GA USA
Job Description
The Employment Specialist assists newly arrived refugees and other qualified immigrants to attain self-sufficiency through employment by guiding them through employment preparation, coordinating job placements, and other career advancement services.
Major Responsibilities:
Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Conduct intake, assessment and provide program orientation to clients eligible for employment services. Develop comprehensive employment plans and budget strategies for each employable adult. Provide job readiness and job search coaching and connect clients with job opportunities.
Develop and cultivate long term relationships with area employers and staffing agencies to identify appropriate employment opportunities for clients.
Assist clients and employers as necessary with post-placement issues and continuing employment needs.
Monitor client job performance, wage levels, and related metrics.
Detail each client interaction in accordance with program requirements. Input client information in database(s) and assist with tracking and reporting as needed.
Collaborate effectively with coworkers and partner organizations. Build and maintain relationships with area service providers for the benefit of clients.
Use personal, insured vehicle and/or public transportation (where available) to travel and transport clients and materials as needed throughout the service delivery area.
May train and lead the activities of support staff, volunteers, and interns.
Other duties as assigned.
Qualifications
Education: Bachelor’s degree in social work or related field of study preferred.
Work Experience:
Relevant professional experience in workforce development field required; minimum of 2 years’ experience strongly preferred.
Experience working with refugee and/or immigrant populations strongly preferred.
Experience with job placement and job readiness training a plus.
Demonstrated Skills & Competencies:
Strong relationship building, diplomacy, and networking skills; ability to effectively build internal and external relationships.
Demonstrated success working and communicating effectively in a multi-cultural environment.
Self-starter with excellent problem-solving skills combined with the proven ability to multi-task, prioritize duties, and manage time effectively.
Attention to detail and accuracy in work product.
Proficient in English, both spoken and written; proficiency in language(s) spoken by client group is desired.
Proficient in Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, Outlook); ability to use the internet and other digital tools for data entry, research and problem-solving purposes.
Valid driver’s license and access to a personal, insured vehicle.
Working Environment:
A combination of standard office environment, remote work, and ‘field’ time within the service delivery area to perform the above outlined responsibilities.
May require occasional weekend and/or evening work.

Cox Automotive People Strategies is transforming Human Resources the same way our company transforms the way the world buys, sells and owns cars. Through strategic imagination, agility, resilience, and active collaboration, we deliver the global talent and organizational strategies that deliver results for our company. We are preparing for the future of our industry and the workplace by devising progressive HR and talent solutions that empower our team members and enable a culture of collaboration and innovation.
We are looking for professionals who have a futurist view, think on their feet, and focus their efforts on strategic programs with the greatest potential for positive impact.
The HR Business Partner serves as an influential people partner, advising clients in one or more key solutions and/or functions. This role will serve as the HR Business Partner for a business or team within Cox Automotive. It plays a key role in developing and implementing the HR strategy and programs in support of short-term and long-term business goals with the overall goal of attracting, retaining, and developing the best talent.
Provide meaningful partnership experiences. Work with management teams to drive engagement, build capability, coach, support, advise, and challenge leaders. Address and support day to day issues related to employee relations, performance management, and development opportunities.
Develop and lead people strategy opportunities to compete and succeed. Contribute to the execution of the business plan through the creation and implementation of the People Strategies that attract, develop and retain Team Members. Collaborate with and influence leaders to prioritize strategic people priorities and solutions that accelerate the achievement of business priorities through talent management, diversity and inclusion, rewards and recognition, and organizational effectiveness.
Design and create the organization that will deliver business success. Proactively challenge the established organizational structure of the customer unit to drive superior performance. Manage effective organizational transformation and change projects using best practice methodologies. Coach and support Line Managers.
Create the culture that enables the business to be successful. Develop and drive the employee engagement strategy to help make Cox Automotive the very best place to be. Be the cultural enabler for your business. Promote and foster a culture that is productive, open and empowering and coach others to behave and make decisions in line with our management and leadership principles.
Resource the organization to enable current and future success. Ensure Performance and Talent Management drive the achievement of business goals, through objective and development plan setting, performance calibration and talent development. Lead talent review / calibration to ensure high performance is rewarded and developed. Implement succession planning and talent management plans that support business goals.
Interpret data insightfully and generate original insights for strategic talent priorities. Analyze qualitative and quantitative data to solve problems and drive continuous improvement of talent priorities. Be an insights advocate that reviews external data and trends and provides relevant insight back into the business.
Deliver better, quicker results through the expertise, resources and connections of your network. Work collaboratively with People Strategies Centers of Excellence to optimize the effectiveness of the business.
Anticipate and respond to changing business needs. Influence lasting change in assigned businesses by serving as a change advocate on companywide strategies and initiatives. Serve as a change advocate for strategic initiatives and programs that influence lasting change in assigned areas.
Other duties as assigned.

#Remote-SE GA

Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in business, HR or a related field and 5 years progressive experience in HR disciplines with a strategic focus OR equivalent combination of education and work- related experience.
Experience working with, coaching and influencing leaders
Proven ability to influence and partner with leadership and individual contributor levels of the organization to achieve results
Strong HR and business acumen, including problem-solving skills, critical thinking, and self-initiative
Must have the ability to diagnose a problem and identify and drive appropriate solutions
Flexibility to travel approximately 30%
Preferred Qualifications
Demonstrated ability to drive human resource strategies and programs in a complex, fast growing, and dynamic environment.
Demonstrated ability to work in a geographically disbursed and matrix organization.
Key Experiences
Exposure to working in a change program
Experience in coaching and developing people
Successful experience in the implementation and execution of people strategies for a business/ function
Worked within a matrix environment
Critical Competencies
Change leadership
Cultural Enabler
Decision making
Relationship building
Emotional intelligence
Impact and Influencing

Who We Are
About Cox Automotive
There’s nothing ordinary about Cox Automotive. We are people of every background driven by our passion for mobility, innovation, client success and community outreach. We make buying, selling and owning (or simply using) cars easier for everyone. Touching more than 40,000 clients across five continents, we bring together the best brands and the best teams to propel the automotive industry forward. Some of those team members work for our iconic consumer brands like Autotrader and Kelley Blue Book, while others are creating the future of automotive at industry-facing brands like Dealer.com, Manheim and vAuto.
About Cox
We are the Cox family of businesses. We’ve been making our mark since 1898 by building and evolving world-class businesses, staying true to our values, and encouraging top talent to always look for growth and impact while building a career with us. Our primary divisions – Cox Communications and Cox Automotive – are driving a new wave of innovation, powering smart cities with powerhouse broadband communications and pioneering greener, more progressive transportation alternatives for individuals and fleet operators. We’re also expanding into new spaces like cleantech and healthcare to rev up our momentum toward building a better future for the next generation. We’re looking for the talent today who will be our leaders tomorrow. Sound intriguing? Learn more about where we are today, where we hope you’ll be going with us, and the common purpose that unites us at coxenterprises.com.
Cox is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer - All qualified applicants/employees will receive consideration for employment without regard to that individual’s age, race, color, religion or creed, national origin or ancestry, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, physical or mental disability, veteran status, genetic information, ethnicity, citizenship, or any other characteristic protected by law.
Statement to ALL Third-Party Agencies and Similar Organizations: Cox accepts resumes only from agencies with which we formally engage their services. Please do not forward resumes to our applicant tracking system, Cox employees, Cox hiring manager, or send to any Cox facility. Cox is not responsible for any fees or charges associated with unsolicited resumes.

We are the now and the next. The power behind the people building the future. We are born from the spirit of innovation. We are created from the idea that people around the world want more, need more, deserve more. We are the home of the global digital revolution. We are CNN.

The Job

We're looking for an experienced temporary writer to join the CNN Underscored team. Strong sense of latest product and commerce trends
Excels at short-term assignments that often require the application of independent judgment

Operates within the context of defined procedures

College Degree preferred
Must have at least 3-5 years of experience in writing content and editing, and a strong interest in ecommerce
Previous experience using photo editing tools a plus
Flawless grammar & spelling
Must be proficient in MS Office Suite, and comfortable using content management systems
Strong creative and writing skills are required for this position. Must be detail-oriented, organized and have strong communication skills.

Access to well-being tools, resources, and freebies
2018 Best Company for Working Mothers

An in-house learning and development team to help shape and grow your career

ENGIE’s Building Systems Specialists are high-energy, technically savvy, customer-focused individuals at the heart of the remote monitoring services we provide our clients. Our Building System Specialists are a highly skilled team who use advanced technology to remotely troubleshoot heating, cooling, lighting, and refrigeration units and determine effective solutions to the clients’ issues. Our focus is to reduce our clients’ energy spend by driving down consumption while optimizing unit performance.
Are you ready to be on the front-line everyday driving value for our customers while supporting their energy strategies?
What you’ll do:
Telephone support and solutions for clients using multiple Energy Management Systems (EMS) interfaces
Troubleshooting incoming service requests and alarms and deciding appropriate actions to resolve the issues
Direction of third-party on-site personnel supporting the Technician’s troubleshooting process
Interpretation and analysis of data for all types of heating, ventilation, air conditioning, and refrigeration (HVACAR), and lighting systems
Perform audits of facilities and report on recommendations for optimizing energy use, asset efficiency, and problem resolution
Other tasks as assigned by Supervisor/ Manager.
Qualifications
What you bring:
High School diploma/GED – required.
Associates degree / Bachelor’s degree – preferred.
Work experience in the commercial HVAC and/or energy management industries performing a similar or closely related role – desirable.
EMS monitoring experience employing various monitoring software and controls such as Novar, Trane, Honeywell. Etc. is highly desirable and preferred.
Two-year technical degree and/or certification (HVAC, Mechanical, Electrical) – desirable.
Knowledge in the following areas: Fundamentals of energy management, HVAC and lighting systems and troubleshooting methods, and/or Refrigeration systems and troubleshooting methods
Demonstrable math and computer proficiency, particularly with Microsoft Office applications such as Excel, Word, and Outlook
Working knowledge of business operations
Why ENGIE?
ENGIE North America isn’t just participating in the Zero-Carbon transition, we’re leading it! Join us as we develop energy that is more renewable, more efficient and more accessible to everyone.
Unite with us in leading the transformation of the world of energy! ENGIE is looking for talented and motivated individuals to create the future of energy and customer solutions. Join a rewarding and flexible work environment that encourages innovation and creativity to help customers meet their energy challenges today and in the future. Are you up for the challenge?

JobTitle: Virtual Turner Sports Data Strategy and Insights Intern- Summer 2021
Text:
Virtual Turner Sports Data Strategy and Insights Intern- Summer 2021
Location Atlanta, Georgia
Business: Turner
Position Type: Intern
Job ID 180735BR
Virtual Intern – Turner Sports Data Strategy & Insights

The WarnerMedia Story
WarnerMedia is a leading media and entertainment company that creates and distributes premium and popular content from a diverse array of talented storytellers and journalists to global audiences through its consumer brands including: HBO, HBO Now, HBO Max, Warner Bros., TNT, TBS, truTV, CNN, DC Entertainment, New Line, Cartoon Network, Adult Swim, Turner Sports and others.

The Team
The Turner Sports Insights team is a passionate group striving to identify growth areas in the sports media business.

We collaborate with all facets of the Turner Sports business leveraging industry trends to deliver insights that inform innovative business solutions.
The team emphasizes business storytelling and teamwork.

The Daily
Evaluate performance of our Turner Sports programs, networks and the general sports media landscape.
Support our businesses with analysis leveraging data and industry trends.
Provide support maintaining standardized reporting analysis.
Use software applications (such as Nielsen, Arianna, Star Media, Conviva, etc.) to extract data from primary and syndicated sources.
Create presentations with an emphasis on business storytelling.

The Essentials
Passion for sports, media, technology or better yet all three!
Knowledgeable sports fan with an understanding of the media and tech industries.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to master new software.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office including Excel and PowerPoint.
Proficiency in Looker is not required but a bonus.
High-level familiarity with our Turner Sports properties, the Bleacher Report app and the HBO Max platform.

Internship Program
Students must be currently enrolled in a college degree program for full duration of the internship.
Summer 2021 program dates are June 7th - August 13th; must be available for full program duration.
Full-time schedule (40 hours/week) designed to work around class schedule.
Fully remote/virtual experience; company owned laptop provided for the duration of the internship program.
Salary based on office location; relocation is not provided.
This position is targeted towards upperclassmen and graduate students

The Perks
An opportunity to work with a great team that is passionate about the same thing you are!
Networking opportunities to meet people that you’d like to know!
A speaker series that introduces you to cool executives and what they do for the best brands!
Part of the WarnerMedia family of powerhouse brands.
Warner Media, LLC and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity employers. Qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.

Discover Your Career at Emory University:

Emory University is a leading research university that fosters excellence and attracts world-class talent to innovate today and prepare leaders for the future. We welcome candidates who can contribute to the diversity and excellence of our academic community.
Description:

JOB DESCRIPTION:
Under general supervision, performs a variety of defined research and laboratory tests and experiments according to prescribed protocols and assigned schedules.
Sets up experiments as prescribed by a principal investigator.
May be required to participate in laboratory maintenance activities such as sterilization and cleaning of equipment, ordering of supplies, inventory and media preparation.
Maintains records, files and logs of work performed in laboratory notebooks and computer databases.
Compiles data and records results of studies for publications, grants and seminar presentations.
Employees in this classification may be required to work with, take specific precautions against and/or be immunized against potentially hazardous agents.
Performs related responsibilities as required by principal investigator.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor's degree in a scientific field OR equivalent combination of experience, education, and training.
NOTE: Position tasks are generally required to be performed in-person at an Emory University location. Remote work from home day options may be granted at department discretion. Emory reserves the right to change remote work status with notice to employee
Emory Supports a Diverse and Inclusive Culture:

Emory University is dedicated to providing equal opportunities and equal access to all individuals regardless of race, color, religion, ethnic or national origin, gender, genetic information, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, and veteran's status. Emory University does not discriminate in admissions, educational programs, or employment on the basis of any factor stated above or prohibited under applicable law. Emory University is committed to achieving a diverse workforce through application of its affirmative action, equal opportunity and nondiscrimination policy in all aspects of employment including recruitment, hiring, promotions, transfers, discipline, terminations, wage and salary administration, benefits, and training. Inquiries regarding this policy should be directed to the Emory University Department of Equity and Inclusion, 201 Dowman Drive, Administration Building, Atlanta, GA 30322. Telephone: 404-727-9867 (V) | 404-712-2049 (TDD).
