Part -Time Customer Service Representative (Virtual)
We are looking for you IF
You want a genuine virtual position where you can work from home as a true team member of a long standing, innovative organization.
You don’t just want a job, you want a career, where you can gain skills and see your future career opportunities blossom.
Your passion is to help people and to be a part of the Health & Wellness movement.
Who we are- what we do.
Healthy Back Institute is a Health & Wellness Direct Marketing & E-commerce platform helping people, MILLIONS of people, literally all over the world live without pain, naturally and safely. We do this via cutting-edge educational information, breakthrough products and by providing truly loving care and service to our online E-commerce customers.
Here at the Healthy Back Institute, we are on a mission to change the way people think about health and support people in their journey to live a pain free life, naturally.
Everything that happens at the Healthy Back Institute is rooted in our core values:
Helping People, Trust, Service, Family and Being Great!
These are the foundations of how we serve our customers as well as how we treat each other.
It is our mission to always provide an environment for our employees that promotes happiness from the inside out. When you work with us, you are valued and inspired to learn, to teach and to grow. We want you to come to work motivated to and proud to be on our team. That's why we continually invest in creating outstanding work experiences and endless development opportunities. We want you to be and feel at your best, always.
In addition to the awesome corporate culture, you'll enjoy the many benefits of WORKING FROM HOME!
Removing the cost, stress and time constraints of a daily commute
Total comfort of working from your own home
A consistent work scheduled that allows you to balance work & life
$13.00+ an hour to start with tons of potential for growth!
What our Customer Service Agents do on a daily.
Our virtual call center Customer Service Representatives are a very important part of our family! You will be the eyes and ears for our team, fielding customer inquiries and authentically connecting to our customers to help them in the best way possible. This role may handle a high volume of inbound or outbound calls or both, support customers through chat, phone and email. You will create a positive experience (win-win) for each caller by providing a consultative, accurate and efficient response to their inquiries AND, this is all from your home office!
Additionally, As a Healthy Back Institute Customer Service Representative you will:
Effectively search for and type information on the computer, navigate through multiple windows and screens quickly, inputting information accurately while keeping pace with the call.
With great attention to detail, document specifics of calls and customer interactions in the appropriate systems (CRM)
Work with confidential customer information and treat it sensitively
Type at least 35 WPM and talk at the same time
Aim to resolve issues on the first call by being proactive
Adhere to call center metrics such as call quality score averages, average talk time and customer feedback scores.
Act as the “Voice of the Customer,” working with the team to refine problem areas and drive continuous service improvements for our customers.
Escalate customer or operational issues to supervisor in a manner that identifies solutions and focuses on timely and mutually satisfactory resolve.
Must have the ability to travel by plane 1 time annually.
As we are fully remote, we strive to connect via technology of all kinds, chat, email and we do have video meetings as often as possible so you must attend interviews and future meetings via video.
Qualifications
Minimum 3 Years Customer Service Experience.
1-year experience working in a contact/call center (preferably virtual)
Strong computer and telephone multitasking skills
Very strong business verbal and written communication skill
Excellent time management skills, highly organized and detail oriented
Very strong work ethic, being the best, even if no one is watching
Business to Customer (B2C) Experience (client facing)
E-commerce Customer Service Support Experience (supporting product knowledge and sales)
Experience supporting customers through Chat, Email and Phone.
Experience with high volume inbound call intake
CRM System (Customer Relationship Management) System Exposure
Empathetic listener, sensitive, upbeat, optimistic
Favorably pass a background and reference check
Bilingual a plus
Should be able to work Saturday shift.
Ability to appropriately control emotions and respond accordingly to the situation.
Ability to handle stressful situations with resilience and respond appropriately.
On the job experience utilizing technologies such as Zendesk, Slack. JIRA, Google Drive/Docs/Sheets, VoIP or other Cloud-Based Telephony software is helpful.
Computer Requirements:
Home computer & headset
Operating System: Windows 7/Mac 10.1 or better
Minimum internet bandwidth of 25MB download and 5MB upload
Internet Router or Modem
Working Webcam
Customer Service isn’t for everyone. It’s for driven, confident people who think on their feet, deliver top notch service and can rise to the challenge to advocate for customers. If you meet most - if not all - of our criteria above and this sounds like a great fit for you, we would love to hear from you.
We can offer you the opportunity to work with great people in a company where you can be recognized, rewarded and appreciated for making a real difference in the lives of others.
If you want to check out the platform you can here at: www.losethebackpain.com If you want to see for yourself how our team members feel about working here, check out our reviews on Glassdoor!

Job Description: Why you and why us?

Who are our Customer Service Agents? They are people who truly care about creating a seamless experience for our customers. Agents are trained in taking calls to assist customers with anything from placing orders and facilitating returns, to locating products and scheduling deliveries for all of our Williams-Sonoma brands. If you consider yourself a blend of determination with a heart of gold, THIS.IS.YOUR.OPPORTUNITY.

40% Discount on most merchandise!
Full benefits including medical/dental/vision/maternity/vacation/401k and much more!
Monthly performance bonuses!
Fun contests / rewards and recognition programs
Growth / Promotional Opportunities
Paid Training from the comfort of your home
Overtime, overtime, overtime
Pay = $14.00/hr

Solve the problem efficiently: Quick with quality
Make it personal: Take ownership
Inspire customer loyalty: Give them a reason to come back
Listen Carefully: Be attentive
Emphasize our effort: Because we care

1 – 2 years previous customer service experience

Strong ability to communicate both verbally and written with capable data entry skills

Equipment you must have for training and for work:

No Chromebook, Windows 7, Windows 8 RT, or Windows 10 S
SAntivirus/Anti-malware
6 GB of RAM
Wired USB headset (with microphone) which is compatible with our systems
Ethernet cable hardwired into you modem/router
Wi-Fi is not permitted
USB to Ethernet converter if your computer does not have an Ethernet port

Mouse and keyboard
Webcam (built in or external) with minimum resolution of 640 X 480
Landline phone, iOS device (tablet or cell phone), or an Android (tablet or cell phone) for purposes of multi-factor authentication

Computer must be hard wired to your modem, router, or gateway. Wi-Fi is not allowed due to security and bandwidth constraints.

JobTitle: Account Executive - Enterprise South Region- Georgia
Text:
Job Summary:

The Enterprise Account Executive will focus on developing new business with existing customers and acquire new customers across a focused Named Account List. Working with our Sales Leadership, Internal Support, and our Training and Development Teams the Account Executive will be enabled to position SHI’s Innovative Solutions and World Class Support to their Target Customer List.
This position is a remote position with a home office set up, however required to reside in the state of Georgia to support business needs. This is an outside sales position. As such, the Account Executive is expected to spend 50 percent or more of the time outside of an office interfacing and building relationships with existing and potential SHI customers, identifying new opportunities, networking, and following up on potential leads. The Account Executive must be self-motivated and comfortable working with limited direction and oversight.
About Us:

Founded in 1989, SHI International is a global IT solutions provider, with a projected 2020 revenue of $11 billion. SHI currently has 5,000 employees worldwide.
To learn more about SHI International Corp, visit our website: www.shi.com/careers
What SHI Can Offer:
World Class Facility includes on site gyms and cafeterias
Ongoing opportunities for personal and professional growth and development due to our strong promote from within philosophy
Work in an up-beat, creative, and fun environment
Benefits including medical, vision, dental, 401K, and flexible spending
Responsibilities:

Include but not limited to:
Develop Business with existing customers and establish new customers based on targeted sales techniques by Cold Calling, Customer Meetings, Partner and Industry Networking
Identify, Create, Develop and Manage Opportunities in the Sales Pipeline and Sales Management Platform to achieve Sales Targets and Goals
Understand Customer’s Business Objectives, IT Priorities and Initiatives
Position SHI’s Portfolio of Products, Solutions, Services and Capabilities
Develop and maintain Strategic Relationships with current and new customers and partner Contacts
Collaborate with Pre and Post Sales Internal Support Teams
Excel in a Team Selling Environment
Continue Education on industry trends, products, and market conditions
Continually meet or exceed sales targets by selling company products, solutions, and services to new and existing customers
Travel within assigned sales territory to meet existing and potential customers and attend company events
Qualifications:
Minimum of 3-5 Years of Successful IT Sales Experience
Bachelor’s Degree
Display a documented history of New Business Development
Required Skills:
Effective written and verbal communication skills
Excellent presentation skills
Excellent time management, planning, and organization skills
Ability to self-study and engage in independent work to increase job related knowledge and skills
Ability to think ahead, plan long-term decisions, and anticipate outcomes
Business-acumen
Possess good judgment and decision-making skills
Ability to be approachable, maintain composure, and possess a professional attitude
Strong interpersonal and customer service skills
Self-motivated with ability to work with limited direction and oversight
Strong consultative sales skills
Ability to prospect, negotiate, and close deals
Preferred Qualifications/Skills:
Advanced Degrees, Sales and technical certifications
Experience Selling Complex IT Solutions
Working knowledge of Programs from Industry Leading OEMs such as Microsoft, Dell/VMware, HP, Cisco, Apple, AWS, Lenovo
Unique Requirements:
Position requires minimum 50% time outside of an office setting meeting with existing and potential customers
Position requires travel to company events and meetings
Additional Information:
FLSA Status: Exempt

Our team is seeking a Liaison in the Atlanta, Georgia area to recruit qualified physicians and practitioners into a partnership to provide cutting edge technology for bioidentical hormone replacement therapy (BHRT) and healthy aging options to their own patients and to the public at large. This position is responsible for relationship development, practice development and sales of the company method to practitioners. Sales activity includes prospecting, cold calling, practice development, tradeshows, sales events, and other methods for creating leads and closing sales within the approved price matrix. In addition, the Liaison provides technical, educational, and Provider Partner support. This is a direct hire opportunity, based in the field/work from home. Some job functions are listed below, but other duties may be required.Essential Job Functions: Must be able to acquire and retain extensive knowledge of hormone replacement therapy through materials provided by the company, as well as outside sources.Effectively conduct physician, staff and patient training in the areas of business protocols; specifically, marketing, financial, therapy, forms, patient seminars, company online resources and other topics that may change from time to time.Prior history or ability to read and understand medical and scientific studies.Research and evaluate physicians in assigned areas based on company criteria for appropriateness and suitability.Effectively present training and business program to physicians, Nurse Practitioners, Physician Assistants, office managers and office staff.Recruit suitable physicians and other practitioners through professional and effective prospecting, appointment setting and presentation skills.Cultivate and maintain mutually productive partnerships with practitioners to grow new and current practices and maintain patient retention levels of 60% or better.Effectively conduct physician, staff and patient training in the areas of business protocols; specifically, marketing, financial, therapy, forms, patient seminars, company online resources and other topics that may change from time to time.Secure all required contracts, paperwork and documentation as well as payments and fees as needed for attendees to participate in regular training and certification classes.Conduct and facilitate patient educational seminars as needed for trained practitioners on a monthly basis.Contribute to the development of the practice by assisting the Office Manager/Marketing position with email marketing, social media, referral cards and website information cards.Prospecting for new leads and identifying quality sales prospects from active leads.Attending marketing and sales events for prospects and current customers.Working with customers for sales referrals with new prospects.Update all relevant sales activities in the Company’s CRM system.Close sales accurately and effectively each month to meet or exceed targets.Respond to all emails received from the customer and company employees and related vendors in a timely manner.Perform other related duties as required or requested.Hours: 40-50 hours per week; 70% travel requiredSalary:  $85,000 - $95,000/Year base, plus uncapped commissionsRequirements: Excellent in business software such as Excel, Word, Power Point, and Outlook.Strong communication skills, both orally and written and the ability to get in front of the practitioner to make presentations.Proven track record of meeting and exceeding assigned tasks.Ability to react to time pressures and to overcome objections effectively.Ability to work extended hours as duties require.Strong teamwork, communication (written and oral), client management, and interpersonal skills.Minimum of 3-5 years of sales experience in a business-to-business model.Must have excellent time management skillsScheduled hours are 40 to 50 hours per week Monday through Friday but may be extended as required to execute the tasks assigned.Ability to travel up to 70% in order to adequately cover the assigned territory including multi-overnight stays, attend tradeshows, and corporate and training meetings is required.Valid driver’s license issued by the state/province in which the individual resides and a good driving record is required.Home office capability is required with reliable high-speed internet access.Must provide employment referencesRegular attendance, teamwork, initiative, dependability, promptnessFor immediate consideration, apply now!KC253216210Job Type: Full-timePay: $85,000.00 - $95,000.00 per yearSchedule:Monday to FridaySupplemental Pay:Bonus payCommission payWork Location:On the roadPaid Training:YesCompany's website:www.burnetts.comBenefit Conditions:Waiting period may applyWork Remotely:YesCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview process

Who We Are

Samsara, founded in 2015, is a leader in Industrial IoT and our mission is to increase the efficiency, safety, and sustainability of the operations that power our economy. Our solutions combine hardware and software to bring real-time visibility, analytics, and AI to operations across various industries. Samsara's fast-growing team is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices in San Jose, Atlanta, and London. Our team has raised $930M from Andreessen Horowitz, General Catalyst, Tiger Global, Dragoneer, AllianceBernstein Holding LP, Franklin Templeton, General Atlantic, Sands Capital Management and Warburg Pincus LLC.

At Samsara, we welcome all. All sizes, colors, cultures, sexes, beliefs, religions, ages, people. We depend on the unique approaches of our team members to help us solve complex problems. We are committed to increasing diversity across our team and ensuring that Samsara is a place where people from all backgrounds can make an impact.
About the role:

We are looking for a smart, ambitious Sales Coordinator with an interest in developing a diverse skill set and helping steer sales operations at a fast-growing IoT startup. You will support and enable our Enterprise sales team in closing complex deals with Samsara's largest customers. This is a multi-faceted role in which you will build out a growing segment while working directly with enterprise sales representatives, leadership, internal stakeholders, and our largest clients. This position is based in our Atlanta office.

In this role, you will:

Support Samsara's enterprise sales team by serving as the main point of contact for Account Executives
Manage contracts, work order requests, and the purchase of add-ons to existing deals
Quickly solve immediate sales pain points and leverage cross-functional relationships with Finance, Legal, and Operations teams to provide comprehensive deal support
Train and enforce Salesforce data hygiene and integrity to enable accurate pipeline and forecasting
Manage account disputes and resolve support tickets from our sales team

An ideal candidate has:

High attention to detail and proven ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal
Ability to tackle tough problems with a solution-oriented mindset
Resourceful, proactive, and adaptive in dealing with operational hurdles
Ability to prioritize multiple tasks while maintaining overall team goals
Prior experience with Salesforce and Excel is a plus
Sales experience in emerging markets and new verticals is a plus
1+ years of work experience

Benefits

Working at Samsara has its perks: for all full-time global employees, we provide private medical and dental insurance plus growth and development opportunities, as well as regular virtual team and company events. In the US we offer flexible vacation time, EMEA employees receive 25 vacation days plus national bank holidays. Post-COVID we'll be back in our global offices with numerous in-office perks.

Regarding COVID-19

With the spread of COVID-19, Samsara's global offices will remain closed until further notice with the exception of employees that require access to hardware and lab equipment.

Our primary concern is for the health and well-being of our employees as well as candidates. We have transitioned all interviews and onboarding to be conducted virtually via Zoom video conferencing. Employees are also able to work from countries and states where Samsara is a registered entity through June 2021, full list of locations here. All employees are expected to return to our offices when they reopen with the exception of field-based and fully remote roles.

If you have any questions or concerns before applying, feel free to contact us at jobs@samsara.com.

Company Description
SmartRecruiters is a fast-growing recruiting SaaS provider on a mission to connect people to jobs at scale. We are bright, passionate individuals on a mission to change the way companies hire.
Rated by industry analysts as the worldwide leader of modern talent acquisition suites, 4,000+ customers around the world use SmartRecruiters’ products to achieve Hiring Success. Our belief is that people are the heart of an organization - hiring success = business success.
SmartRecruiters offers a collaborative, diverse, and remote-friendly work environment, as well as competitive salaries and generous equity. We believe in promotion from within, so high performance can lead to upward mobility. Needless to say, we make sure you’re taken care of.
Our inclusive office environment welcomes and respects all.

Job Description
If you’re a recruitment marketing or job advertising professional who is curious about life inside of a fast-growing software company, this role is for you!
Reporting to the GM, Advertising Products, the Advertising Strategist will serve as SmartRecruiters’ first dedicated job advertising SME. This role is roughly ⅔ customer-facing, ⅓ internal operations and strategy.
The ideal candidate will be excited to wear several hats:
Educator - teach customers about the job advertising landscape, trends, and best practices
Advisor - show customers how to best manage job ad spend using our marketplace, job distribution, and programmatic advertising products
Entrepreneur - give input to product and go-to-market strategy as we grow the ad business
If hired as an Advertising Strategist at SmartRecruiters, we anticipate you will be responsible for:
Onboard - As our customers implement the SmartRecruit ATS, assist with proper setup and onboarding into our advertising products (such as SmartDistribute job distribution).
Build - Partner with the GM, product marketing, and others to build out the materials (e.g., reporting templates, webinar presentations) + processes needed to educate and support our customers at scale.
Educate - Deliver one-to-many workshops and webinars that educate on successful ROI strategies and playbooks for making the best use of our products. Assist with QBRs and presentation of ad metrics.
Advise - Provide custom recommendations on budget allocation to our largest, strategic customers. Coordinate internally with media buying and performance (programmatic/PPC) colleagues to package and support delivery of tailored solutions.

Qualifications

2+ years overall experience with a Recruitment Advertising Agency
1+ years of direct media planning responsibility
Strong presentational and communication skills
Strong digital job advertising knowledge (duration-based *and* performance-based media)
Comfort with data analysis and reporting
Creativity and flexibility as we evolve and grow our advertising offerings
Business development/sales/account management experience
Additional Information
SmartRecruiters has transformed the hiring process by reducing the stress that comes along with attracting, finding, engaging, and hiring new talent. Leading enterprises like IKEA, Visa, Marc Jacobs, and Square have abandoned their outdated Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS), for our all-in-one platform. What once started as a freemium product, has now turned into the world’s fastest growing enterprise solution.
We are a fast growing, series D funded ($50M from Insight) start-up on a mission to IPO. If you're looking to surround yourself with bright and passionate individuals that drive you to be your best - you've found the right place! Our transparent and entrepreneurial environment allows you to feel supported, grow your career, and have fun along the way. Everyone is encouraged to be the CEO of their job. This empowers individuals to own their role and have the confidence to explore and implement new ideas. SmartRecruiters believes in promotion from within, so high performance leads to upward mobility.
SmartRecruiters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

Are you looking to kick-start your sales career within a fast-paced and dynamic technology company? Experlogix is seeking passionate candidates to support our sales and marketing team. As a Business Development Representative, you will uncover sales opportunities through discussions with decision makers at organizations through inbound and outbound efforts. You will determine if an organization is a viable sales opportunity for Experlogix products and then transition that lead to the appropriate sales channel to ensure a continuous pipeline of qualified sales opportunities.
Responsibilities:

Manage lead generation; manage multiple projects or calling campaigns simultaneously.
Follow-up on inbound requests such as web inquiries or information requests from marketing tactics/events.
Initiate outbound cold calls for lead generation.
Initiate contact with prospects identified by sales and marketing and qualify based on BANT (Budget, Authority, Need and Timeframe) criteria.
Educate our prospects and customers on Experlogix and its offerings.
Uncover needs and pain points through qualification process.
Manage leads through the lead life cycle to opportunity creation.
Update CRM daily with accurate and timely information.
Perform basic research and navigate organizations to identify key contacts.
Serve as interlock between sales and marketing.


Required Skills/Qualifications/Experience:

Bachelor’s Degree
Self-motivated, with high energy and engaging level of enthusiasm.
Able to thrive in fast paced, deadline driven environment.
Demonstrated ability to establish rapport and gain the trust of others.
Advanced abilities in data segmentation and reporting within a CRM; Microsoft Dynamics is a plus.
Skilled in problem solving and project management.
Experience developing tracking reports for leads and opportunities and delivering presentations on key results.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint.
Ability to work on a variety of projects at once, with multiple stakeholders.
Ability to work independently & with a team.
Strong writing and verbal communication skills.
Excellent attention to detail and strong organizational skills.

This is a remote position that can be located anywhere in the United States

Because you belong at Twilio

The Who, What, Why and Where

Twilio is growing rapidly and seeking a Product Manager to be a key member of the Financial Systems Enablement team focusing on all Financial applications. This role will collaborate with cross functional business units to understand organizational process and workflow needs, deliver solutions to fulfill those needs. You will drive the strategy and roadmaps for the implementation of major project initiatives, metrics, automation across departments including finance, Accounting, Procurement, Legal, HR and IT dev ops teams. As a successful candidate, you must have a deep background in both Product Management and ERP to deftly identify dependencies and risks, resolve blockers, developing business cases, application maintenance and support and application integrations. You are a self-starter, embody a growth mindset, and can collaborate effectively across the entire Twilio organization.

Who?
Twilio is looking for an exceptional individual who lives Twilio Magic and has a demonstrated track record of delivering complex IT solutions.

5-7 years experience as a Product Manager focusing on ERP in a fast-paced company that delivers software.
Experience driving end-end ERP Oracle cloud (Oracle Fusion) or similar product implementations in providing product direction to meet customer needs.
5+ years experience in leading the delivery of complex 3rd party software implementation projects , Cross functional initiatives and programs across financial disciplines in an Agile environment.
Ability to execute weekly scrums, manage stories and sprints
Possess strong technical acumen–you can communicate effectively with developers and analysts.
Solid communication skills and the ability to clearly articulate your point of view with business stakeholders, leadership team and cross functional teams
Strong preference for someone with prior experience in Accounting, finance, software product management and systems integrations.
An expert ability to cultivate strong working relationships with business partners to understand business processes, process flows, business needs and analyze pain points, and identify viable solutions.
Fluency in performing rigorous system analysis, design and administration of Financial systems.
Experience with the following systems is a plus; ERP (NetSuite,SAP), Coupa, Expensify, Anaplan, ServiceNow, Workday, Salesforce.com, OKTA, GSuite, Looker.
Experience with SOX audit controls and maintaining compliant systems..
Highly entrepreneurial and comfortable working in a fast-paced environment with minimal guidance - be an owner.
Bachelors/Masters degree in Accounting or Computer Science required, or equivalent experience.5+ years of management experience with coaching, mentoring and building and managing high-functioning global teams.

What?
As a Product Manager for the Financial enablement teams, you will live the Twilio Magic and:

BE AN OWNER

Define the long-term strategy & automation for ERP systems.
Own and execute the roadmap for your products–communicate both the business value and the technical rationale behind your product decisions.
You will also work closely managing existing Netsuite project roadmap
Execute the Agile/Scrum process–assist team in planning and execution of sprints, epic and story backlog refinement, and related operating mechanisms. You will work closely with a team of business analysts and Developers

WEAR THE CUSTOMER'S SHOES

Partner with Finance leadership, Accounting, Procurement leaders, and other PMs to ensure they have the right information to engage with the central team and ensure happy customers.
Proactively identify and clearly communicate messages and updates regarding blockers, dependencies, risks, and current status to all stakeholders

RUTHLESSLY PRIORITIZE

Maintain laser focus on MVPs, iterative product development, and releasing immediate/tangible value to stakeholders and adjust frequently.
Manage project plans & prioritization for on-time development and release–ensure the team is working on prioritized projects in the right time with balance of KLO activities and projects

DRAW THE OWL

Identify opportunities for operational improvements across Finance & Accounting business applications and drive solution definition.
Identify necessary reports, metrics, and analysis to measure the effectiveness and validate the success of completed projects.

WRITE IT DOWN

Demonstrate excellent verbal and written communication - ensure that complex ideas, thoughts, and vision can be communicated simply and effectively. You are expected to thrive in a highly collaborative environment.

Why?

The Tech Services team is central to Twilio's continued growth. We work closely with senior leadership and product teams to support company strategy. We lead all aspects of identifying, evaluating, and executing business systems investments that drive inorganic growth and have a significant impact on the overall direction of the company.

Twilio is a company that is empowering the world's developers with modern communication in order to build better applications. Twilio is truly unique; we are a company committed to your growth, your learning, your development, and your entire employee experience. We only win when our employees succeed and we're dedicated to helping you develop your strengths. We have a cultural foundation built on diversity, inclusion, and innovation and we want you and your ideas to thrive at Twilio.

Where?

This position will work remotely. Around the world, Twilio offers benefits and perks to support the physical, financial, and emotional well being of you and your loved ones. No matter where you are based, you will experience a company that believes in small teams for maximum impact; seeks well-rounded talent to ensure a full perspective on our customers' experience, understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint; that continuously and purposefully builds an inclusive culture that empowers everyone to do their best work and be the best version of themselves.

About Us

Millions of developers around the world have used Twilio to unlock the magic of communications to improve any human experience. Twilio has democratized communications channels like voice, text, chat, video and email by virtualizing the world's communications infrastructure through APIs that are simple enough for any developer to use, yet robust enough to power the world's most demanding applications. By making communications a part of every software developer's toolkit, Twilio is enabling innovators across every industry — from emerging leaders to the world's largest organizations — to reinvent how companies engage with their customers.

Company Description
At SmartRecruiters, our mission is to connect people with jobs at scale. That’s why we’ve built our modern Talent Acquisition Platform to help companies hire the best talent and to help people find a job they love!
Our platform is used by hiring teams of Twitter, Visa, Ubisoft, or McDonald’s. We also helped over 50 million candidates through their job search journey.
We understand that working hard means you should play hard too, that’s why we offer a competitive salary, generous equity, and strong career progression opportunities. We enjoy a collaborative environment that spans offices in San Francisco, Berlin, Krakow, Paris, London, and Spokane. This is a casual and pet-friendly place. Enjoy catered meals, snacks, philanthropic activities, and much more. Needless to say, we make sure you’re taken care of.

Job Description
SmartRecruiters is working to build one of the most innovative and successful companies in the world - one that fundamentally changes how recruiting is done. We are looking for a game-changing HRBP (People Partner) who will be a key driver of our company's success. This person will partner with North America-based teams to ensure they are highly engaged and are enabled to deliver high performance in their areas of the business.
As we build our global HRBP (People Partners) team, these are our priorities we want to achieve this year:
We have amazing, skilled, inspiring leaders on all levels; we identify future leaders and support their development from early stages.
Our Smartians love what they do and perform at their best.
High performance is in our DNA and all our key processes aim at achieving that.
We do the basics right, our processes are simple, employee-friendly, well communicated, streamlined and automated
Need more information on the job to decide if this is right for you? No problem. If you decide to join us, you will be the strategic and proactive business partner for our North American teams. As you will be our first HRBP in the US, you will be a one (wo)man show, owner of all HR in NAMER (the sexy-strategic stuff and day-to-day admin tasks). Specifically you will:
Advise our leaders to ensure they have the right teams in place who are inspired, have clear goals, and receive regular feedback
Partner with Smartians (employees) at all levels to find solutions for day-to-day problems
Evangelize and then manage all global people programs in your region.
Build and maintain the company culture as we scale
Ensure we are legally compliant in everything we do
Have a lot of FUN working with great, passionate Smartians

Qualifications
So who is the ideal candidate for our HRBP?
We aren’t a traditional ‘HR’ team and our main priority is ensuring our teams are united, inspired, and empowered to do the best work of their lives. As a business partner, you protect our culture and drive our performance. To do this, you MUST be a ‘Double Q’ person (high EQ and high IQ) who loves to get things done and is thrilled to work for a company who is going to disrupt an entire industry. The ideal candidate will deliver:
Insights and coaching to our leaders to ensure they are running high performing teams
Balance and perspective to our employees to ensure distractions are minimized and we are focused on the right things
Clarity and transparency at all levels to ensure all teams are clear on what we must achieve #asone and how they contribute to our mission
Lightweight programs designed to drive business, not HR outcomes
An inclusive and supportive environment and champion inclusivity across your client group
This will sound super exciting to you if you are:
A person who wants to do the full scope of HR tasks - from strategic thinking and planning to rolling up their sleeves and working on tactical, day-to-day stuff
Someone who likes data and knows employment law across the US (with a deep knowledge of California employment law) but more important, knows how to use it in practice to support business stakeholders
Someone who is upbeat, flexible and excited by fast pace (seriously fast) and not scared by quick decision making (and decision changing) processes.
And you understand how tech start-ups work, have experience in tech start-up and working with a variety of Sales and customer facing roles :)
Does this sound like you? Great, let’s talk.
Additional Information
We are a remote first company and this is a remote role - you can enjoy working from home.
SmartRecruiters has transformed the hiring process by reducing the stress that comes along with attracting, finding, engaging, and hiring new talent. Leading enterprises like IKEA, Visa, Marc Jacobs, and Square have abandoned their outdated Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS), for our all-in-one platform. What once started as a freemium product, has now turned into the world’s fastest growing enterprise solution.
We are a fast growing, series D funded ($50M from Insight) start-up on a mission to IPO. If you're looking to surround yourself with bright and passionate individuals that drive you to be your best - you've found the right place! Our transparent and entrepreneurial environment allows you to feel supported, grow your career, and have fun along the way. Everyone is encouraged to be the CEO of their job. This empowers individuals to own their role and have the confidence to explore and implement new ideas. SmartRecruiters believes in promotion from within, so high performance leads to upward mobility.
SmartRecruiters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

JobTitle: Associate Cybersecurity Counsel - Opportunity to Work Remotely Atlanta, GA
Text:
This role is available to candidates in the US only.
About the Company
VMware accelerates digital transformation through a software-defined approach to business and IT. The trusted platform provider of choice for more than 500,000 customers globally, VMware is the pioneer in virtualization and an innovator in cloud and business mobility. A proven leader, VMware allows customers to run, manage, connect, and secure applications across clouds and devices in a common operating environment.
Our team of 30,000+ people working in 60+ countries worldwide is committed to building a community where great people want to work long term by living our Company EPIC2 values of execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. If you are ready to accelerate, innovate, and lead, join us as we challenge constraints and problem solve for tomorrow.
About the Legal Team
“Fearless legal innovators.” That’s the mantra of VMware’s Legal Team. We’re dedicated to working out creative ways to mitigate legal risks while helping the Company pursue its goals in the global marketplace. We focus on leading with strategic solutions, inspiring an ethical culture, and driving VMware to success. We also reach out to the community by donating hundreds of hours of pro bono support each year. Are you interesting in enriching your career by working on a diverse, award-winning team that goes beyond traditional corporate legal departments? Join our team and you will help provide strategic solutions that impact the success of our business, our customers, and the community.
Job Role & Responsibility
We are seeking an experienced Cybersecurity attorney to join VMware’s Litigation, Employment, Cybersecurity & Regulatory Compliance (LECRC) team. The VMware LECRC team is a global team that focuses on identifying and managing risks, providing practical legal guidance to our clients, and defending the Company against claims anywhere across the globe. Our team practices a collaborative, creative, practical, and results-oriented approach to providing legal advice. If you are looking to join an energetic team where you can be a team builder and a standout colleague, then you have found the place. This position is eligible to be based in Palo Alto, CA, Broomfield, CO, Atlanta, GA, Boston, MA, Austin, TX, Reston, VA, or Bellevue, WA and will report to the Cybersecurity Counsel.
Responsibilities include:
Provide legal guidance to and collaborate with Information Security, Product Security, Privacy, and other business teams as part of security investigations and incident response activities
Review and track security related contractual obligations
Support the Information Security and Product Security teams on cybersecurity and other related legal matters
Coordinate and collaborate with other legal teams, including Privacy, Litigation, Commercial, Employment, and Government Relations on various cybersecurity-related matters
Review and prepare responses to requests from law enforcement or government agencies
Provide practical and strategic advice and counseling to internal clients while balancing risk and business objectives
Build and maintain a positive relationship with internal clients who become involved in cybersecurity-related matters
Collaborate with internal team members and outside counsel to efficiently manage cybersecurity matters and various aspects of outside counsel relationships
Working closely with the Information Security, Privacy, and Government Relations teams, advise the Company about proposed and implemented global cybersecurity laws, regulations, and initiatives
Operate effectively and cost-efficiently, remaining mindful of budget requirements and limitations
Candidate Requirements
J.D. from an accredited law school, strong academic record, and bar admission in at least one U.S. state
2 – 5 years of relevant cybersecurity experience, including with investigations, incident response activities, and law enforcement requests; experience working with or in high tech industry preferred; experience working in government a plus
Must be effective at working with others in a fast-paced environment, with the ability to multi-task and manage a large volume of concurrent projects
Extremely well organized and detail-oriented
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to interface effectively within all levels of the organization and to gain the trust and confidence of colleagues, business leaders, and executives
Excellent legal and business judgment, high standards, and impeccable integrity
Ability to think strategically and to give practical legal advice in the face of ambiguity or uncertainty
Proficient at reducing large amounts of information to a critical few important themes/issues and clearly communicating these to senior management
Creative, practical, entrepreneurial, and pragmatic
Travel may be required from time-to-time

Boomtown and its partner are designing a new program to provide enhanced education and mentorship to undersupported founders looking to explore and support their early ideas. This new initiative offers experienced candidates an opportunity to join a passionate and committed team dedicated to empowering startup founders to develop and sustain their entrepreneurial dreams. Marketing Manager

We are seeking an experienced A-Player to support and lead campaign project management, community outreach activation, social media, email marketing and content development for all marketing initiatives while supporting the Marketing Director. Candidates should be client-focused, self-motivated, organized, digital and project management savvy. We seek a candidate with at least 5 to 7 years’ marketing experience across PR, virtual events, email marketing, social media and project management. A great attitude, solutions-oriented, proactive and performs well in a fast-paced environment.
Job Duties & Responsibilities
Assists with PR projects, media outreach, campaign development and partner promotions
Develop high-quality, on-brand marketing assets like social media graphics, swag, events and experiences

Strong interpersonal skills and desire to support diverse, startup community

Manages marketing teams’ meeting and campaign schedules
Manages occasional website updates; liaise with web/creative team
Assists Marketing Directors and Managing Director with PR/media requests, speaking engagements, etc.
Minimum Qualifications
Marketing, Communications or Public Relations bachelor’s degree preferred
Experience with project management and vendor management
Excellent written and verbal communications skills
Knowledge of WordPress, PowerPoint, Social Media platforms, Hubspot, MuckRack and MONDAY Project Mgmt Tool is preferred
Detail oriented, tech savvy, polished professional with strong work ethic
Diversity, equity and inclusion marketing and community partner outreach experience required
Experience with Startups, Incubators, virtual/physical events and PR is a plus
Graphic design and/or marketing plan development skills a plus
5-7 years of marketing experience preferred

Details:

Monday through Friday, with some evening and weekend hours for event management
Available during business hours, approx. 40 hours per week
Will work remotely with corporate plans to return to office early Fall 2021
Reports to Marketing Director
We Have:

A fun, active, hard working environment and team
Competitive pay, bonus, medical/dental/vision insurance, life insurance and generous time off
Talent for nurturing founders to be their best
Respect for excellence, accountability, doing things right and doing the right thing

You have:

Openness, courage, and a zest for the undefined
Passion for helping founders grow & an understanding of their needs
Independent, creative, persistent and flexible mindset
No problem rolling up your sleeves and doing whatever it takes to get the job done

CollaborateMD is seeking an influential and energetic leader to be the primary point of contact for CollaborateMD users. The Implementation Specialist is responsible for supporting and educating users on the use and functionality of our software application. This role is unscripted - no day is the same - and requires the ability to think critically, demonstrate patience, empathy, sound judgment and balanced decision-making skills.


You:

You are a self-motivated, problem solver who has exceptional customer service and technical skills. You thrive in a fast-paced, high-energy environment and can multi-task like a boss. You’re looking for a career, where you can master your craft in the healthcare-tech industry and deliver phenomenal support to healthcare professionals. If you’re someone with a knack for listening who can identify problem points and create clear and effective solutions, this may be the job for you!


Us:

CollaborateMD, an EverCommerce company, is a leader in Practice Management and Medical Billing Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) with over 1 million patient claims submitted by doctors and billers using our platform each month. Our software helps healthcare entities thrive in an increasingly complex world by offering best-in-class, affordable products that allow them to focus on what matters most - caring for patients.


EverCommerce is bringing together best-of-breed commerce solutions in the service sector, forming one service commerce platform that improves go-to-market strategy for technology companies and simplifies the software-buying process for business owners. Our ecosystem enables companies to thrive in an environment of shared knowledge and resources with significant cost savings.


Where:

CollaborateMD headquarters is located in the heart of Downtown Orlando. Our open floor plan, natural light office space delivers panoramic views of Lake Eola & the Central Business District and is home to high-energy, driven people who like to work hard and play hard. Please note that our teams are working remotely through the rest of 2020 and into 2021, so this role requires reliable internet access and the ability to set up an in-home office.


Core Responsibilities:

Maintain a positive, empathetic and professional attitude toward customers at all times.
Eagerness to quickly achieve a high level of understanding of the software and configuration options, and be able to communicate the value of these features to users.
Document and manage customer interactions in our Salesforce CRM.
Stay up-to-date with the healthcare industry to be a source of reliable knowledge and education for customers and the company.
Relies on instructions and pre-established guidelines to plan and accomplish goals.
Demonstrates limited expertise in a variety of the field's concepts, practices, and procedures.
Supports and helps define the strategic goals and objectives of the department and organization.
Supports all aspects of department policies, objectives, and initiatives.
Supports the development of the organization to ensure future growth.
Asks open-ended and probing questions, use active listening skills to determine the nature and severity of customer's needs.
Development of material, schedules events, obtains instructional material, and ensures customers and business partners are kept abreast of our functionality and capabilities.
Educates and empowers customers by facilitating them with training and support tools.
Assists customers on software usage and how-to questions.
Ability to prioritize and manage work queue requiring excellent time-management skills in order to meet both individual and department level goals and objectives.
Ensures customer's expectations regarding installation, on-boarding, training, support and follow-up are maintained to a level that meets or exceeds customer's expectations.
Identifies areas for process improvements and provides recommendations.
Uses creativity and innovation to drive continuous improvements.
Recognizes trends and takes actions to resolve root cause.
Understands and follows HIPAA e/PHI guidelines and regulations.
Projects positive image/attitude as part of daily approach to work.
Applies a variety of concepts, practices and procedures within Customer Relationship Experience Management, Practice Management, Medical Billing, and EHR/EMR solutions.
Complies with all established policies and procedures.


Must Haves:

 2+ years of customer service experience in healthcare software.
Basic understanding of the healthcare industry (HIPAA, PHI, EDI, CMS, etc).
Flexible availability between the hours of 8:00 AM - 8:00 PM (EDT).
Passionate about delivering world-class customer experience in a friendly, patient and professional demeanor.
Knowledge of Salesforce or other CRMs, MS Office and Google Business Apps.
Remain cool under pressure and have a can-do attitude. Things can get pretty hectic at times, so we want to make sure you keep calm and carry on through even the most stressful circumstances.
Extremely strong attention to detail, yet able to explain complex concepts in simple, friendly terms.
Able to juggle many technical and administrative tasks (multi-task), all with a sense of urgency (prioritization), simultaneously and accurately (time-management).
Be organized, ahead of schedule, communicative, and accountable. In short, own your role entirely, while being open to suggestions and new ideas.
Vibe with our culture. Ability to speak out, take initiative, and challenge the status quo, while also being a true team player. We’re talking energy, integrity, positivity, a hunger for knowledge, and a passion for sharing it.
Nice to Haves:

Knowledge of medical billing, Revenue Cycle Management and/or clinical workflow.
Familiarity with EHR/EMR systems, patient services, and our health insurance system.
Experience using CollaborateMD application!


Benefits and Perks:

Competitive salary
Robust medical benefits & 401k with match
Public Transportation reimbursement
Gym stipend
Start with 17 days of PTO, 8 standard holidays, and 2 floating holidays
Casual dress code
Company sponsored happy hours, picnics, events, and celebrations


EverCommerce is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We look forward to reviewing your credentials and getting to know more about your experience!

What You Will Do In Your Role

The Experience You Will Bring

Experience collaborating and communicating across different users, stakeholders, teams, and businesses

What Will Put You Ahead

JobTitle: Patient Connection Assoc IV - Full-Time - Days - REMOTE
Text:
Responsible for serving as front-line support for the Patient Connection Center within Piedmont Healthcare. The Patient Connection Associate IV is responsible for scheduling complex, and specialized procedures (i.e. Surgery, IR, Recurring services) and coordinating multiple resources for patient services.
MINIMUM EDUCATION REQUIRED:
High school diploma or GED
MINIMUM EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:
At least three (3) years of related customer facing healthcare experience with at least one year scheduling or preregistering patients
MINIMUM LICENSURE/CERTIFICATION REQUIRED BY LAW:
N/A
ADDITIONAL PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Two (2) years of experience demonstrating proficiency in scheduling OR preregistering patients within basic services preferred.

Requirements
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
1. Responsible for pre-registering and scheduling complex and specialized procedures and coordinating multiple resources for patient services.
2. Identify patient medical record utilizing Piedmont’s process/policy
3. Support an exceptional experience through all customer interactions by connecting caller needs with organizational resources, utilizing information from various applications.
4. Operate and utilize the Scheduler Program in the hospital computer system
5. Respond to correspondence regarding scheduling changes/cancellations both written and oral in a timely, accurate manner.
6. Assess and prioritize requests to include communicating accurate, pertinent information to external and internal customers.
7. Preregister patient encounters by obtaining patient demographic and financial information for clinic, hospital and outpatient departments.
8. Support a prospective payment program by communicating organizational policies, providing estimates, financial options, explaining insurance coverage/non-coverage, communicating and collecting patient liability/co-pay.
9. Reviews orders to ensure completeness prior to scheduling. Prepares for the patient visit by verifying patient insurance, confirming benefits, reviewing medical necessity, and creating patient liability estimates. Communicates expected patient liability and collects.
10. Reviews medical necessity and creates patient liability estimates.
11. Calculates and determines financial responsibility for patients including deductibles, co-payments, and amounts covered for requested services.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES:
Ability to maintain composure in stressful situations while working with the public and internal customers.
Demonstrated competence in written and oral communications.
A demonstrated ability to use PC based office productivity tools (e.g. Microsoft Outlook, Microsoft Excel) as necessary; general computer skills necessary to work effectively in an office environment
Strong attention to detail and accuracy required.
Demonstrated skill in effectively managing multiple priorities.
Skill in self-direction and processing new information.
Translation and comprehension skills required to read medical orders.
Demonstrated phone skills required to triage incoming calls and ability to take clear, concise, and accurate information.
Ability to process new information with minimum supervision
Ability to communicate in writing, in a concise and informative manner using appropriate language
Ability to utilize effective verbal communication and interpersonal skills
Ability to meet specific quality, service and productivity measures
Disclaimer
The above information is intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this job. It is not intended to be an exhaustive list of responsibilities, duties and skills required of personnel so classified.

Delivery Manager
Company
CodeScience, Inc. is a professional services firm that enables organizations to deploy enterprise business processes into the cloud. The firm’s core offering is designing and building products for Salesforce ISV partners. The company also provides a range of services to Salesforce customers and on other SaaS platforms.
Position
Delivery Managers are a key member of the portfolio team, they build strong partnerships and drive alignment with Executive Sponsors and senior stakeholders of client engagements of all sizes. A master at handling shifting priorities and comfortable managing ambiguity, the DM will leverage a high degree of emotional intelligence to develop a deep understanding of a client’s motivations and goals, and use that knowledge to empower C|S teams to deliver exceptional business value.
The Delivery Manager acts as the escalation point and helps mitigate risk for the project team, the client, and CodeScience. Additionally, they help ensure the C|S Project Team has what it needs to execute a successful engagement with quality. The DM also provides insight around the account from a portfolio perspective, particularly around risks and opportunities.
Success Predictors

You are able to synthesize project status/risks/opportunities in order to communicate actionable information and tradeoffs to senior leadership

You have been around the block a few times and are able to assist with scoping new work and reviewing SOWs to ensure that delivery teams are set up for success

You are a trusted advisor to clients on SFDC partnership issues, escalating internally for additional support as needed.

You wake up in the morning thinking about how to make software teams work better.

You love the agile manifesto and enjoy helping project teams achieve their goals with efficiency, quality, and integrity.

You believe in building relationships early before things get challenging.

You understand the slings and arrows, as well as the glories, of professional services consulting. And you still want to apply for this job.

You are the voice of positive outcomes, especially when challenges arise; help project leaders (PO/PM/TA) identify paths forward; ask the right questions to help teams pivot when needed

You have an eagle eye and spot risks quickly and drive towards mitigation

You believe passionately that done is better than perfect.

You've worked at one of our bigger competitors and are ready to go where work quality and employee happiness reign over the profit-at-any-cost paradigm.

When someone at a party asks what you do, you’d rather say “I make teams successful” than “I’m in software.”

Duties & Responsibilities

Monitor overall quality of project execution and deliverables and work closely with people managers to help mitigate with course correction and support

Identify key client contacts and their role in the organization to help support potential escalations and opportunities quickly; lay the foundation for the support needed in the event of challenges (Build relationships early, before things get challenging.)

Be the voice of positive outcomes, especially when challenges arise; help project leaders (PO/PM/TA) identify paths forward; ask the right questions to help teams pivot when needed

Support our clients to achieve desired business outcomes

Field resource requests from the project team, address skill gaps

Risk management- spot risks quickly and drive towards mitigation

Synthesize project status/risks/opportunities to communicate actionable information and tradeoffs to senior leadership

Partner with the sales and other services teams to scope new opportunities and plan delivery

Assist with scoping new work and reviewing SOWs to ensure that delivery teams are set up for success with appropriate team mix, deliverables, scope and budget; ensure that assumptions are articulated appropriately in consultation with Sales

Advise clients on SFDC partnership issues, escalate internally for additional support as needed.

Look for opportunities for ISV education, Product GTM Strategy and engage the appropriate SMEs to support (Product Practice Area, Strategic Alliances to CEO)

Conduct Periodic checkpoint with project PO/PM to discuss challenges, risks, escalations, planning/next steps

For large engagements, periodic check-ins with client Executive Sponsor to ensure client satisfaction, alignment on scope and schedule, future-looking strategy

Portfolio Alignment - Bring Sales, Delivery Managers, and Comm Svcs together to align around current state of portfolio, discuss open items and prepare for Executive review

Deal Summary Update - Update the executives with a summary of blockers and key decisions between Sales, Comm Svcs and Delivery Mgrs; Outcome is digestible and actionable discussion on portfolio

Manage and mentor internal and external team members to best leverage their skills.

Experience
Required

College degree - better yet, you left college because it was slowing you down

5+ years of software development or implementation experience

5+ years of experience as a Project Manager, Business Analyst, or equivalent role developing or implementing business software

5+ years of professional services consulting experience

Familiarity with the Salesforce platform

Experience and success leading truly Agile development teams.

Experience and success leading truly Waterfall development teams. (ugh, I know)

Comfortable working with and managing remote teams spread across multiple time zones.

Familiar with agile process management tools such as JIRA, Zenhub, Pivotal Tracker, Trello, Rally, etc.

Possesses technical aptitude and ability to understand high-level technical principles such as SSO and API integrations.

Ability to successfully deliver multiple complex projects simultaneously by trusting your team members and staying at the appropriate level of detail.

Preferred

Agile ScrumMaster certification or equivalent experience

Experience as a Product Owner, Business Analyst, or Quality Assurance specialist

Completed and can describe Salesforce platform product implementations

Salesforce development or consultant certification(s) or equivalent experience

Completed and can describe successful implementations of SaaS applications
To apply, visit www.codescience.com/careers or email your resume with cover letter to recruiting @codescience.com
Your information is confidential and will be held in complete privacy
CodeScience is an Equal Opportunity Employer

This is a remote position.

Company Overview:

Mitchell, Genex and Coventry
With Mitchell, Genex and Coventry now one organization, we’ve dramatically expanded our ability to deliver innovative services and technologies to our customers. We’ve also seen career opportunities within our combined organization grow. Each part of our organization helps people recover after a challenging event in their lives.
Mitchell delivers trusted software and services to the property & casualty claims, collision repair and risk management industries with technology-enabled solutions that simplify claims handling, repair processes and pharmacy transactions. Genex helps injured workers return to their jobs in a safe and efficient manner through compassionate case management, reducing health care costs and disability expenses for our customers. Coventry offers the nation’s largest and most diverse set of provider and ancillary networks focused on improving total overall outcomes.
Together, we bring a complete set of proven capabilities for our partners who require more than one-dimensional solutions. We combine innovative technology, insightful analytics and deep expertise to help them reach their ultimate goal—restoring lives.
Job Description:

*This is a full-time, remote position with regular local travel required in the Atlanta, Georgia area.*
In addition to salary and benefits, we also offer our Field Case Managers: paid travel time, mileage reimbursement and monthly phone and internet reimbursement.
The Field Case Manager is responsible for assessment, planning, coordination, implementation and evaluation of injured/disabled individuals involved in the medical case management process. Working as an intermediary between carriers, attorneys, medical care providers, employers and employees, you will closely monitor the progress of the injured worker and report results back to the employer and insurance carrier. This will ensure appropriate and cost-effective healthcare services leading to a medically rehabilitated individual who is ready to return to an optimal level of work and functioning.
Job Description
Uses clinical skills to help coordinate the individual’s treatment program while maximizing cost containment.
Serves as an intermediary to interpret and educate the individual on his/her disability, and the treatment plan established by the case manager, physicians, and therapists.
Facilitates treatment between providers and worker.
Partners with employers determining modified work.
Provides accurate and quality documentation meeting Best Practices timeframes.
Reports billing hours in accordance with case activity and billing practices.
Follows specific account instructions.
Demonstrates a level of professionalism within the work place and in dealing with injured workers
Qualifications:

*Candidate will work remotely, but must be in/near the Atlanta, GA area.*
*Requires DSL, fiber or cable internet connection from home. 1 mbps preferred or better.*
Licenses or Certifications: Current, unencumbered Registered Nurse license in the resident state required; CCM, COHN, CRRN, CVE
Minimum of two years clinical experience in a hospital setting
Worker’s compensation or disability management experience is highly desired, but not required
Previous field case management experience is preferred but not required
Requires excellent time management and organizational skills.
Spanish speaking a plus
Must have reliable transportation
Knowledge of basic computer skills including Excel, Word, and Outlook Email Must have local unencumbered driver’s license
Written Abilities: Proficient grammar, sentence structure and written communication skills are required.
Mitchell International, an equal opportunity employer, values the diversity of our workforce and the knowledge of our people. Mitchell will not discriminate against an applicant or employee on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, sex/gender, age, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local law.

Location: 100% remote working role (you can work from anywhere in the world)Salary:  NegotiableHours:  Flexibility of working hours, according to your rhythm (no more than 160 per month)We are currently looking to welcome to our Team an experienced and skilled Customer Happiness Specialist in order to take the company to the next level.We at Vimerson Health are creating the model for the companies of the future. We are a 100% remote and happiness-led company that encourages self-empowerment and radical transparency. We put happiness, fulfillment, joy, peace, and harmony before everything. And we have the double advantage of helping people with our natural Dietary Health Supplements.In just 5 years from our inception, we at Vimerson Health have sold more than 3 million bottles of our supplements and continue to grow and expand. Our Culture prioritizes team members’ happiness over everything else (yes, even over sales and profit). We recognize that it’s impossible to do two things at the same time, so having to put things in order of priority we decided that our Team Members’ happiness and fulfillment are First, our Customers’ Happiness and fulfillment are Second, and revenue and profit are Third.We are self-funded therefore we have the freedom to make these decisions. We do not respond to a board of directors whose tendency is to focus on the short-term monetary goal. We have no rigid hours and boast our very own dedicated in-house Happiness Coach. At Vimerson we are creating a company, not for the next 10 years, but for the next 10 generations. We endeavor with an infinite mindset, one day at a time.Your Mission: As a valued member of the Customer Happiness Team, you don’t just LOVE Customer Service, you LIVE it. You enjoy helping people and thrive on going above and beyond to ensure people’s comfort, happiness, inner-fulfillment, peace, and joy. You have initiative, are adventurous, and have faith in your abilities to truly help people and make them happy. You are patient, empathetic and an attentive listener. You work hard and smart, are dedicated, and can meet multiple goals within deadlines. Most importantly you put happiness and fulfillment first, proactively seeking your ideal life/work harmony.As our Customer Happiness Specialist, you will: Uphold Vimerson’s core values of leading with customer happiness;Provide excellent customer service to our customers through chat, email, and phone calls with friendly, upbeat, and genuine responses;Evaluate customer inquiries promptly, identify questions or concerns and provide the best possible solution efficiently;Assess customers needs or desires and provide personalized supplement recommendations;Collaborate with other departments serving as an internal representative and advocate for customer needs;Be motivated to meet or exceed key performance targets, both personally and as a teamFollow team communication procedures, policies, and guidelines;Perform each duty above with our customers’ happiness as your number one priority;Requirements: Have at least 1 year of relevant customer service experience;Have excellent communication skills, both verbal and written;Have the technological aptitude to manage online/telephone communication software (Intercom and Cloudtalk) along with spreadsheets and documents;Have previous experience working in a team-oriented and collaborative environment;Have self-motivation for learning;Have the ability to thrive in high-pressure situations;Are motivated, energetic, driven, and have an impeccable work ethic;Have excellent time management skills;Are amenable to 24/7 shifting schedule;Have full English language proficiency;We Offer: Working in a company that prides itself on our employees working as One Team, regardless of the department you work in. We all have the same goal (to be part of an amazing start-up company that is rapidly growing). You will be part of a supportive and friendly company with excellent team spirit;A full-time remote job which means the FREEDOM of working from any place in the world;Flexibility of working hours (work according to your rhythm);Great possibilities for personal and professional growth in a company that achieved amazing results in the E-Commerce world in just 5 years, and it's looking to keep growing and developing;A dedicated Happiness Coach;VimerDays: 20 accumulated paid days off per calendar year;Anniversary Gift;Birthday Gift;VimerTrips: One trip a year to meet the colleagues we work with and get to know each other in person;An unlimited supply of Vimerson Health Supplements, for your own personal consumption;Charity Match: The company will match any donations that you personally make to your charity of heart. We want to support each Team Member’s cause to make the world a better place;If you feel like you are the PERFECT FIT then send us an English version of your CV.Application Deadline: 04/03/2021Job Types: Full-time, ContractSalary: Up to $10.00 per hourBenefits:Employee discountPaid time offParental leaveSchedule:8 hour shiftApplication Question:Can you provide an example of a time you went above and beyond to provide exceptional service to a customer?Contract Renewal:LikelyWork Location:Fully RemoteCommunication method(s) used:EmailPhoneChatJob Duties:Answer incoming customer inquiriesCollaborate with management teams to stay updated on new products, services, and policiesRecord customer information within our customer service databaseEngage with clients in a friendly and professional manner while actively listening to their concernsOffer support and solutions to customers in accordance with the company's customer service policiesOther duties as requestedThis Job Is:Open to applicants who do not have a college diplomaBenefit Conditions:Only full-time employees eligibleWork Remotely:YesCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processVirtual meetings

Communications Intern (Part-Time)

At Skillsoft, we are all about making work matter. We believe every team member has the potential to be AMAZING. We are bold, sharp, driven and most of all, real. Join us in our quest to democratize learning and help individuals unleash their edge.

OVERVIEW:

Skillsoft is looking for a part-time intern to help elevate the newly refreshed Skillsoft and SumTotal brands. In this role, you will work closely with the internal Corporate Communications team to measure the success of the global Communications program and promote the organization’s news, media coverage, and award wins. The ideal candidate is passionate about gaining new marketing skills and experiences, a strong writer, and able to quickly adjust and balance multiple priorities.
Uncertain times require new skills, and as a result, virtual learning has never been more relevant to an organization’s success. With your help, we will increase awareness for Skillsoft’s journey to build future-fit, agile, and resilient workforces around the world.
OPPORTUNITY HIGHLIGHTS:

Play a leading role in managing and maintaining Skillsoft’s podcast, The Edge.
Join Agile marketing teams focused on supporting key areas of the business.
Contribute to Skillsoft’s Achieving Our Greatness blog sharing the journey of Skillsoft interns.
Write internal and external communications notifying stakeholders about company news.
Maintain media coverage, award wins, speaking opportunities, and press releases on the website.
Develop social media content promoting content developed by Corporate Communications.
Manage speaking/awards calendars and maintain award decks.
Complete weekly reporting deliverables.

SUCCESS QUALITIES:
Adaptable and Agile. We reward risk taking.

Confident & Audacious Achiever. We commit to be the brand.

Entrepreneurial Spirit with Learner’s Mindset. We stay curious.
Committed to our Collective Purpose. We unleash our edge together.

Authentic & Customer Centric. We get real.


MORE ABOUT SKILLSOFT:

Skillsoft delivers online learning, training, and talent solutions to help organizations unleash their edge. Leveraging immersive, engaging content, Skillsoft enables organizations to unlock the potential in their best assets – their people – and build teams with the skills they need for success. Empowering 36 million learners and counting, Skillsoft democratizes learning through an intelligent learning experience and a customized, learner-centric approach to skills development with resources for Leadership Development, Business Skills, Technology & Development, Digital Transformation, and Compliance.
Skillsoft and SumTotal are partners to thousands of leading global organizations, including many Fortune 500 companies. The company features three award-winning systems that support learning, performance and success: Skillsoft learning content, the Percipio intelligent learning experience platform, and the SumTotal suite for Talent Development, which offers measurable impact across the entire employee lifecycle. Learn more at www.skillsoft.com.


Thank you for taking the time to learn more about us.

If this opportunity intrigues you, we would love for you to apply!

NOTE TO EMPLOYMENT AGENCIES: We value the partnerships we have built with our preferred vendors. Skillsoft does not accept unsolicited resumes from employment agencies. All resumes submitted by employment agencies directly to any Skillsoft employee or hiring manager in any form without a signed Skillsoft Employment Agency Agreement on file and search engagement for that position will be deemed unsolicited in nature. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is subsequently hired as a result of the referral or through other means.

Reveleer is a fast-growing technology-enabled services company that powers performance/quality measurement and risk adjustment solutions in healthcare.
