JobTitle: Group Product Manager - Tanzu Mission Control - Opportunity for Working Remotely Atlanta, GA
Text:
The Elevator Pitch: Why will you enjoy this new opportunity?
The Tanzu Mission Control team at VMware is seeking a Group Product Line Manager to lead a team of product managers to define product strategy and advance our mission to make Kubernetes accessible to any enterprise. The Tanzu Mission Control team is focused on helping customers more easily manage Kubernetes and operate modern, containerized applications across multiple clouds and clusters. You will play a pivotal role leading a team to define compelling and competitively differentiated capabilities, communicate our roadmap to internal and external stakeholders, understand our customers deeply, and collaborate with marketing and sales to bring Tanzu Mission Control to market. The team is a fast-paced, startup-like environment where you will have the opportunity to build a new business from the ground up while developing skills in cutting-edge technologies.

What is the primary need, technical challenge, and/or problem you will be responsible for?
Tanzu Mission Control is a critical element of the VMware Tanzu portfolio. Leading a group of product managers, you'll be responsible for driving the vision, strategy, and day to day execution of Tanzu Mission Control’s cluster management capabilities. Together with your team you will be identifying and addressing the needs of operations teams as they embrace Kubernetes and build cloud-native applications based on modern architectures, and operate at scale across distributed infrastructure.
Success in the Role: What are the performance goals over the first 6-12 months you will work toward completing?
You’ll be responsible for delivering best in class Kubernetes cluster management capabilities that are highly integrated into the Tanzu portfolio.
You will be building a highly functional and self-sufficient team of product managers across time zones and countries (including US and India).
You’ll launch Kubernetes management capabilities that enable our customers to manage workloads consistently across 10s of thousands of clusters in on-premises and public cloud domains.
What type of work will you be doing? What assignments, requirements, or skills will you be performing on a regular basis?
You will be hiring and managing a distributed group of PMs, defining the group’s objectives and key results. You will be providing mentorship and guidance helping them be successful.
You will collaborate with other Tanzu teams to plan and deliver integrated experiences across the portfolio. An ability to navigate complex decision making and effectively communicate across teams will be critical to success.
You will own the short- and long-term strategy for cluster management in Tanzu Mission Control based on a deep understanding of customer needs, market trends, and competition. Experience defining and prioritizing product features in a complex technical context will serve you well.
You will lead the product line through various stages from inception to launch to continuous improvement.
You will partner with engineering to drive successful product releases. You will be engineering’s connection to our customers and will be responsible for bringing them along for the ride.
You will engage frequently with customers to learn about their needs, and support the sales channel and key customers in a pre- and post-sales capacity.
You’ll create solutions that scale to meet the needs of the world’s biggest enterprises.
What is leadership like for this role? What is the structure and culture of the team like?
The hiring manager for this role is Eryn Muetzel, Director of Product Management leading the Tanzu Mission Control product team. Eryn joined VMware as part of the Heptio acquisition in 2018. The Tanzu Mission Control product management team is made up of individuals with diverse backgrounds who are excited about delivering a new SaaS offering to enable Tanzu’s largest customers to build, run, and manage modern applications.

What are the benefits and perks of working at VMware?
You and your loved ones will be supported with a competitive and comprehensive benefits package. Below are some highlights, or you can view the complete benefits package by visiting www.benefits.vmware.com.
Employee Stock Purchase Plan
Medical Coverage, Retirement, and Parental Leave Plans for All Family Types
Generous Time Off Programs
40 hours of paid time to volunteer in your community
Rethink's Neurodiversity program to support parents raising children with learning or behavior challenges, or developmental disabilities
Financial contributions to your ongoing development (conference participation, trainings, course work, etc.)
#TeamTanzu

JobTitle: Global Technical Account Manager, Multinational Commerce REMOTE
Text:
Guides and undertakes business development efforts of prospective clients and distribution channels partners. Plans, identifies, and executes due diligence and implementation of strategic business development objectives. Researches, evaluates, and manages new strategic business opportunities, entry into niche or new geographic markets, new business platforms, major segment initiatives, and key partnerships and alliances pursuant to the mid- to long-range strategic plans of the segment and enterprise. Coordinates with Corporate Strategy & Development team in mergers, acquisitions, and/or joint ventures. Establishes policy and strategy implementation. Manages financial feasibility studies to include market analysis, monitoring of competitive activity, and identifying customer needs. Assists with special studies or key projects in areas such as operational effectiveness, capacity utilization, cost containment, etc. as required.
What Part Will You Play?
Identifies, negotiates and secures new business relationships with non-traditional prospects with new ideas for new product solutions to create and new business opportunities.
Champions work with product managers, sales, clients, relationship management teams, consultants, and internal and external partners to help define growth strategies, product marketing positioning objectives, pricing strategies, partnerships, communications, industry events, and/or strategies for products and services.
Coordinates qualified opportunities with various internal teams for product design and detailed solution analysis. Evaluates new ideas to determine technical feasibility, possible deployment options, potential implementation costs and/or high level effort estimates and market potential.
Assists Strategic Marketing in the market assessment and market analysis process to determine target market and client reaction to new solution concepts which are consistent with the organization's long range and strategic plans. Identifies and investigates emerging market and niche opportunities. Oversees market analysis, monitors competitive activity, and identifies needs relative to organization's capabilities and alignment. Provides recommendations (i.e., go/no go, buy, build or partner) to executive management for the delivery of new solution ideas based on the potential return on investment.
Directs commercial and contractual negotiations to secure a profitable financial return on the investment and on the resources deployed into the sign up and the implementation of new clients and new business. Conducts full due diligence throughout the whole negotiation phase leading into contract stage.
Provides the oversight and coordinates with other teams across the sales process including qualifying opportunities against established criteria, developing terms sheets, coordinating solution design, formulating RFP/RFI responses, structuring pricing, and guiding legal/ commercial negotiations.
Monitors revenue generation in order to secure delivery of financial objectives established in the annual budget. Secures invoicing and revenue recognition.
Identifies, negotiates and secures potential business partnerships in order to enhance products and services to new customers with the objective to offer latest technology and innovation in the electronic payments area.
Provides industry knowledge, market understanding and strategic product management expertise to identify market trends and innovation needs that align to the ongoing strategic marketing plan for the business. Delivers industry thought leadership by authoring white papers, case studies and industry publication articles while regularly speaking at financial services industry events, trade shows and client conferences.
What Are We Looking For in This Role?
Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree
Relevant Experience or Degree in: Computer Science or equivalent field from an accredited university is required; however, relevant experience in lieu of a degree may be considered.
Typically Minimum 10+ Years Relevant Exp
Experience in technology and a good grasp of financial services technology preferably across all phases of the B2B product lifecycle within the Payments space.
Strong understanding of the fintech environment and of the emerging players entering the payments space (Google, Facebook, Apple, etc.)
Prior sales, business development or M&A experience is valuable.
Any start-up, executive management or P&L management would be additive.
Understanding of sales management and reporting, ability to drive reviews of sales activity across a broad stakeholder group. Experience driving management reporting and dashboards for consumption at a senior leadership level.
Preferred Qualifications
Master's Degree typically, related field of study from an accredited university.
Typically Minimum 12+ Years Relevant Exp

About Guaranteed Rate:
Guaranteed Rate is the 5th largest retail mortgage lender in the U.S. By offering industry-leading tools, low-rate mortgages and unparalleled customer service, we’ve become the Home Purchase Experts®. At Guaranteed Rate, we think big—pushing beyond what most people believe is possible. We strive to work with the best of the best, building business with the best referral partners and hiring the best employees—allowing us to deliver world-class customer service. Our goal is to make sure every customer has a great experience. Headquartered in Chicago with 5,000+ employees in 300+ offices across the U.S. and licensed in all 50 states, we’ve helped thousands of homeowners with more than $37 billion in home purchase loans and refinances in just the past year alone.

We are currently seeking a hard-working, dedicated Jumbo Underwriter to join our innovative and passionate team.

Responsibilities:
Remote

As an Underwriter you will be responsible for but not limited to the underwriting of residential loans ensuring compliance with appropriate company and investor standards

A Mortgage Underwriter will be responsible for examining loan documentations for accuracy and completeness while working with loan originator or production staff to secure all required documents

Mortgage Underwriters may be involved in one or several types of mortgage lending (conventional, government-backed, etc.)

You may be required to work with more senior mortgage underwriters on loan exceptions having the authority to withdraw and decline loans

You may also be required to respond directly to individual and investor audits

Includes all levels of underwriting authority and exception levels

Qualifications:
MUST HAVE JUMBO UNDERWRITING EXPERIENCE

5+ years of mortgage underwriting experience

5+ years of FHA/VA, Conventional, and USD/RD underwriting experience

Experience with underwriting to multiple lender guidelines and requirements

Knowledge of Fannie Mae/DU and Freddie Mac guidelines and automated underwriting systems

Critically examine credit, income and asset documents and review title policy and appraisals

Guaranteed Rate is an Equal Opportunity Employer that welcomes and encourages all applicants to apply regardless of age, race, sex, religion, color, national origin, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital or parental status, ancestry, citizenship status, pregnancy or other reason protected by law.

Passionate about working with kids? Perhaps you worked at a school or daycare setting and are ready to explore a new career in 2021 where you can continue working with children but call the shots? Or, maybe you’re simply looking for a more fulfilling career that allows you more flexibility, balance between work and family, great income and to help your community during these times?If that sounds like you, we would love to hear from you. Families in your community are looking for small-group child care for their kids. With MyVillage, you start your own in-home child care or preschool program and become the early childhood entrepreneur you've always wanted to become, with support from expert mentors at every step.About MyVillage: MyVillage, started by two women entrepreneurs, is on a mission to harness the power of community to create exceptional care for every child by supporting local educators to provide outstanding education in nurturing homes and get on the path to successful entrepreneurship themselves. MyVillage has also been recently featured in publications such Forbes, Fast Company, and Time, to name a few.Enroll in MyVillage to: Reserve and kick off your orientation, all online and with a class of peers, where you’ll build a step-by-step plan to start the in-home child care program of your dreams.After completing your orientation, take the time you need to bring your plan to life. Description
Job Description:
The Leidos Health Group is seeking Public Health Analysts, contingent upon contract award, in Atlanta, GA.

Primary Responsibilities
This program will fulfill the requirement for a self-motivated and detail-oriented public health analyst to provide effective and innovative data science solutions for the CDC COVID-19 pandemic response.
To produce ad hoc analyses of data, analyses to support programmatic activities, and to provide expertise in managing and analyzing large and/or complex datasets.
This project requires strong epidemiological, statistical, data management and SAS or R programming expertise.

This task requires
1) understanding and application of general statistical approaches including bivariate analysis, logistic regression modeling
2) strong SAS or R programming skills
3) orderly management of microcomputer files in a Windows environment to develop databases
4) importing, exporting, and manipulating data files (SAS, R), including recoding, transforming, and creating variables to accommodate analytic needs
5) provide training and end-user support for tools and technologies being utilized by CDC
6) performing other analytical and data related duties, as needed.

Basic Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree in Epidemiology, Statistics, Biostatistics, or Math and 3 years of experience or MS, MPH, MSPH and 1 year of experience.

Preferred Qualifications
Experience with statistical data analysis and use of data analysis tools (e.g. SAS, R, STATA, EpiInfo, RedCap, SQL)
Previous experience working with Electronic Health Records, Laboratory Data, Bioinformatics, HL7, and/or public health communications.
Previous working experience at CDC, state/local other public health jurisdictions, or other organizations with a public health mission.

Requires ability to obtain Public Trust Security Clearance.
External Referral Bonus:
Ineligible
Potential for Telework:
Yes, 50%
Clearance Level Required:
Public Trust
Travel:
No
Scheduled Weekly Hours:
40
Shift:
Day
Requisition Category:
Professional
Job Family:
Statistician
Pay Range:
Leidos is a Fortune 500® information technology, engineering, and science solutions and services leader working to solve the world’s toughest challenges in the defense, intelligence, homeland security, civil, and health markets. The company’s 38,000 employees support vital missions for government and commercial customers. Headquartered in Reston, Va., Leidos reported annual revenues of approximately $11.09 billion for the fiscal year ended January 3, 2020. For more information, visit www.Leidos.com.
Pay and benefits are fundamental to any career decision. That's why we craft compensation packages that reflect the importance of the work we do for our customers. Employment benefits include competitive compensation, Health and Wellness programs, Income Protection, Paid Leave and Retirement. More details are available here.
Leidos will never ask you to provide payment-related information at any part of the employment application process. And Leidos will communicate with you only through emails that are sent from a Leidos.com email address. If you receive an email purporting to be from Leidos that asks for payment-related information or any other personal information, please report the email to spam.leidos@leidos.com.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, ethnicity, age, national origin, citizenship, religion, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, pregnancy, family structure, marital status, ancestry, domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran or military status, or any other basis prohibited by law. Leidos will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories consistent with relevant laws.

Seeking an awesome candidate to fill our exciting Virtual Sales position! Work from home and make excellent commissions! --No fee ever required to work with us!*Are you incredible on the phone? Are you seeking a meaningful career where you can work from home? If yes, then read on!**Our 30-year-old company is expanding due to our growing nationwide success. We deal primarily in advertising - with our focus on small demographic areas, where most of our clients know each other and support one another in the community. What we offer further lends to this small town community feel.**As our company grows, we see our Virtual Sales Department expanding - and that’s where you come in. Your role - from your home office, would be to call on small businesses - many who already know us, as well as establishing new accounts. You would be explaining to these business owners how their advertising dollar can expand and expose their business and brand for just pennies on the dollar. Passion and ability to see "the vision" is a must...and clearly, B2B cold calling experience is required for this position. Your skills will be nicely rewarded by our compensation plan - a generous commission-only structure that reflects effort as well as your phone sales ability.**Note - This position allows for potential advancement into management.**Responsibilities: * Maintain existing accounts, develop new accounts, and “resurrect” old accounts* Meet reasonably set weekly sales goals* Organize your pipeline so that you can effectively manage all of your accounts* Attention to detail to company policies and procedures - accuracy is a must!* Establish rapport and maintain strong business relationships with your clients* Determine the needs of the client, and successfully match them to our products* Close sales quickly and effectively with professionalism and an ethical manner* Be capable of working independently with optimal performanceQualifications: * 2+ years of B2B Cold Calling experience* 1+ years of Work at Home experience* High School Diploma or EquivalentBonus extras: * Advertising or print experience* If you are known to consistently meet or exceed your goals* You have experience in a Call Center/Sales oriented environment* You have some CRM skills* You know how to generate leads* You have experience with business developmentPersonal Characteristics: * Incredible phone skills with written ability to match* Excellent listening and problem-solving skills* Ability to manage time effectively* Good under pressure with your focus on success* Honest work ethicIf this position sounds exciting to you, then send us your resume along with a cover letter introducing yourself. We’d love to hear from you!*Job Types: Full-time, Part-timePay: $200.00 - $1,000.00 per weekExperience:Call Center: 1 year (Preferred)Application Question:Please describe in 1-2 sentences how your previous experience uniquely qualifies you for this position?

JobTitle: Talent Scout - Contract Opportunity - Opportunity for Working Remotely Atlanta, GA
Text:
Talent Scout - Contract Opportunity
Business Summary
Do you have a passion for connecting with people? Do you love matching people with their passion? VMware is looking for a Talent Scout to join our expanding Employee Referral Team. We have set up an in-house team to proactively support the recruiting function by providing a first touch point with referred candidates in order to qualify them. At VMware, talent readiness is a top priority, so we are searching for someone who understands the challenges faced daily in hiring the top talent within our industry.

Job Role and Responsibility
Capable of supporting various lines of business and geographies
Focused on Employee Referrals and connecting them with existing opportunities at VMware
Focused also on Internal Sourcing efforts
Responsible for delivery of a high volume of candidates, ensuring the accurate capture and entry of conversations as well as appropriate dispositioning
Performance of ‘on demand’ talent pool conversations as referral pools increase due to Referral Campaign activity
Responsible for compact, focused candidate screens and subsequent delivery of relevant candidate information for consumption by recruiters
Responsible for creating strong partnerships with recruiters within each of VMware’s business units
Has a strong understanding of VMware’s organizational structures and talent sourcing implications.

Required Skills
Customer Passion - Passionate about creating a world class experience for stakeholders engaging with the Employee Referral Program, including candidates, referring employees, staffing and hiring managers.
Operational Excellence - Drive Operational Excellence via consistent and appropriate use of Workday Recruiting
Global Mindset - Utilize available tools and trainings (Talent Scout Training program) to flexibly deliver world class candidate generation across different businesses, roles and geographies.
Driven to Deliver - Ability to consistently exceed expectations around quantity of candidates and quality of screens
Curiosity - Intense intellectual curiosity that motivates you to learn more about talent pools, talent trends, immediate and emerging needs and business objectives. Inquisitive about candidate delivery and how a programmatic delivery model can augment VMware’s Talent Acquisition Strategy
Critical Thinking - Connecting dots. Skillfully gathering data, analyzing, synthesizing, and/or evaluating information from relevant screens to build a better understanding of what attributes will best serve the business and geographies at hand
Adaptability - Be a change agent. Model a positive and willing attitude by effectively responding to diverse challenges and demands. Different hiring scenarios such as campaigns will require increased focus on specific skill sets or business units, increased volume in additional geographies may have you shifting focus to where the business needs
Personal Credibility - Building rapport with Talent Acquisition stakeholders based upon aligning against current and future talent. Establish a credibility with candidates as a first touchpoint with the VMware TA team
Collaboration - Think broadly. Be a model for proactively working across boundaries; identify silos and solutions to break down barriers.
Communication - Proactively communicate with internal and external stakeholders. Awareness of all key stakeholders and communication needs. Ensure TA shows up as one team in all communications. Identify and utilize verbiage designed to deliver optimum results from candidates.
Business Acumen - Have a high-level understanding of the client's business, including strategic direction, priorities and goals and translating that to the relevant candidates and candidate pools. Increased engagement will lead to a deeper understanding of the businesses supported

This job requisition is not eligible for employment-based immigration sponsorship by VMware.
This role is fully remote and can be done anywhere in the U.S. or Canada.
#li-remote

JobTitle: Independent Medical Sales Representative - Atlanta, GA
Qualifications: High school or equivalent (Required)Sales Experience: 1 year (Preferred)
Text: SingleCare 1099 Medical Sales Opportunity Atlanta, GAIndependent Sales Representative Compensation - $2,250 - $10,000 Plus / month – UncappedNot familiar with SingleCare? Check out this Video with Martin Sheen. https://lnkd.in/eXsPB_GPart Time or Full Time – Flexible Schedule Pharmaceutical / Medical / Home Health / Hospice / DME Sales and Business Development ProfessionalsWhether you are an established healthcare sales professional or are just breaking into the industry, SingleCare is a great opportunity for you. As an Independent Sales Representative you will help drive growth and shape the future of the healthcare industry. SingleCare’s free pharmacy savings card provides discounts of up to 80% on most FDA approved prescription medications. We are looking for Independent Sales Representatives in all major US Cities.Qualifications Medical Sales experience is a plus, but not required – just a strong work ethic, exceptional interpersonal, communication and presentation skills, the ability to build relationships and a passion for helping others.Ability to work independently and manage your time (set your own schedule)SingleCare can serve as a perfect opportunity for College Students studying Business / Marketing / Sales needing the training, experience and ability to build a sales track record to break into Medical Sales. Also perfect for existing sales professionals looking for something extra of value to offer current customers or referral sources.This is an exciting / fun sales position with predictable results. You put in the work / activity, the results will come.Your success truly does depend on the effort you put into this. Your success is not dependent on patient care teams, managed care contracts, formulary status ect. Your success is solely dependent on your call activity and ability to educate office staff on how the SingleCare Pharmacy DiscountCards can help their patients save on their prescription medications.For those of you who have been in sales for some time, you know that SALES is actually pretty easy when you believe in what you’re selling and you can see that you’re genuinely helping people solve an important problem in their lives or businesses. This genuine desire to help others shines through as you’re educating your customers. They’re not a number, or a means to a paycheck but as an opportunity to help the patients they serve. As a SingleCare Sales Representative, you’ll be driving company growth by spreading our message and helping patients afford their prescription medications. Allowing them to remain compliant with the treatment regimen recommended by their healthcare professional. Whether they be uninsured, have commercial insurance, Medicare, or Medicaid.The Problem many patients are facing today Too many patients are now having to choose between taking a pill and putting food on the table. 35% of patients in the US can't pay for their medications. Research has shown that more than half of patients will abandon their prescriptions at the pharmacy when their out of pocket cost is $125 or more. The shift to high- deductible health plans and higher co-pays means that even insured individuals are increasingly paying more for their prescription drugs out of their own pockets. 8% are cutting pills in half putting themselves at risk by endangering their health.Even Medicare patients often have high prescription drug co pays, eventually fall into the “doughnut hole” and need help with Rx costs. Plus there are many medications that Medicare just doesn’t cover.Circulation Dec 2019 – “I in 8 patients with Atherosclerotic Cardiovascular Disease report nonadherence to medication regimens because of cost, resorting to skipping doses, breaking tablets and taking a lesser dose than prescribed and delaying filling of prescriptions to save money.”Gallop Poll Reported in Nov 2019 – “About 1 in 5 US Adults say they or someone in their household has been unable to afford drugs that were prescribed to them in the last year. 22.9% in Nov, up from 18.9% in Jan. 58 million adults experience “medication insecurity.”Annals of Internal Medicine published in April 2017 – “Studies have consistently shown that 20% - 30% of medication prescriptions are never filled, approximately 50% of medications for chronic disease are not taken as prescribed due to cost constraints.The Solution you will provide as a SingleCare Sales Representative You will help shape the future of the healthcare industry. SingleCare’s free pharmacy savings card provides discounts of up to 80% on most FDA-approved prescription medications. SingleCare has relationships with 94% of all pharmacies nationwide including Target, Walmart, CVS, Walgreens, HEB, Randalls & more. A patient can walk into any of our contracted pharmacies and receive a better price than without the card, but as a SingleCareRepresentative, you will be equipped with the knowledge of the SingleCare mobile app to educate healthcare professionals on how to help their patients find the best price for their specific medication and location.SingleCare negotiates directly with pharmacies across the USA helping to cut out of pocket costs for patients. We have an internal analytics team to manage better pricing and more flexibility to support patient savings year-round.Essentially, SingleCare Account Managers are driving more traffic to these pharmacies. Win-Win!Responsibilities Work full time or part time, with flexible hours. You decide when you work, no quotas, no cost to you. All materials and supplies are provided, including business cards and brochures. You create a territory and schedule that works for you.Share Singlecare Cards with your existing customers and referral sources, and / or make new contacts in Emergency Rooms, Urgent Care Centers, Physicians’ offices – all specialties, Dentists, Eye Doctors, even Veterinarians. Anywhere prescriptions are written.Our successful Representatives first approach the receptionist when they walk in the offices, explaining the SingleCare difference and how best to utilize the savings card. They set up / distribute SingleCare stands filled with cards in the patient lobby, front counter, checkout counter, sample closets, and in each exam room when possible. They speak to everyone who will listen! The Physician, the Nurse who calls in the prescriptions, the Nurse who handles prior authorizations, and the patient in the lobby who asks “whatcha got there?” (discreetly of course).They share “success stories” of particular drugs that other offices have asked them to look up and that they’ve seen incredible savings on. They share their own personal success stories on savings.They take Singlecare with them when they travel. There are no territory restrictions. Simply check the providedSingleCare CRM to see if an account has already been claimed by another SingleCare Representative, if not they go for it! Accounts are only Claimed when there has been an activation.Healthcare professionals and facilities WANT these cards! And they WANT you to educate them on how best to use them. You will be providing a valuable resource for them that they can share with their patients, which makes them LOOK GOOD! You’ll know you’re on to something the first time a Physician or office staff member pulls our his or her cell phone in the middle of your discussion and starts looking up their own prescriptions on the SingleCare App!Training and Compensation You will be provided with on line Comprehensive sales training as you’re waiting for your first shipment of kits to arrive (usually 2 weeks). Plus optional one on one calls to help you identify your target list. Ongoing training and support is also available, but your attendance is not required.The typical SingleCare Representatives working part-time make between $2,000 - $5,000 monthly, many full- time reps are making $15,000 - $20,000. The top SingleCare Rep makes $40 K+ monthlyThis is a 1099 Commission Only position Monthly bonus is paid on Call Activity / Kit Placement and reporting of Competitive materials - Up to $2250 monthly. Commission earning potential for card activations is uncapped.Commission starts at $10 / discount card that is activated. - The more offices you have marketing materials in, the higher your monthly commission will be. Eventually, your accounts are doing the “selling” for you.For further information, click here to view an Informational Presentation .Our process is intentionally short and sweet.Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Contract, CommissionPay: $2,250.00 - $10,000.00 per monthEducation:High school or equivalent (Required)Experience:Sales Experience: 1 year (Preferred)Contract Length:VariesCommission Only:YesWork Location:Fully RemotePaid Training:NoCompany's website:www.SingleCare.comCompany's Facebook page:https://www.facebook.com/SingleCare/COVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processVirtual meetings

Account Executive - Online Division
Atlanta, GA ( Fulton County)
Job Description
Grand Canyon Education, formerly part of Grand Canyon University, became its own entity in July 2018 after the HLC approved GCU’s application to become a nonprofit institution. GCE will work in close partnership with GCU. Moreover, many positions with GCE are located on GCU’s main campus.
If you’re passionate about education and have an entrepreneurial spirit, consider an Account Executive position with Grand Canyon Education, Inc. as your next exciting career move. GCE’s Online Division is seeking a self-motivated, business development professional to build awareness of our online academic programs for education, healthcare and business within the Atlanta, GA (Fulton County) territory. You will focus on building relationships with businesses/organizations to expand our reach to prospective students. You’ll also take an active role in supporting prospective students through the admissions process to guide them on the right path towards a successful online learning experience.
Starting salary is $65,000 a year.
Responsibilities:
Work remotely within your assigned territory, managing and implementing strategies to increase prospective student inquiries.
Cold calling key decision makers at prospective businesses/organizations to build relationships and create a pipeline of prospective students.
Create and execute event/activity plans, which includes conducting informational, prospective student presentations.
Counsel students on the enrollment process from lead generation through first few classes
Maintain and grow inquiry and account databases.
Significant regional travel within assigned territory.
Qualifications:
3 years’ demonstrated success in outside business development, consultative sales or account management experience. Prior higher education experience a plus.
A bachelor’s degree (highly preferred) or 5 years of related experience with a minimum of 60 college credits completed and progressing toward an undergraduate degree.
Excellent interpersonal and sales presentation skills with strong verbal and written communication skills.
An entrepreneurial and determined attitude in order to meet performance targets, and the confidence to work independently without daily oversight.
Computer/office software proficiency including MS Office Suite and CRM tools.
Requires use of a personal vehicle, a valid driver's license and clean driving record.
Cannot be delinquent or in default on a federal student loan as verified in your credit report. If in a rehabilitation program, your credit report must reflect that you are current, not delinquent, on your payments.
Provide a positive example to students by supporting the University’s Doctrinal Statement, Ethical Position Statement and Mission of Grand Canyon University.
Ability to work a flexible schedule including evening and weekend hours.

Text: Wayne Wire and Cable is looking for a Marketing and Design Coordinator to participate in our company’s advertising campaigns. Your main responsibilities include managing the overall look of the website; managing promotions and how they are portrayed on the website and how they target our market; and marketing; to include making content for and advising on how to maximally utilize email, social media, google search, online ads etc. Our ideal candidate is able to interpret customers’ behavior and suggest creative ways to increase brand awareness. If you have excellent communication skills and a passion for advertising strategies, we want to meet you. Ultimately, you will ensure our company’s marketing efforts help us achieve our immediate and long-term business goals. This position is part-time to start and then will become full-time.ResponsibilitiesProvide online presence design guidance to our development team.Actively promote the site (and eventually our app) and brand to our target market utilizing all current marketing technologies including email, online ads, and social media.Devise special promotions as appropriateDo focus group tests of the website to determine best layout, functionality and most effective promotions.SkillsProven work experience as a Marketing Coordinator, Marketing Officer or similar roleCandidate must have experience in online marketing and some background in design.Candidate can be located anywhere in lower 48 states, preferably in a major metropolitan area that is experiencing a high rate of commercial (multifamily, office, or industrial such as factories or fulfillment centers) real estate development.Candidate must have knowledge of and some experience in electrical wholesale and or electrical construction industries so he / she can effectively communicate with our customer. Our target customer is either an electrician or does purchasing for an electrical construction company, or is an estimator at an EC company.Knowledge and experience should be from a major metropolitan market such as NYC, Miami, Atlanta or Austin. Preferably, a city that is presently experiencing a lot of commercial real estate development. Different geographical locales use slightly different variations of the wire we are making and also have their own lingo for product. Initially, we want to target one high growth market specifically. Candidate must be familiar with this market.Speaks Russian is a plus but not required.Job Types: Full-time, Part-timePay: $30.00 - $40.00 per hourEducation:High school or equivalent (Preferred)Experience:Online Design and Marketing: 1 year (Required)working in the electrical industry: 1 year (Required)Work Location:Fully RemoteThis Job Is Ideal for Someone Who Is:People-oriented -- enjoys interacting with people and working on group projectsAdaptable/flexible -- enjoys doing work that requires frequent shifts in directionDetail-oriented -- would rather focus on the details of work than the bigger pictureAutonomous/Independent -- enjoys working with little directionInnovative -- prefers working in unconventional ways or on tasks that require creativityCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processVirtual meetings

Text: REMOTE WORK: Preferred located in Charlottesville, VA; Atlanta, GA; Chicago, IL; Richmond, VA; D.C. Metro area; or Maryland.About UsAt CoConstruct, we deliver software that transforms the lives of our users by eliminating the chaos in their days and creating rewarding building experiences for home builders and their clients.CoConstruct is seeking a Business Development Representative (BDR) to join our sales team.Our BDRs research prospective customers, create outreach strategies, and identify sales opportunities. As a BDR, you will conduct exploratory conversations with potential customers, use your business acumen to identify how CoConstruct could help their business grow, and successfully position the CoConstruct value proposition. The purpose of this outreach is to schedule qualified customers with our Account Executives (product specialists) for a value driven discovery and product demonstration call.This position offers a base salary and commission. CoConstruct employees who demonstrate high performance and commitment will have the opportunity for career development and advancement within the sales organization and company wide.In This Role, You’ll Get ToWork closely and collaboratively with CoConstruct Account Executives, Marketing and Sales leadership to develop and implement appropriate prospecting strategiesConduct high volume prospecting (60-100 activities per day) to qualify leads through calls, emails, and social mediaSchedule discovery meetings for Account Executives to further assess a prospect's business and potential for partnership with CoConstructConduct needs qualification calls with specific prospects as assignedHelp custom builders and home remodelers from all over the globe realize the potential of systemizing their business practicesSet yourself up for a successful career by learning the necessary fundamentals to be a great salesperson, leader, and executiveGet a Construction industry mini-MBA! You'll learn how a variety of construction businesses operate, what challenges they face on a daily basis, and how technology can dramatically improve their businesses and employees' livesWe’re Looking For People Who HaveA track record of high achievementExcellent written and verbal communication skillsPrevious successful sales experience OR a strong desire to begin a sales careerThe ability and desire to work in a fast-paced, challenging environment with peers who challenge you to be betterThe desire to meet and exceed measurable performance goalsAre naturally curious and passionateThe technical aptitude to master our sales toolsA keenly developed competitive natureA "one-speed" energy with a highly self-driven sense of motivationThe ability to deal with and thrive on objections and rejection on a daily basisPrevious sales experience in which you demonstrated the ability to meet or exceed sales quotas a plus (but not required)Why UsWe're already the #1 rated company in our space and our customers love our system and our people. Recently voted locally as "The Best Place to Work in Charlottesville" we care as much about our people as our customers, and it shows! Whether it's a pancake breakfast, a video game night, a 5k mud runs, or a happy hour, there's time to enjoy the other people who are on the mission with you.We're also on a strong financial footing, with 12 years of organically-fueled growth and four years running on the Inc. Magazine list of fastest growing privately held companies in the US. But, there's so much more we can do. And that's why we need you to join our growing team!CoConstruct's core values appear in everything we do and everyone we hire:Look in the mirror first: We first look to ourselves to see what we can do (and not just say) to make a difference.Understand why: We constantly dig deeper and question the status quo in pursuit of a better way.Practice sympathetic straight-shooting: We don't sugar coat the truth, but we always tell it, with care -- even when it's not convenient.Pursue the customer's perspective: We make our customers' lives happier by looking at the world through their eyes -- and then taking action.Show personality: We allow our personalities to shine, so our customers love not just what we sell, but who we are.Boldly Innovate: We unapologetically question the status quo - then focus, experiment, and simplify to solve important problems.CoConstruct is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, age, national origin, religion, physical or mental disability/handicap, marital status, veteran status, or any other basis prohibited by law. The purpose of this document is to provide a general statement of the major responsibilities of this position and is not intended to describe all elements of the work that may be performed and should not serve as the sole criteria for personnel decisions.Job Type: Full-timePay: $28,786.00 - $92,196.00 per yearEducation:High school or equivalent (Preferred)Experience:Sales Experience: 1 year (Preferred)Customer Service: 1 year (Preferred)

Company OverviewGlass Lewis is the world’s choice for governance solutions. We enable institutional investors and publicly listed companies to make sustainable decisions based in research and data. We cover 25,000+ meetings each year, across approximately 100 global markets.Our customers include the majority of the world’s largest pension plans, mutual funds, and asset managers, collectively managing over $40 trillion in assets. We have teams located across the United States, Europe, and Asia-Pacific giving us global reach with a local perspective on the important governance issues.Position DescriptionThe Engagement associate will assist in tracking and facilitating interactions between Glass Lewis research staff and companies/their representatives. The Engagement associate will use our customer relationship manager (CRM) to record interactions between Glass Lewis staff and outside contacts. The Engagement associate should have excellent communication skills (phone, speaking and email), and a positive personality will go a long way when communicating with outside parties. Duties also include administrative and clerical tasks, so a successful candidate must have a well-organized, systematic approach to their work.This is an excellent opportunity to hone skills in communications, investor relations and financial services. Engagement Associates will communicate with high level employees at publicly-traded companies and gain knowledge about corporate structure, shareholder rights, and the emerging field of corporate governance.This is a temporary, full-time, entry-level position based in our Kansas City office. Engagement Associates will receive comprehensive training about our firm and their duties and responsibilities on the Engagement team. Employment is expected to begin in February 2021 and continue through June 2021. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis; therefore, highly motivated candidates are encouraged to submit their applications as early as possible.This is a non-exempt position. The compensation is $15.00 per hour.Qualifications* Bachelor's degree required* Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail* Excellent verbal and written communication skills* Computer proficiency and typing skills* Ability to comprehend and summarize incoming inquiries* Ability to work effectively under tight deadlines* Willingness to learn* Desire to work in a professional, fast-paced atmosphere with other bright people is a must!Please Note: Candidates must be eligible to work for any company in the U.S. We cannot provide assistance in obtaining work permits.Apply online at www.glasslewis.comJob Types: Full-time, TemporaryPay: $15.00 per hourSchedule:8 hour shiftEducation:Bachelor's (Required)Work Location:Multiple locationsFully RemoteCompany's website:www.glasslewis.comCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processVirtual meetings

This role will partner with various Masten Teammates to assist with ongoing Project Management efforts expanding across multiple functions of the business.This is a great opportunity for someone to join a growing NewSpace company, as Masten is currently building a Lunar Lander to land on the South Pole of the Moon in December 2022. This role will start off as a full-time, 3 month contract with a high possibility of extension and can be fully remote.Responsibilities: · Act as the Subject Matter Expert with a solid understanding and application of all Smartsheet models in both functional and technical requirements· Assist team with creation, deployment, and support of Smartsheet applications· Conduct assessments and gap analysis of existing Smartsheet applications as needed· Share best practices and common processes with the Masten Team as neededKey Requirements: · Minimum of 3 years of experience effectively leading large-scale projects & programs within Smartsheet, with a focus on Project Management and PMO job functions· Proven track record of Smartsheet expertise, helping organizations build new applications and audit & update existing ones· Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, MIS or equivalent; Master’s Degree is a bonus· Positive attitude and passionate about support a team across multiple functions· Ability to take direction from multiple Points of Contact, multitask and shift direction as neededAdditional Requirements: Due to U.S. State Department restrictions on access to space technology, candidates must be "U.S. Persons" as defined by the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) 22 CFR 120-130. Civic Dinners is looking for a highly experienced Community Manager who can join our team and lead our community engagement and outreach.
As our Community Manager, you will help Civic Dinners invite more people to the table to discuss the most important topics of the 21st century, such as climate change, polarization, equity, inclusion and sustainability. You will help Civic Dinners engage millions of people, driving thought leadership around the importance of listening and engaging employees, neighbors and leaders in crucial community conversations.
We’re looking for the perfect “super-connector” and the ultimate host to invite new users to existing dinners. Someone who is confident and fearless when it comes to reaching out to people he/she doesn’t yet know, by phone, email, social media and live events (when it’s safe). Someone who knows how to build relationships with strangers, build trust instantly and provide resources to those who need them.

About Civic Dinners

Our team at Civic Dinners is lean and strong with 24 (15 full-time, 9 part-time) as a rapidly growing tech company based in Atlanta, Georgia. We only hire ace players, who are talented, collaborative, kind, hardworking and fully committed to making Civic Dinners a flying success. Everyone who works at Civic Dinners is willing to roll up their sleeves and dive in wherever needed, whenever needed.
Our team is award-winning, fun, diverse and whole-heartedly committed to the purpose of Civic Dinners. As a benefit corporation, we champion inclusion for all and aim to become the global platform for conversations that open hearts, connect minds and spark real change.
As the champion for hosts and guests, you’ll work closely with the Marketing team, Customer Success team and Sales team.
Who you are
You are an upbeat, positive thinker and excellent communicator with exceptional copywriting skills. You’re fluent in social media and have mastered the art of targeted email campaigns. You’ve designed drip campaigns in your sleep to convert non-users into raving fans. You love speaking in front of live audiences and you know how to keep an audience engaged. You’re also genuine and delightful when connecting one-on-one with strangers, and can proudly represent Civic Dinners on your own. You’re not afraid of interviewing high-profile celebrities, or asking for testimonials from anyone who participates in a Civic Dinner. You can’t wait to join a fast-paced startup and help us grow exponentially.
You are a great communicator and would be an articulate ambassador for Civic Dinners in a client meeting or community conversation. You are ambitious, comfortable working to meet deadlines and you really want to use your talents, time and passion towards creating a more inclusive, sustainable world. You are excited about the mission and values of Civic Dinners, and the opportunity to create community conversations that enhance empathy and spark social change.
Requirements

3+ years experience in marketing, community outreach, and/or sales
Excellent communication and active follow-up (follow-up is essential for this role)
Significant experience in digital marketing (audience growth, social media, landing pages, online campaigns, digital advertising, tracking and measuring impact)
Having successfully implemented lead drip funnels and automation flows
Thorough understanding of Hubspot or similar automated marketing tools
Thorough understanding of Intercom and segmentation of automated messages to different user types
Thorough understanding of Mailchimp and all email marketing tactics to segment audiences and increase engagement and click-through rates
Experience carrying out market research (speaking with customers, hosts, guests via focus groups or surveys to understand user/customer needs, wants and barriers)
Excellent written and oral communication skills, as well as presentation skills to both internal and external stakeholders
Some sales experience is a bonus (marketing is sales multiplied by media, thus ability to sell is very useful)
Experience in automated targeted emails based on potential client characteristics and behavior is a bonus
Experience working with multiple teams (product, sales, customer support) and coordinating the marketing plans and efforts
Strong problem-solving skills
Flexibility in working with a global remote team
Open minded, collaborative, decisive, accountable and friendly
Confident, self-motivated and a true team player
Well-organized, with a high attention to detail and ability to prioritize
Ability to self-manage and keep track of own schedule while working remote
Benefits
There are some clear reasons to join the Civic Dinners team.
Be part of an incredibly talented, driven and supportive team — we are building an amazing team culture and want you to contribute to its formation.
We have a clear vision to make significant issues more personal, accessible and actionable for everyday citizens. And by doing so we hope to create more engaged, passionate and active citizens around the world, at a time when we need them more than ever.
Join a fast-growing technology business based out of Atlanta, Georgia.
In addition to the great things above, at Civic Dinners we care about you and offer some great perks for full-time members of our team.
Vacation & PTO
Fully covered health insurance for the employee
Technology allowance
Growth potential in a fast-paced start-up

Kelly Services is seeking an Associate Regulatory Affairs Specialist IV for our well-known client in the Consumer Goods industry in Atlanta GA (Remote). This is a 12-month contract position
Title: Associate Regulatory Affairs Specialist IV
Location: Atlanta GA (Remote)
Duration: 12-month
Payrate: $25-40/hr.
Job Description
Purpose of the Position: Support regulatory compliance for electronic dispensers.

Responsibilities:

Maintain international regulatory affairs files and distribute information as required to support key stake-holders.
Provide regulatory support for new/modifications to product design/ project teams.
Maintain technical files for international regulatory registrations, including Declarations of Conformity as required
Prepare and obtain clearance of international product submissions according to their respective regulations
Review and maintain compliance with international regulations.
Participate in the review of process/product changes, labeling, claims, etc. , to determine the need for any regulatory activities and to ensure compliance to international requirements.
Embrace the Culture of Accountability and actively demonstrate One K-C behaviors. Responsibilities include:
Bachelor's Degree, ideally in electrical engineering or similar field
Experience : One - there year experience in Regulatory Affairs or product development of relevant products
Preferred: Experience with lower voltage electronics and associated power supplies;
Experience with IOT and other connected (wireless) device capabilities.
Familiarity with global market access for electronics with knowledge of country differences.
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills. Team player with excellent organizational skills.
Detail focused with ability to multitask effectively and work efficiently within a strict timeline-driven environment. Project management skills preferred.

Senior Project Manager – Fannie/Freddie Agency PCR Reviewer

Job Description
Senior Project Managers (SPMs) at Nova Group, GBC manage the project workflow and report preparation to both Nova and our Client standards and deadlines. SPMs engage in project setup and assignment with our scheduling team, communication with Field Managers on project requirements, progress, schedule, technical review and close out of the project (invoice, shipping, etc).
As technical reviewers, SPMs are responsible for the review and submittal of the PCNA report by the Field Manager, and resolution of outstanding report issues. They use their knowledge of Agency Guidelines to ensure proper report documentation. Ultimately, our SPMs are accountable for the technical merit of the Nova reports delivered to our Clients.
SPMs may also be asked to perform Property Condition Assessments (PCAs) as needed. Typical sites to be assessed would include commercial properties such as offices, warehouses, multi-family sites and hotels.
Our Senior Project Managers are a core member of our project delivery and client relationship teams working with our field teams, Account and Sales Managers to ensure the quality of our deliverables to our clients, exceeding their expectations along the way.
Required Experience and Skill Sets:
Bachelor’s degree in architecture, engineering, or construction-related field
5+ years’ experience conducting and/or managing PCNAs (preferably Agency scopes), and/or engineering and architectural consulting services
Thorough understanding of Agency Guidelines
Experience in the management/review of related due diligence projects
Knowledge of building components, systems and cost estimating
Strong technical writing skills and proven attention to detail
Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook
Current, valid state driver’s license (position requires a motor vehicle record background check)
Candidates with professional registrations preferred (PE, RA, etc.) Familiar with Agency PCR scope requirements
Ability to analyze assessor findings to ensure the PCR accurately reflects the Property
Ability to coach assessors, both employees and associates, to complete accurate and scope-compliant deliverables
Ability to analyze client-provided documents, such as Capital budgets, repairs and projections and incorporate in to the findings and reserve analysis
Ability and willingness to work effectively as a member of the Nova Deal Team to support the needs and goals of CMG Clients
Ability to strictly adhere to deadlines on multiple simultaneous projects

Click here to apply now!

Working for Nova Group, GBC
Nova Group, GBC (Nova) is a privately held multidisciplinary advisory firm incorporated in 1987. We have a global footprint headquartered in Chaska, Minnesota, but our team services clients throughout the United States and abroad. Nova provides services in the areas of environmental management, compliance investigation, corrective action activities, strategic energy services, and construction services. Our diverse portfolio of services creates a multitude of career possibilities, and we strive to bring on talent who want to learn and build their skills across multiple sectors of our business.

A General Benefit Corporation (GBC), often referred to as a B-Corp, means Nova is aligning our values with our business practices. We recognize our role goes beyond profitability, and we value our environment, our communities, and our people. Beyond our articles of incorporation, we are making a commitment to measure our impact in four key segments: our environment, our communities, our customers, and our employees.

In efforts to remain competitive and to differentiate ourselves from others in the industry, we continuously review our benefit programs. One way we accomplish this is with flexible and remote work arrangements, because we realize that personal demands don’t just happen after 5 p.m. The great majority of our staff work from remote offices that allow the ultimate balance of work and personal life. Different work environment options are available to you, from offices in larger cities to offices available on an as-needed basis. Whatever your work-environment needs, we will make an effort to accommodate them. At Nova this culture is successful because we trust our teams to be accountable to each other and to our clients.

In addition, Nova is committed to supporting your professional development through career ladders, training programs, and continuing education to support your certifications and licenses. We look for opportunities to build skills on the job in particular, shadowing mentors and senior staff, leveraging all they have to offer. We always want our employees to feel challenged and to strive to grow their skills and careers.
Click here to apply now!

JobTitle: Solutions Strategist, Observability & Monitoring (retail/ecommerce) (Any U.S. City)
Text:
Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to enable a world where data provides clarity, elevates discussion, and accelerates progress. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, customers, having fun and most meaningfully to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey!
Are you an Influencer and born Leader? Do you love a fast-paced start-up environment? Do you want to be part of the analytics revolution helping to disrupt and evolve the Retail industry? Do you understand the complexity of selling and supporting end-to-end analytics solutions? Would you like to work at a company that embraces innovation, passion, openness and fun, and loves to disrupt the status quo?
If so, we have a role for you.
You will be a pioneer for Splunk to drive success within this industry, including Internet retail, Department stores, Supermarkets, Drugstores, Apparel and Electronics sectors. In this role you will work cross-functionally with several organizations at Splunk (including Sales, Partners, Marketing, and Product Management) with the primary objective of looking for ways to build and grow our business in this industry. You are responsible for driving Splunk software bookings, adoption, and GTM Strategy for Splunk’s solutions for Retail customers and prospects. You have deep, credible knowledge of how retailers use digital assets to deliver outstanding customer experience. Additional experience in IT and Security related markets and the Splunk platform is helpful. Lastly, you know how to communicate at an executive level as a guide and trusted advisor.
About The Team
The Vertical team is responsible for helping the field build, grow and speed sales opportunities to close while enabling the entire Splunk eco-system with its domain expertise to increase skills. You will report to the global leader for Manufacturing, Retail and Natural Resources Verticals.
Responsibilities
You will innovate within and across internal teams to develop new use cases, value propositions, tools, technical content and engagement programs that scale and evolve the Splunk selling and adoption motion. In addition, you will
Act as Industry point of contact and collective voice in terms of product strategy and direction from the field.
Evangelize the Splunk portfolio for Retail industry internally with our field organization and externally with customers, prospects, and partners.
Help Splunk extend its brand and value proposition through social media, conference presentations and blogs.
Drive opportunities end-to-end during all technical parts of the sales cycle alongside Splunk and partner technical staff & work with them in the design phase of technical projects.
Influence, contribute, and drive adoption of enablement material to the Splunk global sales force in order to increase the knowledge of the Retail industry.
Qualifications
10+ years total work experience in fast growing, highly dynamic organizations and responsibilities similar to this role
Demonstrated subject matter expertise in observability, analytics, customer experience and supply chain use cases, trends and applications.
Experience in site reliability, performance monitoring and security for a major web property or ecommerce platform.
Expertise and understanding of the growing challenges and innovative successes related to Retail ecosystem.
Hands on Splunk experience or similar technology a plus
Capable of leading sophisticated customer deployments as a technical authority. Experience building positive relationships with customers.
Strong executive presence and polish internally and externally. Very comfortable in the “C” suite with a track record of success positively impacting sales, teamwork, strategy and vision.
Demonstrated ability to use both formal and informal influencing skills in a cross-matrix organization - this skill is critical to the success of this role.
Able to work independently and remotely from other members of your team and corporate.
Bachelor's degree in computer science, a related field or equivalent work experience
Post-pandemic, up to 50% travel may be required.
Location: anywhere in U.S. city but prefer close to major airport or cities with large retail hubs etc.
We value diversity at our company. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying.
For job positions in San Francisco, CA, and other locations where required, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

define future product updates/upgrades with a focus on healthcare payments functionality· Deliver marketing required documents (MRDs) and product requirement documents (PRDs) with prioritized features and corresponding justification to product platform owners and commercial launch teams· Work with external third parties to assess and manage partnerships· Be an expert with respect to the competition· Develop the core positioning and messaging for the product· Perform product demos to customers and enable, support sales organization in achievement of product growth and revenue· Set pricing to meet revenue and profitability goals· Deliver a monthly revenue forecast, primarily in merchant services offering and other core payments products that directly drive revenue· Deliver management reporting on financials, forecasts, and other KPIs· Partner with marketing to develop sales tools and collateral· Propose an overall budget to ensure success· Brief and train the sales force at sales meetings· Brief, train and support the client implementations teams when new products are releasedRequirements: · Minimum of 5 years of experience as a Product Manager· Direct card acquiring product and program experience, including demonstrated knowledge of hardware, gateways, value added services, bankcard rules and requirements; payment facilitator experience preferred but not required· Demonstrated success defining and launching high performing products, and managing growth throughout lifecycle· 10+ years of experience in a job in the payments processing and acquiring market.· Excellent written and verbal communication skills· Bachelor’s degree (MBA preferred)· Excellent teamwork skills· Proven ability to influence cross-functional teams without formal authority· Must be able to travel 25% of the timeJob Type: Part-timePay: $0.00 per yearBenefits:401(k)401(k) matchingDental insuranceFlexible spending accountHealth insuranceHealth savings accountPaid time offProfessional development assistanceTuition reimbursementVision insuranceSchedule:Monday to FridayExperience:Product Management: 5 years (Preferred)Payment Processing: 10 years (Preferred)Company's website:revspringinc.com

About Guaranteed Rate:
Guaranteed Rate is the 5th largest retail mortgage lender in the U.S. By offering industry-leading tools, low-rate mortgages and unparalleled customer service, we’ve become the Home Purchase Experts®. At Guaranteed Rate, we think big—pushing beyond what most people believe is possible. We strive to work with the best of the best, building business with the best referral partners and hiring the best employees—allowing us to deliver world-class customer service. Our goal is to make sure every customer has a great experience. Headquartered in Chicago with 5,000+ employees in 300+ offices across the U.S. and licensed in all 50 states, we’ve helped thousands of homeowners with more than $24 billion in home purchase loans and refinances in just the past year alone.

What's the Role?

We are currently seeking a hard-working, dedicated Underwriter to join our innovative and passionate team.

Responsibilities:
As an Underwriter you will be responsible for but not limited to the underwriting of residential loans ensuring compliance with appropriate company and investor standards

A Mortgage Underwriter will be responsible for examining loan documentations for accuracy and completeness while working with loan originator or production staff to secure all required documents

Mortgage Underwriters may be involved in one or several types of mortgage lending (conventional, government-backed, etc.)

You may be required to work with more senior mortgage underwriters on loan exceptions having the authority to withdraw and decline loans

You may also be required to respond directly to individual and investor audits

Includes all levels of underwriting authority and exception levels

Requirements:
5+ years of mortgage underwriting experience

3+ years of Conventional underwriting experience

Experience with underwriting to multiple lender guidelines and requirements

Knowledge of Fannie Mae/DU and Freddie Mac/LP guidelines and automated underwriting systems

Critically examine credit, income and asset documents and review title policy and appraisals

Encompass and GUS experience are preferred

Guaranteed Rate is an Equal Opportunity Employer that welcomes and encourages all applicants to apply regardless of age, race, sex, religion, color, national origin, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital or parental status, ancestry, citizenship status, pregnancy or other reason, as protected by law.

Gong enables revenue teams to realize their fullest potential by unveiling their customer reality. The patented Gong Revenue Intelligence Platform™ captures and understands every customer interaction, then delivers insights at scale, empowering revenue teams to make decisions based on data instead of opinions. Over 1,500 innovative companies like Zillow, Slack, PayPal, Twilio, Shopify, Hubspot, SproutSocial, Zoominfo, Outreach, MuleSoft, and LinkedIn trust Gong to power their customer reality. With Gong, customers experience improved win rates, increased deal sizes, and accelerated employee ramp-times.
Location: Atlanta, GA or Remote (US).
As an Implementation Consultant, you will fill a key role in onboarding new customers and spreading the Gong gospel. Your ability to work independently and keep commitments to tasks and assigned work packages on multiple concurrent projects is essential.
With all of our activities focused to ensure that our customers are raving fans of Gong, you will get our customers on-boarded seamlessly by assisting them to see, learn, use and believe in the Gong Revenue Intelligence Platform™. Based on customer use cases and requirements, you will be responsible for driving the design and configuration of Gong for our customers. You will work within the framework of our implementation methodology facilitating multiple sessions and tasks with a focus on customer adoption & launch.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Guide and onboard customers to give them proactive assistance as they onboard and configure their Gong instance driving the most value possible to their business.
Manage competing priorities across multiple customer implementations.
Ability to manage projects to a timeline, based on the scope provided, and ensure deadlines are met and any delays escalated.
Maintain product expertise across the Gong product line, API’s, and 3rd party apps.
Collaborate with customers in understanding their use cases of Gong.
Work closely with customer's technical and security teams to deploy Gong, and guide them in integrating with their internal systems.

Cloudbeds is the fastest growing hospitality management suite in the world, providing tools to manage independent properties of any type and size. We make award-winning cloud-based hospitality software that’s trusted by more than 20,000 hotels, hostels, inns, and alternative accommodations in over 157 countries. Our 400+ team members are distributed across over 40 countries and altogether we speak 40+ languages. How do we do it? On a #remotefirst platform that allows every member of our team to work from wherever they are around the globe. We’re looking for people who want to disrupt the travel industry and love to travel as much as we do.
We’re looking for Onboarding Coaches who want to disrupt the travel industry and love to travel as much as we do. As an Onboarding Coach, you will make our company motto of “more reservations, happier guests” a reality by providing outstanding hospitality support and onboarding to our customers around the world.
Location: Remote

What You Will Do:
Responsible for onboarding, training, and the overall success of each client using the Cloudbeds platform thru video conferencing, phone calls, and emails
Follow up with new accounts and assist with the onboarding process
Assist and support our existing customers (hotel properties) daily in the use of our software in English (Spanish and Portuguese is a plus)
Partner and work closely with Sales to define and achieve customers’ success criteria, demonstrate ROI, and ensure customer renewal with Cloudbeds product suite.
Resolve customer complaints/questions via phone, email, chat, or any other media that Cloudbeds uses to help customers.
Answer product and service questions via our email ticketing system
Troubleshoot and make outbound calls for escalated issues and onboarding calls
Use training materials to keep up-to-date with the latest system updates
Attend company-wide online training sessions
Act as a trusted advisor, thought leader, and subject matter expert to customers in relation to the full suite of Cloudbeds’ products.
Utilize customer service skills to resolve client inquiries; understand the needs of clients and determine appropriate solutions.
Cultivate and maintain an excellent relationship with clients to build client loyalty/retention and promote increased usage and adoption of the software.
Develop and maintain a deep understanding of customers’ business drivers and operational goals, and steer our product to align with those initiatives.
Gather client feedback and requirements for future releases of the software.
Enter critical support and activity notes in salesforce
Help create and/or translate new tutorials as needed by contributing content to the database of support articles
Key Competencies include:
Product Delivery Expertise: Capability to clearly communicate the product(s) and brand to customers and key stakeholders.
Ability to clearly communicate & synthesize customer details (needs, feedback, concerns, opportunities, etc.) internally to multiple departments (Sales, Support, Product, Marketing, Design).
Project Management and Collaboration: Highly organized, proactive, self-starter, and team player with a love of continually improving the processes around you.
Ability to manage multiple projects/customer accounts with varying processes at once.
Can proactively and positively empower the client to work as independently as possible.
Able to lead to multiple personality types and stakeholders through onboarding.
Communication and Emotional Intelligence: Outstanding written and verbal communication skills, coupled with strong empathy for customers and their success.
You’ll Succeed With:
1+ years of hospitality experience in hotels, hostels, BNBs or similar with Front Desk, Night Auditor, Revenue Manager, General Manager roles
Experience in hospitality/tourism
Communication skills and a positive attitude
Fluent in English
Fluency in Spanish or Portuguese is a differential and a plus
Problem-solving skills and emotional management
Compatible graduation course or more than 2 years of proven experience in the area
Skill with computers and systems
Excellent internet/wifi connection
Note: This is a remote position that can be done from home

Our company culture supports flexible working schedules with an open PTO policy and the opportunity to travel and work remotely with great people. To make it easy for our team to travel we offer 2 corporate apartment accommodations near our San Diego and Sao Paulo offices. At Cloudbeds we are dedicated to your personal and professional development. You will have access to over 10,000 courses within LinkedIn Learning when you join our team for your unique individual growth! If you think you have the skills and passion, we’ll give you the support and opportunity to thrive in your career. If you would like to be considered for the role, we would love to hear from you!
