Department: Customer Experience – Project Management

Reports to: Senior Director, Project Management

Location: Remote within the U.S.

Company Description

OnSolve: Always On.

With over two billion notifications sent annually and over 60 years of proven support to both the public and private sectors, OnSolve delivers critical event management solutions backed by unmatched industry expertise, which gives our customers the ability to proactively keep everyone informed, instill confidence, foster teamwork, mitigate disruptions, improve operational outcomes, protect assets, and save lives. We do that through a SaaS-based global portfolio that delivers scalable, easy-to-deploy-and-use solutions for the rapid and secure exchange of vital information and coordination among organizations, people, devices and partners, regardless of the situation or level of need. Visit us on the Web at onsolve.com.


OnSolve is an equal employment opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other status protected by law.
Job Summary

OnSolve is seeking a talented and self-motivated Implementation Specialist to join our Professional Services team that walks our customers through OnSolve product implementations. This key role involves leadership and collaboration in planning, configuring, testing, and implementing the OnSolve SaaS alerting solution to meets each customer’s business needs.
As an OnSolve Implementation Specialist, you will oversee and be responsible for all project deliverables and milestones for your portfolio of assigned projects. You will ensure every implementation is deployed according to processes and expectations, working under the guidance of the Senior Director of Project Management. You will also work closely with other OnSolve team members including Account Executives, Account Managers, Sales Engineers and Support, toward a shared goal of full customer satisfaction with every implementation.
Responsibilities

Manage and execute client implementation projects for:
All OnSolve products
Proof of concept for all OnSolve products
Schedule internal resources for project work and schedule start and end dates for each task or project based on resource availability.
Design and analyze data format.
Hold status meetings during projects including logistics details. Include the meeting date, time, location, and participants, discuss accomplishments, upcoming milestones, upcoming events, outstanding action items, open issues, other specific project needs, and new issues or action items.
Provide weekly status updates on all projects to keep clients, team members, and stakeholders up to date.
Manage communication and relationship with the customer and all stakeholders. Make sure all your team members know about the milestones and track their progress regularly to know the difference between where they are and where they should be.
Ensure all projects are delivered on-time and within scope. Know strengths and weaknesses prior to implementation.
Document the scope of the project before you start. Set goals within realistic timelines. Make sure team members understand schedules and deadlines before launch.
Use of collaboration tools.
Other duties as assigned.


Qualifications

5 – 10 years of project management/SaaS implementation experience
Project Management Professional (PMP)
Ability to run meetings efficiently and effectively
Solid organizational skills including attention to detail and multi-tasking skills
Excellent communication skills both verbal and written
Detail oriented and very organized
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously


Preferred Qualifications

Salesforce experience
FinancialForce experience


Compensation & Benefits

Health, Dental, Vision, Life and additional supplemental insurance
401K
Paid time off and personal days
Paid holidays

Eaton’s Electrical division is seeking a Sales Representative (OEM) to join our team. This position can be REMOTE or based in Ellisville, MO.
Position Overview:
This position promotes the principle sales philosophy that will convince key OEM’s and their manufacturing partners to utilize Bussmann products in the design and use of their equipment/products and to specify Bussmann products. The intent is to create a successful program that will accomplish the Division’s sales objectives and create a “differentiation” for Bussmann products at the key OEM. The incumbent will have the direct responsibility for implementing this strategy.

Making what matters work at Eaton takes the passion of every employee around the world. We create an environment where creativity, invention and discovery become reality, each and every day. It’s where bold, bright professionals like you can reach your full potential—and where you can help us reach ours.

In this function you will:
Effectively communicate account product needs, new programs, forecasts and strategies with all levels of management
Coordination with the global selling organization, engineering, marking, manufacturing and finance departments to create and implement the strategy.
Develop and executes sales plans to meet performance expectations and requirements.
Works with customer engineers to understand application requirements and recommend appropriate products/solutions.
Prepare sales & technical presentations to create product understanding and awareness.
Builds relationships with key customers to enhance long-term business prospects.
Prepare sales proposals based on customer needs and expectations.
Administer all phases of the sales process to ensure effective and timely customer service and response.
Recommend new, modified, or expanded products or markets.

When we embrace the different ideas, perspectives and backgrounds that make each of us unique, we — as individuals and as a company — are stronger.

Qualifications
Required (Basic) Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited institution.
Minimum of 5 years of customer facing sales experience in the electronics industry.
Must be authorized to work in United State without company sponsorship now or in the future

Preferred qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Business or Engineering from an accredited institution
Live within 50 miles of a major airport
Master’s degree from an accredited institution

Position Criteria:
Ability to respond to a variety of challenging circumstances
Significant electronics product & application knowledge
Strong Time Management Skills
Strong Presentation/Training and Communication Skills
Significant experience utilizing Solution Selling techniques
Strong Leadership competencies
Ability to work well within a team
Strong Interpersonal Skills.
Travel to customers & manufacturing locations may be required.
Have an appropriate understanding of application requirements, manufacturing processes, both internal and external, industry standards, test procedures, quality assurance programs, and a strong business and technical background.

When you’re part of the team at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you’ll do important work, and you’ll be valued and recognized for your performance. With talented managers and inspiring coworkers to support you, you’ll find the resources and opportunities to make significant contributions to the world.

How will you make an impact?

The Client Services Manager will be responsible for developing, launching, streamlining and managing global Licensing and Commercial Supply (LCS) processes and procedures related to pre-sale activities, quote-to-cash processes, and post-sale support. Specifically, the individual will support the LCS Segment Leads responsible for driving and supporting the Genetic Sciences Division (GSD).

What will you do?
Develop, refine and manage the methods and processes to enable the effective and efficient flow of information between internal Thermo Fisher Scientific teams (i.e., Operations, R&D, Product Management, etc.) and external-facing Business Development Managers (BDMs).
Coordinate the gathering, development, approval, and execution of activities to assist the BDMs and LCS Segment Leaders to address LCS customer needs and requirements. These tasks will include but not be limited to:
Interaction with R&D
Direct Customer support
Early access product support
Interaction with the following functions within Operations:
Manufacturing
Technical operations
Project Management Office (PMO)
Quality
Regulatory
Manage and own the relationships, communications and interaction with key operational partners at global sites in order to manage, improve and develop processes related to post-sale support of customers, BDMs, and LCS Segment Leader, and update customers as appropriate in partnership with BDMs.

About FireMon
As a thought leader in a space we invented, FireMon is paving the way in the cybersecurity industry across the globe. At FireMon, you'll find a disruptive, cutting-edge environment. It's a place where being proactive is rewarded and each day is more innovative than the last. This drive permeates everything we do – from how we develop our products to how we engage with our customers and how we get things done.
One of the biggest benefits of working with a groundbreaking company like FireMon, is the huge impact employees have on the overall product and business. Each person’s work directly affects the outcome of the finalized product and success of the business. Additionally, you can voice your ideas and collaborate across departments to learn new aspects of the company. Since we are securely backed by some of the savviest investors in the industry, you get the security of an established organization but at the same time get to experience the agility and autonomy of a smaller company.
This role can be located ANYWHERE in the US!
The Implementation Project Manager is responsible for performing a wide range of activities related to the project management and implementation of FireMon products and services.
The role serves as a key partner and primary point of contact to customers; with ownership and accountability for ensuring our solutions deliver value to the customer on or ahead of schedule. Tactically, the PM owns Professional Services Delivery Projects and oversight of the customer journey inclusive of Sales Hand off, Services Engagement, and Services Hand off to effectively engage customers, successfully implement their solutions, and position them for ongoing success and support following implementation.
The successful candidate will have a background in consulting or professional services, experience with SaaS delivery and project management, account and program management, extensive experience managing software development projects, and experience managing matrixes project teams. The candidate must have an ability to lead technical teams and provide leadership in resolving technical issues.
What you'll do:
Build relationships at all levels of the customer to understand needs and drive time to value.
Successfully manage simultaneous global projects for multiple customers ensuring timely implementations in accordance with best practices, policies, procedures, and prescribed implementation methodology including use cases adoption, project risks are mitigated with a collaborative team approach and that client satisfaction remains at the forefront of all efforts.
Plan, document and execute all phases of the project life cycle including leveraging expertise in various project management functional areas including: Scope Management, Requirements Management, Timeline Management, Risk/Issue management, Communications Management, Priority & Dependency Management, and the coordination of resources.
Promote change, continuous process improvement, and best practice adoption within both the business and technical team members.
Provide consistent and comprehensive updates to project stakeholders, including (at a minimum) to-date cost analysis, issue and resolution tracking, and communication with business lines and technology management.
Partner with internal teams (development, product management, sales, support, and technical engineering) to overcome risks and drive Time to Value of our customers for standard use cases.
Required Skills and Experience:
Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, other related technical field, or equivalent experience
4 or more years project management experience with a proven record of accomplishment of successfully delivering projects to senior executives/sponsors for Fortune 500 customers; experience working on and managing enterprise scale IT, Service Delivery, or similar projects or equivalent experience
Demonstrable flexibility and the ability to execute effectively in a fast-paced environment with competing priorities.
Strong negotiation, problem solving, risk management, prioritization, decision making and organizational skills.
Strong written and verbal communication skills, executive level presence and experience in communications facilitation.
Demonstrated success in a customer-facing role requiring a high level of individual responsibility, sound business judgment and large enterprise account management, including an aptitude for improving customer satisfaction.
A natural self-starter, with strong team building, conflict resolution and collaboration skills.
Maintaining reliable and predictable attendance with experience managing a high volume of activity, and a large number of projects, in a fast-paced growing organization. Ability to self-manage and prioritize
What it Takes to be Part of the FireMon Team
FireMon provides persistent network security for hybrid environments through a powerful fusion of real-time asset visibility, continuous compliance and automation. Since creating the first-ever network security policy management solution, FireMon has delivered command and control over complex network security infrastructures for more than 1,700 customers.

Our customers have unique and complex security problems that are difficult to solve. This doesn’t intimidate us, it inspires us. It pushes us to be more creative and find solutions to ensure their success. If this sounds like a movement you'd be interested in joining, we invite you to apply today.

JobTitle: Account Executive II – Hy-Vee – Des Moines, IA
Text:
Position Overview
The successful candidate as the Account Executive (AE) II will work with the integrated account team to manage key aspects of the business relationship with Hy-Vee. This role will develop and implement Annual Business Plans which support business objectives. The AE II will act as a system-wide expert on strategy, business systems, and operating philosophy of assigned customer(s). The AE II will ensure a flawless execution of programs throughout the system.
Function Related Activities/Key Responsibilities
Develops Annual Business Plan with customer, Bottler, and system input that outline key strategies and initiatives for Coca-Cola growth within customer's management and Bottler system.
Ensures business plan and marketing activities are developed to deliver volume, profit, and customer satisfaction commitments made to all stakeholders during business acquisition and/or stewardship planning.
Grows level of customer satisfaction, maintains win/win business relationship, and ensures effective communication with all key buying influences.
Manages communication with Bottler system and customer field network to ensure constant application of strategies as outlined in the Annual Business Plan and flawless execution of programs.
Aligns system resources to implement marketing and operational programs according to plan, schedule, and budget.
Acts as a system-wide customer expert to ensure that the Coca-Cola system understands customer(s) objectives, strategies, positioning, and needs and that Company programs are consistent with their needs.
Responsible for problem solving operational or exceptional issues with customers or bottlers.
Responsible for forecasting and managing to budget.
Responsible for item maintenance and ad maintenance in customer systems.
Education Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in business or related background preferred
Related Work Experience:
Beverage/consumer packaged goods experience is an asset
Experience in managing price package plans for customers
3 - 5 years of key account experience
Experience managing trade budgets and promotional planning
Customer & Commercial: Develop/Communicate to Bottlers/Retails Sales Org - Develop and communicate to Bottlers, Retails Sales Organization (DSD & warehouse business) regarding promotional packaging production and key deadlines in order to ensure promotions are properly executed.
Customer & Commercial: Obtain Coca-Cola System Alignment - Obtain Coca-Cola System alignment by following Operating Processes, Cold Drink Executive Committee Approval, Customer Marketing Agreement Committee (CMAC) approval and Bottler/Distributor agreement in order to obtain system approval of plan.
Customer & Commercial: Activate System to Develop/Implement Business Plan/Solution - Activate The Coca-Cola Company System (e.g., cross-functional team members, segment resources) to develop and implement business plan/solution that meets customer needs and drives beverage category profit and volume.
Customer & Commercial: Orchestrate Deployment of Resources - Orchestrate the deployment of resources from Coca-Cola and customer systems (e.g., people, information, financial, management information system) in order to assure profitable growth for customer and Coca-Cola system.
Location - Des Moines, IA - Work from Home
Travel - approximately 20%

Text: Here is the job descriptionTitle: Field Service Delivery Manager (Petroleum) - RemoteFull TimeDescription: We are looking for a Field Service Delivery Manager to join our North America team supporting the implementation for our customers. This position is critical as company continues to grow across North America - and we have flexibility where this role is located. This position requires someone with project management and petroleum industry experience.As part of our busy customer focused operations team, you will be key in building, and managing a best in class service partner network - which provides nationwide coverage. This position has a high percentage of travel – up to 75% as you will be working closely with new service partners and ensuring that they are set up to successfully install company products. It's essential that you have petroleum industry experience, are comfortable working frontline with customers, and can act as a link between our installer network and our customers.This is a technical role - and you will need to be able to resolve highly complex technical problems related to installation, maintenance and repair of company's products. We are on a high growth trajectory for 2021 and this will be a busy and varied position. It's essential that you are able to multi-task, enjoy being busy and working in a fast-paced environment. We pride ourselves on our culture and you will be supported in a collaborative environment.Role Summary - The core functions of the role will include: 1. Develop, manage and evaluate the Company Service Partner Network: · Launch new service partners by being onsite during first install· Recruit, evaluate and onboard new service partners· Assist with resolution of highly complex technical problems related to installation, maintenance, use and repair of company's products· Available to be onsite to assist with troubleshooting/issue resolution· Monitors work quality, coach new/existing service partners and develop training materials/programs2. Implement educational/certification programs: · Be a subject matter expert (SME) for Company products & installations.· Assist with creating educational/certification programs and supporting materials.· Ensure new training material is provided to all service partners and any associated training has been completed3. Establish Company Service Partner Processes & Procedures: · Inventory logistics pertaining to in field replacements, service stock, RMAs and new orders.· Manage Service Partner Portal· Create documentation (Site Surveys, Check In/Check Out and Playbooks)· Hardware maintenance/handling of Company’s products4. Service Partner Portal Management· Manage the Service Partner Portal· Ensure had up to date and relevant information· Training Service Partners on use of external ticketing system· Provide SME input to any future system development5. Implement a service infrastructure that promotes customer satisfaction.· Implement a service infrastructure that promotes the Company’s brand and customer satisfaction· Ensure all services provided are consistent with company policies· Meet KPIs pertaining to Pro and Standards Service Level agreements - manage customer complaints for installations· Documentation for Site Surveys is accurate and interpreted by Company staff appropriately.About your experience: · We are interested in speaking with technical candidates with previous petroleum industry experience. This position requires the following technical skills:· High-level understanding of POS & Petroleum environment· Experience being front line with customers· Process implementation and continuous improvement· Ability to investigate a problem and find a resolution in a software & hardware environment· Strong organisational skills, and record keeping· Ideally experience of salesforce, or similar call center software· Strong communication skills - and able to work easily within a team.· Payments knowledge and ideally experience with cloud-based service.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $80,000.00 - $120,000.00 per yearExperience:being front line with customers: 2 years (Required)Technical installation, maintenance and repair: 5 years (Required)project management: 4 years (Required)petroleum industry: 4 years (Required)Process implementation and continuous improvement: 3 years (Required)Work Remotely:Yes

Supplier Program Manager – Facilities Goods, JLL Marketplace

POSITION OVERVIEW:
JLL/Technologies is currently seeking a dynamic individual for the role of Supplier Program Manager in our Technologies business line to develop and manage facilities goods supplier relationships for our JLL Marketplace business. Suppliers consist of large B2B products distributors and manufacturers that service the facilities management space. Categories of spend include, but are not limited to, MRO, janitorial & sanitation (absolutely required), and office/administrative supplies (second priority). Primary areas of focus will be supplier relationship management, program development and enablement, and strategic growth within your book of supplier partners. Developing supplier strategies, leveraging JLL scale, building new supplier relationships, identifying and bringing forward market innovations, supporting client solutioning and providing overall value to supplier stakeholders in support of the business will be this position’s mission. Contracting and directly managing suppliers in a category management function will also be required based on business needs.

This position entails working with various users and influencers across multiples levels of the organization, and the successful candidate will require the independent judgment to plan, prioritize, and organize a diverse workload. Position is virtual/remote; but Austin, Atlanta, or Charlotte marketplaces are highly preferred.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Duties and Responsibilities
Contribution to delivery of financial targets in line with business expectations. Position continuously drives assigned seller category strategies and self-sufficiently identifies and executes these projects.
Use market and industry intelligence to identify and qualify new suppliers and use data to support the business and delivery of services. In addition, identify risk, threats and provide solutions for mitigation.
Contribute to Seller Council with the intent of bring seller best practices, feedback, and innovations into the organization and out to clients
Accountable for creating strategic solutions for specific commodities, RFP/quotation management, bid analysis and recommendations
Liaison with internal stakeholders for contract approvals, savings reporting, documentation and compliance
Develops clear strategic supply partner framework and maintains this framework at senior supplier level
Prepare high quality papers and presentations for use with internal and external stakeholders and/or teams as required
Ability to negotiate and have proven strategies within areas of responsible spend
Partner with functional leads and the business to drive both immediate and sustained benefits to business and its clients
Bring strategic thought leadership to identify additional cost and operational efficiencies
Subject matter expert for Supplier Management and main point of contact within business
Assist teams with driving purchasing process improvements; including SKU rationalization and standardization
Provide pricing support to new business pursuits and other JLL teams; such as group buys and consulting engagements
Manage product cross referencing and spend analytics tasks with vendors
Leads contract administration for the Supplier Management team
Comply with all JLL policies and procedures, including but not limited to ethics and business practices

QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor Degree from an accredited institution in business or engineering - supply chain, purchasing, industrial sales or operations background strongly preferred.
Must have a minimum of 5 years of relevant work experience, or combination of relevant work experience and education
Knowledge of emerging procurement technologies and marketplaces is a plus
Experience maintaining and executing on compliance programs
Experience in the janitorial industry a plus
Strong contracting, negotiation, and account management skills are a must
Outstanding interpersonal and communication skills (verbal and written) with the ability to successfully communicate with clients’ and suppliers’ representatives, internal business customers and team members
Strong organizational and time management skills
Able to adapt and prioritize meeting deadlines in a fast-paced environment
Flexibility with work hours and travel as needed
Operates with a sense of urgency, quickly responding to stakeholders
Professional yet personable demeanor
Detail oriented with strong analytical skills
Able to maintain confidentiality, utilize judgment, and work with minimal supervision
Demonstrated proficiency with all applicable software packages including but not limited to MS Windows; MS Office, including MS Word, Excel, Outlook, and PowerPoint

Company Description

Founded in 2007, Tricentis has been making waves worldwide as an innovative and cutting edge continuous testing company. We help enterprises accelerate their digital transformation with an AI-driven, end-to-end testing, and automation platform. To learn more about the world’s #1 testing and automation platform visit our website: tricentis.com
As we rapidly expand, we are looking for a highly engaged Business Development Representative to help us grow. Our company culture is fun, lively, and agile – using the same DevOps principles that are currently helping us re-shape the future of software testing for our customers.
We are located worldwide with our headquarters in Vienna, Austria, and offices in Germany, Switzerland, the UK, the Netherlands, Poland, India, the US, and Australia.
If you’re ready to join a fun and dynamic company, be sure to apply!

Job Description

Tricentis is looking for an enthusiastic and strategic Business Development Representative (BDR), to join our growing Marketing team. As a BDR at Tricentis, you get the opportunity to lead the initial outreach to targeted (Commercial or Enterprise) accounts working in conjunction with the Field and Digital Marketing teams. In this role you will leverage creative marketing and sales tactics to prospect and engage with multiple buyer personas and roles to introduce Tricentis’ value. You will be responsible for generating qualified meetings and opportunities for the Tricentis’ Sales organization.
Key Responsibilities:
Effectively manage inbound lead flow as well as executing outbound prospecting initiatives
Conduct high-level discovery conversations in target accounts
Meet or exceed BDR sourced Opportunity volume targets
Collaborate with and leverage teammates to develop targeted lists, call strategies, and messaging to drive opportunities
Utilize business and industry knowledge to research accounts, identify key players, generate interest, create/identify compelling events, and develop accounts
Work to have a variety of touches (call, email, social, etc.) on all leads in your assigned territory
Manage, track, and report on all activities and results using Salesforce
Work in collaboration with Field and Corporate Marketing to drive attendance at regional marketing events
Act as a mentor for new BDR hires in helping them navigate their key accounts
Work in collaboration with Digital Marketing to develop targeted marketing tactics against your assigned target accounts

Qualifications

Excited by the prospect of working cross-functionally with sales and different marketing departments. You'll have exposure to different departments like Sales, Marketing, Finance, Recruiting, Enablement, Engineering, etc. which will help you determine your career path at Tricentis.
Positive and energetic phone skills, excellent listening skills, strong writing skills
A self-starter with a track record of successful, credible achievements
Knowledge of business process, roles, and organizational structure
Determined personality with a desire to grow and win
Passionate about being a part of Tricentis’ journey
Proficient in using Salesforce and Salesloft (or similar products)
2+ years work experience in a professional environment
Previous tech industry experience or experience in sales development, marketing and/or sales is a plus
Outbound prospecting experience is a plus
Globally we require excellent written and spoken English which is our company language
Additional Information

We offer:
Market conform salary + success-oriented bonus
Favorable working atmosphere in a rapidly expanding company
Personal and professional development
100% coverage of medical and dental plan
401k plan
corporate travel insurance (CTI)
Variety of career opportunities and a wide range of tasks
permanent, full-time employment
If you are interested in the opportunity to become a member of Tricentis where your ideas count, apply now for immediate consideration. Tricentis is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran.

JOB DESCRIPTION
Brafton is looking for a talented consultant who has a track record of successful paid and organic YouTube campaign creation and management.
Specific to YouTube campaigns: The ideal candidate will have experience pitching and landing prospects, analyzing a client's existing strategy, ideating on an impactful campaign, executing on a successful strategy, and reporting on progress. This person should feel comfortable in a client-facing role at all points in the sales and rebuy process.
This is currently envisioned as a contract freelance/consulting position that reports to our Boston team. There's the potential for this role to turn into a full-time opportunity based on performance and business needs. This role is remote and location-independent.
It's imperative that candidates have demonstrable experience (3+ years) and SME in the following areas for both B2B and B2C clients:
YouTube Channel Optimization.
YouTube Channel & Subscriber Growth (organic and paid).
YouTube Ad Creation and Management.
YouTube Content Ideation.
Expertise in PPC is helpful but not imperative or required.
ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS
Creating and presenting compelling YouTube management proposals for interested prospects.
Successfully executing on planned YouTune campaigns/scopes of work.
Regularly reporting on results internally and externally.
Effectively collaborating with the client, account manager, project manager, social media manager, and all other Brafton stakeholders as is necessary.
KEY SUCCESS FACTORS
Strong working knowledge of:
YouTube Channel Optimization.
YouTube Channel & Subscriber Growth (organic and paid).
YouTube Ad Creation and Management.
YouTube Content Ideation.
Strong working knowledge of AdRoll, Google AdWords, Google Analytics, Google Search Console, Bing Paid Ads, and the ability to learn new software quickly.
Excellent client-facing communication skills (via phone, email, and in-person).
The ability to craft a compelling proposal.
The ability to create clear reports with a riveting ROI narrative.
Strong interdepartmental and interpersonal skills.
The ability to work at a computer during standard working hours.
Meeting scheduled and proposed deadlines.
SKILLS & REQUIREMENTS
Bachelor’s degree preferred.
Minimum 3+ years of relevant work experience
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to adapt to new software and changes in the paid environment quickly
Ability to meet deadlines
This is a 100% remote working contract role, so location is not important. Your immediate supervisor would be based out of our Boston office, however you’ll be able to operate day to day in your local time zone, but on occasion be able to adjust your schedule to cover meetings or calls with staff and clients in Australia or the UK.
As such you must be setup to operate effectively from your own work-space and be comfortable with pure remote / home-based working. Brafton’s core business is heavily remote focused - and was so well before the COVID-19 pandemic, as such the business is extremely agile and well adapted to such working practices.

Remote contractors are responsible for providing and maintaining at their own cost and expense their own computer infrastructure, internet connection and any industry-related hardware.
EQUAL OPPORTUNITY | E-VERIFY: Brafton is an Equal Opportunity employer. In addition to federal law requirements, Brafton complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, transfers, leave of absence, compensation and training.

Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States and with Brafton (i.e., H1-B visa, F-1 visa (OPT), TN visa or any other non-immigrant status).

JobTitle: (AWS) Cloud Support Analyst - East Coast / Remote
Text:
This position is 100% remote with East Coast preference.

Company Description

Established in 2006, CyberClan’ carefully selected team of experts are capable of solving

complex cyber security challenges – keeping data secure and businesses running as

usual.


CyberClan’ Global Incident Response Teams are available 24/7/365 to leap into action,

responding to all cyber-attacks with proven defensive methodology, we quickly identify,

contain, eradicate and recover from a cyber-attack. Our goal is to get businesses fully

operational as quickly as possible and to further prevent any downtown or impact to the

business operations.

Job Description

CyberClan investigates and assists clients with all types of security breaches, insider threat, unauthorized access, malicious code. Some you’ve probably read about in the news before, but many more stay hidden from the public’s eye. We receive and investigate the client’s data in a secure forensic lab environment. Because of the company growth and dynamic nature of the caseloads, we want to move these efforts to the public cloud and take full advantage of the inherent elasticity and automation capabilities.
Responsibilities

Build, support, expand our new AWS forensic lab environment based on a POC currently being conducted.
Able to assess and understand a complex requirement when it comes to business needs including application specific requirements and architecting a solution to meet those requirements.
Assist and own various application support scenarios that are used for network, application and mobile forensics, log, source code and malware analysis and reverse engineering
Continually grow and expand lab leveraging automation, devops methodologies, and infrastructure as code concepts.
Assist clients and staff with ingestion of data into the lab.
Continually update and secure environment as well assist with testing to ensure lab meets or exceeds our security demands.
Support current on-premises server and desktop footprint as migration to the public cloud progresses. This environment will be scheduled for review so strategizing a long-term solution to reflect the move to the cloud will be required.
Triage active high-stakes security events, including reviewing and applying security controls to detect, respond, prevent and remediate threats
Continually monitor and report usage to ensure costs are controlled.
Develop custom scripts, tools, or methodologies to enhance CyberClan’s incident response processes for a wide range of systems and technologies
Develop comprehensive and accurate reports of AWS activity related to Incident Response activities for both technical and executive audiences
Effectively communicate report findings and strategy to client stakeholders including technical staff, executive leadership, and any third-party stakeholders.
Assist with the scoping of new engagements using a whole lifecycle approach, guiding the CERT team from initial discovery, ingestion through to mitigation and remediation
Provide in-person and digital training to clients, stakeholders, and vendors
Research new cloud services that would be pertinent to the continued growth of the company
Knowledgeable in the Windows environment, including Windows Service and Workstation, troubleshooting and diagnosing low-level operating systems and network issues.
Ability to learn new technologies quickly.
Excellent relationship management, customer service and communication skills in variety of forms (written, live chat, conference calls, in-person).
Ability to work independently with little direct supervision and as a part of a team.
Strong hands-on working knowledge of:
Windows OS and networking protocols
Windows disk and memory forensics
Unix OS and networking protocols
Network traffic analysis
Scripting and/or programming with things like PowerShell, bash, etc
Enterprise domain and application architecture


Required qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in a technical field.
AWS certification either in DevOps or SysOps arena
5+ years of experience in a system administration or software development role
3+ years of experience building, supporting, and expanding AWS infrastructure environments.
Background or strong interest in investigating cyber-related incidents

Additional qualifications

Ability to document and explain technical details in a concise, understandable manner
Capable of completing technical tasks without supervision.
Desire to grow and expand both technical and soft skills.
Strong project management skills.
Contributing thought leader within the incident response industry.

Nice to have

Experience in a technical consulting role
Experience with CI tools such as GitHub
Translatable experience within competing cloud environments.
Hands-on experience with Penetration Testing and/or Red Teaming
Hands-on experience Security auditing and consulting

Work from your home while making a difference at the nation’s elite telephonic behavioral health organization!

Remote Crisis Counselor Positions

In these uncertain times, ProtoCall Services, a national leader in crisis intervention, assessment and access services to the behavioral health field, has successfully migrated 100% of our workforce to working fully remote. As we continue to grow our team, our employees’ health and safety remains our top priority, and our years of experience supporting a remote workforce has allowed our staff to continue taking calls from the comfort of their homes without risking themselves or their loved ones by attempting to come to the office. Our close-knit community is used to supporting each other virtually, making this a perfect opportunity for someone eager to join a team while working remotely.


Established in 1992, ProtoCall’s customers include community behavioral health providers, employee assistance programs, university counseling centers, and managed behavioral health organizations. ProtoCall answers calls on behalf of over 400 organizations who look to our call takers to provide effective and compassionate access to services 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, as coverage that they typically could not otherwise afford.


ProtoCall Services is made up of a resilient team who work around the clock to provide immediate support for those in crisis, and are located all over the country. Think of us as mental health first aid on a paramedic scale; we are telephonic first responders to people in need. We’re looking for Master's-level counselors and social workers to provide crisis counseling services to consumers nationwide. Remote workers are highly independent and technologically savvy, with a private work space available.

At ProtoCall, you will learn how to effectively navigate emergent mental health situations with confidence as one of our crisis intervention professionals. Through our rigorous 6-week training and 6-month orientation period, you will be trained at the elite level of the nation’s leading telephonic behavioral health organization. We are ProtoCall’s Crisis Counselors.


What We Look For

You must have an MSW, PsyD, or PhD in behavioral health field or M.A. or M.S. in behavioral health with a clinical practice emphasis from a program that is accredited by COAMFTE, CACREP, or CORE.

You must be licensed (limited and full LMSW/full LPC) according to the State of Georgia licensing board requirements.

We are looking for clinicians who thrive in a fast paced environment that serves people in crisis.

Our clinicians work from a brief, solution-focused model to best assist as many of our callers as possible in a first responder model, while maintaining an unfailing commitment to quality care.

We move fast, much like paramedics or ER nurses. We need folks who are able to multitask while remaining present and attuned to callers who may be in their darkest hour, and be ready to do it again the next day.

We do all of our documentation while on and between calls. That means navigating all of our systems and entering information quickly.

Crisis is 24/7/365 and so are we. We don’t do traditional schedules. Our folks thrive working full-time (32 or 40 hours) in afternoon, evening, and overnight shifts, with one weekend day required every week. Schedules are consistent.

While working from home, to maintain HIPAA compliance and focus, we ask our clinicians to have a private office space with a door, with business internet with 10mb speeds or higher, not susceptible to frequent outages. Because our systems run through the internet, it cannot be satellite or cellular hotspots. Static IP address and business class internet is required. This job is high-tech and requires multitasking.


What does an average day look like for a Remote Crisis Counselor?

Our remote call takers operate from a private home office using our telecommuting equipment, but they are strongly connected to the call center through our technology and chat system. Crisis counselors receive calls from working professionals with anxiety, college students in distress, consumers in recovery, people with thoughts of suicide, and a myriad of other mental health-related presentations. We experience all levels of acuity - from routine counseling requests to someone who is in immediate danger. During an interaction with a client, you will learn to simultaneously speak with consumers over the phone, access information on available resources, manage documentation, collaborate with colleagues for support, and guide callers to their next step…all while talking someone through a critical moment in their life. Our crisis counselors do not carry a caseload and once the immediate work is done with that caller, follow up is arranged with our partners. You will start each new work day fresh without anything left over from the previous shift. As a remote crisis counselor, you are able to work independently, troubleshoot technology, and stay in touch with supervisors and colleagues to continue contributing to the team environment.

This work will teach you to literally talk people off of ledges, help others through job or love loss, grief, loneliness, anxiety, from callers who may be children, college-aged, or retirees. We talk with people looking for recovery options, counseling, or legal services through their EAPs. Crisis is a spectrum, but our training and intervention are thorough and leading in the field. If you want to learn crisis intervention, you have come to the right place.


Benefits

Ability to work safely from home
Full benefit program that includes medical, dental, life insurance, 401k, STD/LTD and EAP services
An accrued planned time off package that earns up to 4 weeks of vacation during your first year
Professional licensure supervision stipend available, if needed.
A team-oriented culture of leading crisis intervention specialists with a supportive supervisory team and accessible CEO
Opportunities for advancement within our unique company
Company-matched student loan repayment

Job Title: Business Analyst

Job Duties:

Facilitate requirement gathering/interview sessions, synthesize requirements and put together an implementation plan for the client

Significant involvement in the analysis phases of the implementation, collecting and documenting functional requirements, and understanding and possibly re-defining business process based on the capabilities of the platform

Responsible for the creation of requirements and process documentation including functional requirements, business process requirements, technical design document, integration specifications

Configure declarative portions of applications in Force.com


Oversee quality assurance and guide the client through UAT

Identify changes to project scope

Provide full time support throughout the implementation lifecycle as a key member of the implementation team

Support the design efforts by documenting suggested data models, technical process flows, integration specifications

Primary resource responsible for all declarative configuration within Salesforce.com including security and sharing, object creation and definition, workflow and validation, approval processes, etc.

Responsible for supporting the client through User Acceptance Testing and any support for defect management during UAT process.

Telecommuting permissible from anywhere.

Job Requirements: Bachelor’s Degree or higher in Information Systems + 2 years of experience as a computer software professional.

Interested applicants should send resume to Coni Thomas-Operations Director, CodeScience Inc., 1401 Chestnut Street, Suite 100, Chattanooga, TN 37402 or coni@ codescience.com

This is a remote position.

Nestlé Coffee Partners is on a mission to elevate how our consumers experience coffee. With brands like Starbucks, Nescafe, Chameleon Cold-Brew, and Blue Bottle, our diverse product portfolio is brimming with rich and fulfilling opportunities for motivated individuals passionate about sharing their love of coffee and the moments it creates. Our Seattle office provides an inspiring and high-energy work environment that fuels our fast-paced growth, and our flexible, field-based positions across the country ensure that we’re fully immersed and positioned to pioneer the coffee market. Across our organization, we're creating a workplace where collaboration is essential, courage is rewarded, speed is expected, and agility is the norm to delight our consumers every single day. Together, we'll brew remarkable things!

Position supports clients on the East coast and can be home office based in Charlotte, NC, Boston, MA and general Northeast region (Carlisle, PA, Landover MD, Scarbourogh, ME).
Job Summary and Mission
The Category Management Analyst contributes to Nestle Coffee Partners (NCP) success by being accountable to drive NCP sales and equity, along with category growth through the delivery of best-in-class category thought leadership, insights, analysis and reporting directly to CPG customers and through our field-based Category Development partners. The Analyst will be accountable to assist in building national and cross-channel strategies to set up brands to grow disproportionately through mutually beneficial category stories, thoughtful analysis, fact-based selling stories, and best-in-class category management processes. This position also works cross functionally across the CPG team to serve as the category expert to enable better decision making across the organization through data, insights and analytics.
Summary of Key Responsibilities
Responsibilities and crucial job functions include but are not limited to the following:
Provides business insights to deliver greater share of promotion, distribution and shelving for NCP brands by identification of category trends and business opportunities to recommend solutions that benefit NCP and the customerExhibits strong understanding of multiple syndicated data sources and tools, including IRI and/or Nielsen; demonstrates a sophisticated knowledge of Microsoft Office Excel and PowerPointUses analytic tools, including internal NCP specific data and tools, to develop new department and category insightsAssists in developing new category insights through the analysis of sales fundamentals at the national and regional levels to bring the NCP experience to life down the aisleMaintains relationships with external data suppliers and partners closely with sales, marketing and shopper insights teams to understand the latest category and consumer insightsDevelops national Category Management selling strategies to deploy to the field category management teams for use with specific customersCrafts "gold standard" planograms for specific NCP categories and brandsUtilizes space management software to analyze days of supply, inventory turnover, space to sales, etc.Develops custom reporting solutions using new and existing technologies/toolsChallenges and inspires team members to achieve business resultsCollaborates with the Category Manager and Director to formulate the team's annual goal setting process; identifies strategic opportunities, analyzes and aligns activities with the team's business plans.

Summary of Experience:
Minimum of 3 years of total work experience2+ years experience in Analyst, Sales Support or Category Management roles2+ years extensive experience with working with IRI and/or Nielsen data and shelf management software
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree required
Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Understands how to analyze business trends, mine data sources to tell compelling sales stories and sell persuasivelyAbility to work cross functionally including with teams that are geographically dispersedAbility to negotiate, collaborate with others and reach win/win agreementsAbility to build diverse and collaborative relationshipsAbility to communicate clearly and concisely comfortable in a "selling" role working with the customerCan work in a fast paced, changing, matrix environment comfortable dealing with ambiguity

General Description
The successful candidate for this position will collaborate with department hiring managers on a regular basis and proactively identify future hiring needs. They will also be able to attract candidates using various sources, like job boards, social media networks, and employee referrals. Our ideal recruiter holds an academic HR background combined with work experience in screening, interviewing, and assessing candidates.
Ultimately, the responsibilities of this candidate will be to ensure our company attracts, hires, and retains the best employees while growing a strong talent pipeline and protecting the core values of our company as we grow.
This position will work closely with the HR generalist in providing the HR function of staffing to include everything from the entire recruiting life cycle, to workforce planning, job descriptions, internal transfers, recruiting events, and ATS management.
Key Responsibilities
Recruit qualified employees in a high pace, high growth environment. Provide excellent customer service to the business by filling the hiring needs of the organization through constant communication with hiring managers and the administration of the recruitment process.
Assist in the design and implementation of the overall recruiting strategy
Participate in Full Cycle Recruitment
Post openings internally and externally
Source and attract candidates by using databases, social media, etc
Screen candidate resumes and job applications
Conduct phone interviews and filter candidates for open positions
Assess applicants’ relevant knowledge, skills, soft skills, experience, and aptitudes
Administer Assessment Testing
Coordinate and participate in panel interviews
Execute background screening and reference checks
Onboard new employees in order to become fully integrated
Act as a point of contact and build influential candidate relationships during the selection process
Assist in the development and updating of job descriptions and job specifications
Perform job and task analysis to document job requirements, objectives, and pre-screening questions
Prepare recruitment materials and post jobs to appropriate job board/newspapers/colleges etc
Monitor and apply HR recruiting best practices
Provide analytical and well documented recruiting reports to the rest of the team
Promote the company's reputation as a “best place to work”. The candidate chooses us as much as we choose them.
Record Retention - assist in the creation of all employee files and Human Resources documents for new hires to ensure they are organized correctly for easy reference.
Maintain compliance with federal, state, and local employment and benefits laws and regulations in regards to hiring.
Additional requirements as assigned.
Professional Qualities
Sense of humor, ability to have fun
Unquestionable Integrity and ability to maintain strict confidentiality
Proven work experience as a Recruiter (either an in-house recruiter or a staffing agency recruiter)
Knowledge of federal and state employment laws, recruitment processes, on-boarding, and other basic HR processes.
Solid ability to conduct different types of interviews (structured, competency-based, stress, etc)
Hands-on experience with various selection processes (video interviewing, phone interviewing, reference checks, etc)
Familiarity with HR databases and Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS)
High level of computer/web literacy
Exceptional communication and consultation skills (both verbal and written)
Ability to multitask effectively and often
High Emotional Intelligence
Ability to adapt and be flexible with duties, time, priorities
Cultural Awareness
Relationship Management
Strong decision-making skills
HR Expertise
Ability to Travel Occasionally to Job Fairs and Recruitment Events
Preferred Experience
Bachelor’s degree in Business, HR, Communications or a related field preferred.
MS Office or Google Apps
Experience with Paycom and Jobvite a plus but not required.
Minimum of 1-3 years of experience in Employee Recruitment
Professional certification preferred (SHRM-CP, SHRM-SCP, PHR, SPHR).
Physical Requirements
Requires the ability to sit or stand for long periods of time, occasional stooping, and reaching; May require lifting up to 25 pounds; requires a normal range of vision and hearing with or without accommodations.
Additional Information
Cleared Background Check Required
Employment Information
Main Office is in North Charleston, SC but open to Remote Hires from TX, GA, FL, PA, OH, NC and AZ.
Benefits include health plan, dental, vision, paid time off
Flextime
401k

Imagine a world where every car with a smartphone is safer, where massive amounts of data and insights make cities safer and reduce costs for fleets. Zendrive is executing rapidly on its mission of “making all ground transportation safer using data and analytics” and is focused on building products to support the evolution of transportation.
Zendrive is looking for a Business Development Representative to play a key role as we build our sales and marketing engine to support our fast-growing business. Your primary focus will be outbound calling and email efforts to marketing-qualified leads to identify net new accounts, opportunities, and revenue.
Through great communication you will work to establish the credibility of Zendrive and our brand and make our platform top of mind for our prospective customers. You will also coordinate closely with the rest of the organization to support prospecting activities for priority accounts to secure a sufficient flow of additional qualified opportunities for the team. An ideal candidate will be a self-starter, with a high-energy, positive phone presence, and a track record of effective, credible lead follow-up and sales development at multiple levels within an organization.
This is a remote (work from home) position that can be based anywhere within the U.S.

Responsibilities
Be a self-starter and execute outreach strategies for new lead generation methods
Identify new leads by conducting thorough research and account mapping for target accounts in key market segments
Liaise with peers in the marketing and product team to create personalized messaging for Account-based Marketing campaigns
Develop nurture campaigns for cold leads and keep them engaged by sending them relevant resources
Work closely with the sales team to run regional campaigns every quarter
Continuously improve and iterate on persona-specific campaigns
Manage the introductions and follow-ups with prospects by monitoring and attending meetings with Account Executives
Bring innovative lead generation ideas to the weekly marketing team meeting
Qualifications
1-2 years in a BDR/SDR role within an Enterprise SaaS company. Mobile, Telematics, platform experience a plus
Strong autonomy over your own work cadence, and relentless persistence to follow-up with your targets
Exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal, with public speaking experience
Ability to learn new software quickly with some understanding of the Enterprise software market
Demonstrated ability to work solo as well as being a productive team member, making outbound emails/calls every day
Strong work ethic and are eager to learn and make new connections with prospects
Experience using LinkedIn Sales Navigator or other similar prospecting applications while keeping track of dead-end leads
Must be an excellent problem-solver and willing to collaborate in an exceedingly competitive environment
When we say Zendrive is an Equal Opportunity Employer, we are not just adding a legal addendum. Of course, we do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion or beliefs, national origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability, but we believe that is quite a low bar. In fact, we celebrate our differences as our strength and actively work to build an inclusive environment for all. If we can do anything to improve your application and interview process, please let us know!
To all recruitment agencies: Zendrive does not accept unsolicited resumes. Please do not forward resumes to Zendrive employees or any other company location. Zendrive is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Starting Pay: $60,000 Annually + Excellent Benefits
The District Manager is responsible for organizing, coordinating, and monitoring the activities of the Territory Service Representatives. The District Manager is also responsible for motivating and training Territory Service Representatives in such a way as to ensure that they reach established sales goals. The District Manager works with TSRs and home center associates to build and maintain a strong supplier-customer relationship in order to promote sales growth. This position requires daily travel involving the use of a company provided vehicle, therefore a good driving history is a must. A commitment to hard work, extended hours and meeting with the job’s requirements in order to maintain customer satisfaction is an expectation for this position.
Essential Functions:
This position requires that the employee perform all essential duties as assigned by the Regional District Manager which shall include the following:
Organizes, coordinates, motivates and monitors Territory Service Representatives’ activities. Compiles, maintains, and submits reports and records such as overtime, vacation, sick leave, etc. to the Director of Field Operations.
Initiates and implements plans of action for the growth of sales and service and works with the Director of Field Operations, Regional District Manager, and other office personnel to ensure that the highest level of service and sales are maintained.
Works closely with the Territory Service Representatives on store resets and displays promoting and enforcing safety policies and procedures.
Travels to customer locations, work sites, etc., to resolve any customer complaints.
Conducts interviews alongside the Regional District Manager for vacant positions utilizing the job description as the basis for qualifications required to perform the Territory Service Representative function.
Performs documented in store evaluations of assigned personnel and maintains this documentation to perform follow-up as well as lead towards positive results.
Fills in for Territory Service Representatives during vacation, illness, training classes, or any occasion when the Territory Service Representatives cannot service his/her customers.
Must be willing to travel extensively by company automobile and air. Also, must be willing and able to stay overnight when necessary. Work weekends, and holidays when necessary.

Physical Demands:
Requires ordinary conversation, hearing, and visual acuity.
Bend, squat, kneel, twist and reach repetitively.
Sit, stand, walk for prolonged periods (2 – 6 hours per day), and move about the office and customer facilities as necessary.
Repetitively lift and carry up to 75 pounds

Prospective candidates for this position must have a keen eye for merchandising and detail, self-motivated, willing to work a flexible schedule and thrive in an environment that requires working independently. Candidates must also be a strong leader that can supervise a team remotely.
Compensation and Benefits
Starting Pay: $60,000 Annually
10 paid holidays
Paid Time Off (PTO)
Other benefits include access to medical, dental, vision, life and disability starting after 90 days
401k

Overview:

OneNeck IT Solutions has an exciting and unique opportunity for an experienced Cyber Security Consultant. OneNeck offers hybrid IT solutions including cloud and hosting solutions, managed services, enterprise application management, advanced IT services, hardware and local connectivity via top-tier data centers across the country. Our technology professionals manage secure, world-class, hybrid IT infrastructures and applications for businesses around the country. Come join and add value to our team!

**Once our offices safely reopen, this position can sit in any of our OneNeck or TDS Inc. locations -OR- be full-time work-from-home. We are unable to provide sponsorship for this position and this is not a contract or contract to hire role**
Responsibilities:

The Cyber Security Consultant conducts risk and security assessment activities with our customer, including analyses of customer environments, assessment of their current state of security and level of preparedness to protect their services and data and recommendations to address any gaps determined. This critical position partners with security architects/engineers, and various program management areas to create cybersecurity recommendations, response plans, and direction for the customer(s).

Responsibilities:

Works with senior level Cyber Security Analysts to conduct in-depth analysis of customer environment:
Utilizes OneNeck defined procedures for performing audit, assessments, and data gathering.
Assesses the effectiveness of existing security controls and provide recommendations. Analyze all audit and assessment data.
Develops report of recommendations for customer remediation to fill identified gaps in security.
Works with senior Cyber Security Analysts to facilitate customer read-out of recommended cybersecurity preparedness and response posture:
Delivers report and explains findings and suggestions to customer.
Recommends operationally feasible and cost-effective solutions to reduce risk, as appropriate.
Helps facilitate review of changes in customer processes; standards and technology to ensure the effectiveness of security controls meet compliance requirements.
Reviews data flow diagrams, network, or conceptual architectural diagrams to help validate scope of most critical systems is appropriate.
Works with, and assists, customer on initiating their own self-assessments.
Executes on agreed upon methodology to identify, test, and report on control operating effectiveness. Partners with external auditors, security architects/engineers, and various program management areas.
Qualifications:

Required Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree (or higher) -OR- 4+ years professional work experience.
7+ years Information Security compliance, security engineering or architecture experience, including at least 3+ security assessment experience.
2+ years experience interfacing with customers and providing technical solutions.
Must have and maintain a valid driver’s license, insurance, and have access to reliable transportation.
Post pandemic, travel will be required per business / client needs, up to 50% may be necessary
 Other Qualifications:
Working knowledge of PCI DSS 3.2, HIPAA applicable security / privacy controls, Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) 404, ISO/IEC 27000 family of standards, NIST 800-53, NIST cybersecurity framework, and COBIT.
Training or Certifications: ISC2, SANS Institute/GIAC, CompTIA, Cisco, Palo Alto, Microsoft, VMWare, Offensive Security, PCIP.
General knowledge of common application security architecture and vulnerabilities (e.g. OWASP Top 10), attack techniques and remediation tactics/strategies.
Familiarity with common enterprise infrastructure (OS platforms, directory services, networking infrastructure, appliances, middleware, common security infrastructure)
Experience using GRC tools for security control assessment workflow and evidence gathering.
Knowledge of or experience with Rapid7, Qualys, or Tenable’s suite of assessment tools.
Strong computer skills including Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, Power Point, Project Manager, and Visio).
Project management skills. Effectively manage multiple, competing projects/priorities while achieving targeted completion results. Communicate directly to technical teams and provide network architecture layout based on solutions' performance needs.
Ability to gather relevant facts and develop and successfully pursue a business case including revenue opportunities, network diagrams and capital requirements.
Ability to effectively work with technical and non-technical resources, able to partner with multiple business groups, managers, and network architects or engineers.
Ability to stay up-to-date with the current cybersecurity threat landscape to account for changing circumstances when evaluating security risks, maintain technical proficiency via self or formal training.
#OneNeck offers a competitive salary and robust total rewards package. To learn more about this position, or our company, please visit oneneck.com.

Employment at #OneNeck is subject to post-offer, pre-employment drug testing. EEO/AA Employer/Vets/Disability.

Job Description:

Job Title: Vertica (Big Data) Business Development Representative
Job Function: Find, qualify and deliver sales leads to the sales team
Ideal Profile: Previous Software Business Development experience
Job Location: Any US City. This is a work from home opportunity.
About Vertica:
We’re the Vertica team with offices around the world, and the brains behind the analytics database that is taking the industry by storm. Our customers such as Facebook, Zynga, Uber, and others put in petabytes of data and ask whatever questions they want; it’s our job to make that easy and fast. It’s a practical twist around some tough theoretical problems. Learn more at www.vertica.com
We’re also part of Micro Focus, but we operate as an independent unit. Think of us as a mature start-up that has maintained that small-company atmosphere and hunger to achieve, while also enjoying the perks and backing of a large, stable company.
About the role:
This is a non-sales-coded role. Should be aligned to driving pipeline, new logos contacts, discovery meetings and attendance to marketing/meet & greet events and be an evangelist for new product information and updates to existing installed base clients with a view to driving field, digital sales or OEM engagement. Simple metrics to drive simplified expectations of the role. Measured by objective, owned by field leader.
Responsibilities:
Majority of work done independently and under limited supervision with priorities and metrics set up regional sales leaders
Follows up inbound leads passed from Marketing including Community Edition leads.
Owns finding and developing entry points at the customer aligned to the business objective area with a view to positioning the portfolio and finding potential upsell or new logo opportunities and contacts.
Setting up discovery meetings for Field or Digital Sales teams they support to find new qualified opportunities.
Their efforts are reflected in a growth in unqualified pipeline which moves to Field or Digital Sales for qualifications and attainment of SS3 in SFDC.
Focused on positioning and prospecting the Vertica portfolio.
Works to an assigned geography or territory supported by Vertica Field or Digital Sales as the primary quota carriers for the business. Actively participates in development of district sales strategy with Field or Digital Sales Reps.
Actively prospects within accounts to discover or cultivate sales opportunities.
Partners effectively with other teams, including third party partners and resellers where appropriate.
Assists and support marketing in securing attendees at key marketing events or local “meet & greet” sessions as determined
Experience
2-4 years experience in a customer service role with proven track record in software sales, demonstrated by the ability to under the sales process and move leads through the early stages of opportunity development.
Knowledge & Skills
Knows and understands the company sales tools and processes.
Listens to customer needs and tailors messages to customer based on their needs and ties-in additional promotional campaigns, upgrades or extended products/services
Primarily transactional sales approach
Consistently demonstrates proactive activities within accounts to uncover new business and take ownership for developing early stage opportunities.
Exhibits thorough knowledge of the portfolio, observed via customer conversations and product discussions.
Consistently meets or exceeds metrics related to the role set by the direct reporting manager

Terra Universal, a leading U.S. manufacturer of critical environment applications and distributor of lab equipment and analytical instrumentation, with over 40 years of design and fabrication experience in cleanroom and laboratory environments, seeks a full-time Sales Associate / Sales Associate to work from home.Position Overview:This is a business to business inside sales and product specialist position. JOB SUMMARY

The purpose of this position is to design and analyze reports based on the collection of data related to the sourcing, contracting, management and performance of suppliers and vendors.


ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Designs and implements reports to support account, client, and global sourcing requirements.

Maintain data integrity of databases and make changes as required to enhance accuracy, usefulness and access.

Collects and rationalizes data from multiple sources. Ensures data integrity and accuracy.

Coordinates with global souring team and peers to aggregate data align reporting.

May provide training to new and existing users of database and reports.

Other duties may be assigned


SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES

No direct supervisory responsibilities in this position. May provide informal assistance such as technical guidance, and/or training to coworkers. May coordinate and assign tasks to co-workers within a work unit and/or project.
QUALIFICATIONS

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.


Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.



EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE

Bachelor's degree in Business Administration or related field from four-year College and/or University. Minimum of three years of related experience and/or training.


Experience working with standard accounting systems reports and data feeds.

Functional knowledge of procurement practices and requirements.



CERTIFICATES and/or LICENSES

None

COMMUNICATION SKILLS

Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong organizational and analytical skills. Ability to provide efficient, timely, reliable and courteous service to customers. Ability to effectively present information.

FINANCIAL KNOWLEDGE

Requires knowledge of financial terms and principles. Ability to calculate intermediate figures such as percentages, discounts, and/or commissions. Conducts basic financial analysis.

REASONING ABILITY

Ability to comprehend, analyze, and interpret documents. Ability to solve problems involving several options in situations. Requires intermediate analytical and quantitative skills.

OTHER SKILLS and ABILITIES

Intermediate/Advanced knowledge in Microsoft Office Software. Ability to work with large amounts of data. Problem solving, mathematical analysis and knowledge of accounting preferred.

SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITY

Decisions made with understanding of procedures, company policies, and business practices to achieve general results and deadlines. Responsible for setting work unit and/or project deadlines. Errors in judgment may cause long-term impact to co-workers, supervisor, department and/or line of business.
