CollaborateMD is seeking an influential and energetic leader to be the primary point of contact for CollaborateMD users. The Customer Support Specialist is responsible for supporting and educating users on the use and functionality of our software application. This role is unscripted - no day is the same - and requires the ability to think critically, demonstrate patience, empathy, sound judgment and balanced decision-making skills.


You:
You are a self-motivated, problem solver who has exceptional customer service and technical skills. You thrive in a fast-paced, high-energy environment and can multi-task like a boss. You’re looking for a career, where you can master your craft in the healthcare-tech industry and deliver phenomenal support to healthcare professionals. If you’re someone with a knack for listening who can identify problem points and create clear and effective solutions, this may be the job for you!


Us:
CollaborateMD, an EverCommerce company, is a leader in Practice Management and Medical Billing Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) with over 1 million patient claims submitted by doctors and billers using our platform each month. Our software helps healthcare entities thrive in an increasingly complex world by offering best-in-class, affordable products that allow them to focus on what matters most - caring for patients.


EverCommerce is bringing together best-of-breed commerce solutions in the service sector, forming one service commerce platform that improves go-to-market strategy for technology companies and simplifies the software-buying process for business owners. Our ecosystem enables companies to thrive in an environment of shared knowledge and resources with significant cost savings.


Where:
CollaborateMD headquarters is located in the heart of Downtown Orlando. Our open floor plan, natural light office space delivers panoramic views of Lake Eola & the Central Business District and is home to high-energy, driven people who like to work hard and play hard. Please note that our teams are working remotely through the rest of 2020 and into 2021, so this role requires reliable internet access and the ability to set up an in-home office.


Core Responsibilities:


Maintain a positive, empathetic and professional attitude toward customers at all times.
Eagerness to quickly achieve a high level of understanding of the software and configuration options, and be able to communicate the value of these features to users.
Engage and build customer loyalty by providing fast, accurate and helpful insights to user inquiries in all of our support channels (eg, phone, messaging, email)
Initial troubleshooting of technical software and customer issues using creative-problem solving skills, seeing all problems from start to finish.
Document and manage customer interactions in our Salesforce CRM.
Stay up-to-date with the healthcare industry to be a source of reliable knowledge and education for customers and the company.
Identify trends and offer feedback to improve systems and processes to enhance customer satisfaction and engagement with our platform.
Contribute to weekly discussions within the team to creatively strategize how to improve customer education (Help Pages), training, and happiness more efficiently.
Grow CollaborateMD’s business through hard work and passion.


Must Haves:


Bachelor's Degree or 2+ years of customer service experience, preferably in healthcare or software.
Basic understanding of the healthcare industry (HIPAA, PHI, EDI, CMS, etc).
Flexible availability between the hours of 8:00 AM - 8:00 PM (EDT).
Passionate about delivering world-class customer experience in a friendly, patient and professional demeanor.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills; comfortable handling up to 15+ calls / live chats per day.
Knowledge of Salesforce or other CRMs, MS Office and Google Business Apps.
Remain cool under pressure. Things can get pretty hectic at times, so we want to make sure you keep calm and carry on through even the most stressful circumstances.
Extremely strong attention to detail, yet able to explain complex concepts in simple, friendly terms.
Able to juggle many technical and administrative tasks (multi-task), all with a sense of urgency (prioritization), simultaneously and accurately (time-management).
Be organized, ahead of schedule, communicative, and accountable. In short, own your role entirely, while being open to suggestions and new ideas.
Vibe with our culture. Ability to speak out, take initiative, and challenge the status quo, while also being a true team player. We’re talking energy, integrity, positivity, a hunger for knowledge, and a passion for sharing it.


Nice to Haves:


Knowledge of medical billing, Revenue Cycle Management and/or clinical workflow.
Familiarity with EHR/EMR systems, patient services, and our health insurance system.
Experience using CollaborateMD application!


Benefits and Perks:


Competitive salary
Robust medical benefits & 401k with match
Public Transportation reimbursement
Gym stipend
Start with 17 days of PTO, 8 standard holidays, and 2 floating holidays

Casual dress code
Company sponsored happy hours, picnics, events, and celebrations


EverCommerce is an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We look forward to reviewing your credentials and getting to know more about your experience!

Description

This is an opportunity to gain practical experience, develop professional skills, test career interests, and participate in the culture of a global company.
School Assessment is a business of Pearson that works with US national, state, and local education organizations to provide K12 student assessment solutions. The internship is for an associate market analyst on the Business Development team. This will be a valuable experience for someone interested in pursuing a career in business administration, marketing, education, or public affairs. With the mentorship of senior team members, you will have the opportunity to work on a variety projects. We will work to align your interests and field of study with projects that support current business development goals.
Duties and Responsibilities
Analyze business development goals and needs

Apply project management practices to define goal, scope, schedule, resources, and outputs

Evaluate costs and benefits of multiple actions and/or solutions and provide data-driven recommendations

Collaborate across a matrixed organization to achieve results

Attend company and industry webinars

Apply professional writing skills in developing communications, reports, and presentations

Present in small and mid-size team settings, including to members of senior leadership

Complete capstone project

Perform market research and analysis

Analyze industry marketing and sales materials

Help to develop marketing collateral, including articles and posts for social media campaigns

Work with subject matter experts to evaluate and design solutions

Support proposal development

Monitor social media channels for industry news

About Pearson
Pearson is the world’s learning company with more than 24,000 employees operating in 70 countries. We combine world-class educational content and assessment, powered by services and technology, to enable more effective teaching and personalized learning at scale. We believe that wherever learning flourishes so do people.

Up to six months

Flexible schedule with partial availability during regular business hours. Up to 25 hours a week.

Location: Remote or accessible to Pearson offices in Austin TX, Bloomington MN, Iowa City IA, or San Antonio TX

Benefits
Compensated

Practical experience with varied business activities

Acquire real-world skills like problem-solving, public speaking, and communication.

Shadowing, mentoring, and training opportunities with experienced and accomplished business professionals

Gain experience collaborating with in-person, remote, and blended teams

Use collaboration software

Experience the culture of the company through participation in global and organizational business meetings and networking events

Participate on internal social platform on initiatives and conversations focused on our mission

Learn about K12 education practices, policy, regulations, and technology

Opportunity to interact with senior leaders

The anticipated starting hourly wage for Colorado-based individuals expressing interest in this position is $20/hr . This position is not eligible to participate in an incentive program. Pearson is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer and a member of E-Verify. All qualified applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

Qualifications
Business Administration, Marketing, Education, or related major

Experience with Microsoft Office

Excellent critical thinking and problem-solving skills

Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills

POSITION OVERVIEW:
ProTrain is currently recruiting for an eager to learn and dependable Training Sales Representative with a passion for education and sales. A TSR is someone who has a nurturing and caring demeanor for assisting individuals in finding their career path and assessing the needs of potential students to acquire the knowledge, skills and abilities for their future career. The TSR will assess the needs of the potential student and client and manage the associated sales information.
This is an entry level sales position for a national level training organization that works directly with people wanting to gain the knowledge, skills and abilities to excel in today’s high demand portable/stackable and competitive job market. As a Training Sales Representative, you will have the responsibility for helping potential students in assessing what programs are best for their career goals and managing their expectations in the “Education to Employment” path that they will embark on. This position is responsible for timely execution and localization of sales activities and campaigns directed at schools and student/client leads nationwide. The main objective is matching skillsets and interests of potential students to stackable skills that will assist in the best program for the student’s future career, while assisting with various financing options. This may include assisting with ideas and activities for marketing and campaigns in several regions to attract schools and students to our educational offerings. Attention to detail and documentation is key to this position.
This is a full time, salaried, work-from-home position that can begin immediately.
What your job entails:
Learn about all program offerings, the modality in which they are offered – In classroom, Online and Live Online Synchronous offerings.
Learn about all financing options available to students, based on each client’s circumstances and schools attending.
Provide assessment and consultation to potential students to provide an affordable training solution to meet their needs for career skill goals.
Gain a complete and ongoing understanding of the training products, programs, certifications, and classes available to the prospective students/clients.
Manage the prospect database through proper procedures regarding follow-up calls, prospect status, and account ownership.
Assist students in arranging payment options, registration of classes, internships when applicable and explain any applicable lab and testing procedures and policies to students.
Be a forward-thinking sales person by making recommendations to maximize the student’s experience and effectiveness. Identify student trends for potential future corporate sales opportunities.
Provide the necessary customer service required for ongoing student/client satisfaction. Identify potential refund situations and offer recommendations for resolution to management. Where required, utilize supervisor and other available resources.
Meet minimum monthly/quarterly sales goals, as set forth by immediate supervisor.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Equally strong listening skills.
Highly customer service focused attitude.
Strong Computer skills; Excel, Outlook, Word and PowerPoint.
Customer Relationship Management tool (CRM) experience preferred, i.e., Salesforce.
Excellent multi-tasking skills.
From time to time may be called on to host seminars at a local training facility or online. Make presentations when required and follow up with prospects following the presentations.
Attend trade shows, local school events, etc., as assigned, to generate new business leads.
COMPENSATION:
$31,500 base with On-Target Earnings up to $45K based upon exceptional sales performance.
Full-time employees get 10 paid days off based on select holidays and earn another paid time off day for each full month worked.
WHAT WE OFFER:
Competitive Salary (base plus bonus earned for results)
Full-time
Work-from-Home
Professional Development
WHY PROTRAIN?
Founded in 2004, ProTrain offers quality In classroom, Online and Live Online Synchronous training. We provide a CE-Turnkey Solution and partnership opportunities for institutions of higher learning to provide programs to various verticals such as Military Tuition Assistance (TA), Military Spouses (MyCAA), Wounded Warriors, Veterans, Unemployed (WIOA), Corporate and Individuals.

ProTrain is an affordable solution for students seeking to prepare for an in-demand career that will help move them and America forward to achieve the goal of Education 2 Employment! Personal Training Assessment Managers will work with you throughout the entire process before, during and after to assist with the student’s program of study.

At ProTrain, we realize that learning is a commitment that we are all making to have a better future. Our clients’ needs (partners and students) are paramount. We are committed to your success and ours.
ProTrain is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
For more information, visit us at www.ProTrainEDU.org

Sales Representative - Securos Surgical Sales - 000025UX
MWI Animal Health, the foundation of AmerisourceBergen’s Animal Health division, understands that the health of animals and humans are intrinsically linked. We source and distribute pharmaceuticals, healthcare products, and supplies for both the companion animal and livestock markets. We have a diverse workforce who have a strong passion for what we do: We are united in our responsibility to create healthier futures.
What you will be doing
The General Surgical Sales Representative will sell Securos general instruments, sutures, headlamps & suture based products such as extracapsular products. This individual will ride along with and train MWI sales reps to support the general practice market. They will work closely with the Securos team, MWI salesforce and Riverpoint manufacturer. They will be a key contact for the Securos Trainers ( MWI reps) that Securos utilizes across the U.S.
Drive U.S. sales for the suture products, headlamps & general instruments.
Train sales reps on products and ride with them to visit customers
Provide sales activity reports, sales intelligence and customer feedback to Mgt.
Answer technical questions from customers (veterinarians and/or veterinary technicians, Territory Sales Managers, Inside Sales Repâ€™s and Key Account reps,
Develop and maintain strong professional relationships with key accounts; developing the insights to â€˜profileâ€™ their individual characteristics
Build and maintain relationships with MWI Sales Representatives and their customers.
Attends and assists with sales meetings, trade shows and training programs as needed.
Communicate with Sales/General Manager on client issues, product feedback and customer requests.
Make outbound calls to gather market data, conduct surveys, source new customers, and increase sales.
Contribute to the data base of competitive market products.
As the subject matter and product expert, attend tradeshows and visit with accounts or Representatives as needed.
Continually seek and utilize further product training, market knowledge and reference materials, to include intra-operative observations, when available.
Follow up on all outstanding customer issues or questions in a timely manner.
Support the corporate IBS systems as it relates to customer support and product searches.
What your background should look like (minimum qualifications)
Ability to provide superior customer experiences
Ability to collaborate with others and build trust and credibility.
Ability to communicate effectively both orally and in writing.
Ability to travel about 40%
Excellent interpersonal, presentation and organizational skills
Resolve client issues in a timely manner.
Keeps informed of technological advances affecting the industry; recognizes/identifies appropriate and effective technological applications for use by the company; applies internal technology to effective advantage.
Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office applications - specifically Excel, Word, and PowerPoint

What AmerisourceBergen offers
We offer competitive total rewards compensation. Our commitment to our associates includes benefit programs that are comprehensive, diverse and designed to meet the various needs across our associate population.
Healthcare for associates and eligible dependents, same-sex and domestic partners
Paid time off, including vacations and holidays
Paid volunteer time off
Life insurance and disability protection
Pet insurance
Employee Stock Purchase Program
Retirement benefits and more…
Throughout our global footprint and various business units, we take a balanced approach to the benefits we offer. Many benefits are company-paid, while others are available through associate contributions. Specific benefit offerings may vary by location, position and/or business unit.
About AmerisourceBergen
AmerisourceBergen is a publicly traded Fortune 10 global healthcare solutions company and is one of the world's largest pharmaceutical services companies. Powered by our associates around the world, we provide pharmaceutical products and business solutions that improve access to care. We operate the backbone of the healthcare supply chain. We drive the future of local care delivery. We guide medical innovations to market. We create healthier futures.

United States-Georgia-Atlanta
This is a remote position and will support a large portion of the United States. The ability to travel domestically is required.

ORGANIZATIONAL DESCRIPTIONUnder the Dream Corps Umbrella, Dream Corps TECH (formally #YesWeCode) is a national program cultivating future leaders and entrepreneurs from underrepresented backgrounds, creating a pipeline of diverse talent that will shift the culture of the tech sector. We accomplish this through our scholarship fund, our cohort training programs, and partnerships with tech and community leaders.PROGRAM DESCRIPTIONAre you looking for an exciting career in sales? How about an opportunity to break into the tech sector? Not only will Dream Corps TECH train you for this opportunity, Workday, Inc. will employ you if you put in the work! Dream Corps TECH is launching its virtual Tech Sales Training Cohort in Atlanta in partnership with Workday, Inc! By partnering with corporate and community organizations in the local area, Dream Corps TECH will provide 8 participants a unique opportunity to train and learn skills directly related to the sales role they will fill. This training onboards you into a paid 4-month internship at Workday, Inc. which can onramp you into a full-time Inside Sales position. This program is specially designed for individuals from marginalized communities willing to immerse themselves in a proven learning environment.HOW IT WORKSLEARN: Get over 300 hours of FREE technical sales skills and soft skills training, loaned equipment, and a bi-weekly stipendNETWORK: Mix and Mingle with a network of tech industry professionals and mentorsEARN: Interview and job placement with TECH Corporate PartnerBUILD: Social capital as well as a community of support in navigating the tech industryPROGRAM ELIGIBILITYBachelor Degree preferred (not required)Some sales experience preferredMust demonstrate an insatiable curiosity to learn and growth mindsetMust be able to legally work in the U.S.Must be a resident of the Greater Atlanta areaMust be available 40 hours/weekMust be available Monday – Friday, 8-weeks beginning March 1, 2021Apply at https://dreamcorps.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=31Job Types: Full-time, InternshipPay: $500.00 - $1,000.00 per monthSchedule:8 hour shiftCOVID-19 considerations:Training is 100% virtualEducation:High school or equivalent (Preferred)Work Location:Fully RemotePaid Training:YesTypical start time:9AMTypical end time:5PMThis Job Is Ideal for Someone Who Is:Dependable -- more reliable than spontaneousAdaptable/flexible -- enjoys doing work that requires frequent shifts in directionInnovative -- prefers working in unconventional ways or on tasks that require creativityCompany's website:www.thedreamcorps.usCompany's Facebook page:https://twitter.com/DreamCorpsTechCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processVirtual meetings

The volunteer role of Creative at empath worldwide is a project-based commitment for a specified time period to create and implement deliverables such as social media posts, media lists, pitches, design, branding materials, or event plans that meet the needs of our clients.Creatives can choose to commit to one-month, three-months, or six-months. After their period of commitment has completed, they can choose to extend their availability to another month, three months, or six months. These commitments will determine which client projects they work on.ResponsibilitiesCreate deliverables in an area of expertise for assigned clientReport to department Director with inquiriesWorking on preliminary audits assessing client needsQualificationsHave been enrolled in a higher institution for at least 2 years (junior standing or higher) or 1 year of relevant industry experienceAvailable to attend weekly meetings set by Agency and DirectorsHave a passion for mission-driven initiatives and agree with our core valuesBe a team player!*empath worldwide is a virtual, pro-bono, global communications agency dedicated to delivering public relations services to nonprofit organizations and small businesses that may need extra support during this time. These past few months have been difficult to navigate for both the small organizations/nonprofits and young PR professionals in their respective ways.With the COVID-19 pandemic, the economy has plummeted leaving many to sacrifice brand management and communication services. Simultaneously, the job market has also been impacted, leaving many eager graduates and students out of work.empath worldwide is a way of combining these complementary needs to have a meaningful impact on social conversations happening today. The agency will be entirely staffed by aspiring professionals, either students still in school or recent graduates. As a globally integrated agency, we will provide media relations, social media, crisis communications, virtual (for now!) event planning, and branding services to our clients.Creatives are volunteers, not employees of the organization or its clients. Creatives are not entitled to receive any compensation or any benefits from empath worldwide or its clients. Creatives further understand and agree that the Services are given on a voluntary basis and not covered under the unemployment compensation laws and are not intended to be covered by workers’ compensation laws in the present and future.Job Types: Part-time, TemporaryPay: $7.25 per hourWork Location:Fully RemoteCompany's website:empathworldwide.comCompany's Facebook page:https://www.facebook.com/Empath-Worldwide-108475864272127/

JobTitle: Practice Leader – Cloud Solutions and Integrations - Remote
Text:
Role: Practice Leader – Cloud Solutions and Integrations
At Sphere, we offer management consulting, end-to-end technology solutions, enterprise applications, software engineering, data analytics, and staff augmentation services, through onsite and remote world-class teams. Now we are looking for a Cloud Solutions and Integrations Practice Lead to join our team.
This role is for an experienced and motivated technical leader who possesses a unique balance of technical depth and strong interpersonal skills.
Responsibilities:
Accountability for the practice, including driving sales, recruiting, account management, consulting, and all operational aspects, including:
Practice Building – Drive overall growth of practice area through a combination of business development, talent management, oversight of delivery work, partner management and thought leadership.
Business Development – Lead business development activities, leveraging professional contacts for the benefit of the Company.
Team & Individual Development – Maximize team performance through an effective team approach that increases productivity and job satisfaction.
Engagement Management – Manage engagement risk, project economics including planning and budgeting, managing accounts receivable, defining deliverable content, and ensuring buy-in of proposed solutions from top management levels at the client.
Identify opportunities and sell services to both new and existing clients
Manage executive and Senior executive-level client stakeholder relationships
Work with teams to capture best practices and develop case studies and other core deliverables to build solution offerings
Participate in industry forums, events, and speaking engagements; manage production of project deliverables, budget, and presentations to client personnel and leadership
Mentor, develop, and proactively support practice capabilities per market demand
Support recruiting and on boarding of new employees and development of leaders
Qualifications
BA or BS Degree
10 years of demonstrated ability focused in engagement–based consulting experience or equivalent industry experience
Strong technical knowledge of and experience with custom software engineering and/or product engineering.
Software development experience covering a broad business base, complemented with a concentration in cloud transformation (AWS/Azure/GCP), production engineering, application integration and/or DevOps
P&L experience from a professional services organization
Demonstrated professional growth and the proven ability to work cross-functionally
Proven history of leveraging and growing existing client base; organic business development responsibilities; i.e. growing new account/clients from the ground up
Deep experience with managing people, including mentoring and leadership skills
Background in full-stack software engineering and agile delivery
Expert business operations experience (e.g., invoicing, SOW, margins, utilization)
Outstanding verbal and written communication skills to audiences of all levels including client-facing skills

Tombras, an independent, 330+ person, national full-service advertising agency is searching for an Account Supervisor in our Atlanta office.
You’ll be joining an Ad Age 2019 A-List Agency. Blurring the lines between a creative agency, a digital agency and a management consultancy, we are one of the largest and fastest growing independent agencies in North America. Our digital offering is married to the discipline and rigor of our Effie-winning strategists and Cannes Lion-winning creative directors. We are united by our philosophy: Connecting Data & Creativity for Business Results®. You’ll also be a part of a highly creative agency that has been recognized by Ad Age, Adweek, Communication Arts, Fast Company, Forbes and Fortune.
What you’ll be doing:

Develop strong client and internal agency relationships, while leading project implementation
Interface with internal agency departments and clients to monitor the status of on-going projects and ensure smooth cooperation between resources to deliver projects on time and on budget
Manage client budgets, assist with the development of client keynote presentations, analyze client marketing and sales data, measure media performance, lead internal teams in project management and prepare sales analysis spreadsheets
Schedule and participate in creative briefings and planning sessions to develop creative execution and tactics that will achieve client objectives
Manage digital jobs related to websites, mobile, online media, PPC, social media, video content, etc.
Manage traditional jobs related to television, radio, out of home and print
Coordinate with agency research department to plan and execute all types of qualitative and quantitative studies
Benchmark our clients’ competitor’s digital marketing programs weekly.
Responsible for opening jobs, tracking jobs through to completion, and reviewing and monitoring/managing budgets for all client work
Schedule and conduct status meetings with internal team and client


What you bring:

5+ years Account Management experience in a traditional or interactive advertising agency with experience working with and managing creative and production teams - national brand experience
Minimum of 1 year experience managing and mentoring a junior account staff member
Thorough understanding of creative development and production process for both traditional and interactive media-based programs
Working knowledge of Data Management Platforms (DMP) is a strong plus
Experience estimating, tracking and managing multi-phase project budgets
Exceptional time management, attention to detail, proofreading and organizational skills
Experience in assisting with the development of client presentations
Demonstrated experience in handling multiple projects and working well under pressure

Bachelor’s degree in advertising in communications or communications studies
Independent spirit
Entrepreneurial attitude
A drive for innovation


Why you’ll want to work at Tombras:

New, modern building in Buckhead
Casual dress
Highly collaborative and high-energy work environment
Competitive salaries
Benefits including health, dental, vision, life and disability insurance, 401(k) and more.
Company culture of promotions from within and an atmosphere allowing for varied and rapid career development


This position will be based remotely to start, but will ultimately be based in Atlanta.
Tombras is proud to be an equal opportunity employer dedicated to pursuing and hiring a diverse workforce.
This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change or new ones may be assigned at any time with or without notice. Job may require traveling overnight, driving long distances as required and sitting for extended periods of time with occasional walking and standing and occasionally lifting or carrying articles weighing less than 10 pounds.

Please note that visa sponsorship is not available for this position
Your Opportunity
Platform Performance is a newly formed group within the Telemetry Data Platform organization charged with end to end platform reliability and observability. The group will own observability of our platform reliability as well as platform-wide activities like commissioning and decommissioning cloud environments.
Our team is looking for an experienced manager with a passion for people, who can lead and mentor engineers as well as collaborate with multiple teams. This position will report directly to a Senior Director and is available to work from home or any New Relic office.
What You’ll Do
Lead and grow teams of software engineers that work on the observability and reliability of our data platform
Ensure the success of software projects through the planning and execution phases within and across teams
Partner closely with product management, fellow engineering managers, and key decision-makers to set up team priorities and roadmap
Mentor and develop an engineering team by holding regular coaching and career pathing conversations
Provide growth opportunities for engineers by assigning projects tailored to skill level and interests
Develop and iterate on processes and practices that keep your team focused and executing efficiently
Your Qualifications

Must-have:

2+ years of experience leading high-performing software engineering teams
Experience leading back-end teams and engineers or SRE teams
Consistent track record of delivering high-quality software in regular, iterative releases
Ability to collaborate within your own and across departments
Experience mentoring and coaching team members
Nice-to-have:

Familiarity with modern people management practices
Experience leading high-complexity projects with cross-team dependencies
Please note that visa sponsorship is not available for this position
Our Office
Our office is in the center of downtown Portland, situated in a thriving tech community in the Pacific Northwest. We enjoy easy commute access and a plethora of good eats and great coffee. We provide competitive compensation including equity and big-company benefits (medical, dental, etc.)—all while maintaining the energy, agility, and fun of a start-up.
About Us
New Relic (NYSE: NEWR) is a cloud-based platform that gives developers, engineers, operations, and management a clear view of what’s happening in today’s complex software environments. So they can find and fix problems faster, and deliver delightful experiences for their customers. That's why the world’s best engineering teams rely on New Relic to visualize, analyze, and troubleshoot their software. It’s the simplest, most powerful cloud-based observability platform, built to create more perfect software. All from one place.
Founded in 2008, we’re a global company passionate about building a culture where all employees feel a deep sense of belonging, where every ‘Relic’ can bring their whole self to work and feel supported and empowered to thrive. We’re consistently recognized as a distinguished employer and are committed to building world-class products and an award-winning culture. For more information, visit newrelic.com.
Our Hiring Process
New Relic takes seriously our stewardship of the data of our thousands of customers worldwide. In compliance with applicable law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work and to complete employment eligibility verification.
We will consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records based on individual circumstances and in accordance with applicable law including, but not limited to, the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. https://sfgov.org/olse/sites/default/files/Document/FCO%20Poster%20Set%20All%20Languages%2010%2001%2018.pdf
Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this website or directly to managers. New Relic does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes, and will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with New Relic.
New Relic is an equal opportunity employer. We eagerly seek a diverse applicant pool and hire without regard to race, color, gender identity, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, physical abilities (or disability), age, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
Interested in the details of our privacy policy? Read more here: https://newrelic.com/termsandconditions/applicant-privacy-policy

This is a remote U.S. opportunity

Position overview

We are looking for a successful Account Executive to sell ecommerce solutions into grocery accounts across North America. Experience in ecommerce sales to grocers is preferred.


What you'll be doing

Build specific territory and account plans to ensure growth of the ThryveAI business and exceed revenue targets.
Continually drive sales pipeline growth needed to exceed quarterly and annual sales targets.
Develop strong relationships as a trusted advisor to customers, understanding their business initiatives and challenges that align with ThryveAI solutions.
Make the customers successful by understanding their technology footprint, strategies, competitors and industry trends.
Advance and close sales opportunities through the successful execution of the territory and opportunity plans.
Lead a team of sales resources and provide engagement excellence during all phases of the sales cycle.
Present ThryveAI’s solutions in a professional and compelling manner.
Understand the competition and effectively position solutions against them to meet or exceed customer needs.
Understand Value-Based selling while identifying ROI data and how they support the customer’s decision-making process and criteria.
Maximize the value of your sales support ecosystem and ensure your team is well positioned within each account and opportunity.


What you bring to the table

Required

3+ years software sales experience with documented success selling enterprise-level, complex software solutions.
Previous experience in enterprise selling to accounts $500M annual revenue and above.
SaaS sales experience.
Previous attainments of >$1M annual software sales and above.
Experience in a team-based selling environment.
Exceptional presentation, facilitation, communication and negotiation skills.
Bachelor’s degree preferred with equivalent experience to be considered.


About ThyrveAI
ThryveAI is a brand of Mi9 Retail, a leading provider of enterprise retail and industry-focused digital commerce software. ThryveAI builds on the company's years of experience providing cutting-edge e-commerce solutions to the world's largest grocery retailers. ThryveAI software is modular, scalable, and intelligent, enabling retailers to deliver digital storefronts, optimized fulfillment, and personalized shopper experiences to grow their businesses profitably. Our mission is to help our customers fulfill their potential while future-proofing their businesses so they can Thryve in any environment.

Must be legally authorized to work without visa sponsorship for employment.

Mi9 Retail is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

No phone calls please.

Mi9 Retail participates in e-Verify for all positions based in our US offices. For more information, please click here (English| Español).

Description
SHIFT: Day Job

SCHEDULE: Full-time

Your Talent. Our Vision. At Anthem, Inc., it’s a powerful combination, and the foundation upon which we’re creating greater care for our members, greater value for our customers, and greater health for our communities. Join us and together we will drive the future of health care.
This is an exceptional opportunity to do innovative work that means more to you and those we serve at one of America's leading health benefits companies and a Fortune Top 50 Company.
Title: Advanced Analytics Consultant
Status: Work at Home, Full-time, Salary, Bonus Potential
Preferred Locations: Atlanta, GA or Chicago, IL - (Other locations will be considered)- must live within 40 miles of the Anthem Office.
The Advanced Analytics Consultant employs advanced analytics to gain critical insights into member behavior drivers and preferences, product/program concepts and value propositions, operational effectiveness and efficiencies, client specific health gaps and needs. Consults business leaders and internal partners to apply the insights to test and drive product innovation and enhancement, to target the right members for the right service, to measure program outcome and demonstrate value, to help win and retain clients, and to support information based strategic decision making.
Primary duties may include, but are not limited to:
Provides analytical insights to support business solution development based on quality, use, cost and other key drivers;
Develops and refines analysis templates for problem diagnosis and opportunities assessment;
Consults on all considerations related to designing and executing tests or pilot programs; contributes to the design of new program/initiative based on test/pilot outcomes;
Develops targeting criteria or customer segmentation based on analytical insights, clinical inputs, product design and operations considerations;
Develops predictive models and other tools that help target the right members;
Develops methodology to measure clinical, utilization and financial outcomes of a program/initiative;
Conducts in-depth research to address challenging issues in measuring outcomes; leads applied research projects; authors white papers, presents at industry conferences and submits journal publications.
Addresses limitation of certain data sources and evaluates incremental value of new data sources.

Qualifications
Graduate-level degree with concentration in a quantitative discipline such as Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Epidemiology, Engineering, Computer Science or Operations Research
PhD preferred
5-10 years’ experience in related health care analytics; or any combination of education and experience, which would provide an equivalent background.
Experience with developing expert modeling system for segmentation/stratification that supports customized strategies for different customer segments in a major industry highly desirable - healthcare, financial, database/direct marketing, online retails, consulting, etc. Substantial analytical experience in healthcare industry preferred.
Advanced expertise with SAS or equivalents analytical tools comprehensive experience with Teradata, SQL, or equivalent data base tools.
Anthem, Inc. is ranked as one of America’s Most Admired Companies among health insurers by Fortune magazine and has been named a 2019 Best Employers for Diversity by Forbes. JobTitle: Manager, ESG Reporting - Opportunity for Working Remotely Atlanta, GA
Text:
Job Title: Manager, ESG Reporting
Role Location: USA, Remote office
Reports to: Director, Sustainability & ESG
Job description
VMware’s Environmental, Social & Governance (ESG) sits in the Office of the CTO. The ESG Office oversees and manages all ESG reporting, ratings and rankings. The Office facilitates ESG Steering Committees at the management and executive levels, as well as leads on VMware’s 2030 Agenda.
The position will lead and manage all of VMware’s ESG reporting. This role is both strategic and pragmatic; requiring that we execute on our annual reporting commitments, as well as continue to mature our reporting processes and outputs. You will be responsible for evolving VMware’s sustainability/ESG reporting and supporting in the development of meaningful public disclosure strategies. You will be responsible for gathering data and information, shaping and developing our sustainability stories, and translating key sustainability messages into mediums for different target audiences (e.g., investors, customers, employees, etc.).
Key responsibilities include:
Annual reporting & assessments
Manage, oversee and complete VMware’s ESG Indicators & Metrics
Manage, oversee and complete VMware’s Global Impact/ESG Report
Manage, oversee and complete CDP’s Climate response
Support Finance with ESG disclosures in Form 10-K
Respond to key ESG surveys, inquiries and ratings agencies (DJSI, EcoVadis, MSCI, JUST and others) and perform ongoing due diligence and regular monitoring of VMware’s ESG scores.
Support Investor Relations for all investor and board reporting of ESG including materials, reports, and presentations.
Continue to deepen alignment with GRI, SASB and TCFD
Partner with risk management and finance on TCFD
Lead on future materiality assessments
Build relationships across functions and business units to enable opportunities for improvement
ESG communications expert
Ensure ESG reporting and monitoring communication is aligned with VMware’s strategy, brand and purpose.
Play a leadership role in partnering with Marketing and Communications to develop communication strategies for internal and external stakeholders.
Drive internal and external communication and reputation of ESG progress, leveraging external partners, ESG awards, and other influencer initiatives.
Key requirements
5+ years of experience as a sustainability/ESG practitioner, with direct experience leading sustainability reporting projects.
Skilled at leading and managing without authority.
Ability to work at and navigate all levels of an organization, driving decisions and direction through influence, including executive and senior business stakeholders.
Highly organized with strong project management skills.
Strong interpersonal skills, with ability to lead complex stakeholder processes.
Strong execution skills, with ability to work independently while pursuing organizational and team goals.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills; with demonstrated experience presenting to large, high-profile audiences.
Bachelor’s degree (advanced degree preferred) or equivalent experience

Category : Business Strategy and Operations
Subcategory: Project Management
Experience: Manager and Professional
Full Time/ Part Time: Full Time
Posted Date: 2021-02-03
VMware Company Overview: At VMware, we believe that software has the power to unlock new opportunities for people and our planet. We look beyond the barriers of compromise to engineer new ways to make technologies work together seamlessly. Our cloud, mobility, and security software form a flexible, consistent digital foundation for securely delivering the apps, services and experiences that are transforming business innovation around the globe. At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Shape what’s possible today at http://careers.vmware.com.

Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. is the world leader in serving science, with annual revenue exceeding $25 billion. Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Whether our customers are accelerating life sciences research, solving complex analytical challenges, improving patient diagnostics and therapies or increasing productivity in their laboratories, we are here to support them.

Location / Division

Rochester, NY or Remote U.S. / Laboratory Products

How will you make an impact?

If bringing new products to life excites you, then read on to learn more about the Program Manager role in our Laboratory Plastics Essentials group. The position of Program Manager provides an exciting opportunity for an experienced, highly motivated individual. The role is accountable for delivering to budget, scope, timeline and quality commitments established for development of liquid handling equipment and plastic consumables.

The successful candidate will be expected to demonstrate exceptional facilitation, organizational, communication, and influencing skills. They must also have a proven track record in managing a range of complex, high-impact projects simultaneously.

What will you do?

Leads project core teams
Collaborates with team members to develop detailed project plans (scope, milestones, roles & responsibilities, timing, budget, communication and interface with any external alliance or collaborator partner organizations, etc.)
Oversees and prepares project team budget including resources and costs, collaborating with Finance and other cross-functional departments
Communicates, documents and archives project team activities and decisions
Acts as primary contact for project team related information
Facilitates project team meetings, cross-functional communication and decision making, ensuring alignment with internal and external stakeholders
Manages projects within established scope, schedule, resources and budget
Identifies any program-related issues, concerns or challenges proactively
Facilitates tradeoff decisions and removes obstacles
Conducts proactive risk management: communication of needs, mitigation plans, and requirements relevant to internal/external stakeholders
Reviews project team progress regularly and uses processes, tools and other related resources to ensure effective team dynamics and decision-making, as well as effective interactions with all internal and external collaborators
Builds high morale and team commitments to goals and objectives by creating a compelling sense of common purpose and direction
Acts with a sense of urgency

How will you get here?

Education

BS in business, engineering or science discipline
Experience
5 years multi-disciplinary knowledge of the life sciences or biomedical industry
3 years direct project management
Proficient with project management principles (e.g., resource allocation, cost estimation, risks analysis).
Proficient with project management tools and applications software to manage complex project timelines and resources

Knowledge, Skills, Abilities
Persistence to overcome project obstacles and drive work to completion
Courage to make issues transparent to all levels of leadership, drive consensus and forge solutions
Management of concerns and conflicts productively and effectively within core and extended teams
Comfort with ambiguity and uncertainty
Interpersonal savvy that enables the formation of strong and trusting relationships with customers and key stakeholders
Business acumen to translate strategy into action
Results and detail-oriented; self-motivated
Outstanding orientation to teamwork and works collaboratively
Financial acumen; capable of planning and oversight of project budgets and product valuations; understanding of portfolio management concepts.
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills; able to effectively articulate complex concepts and ideas to broad audiences.
Strong presentation skills; highly effective at summarizing and presenting decision points and key considerations.
Strong influencing skills; proven ability to get things done without formal authority.
Strong negotiation skills; can effectively drive discussions and decisions toward desired results.
Proficient with Microsoft Office applications (Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Visio, Project).
Ability to travel 10-20% (majority of which would be within the United States)

Preferred Qualifications
Professional Project Management (e.g. certified by PMI®, Program Management Institute)

Our global team of more than 75,000 colleagues delivers an unrivaled combination of innovative technologies, purchasing convenience and pharmaceutical services through our industry-leading brands, including Thermo Scientific, Applied Biosystems, Invitrogen, Fisher Scientific, Unity Lab Services and Patheon. For more information, please visit www.thermofisher.com

JobTitle: Retail Edge Activation Manager- South East Region
Text:
Retail Edge Activation Manager- South East Region

Location: 123 Anywhere, , Georgia 99999
Department: Marketing

Description
Job Summary:

Develop and direct the company's efforts to affect positive change in marketing, merchandising, training, and instore experience (Retail Edge) to improve overall business growth and expand relationships with customers while developing a strategic plan to continue development and implementation of the Retail Edge program. Mentor and collaborate with sales representatives in the field while supporting the Regional Sales Director (RSD) they are assigned. This is a remote role and can reside from any location in the region.


Essential Duties, Responsibilities, and Key Results Area:

Conduct internal Retail Edge trainings with the objective to elevate Regional Sales team proficiency in a measurable way:

Set Retail Edge competencies goals with FSM, RSD, and Retail Edge Activation Director (READ).
Provide end of the year Retail Edge review on Account Managers accomplishments to FSM, RSD, and READ.
Coaches and mentors Account Managers on integral Retail Edge best practices and performance objectives.
Assess the level of Retail Edge competency of each Account Manager and work to address areas of opportunities.
Lead training and implementing Retail Edge certification within the Region .
This requires a strong adherence to EASI principles & adult learning principles, a different skill outside of business acumen.
Tracking and measuring capability of the regional team's RE expertise (example: SAT performance YOY)
Provide feedback on Account Manager performance of Retail Edge deployment to FSM, RSD, and READ.
Work with Retail Edge solution owners to customize content to meet Regional needs & priorities.
Participate in Regional staff calls and Regional leadership calls.

Conduct external Retail Edge Meetings with the objective to elevate Regional Sale team performance in a measurable way:

Ride along with Account Manager for customer-facing meetings on a regular schedule to present and improve the sales effectiveness of the Regions Retail Edge strategies
Interfaces with multiple retailer business functions.
Focused on the largest regional accounts which are not currently being captured by dedicated CMM support or their account prioritization and planning scope. Role contributions within these accounts include presentations, meeting participation, Retail Edge project management, etc. REAM supports how to present insights and sell-in solutions and create plans to implement.
REAM supports how to present insights and sell-in solutions and create plans to implement.
Ride along with Account Managers for a day of development (this should be linked to a customer ride along)
Design Co-marketing strategies with top accounts which are presently not being managed by our Customer Marketing Managers (CMM's) using hybrid or customized toolkits.
Measuring account level results and capturing best practices based on KPIs set by the FSM, RSD, READ & Retail Edge stakeholders.
Sets performance goals for Region team and individuals with consultation and approval from FSM, RSD & READ.
Support Region to attain sales and profit goals each year.
Responsible for growing region revenue, profit, margin, share to achieve budgeted goals.
Analyze sales history, provide insights and articulate drivers in variance between sales and forecast to support top projects
Present monthly to FSM, RSD and READ on analysis, insights, wins, obstacles, and best practices.
Develop an annual plan on the page for key Retail Edge initiatives that benefit and complement Regional strategies.
Develop annual Regional marketing plan in collaboration with CMM, FSM, RSD, and READ.
Actively provide Retail Edge stakeholders recommendations for improvements & optimization of current and future tools.
Voice of field and retailers in creating content for Retail Edge program
Leverage shopper, customer, and category insights to create and deploy comprehensive (annual) marketing, merchandising, training, and in-store plans for assigned customers.
Strong thought leadership in creating advertising strategies and creative that builds the Tempur Sealy brands and customer's brand.
Collaborate with brand management, consumer marketing, and sales to ensure alignment of brand objectives.
Interfaces with various internal company business departments.
Cross-functional expertise with Retail Edge vendors to facilitate Regional wins.

Other primary duties and responsibilities include the following; however, Management reserves the right to assign or reassign other appropriate duties to this job at any time. This document excludes the marginal functions of the position that are incidental to the performance of fundamental job duties.

Requirements
Ideal Candidate Possesses These Attributes:

Strong strategic thinker with the proven ability to develop and activate breakthrough solutions.
Strong Marketing generalist with proven ability to manage, motivate & lead people and process.
Compelling story teller that's able to influence the organization @ multiple levels.
Demonstrates the ability to apply macro trends, insights, channel, competition and industry knowledge to influence key stakeholders.
Has highly developed project, vendor management and multi-tasking skills.
High business acumen & strong analytical skills. Must be able to understand basic P&L structures
Organized, good communication skills both orally and in writing
Ability to multi-task and run multiple projects in a fast-paced work environment.
Solid understanding of retail channel dynamics.
Solid working knowledge of digital marketing channels.
A passionate ambassador for the brand with the ability to convey the corporate message (vision and strategy) convincingly to the customer
Unwavering personal integrity and ability to build relationships based on trust and respect
A player coach who can clearly articulate a vision and ensure its implementation
Ability to build strong collaborative relationships internally across multiple functions and externally with customers and vendors
Process and solution oriented, keeps the long term in the forefront while solving for the short term
Creative and capable of taking smart risks to enhance standards.
Ability to execute a concept and scale it across a Region

Internal and External Interfaces:

Member of the Sales organization

Reports to: Retail Edge Director
Direct Reports: indirect influence for Field Sales Consultants, Territory Sales Managers and Key Account Managers.

Internal Partners

Marketing
Product Development
Category Management
Customer Service

External Partners

Retailers
Vendors

Qualifications:

3+ years of sales or marketing experience
Strong foundational level of marketing understanding, knowledge, and capability
Strategic and executional expertise
Proven success at managing account relationship
Executive presence
Strong business acumen
Organized and results-oriented
Passionate about Retail Edge program

To perform this job successfully, the employee must be capable of performing each essential duty and responsibility satisfactorily. The requirements herein are the minimum levels of knowledge, skills, and/or abilities required.


Training/Equipment:

Athena and/or Business Objects

Work Environment/Physical Requirements: This role is a field position based in the employee's residential home office. Regular, high volume travel may be required to build customer relationships in a retail-focused environment. Customer interaction is expected to mirror regular and customary "retail" hours of operation. Some stress may occur due to the fast-paced, change-oriented, results driven organization.


The work environment and physical demands characteristics are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential duties, responsibilities, and key results of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential duties, responsibilities, and key results outlined herein.

Tempur Sealy is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibit discrimination and harassment of any type based upon race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

JobTitle: Tanzu Labs Sales Executive - Opportunity for Working Remotely Atlanta, GA
Text:
Ready to build? So are we. Come join VMware’s new exciting Modern Applications Platform Business Unit (MAPBU), made up of products and services under the Tanzu portfolio to help customers build, run and manage their most important applications. We build applications with velocity to run in a cloud-native environment, run open-source Kubernetes with consistency, and manage our customers’ entire footprint with confidence to help them achieve their business outcomes.

You

You are a high-energy, services sales professional who can identify and strategically consult with customers on our Tanzu Labs Services (fka Pivotal Labs) and Tanzu product opportunities. You are expected to generate net new business as well as maintain and grow relationships with existing accounts working in conjunction with other VMware Sales Executives, Office Directors and Platform Architects. You have broad responsibility for the overall health and sales performance of a growing territory of defined accounts. Come to a dynamic team who works to challenge each other and continuously learn.
Us

Tanzu Labs has a unique opportunity to help some of the biggest brands in major industries create new digital experiences and rediscover the power of software by using our Tanzu Labs Services and our Tanzu portfolio of modern application platforms. Our team is growing rapidly as we are seeing a huge increase in demand from clients who are transforming their software delivery capability and building cloud-native applications to drive customer engagement.

Your Day

Interacting with C-Level and VP-Level Executives, you will be driving the digital transformation strategy for our Enterprise customers. You will be charged with identifying and collaborating on the Pivotal Labs implementation plans for our customers journeys with VMWare. Each customer may have a different entry point for their journey with Tanzu and Labs, but you will play a central role in developing the plan to help our customers drive the outcomes they desire and gain the most benefit from our process and software.

Role Responsibilities
Work with other VMware Sales Executives, Office Directors and Platform Architects to drive the Tanzu Labs Services value proposition into our Enterprise accounts
Assist in the preparation of pre-work, scoping and contracts for Tanzu Labs Services engagements
Consult with C-level executives to develop and implement an effective enterprise wide strategy that maximizes the value delivered by our products and services
New logo acquisition/working with existing customers to introduce and expand our application and platform services within your assigned market territory
Forecast revenues timely and accurately; Increase revenue/ retention rates for specified key accounts
Represent VMware with integrity, maintain an industry credibility, prospect for new business, and establish and strengthen relationships through presenting to various audiences

Required Skills / Experiences
Consistent high performance against sales quotas driven by C-Level and VP level relationships at key customer contact
Experience using a consultative or advisory based sales approach in a complex enterprise sales environment
Ideally have experience selling into State & Local government entities in the US
Innovative and creative thinker who can work independently and leverage resources wisely to meet objectives
Experience with Agile Methodologies and Application Lifecycle Development Processes in large enterprises
First-hand experience selling Software Development consultants and/or Cloud Application consulting
Partner / Systems Integrator management skills
Proven ability to assess and disqualify customers/opportunities under minimum guidance and high pressure
Driven to assist customers in making the right decisions which will drive the optimal outcomes - even if it results in elongating the sales cycle
Values and practices empathy with a high degree of emotional intelligence
Bonus: we are actively looking to bring on new leadership who is passionate about creating diverse and inclusive communities
If you are passionate about this opportunity but don’t meet 100% of the requirements, we encourage you to apply.
This position is eligible for TanzuChallenge referral campaign

GuidePoint Security provides trusted cybersecurity expertise, solutions and services that help organizations make better decisions and minimize risk. By taking a three-tiered, holistic approach for evaluating security posture and ecosystems, GuidePoint enables some of the nation’s top organizations, such as Fortune 500 companies and U.S. government agencies, to identify threats, optimize resources and integrate best-fit solutions that mitigate risk.

As a member of the Proposal Support Group (PSG), the Proposal Manager will be an integral part of our growing team and organization. This highly-visible position will be involved in all phases of the proposal development process, with critical responsibility for assisting in the production of high-quality proposals, while ensuring on-schedule proposal production and submission.

The Proposal Manager will work collaboratively with the proposal team members to produce large volumes of work with consistent quality. The Proposal Manager will assist the team by evaluating government and commercial solicitations; conducting bid/no-bid meetings; developing compliance matrices and proposal schedules; monitoring RFx amendments and conveying changes to response team; gathering vendor questions and distributing client responses; revising schedules, outlines, and matrices, as necessary; creating RFx response shells; customizing boilerplate verbiage; working with Subject Matter Experts to create custom content; editing and formatting responses; coordinating proposal reviews; communicating response statuses; and working closely with the team to produce compelling, compliant proposals.

Required Skills
Extreme attention to detail and dedication to producing high-quality proposals
Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience

Minimum of five (5) years of experience in all phases of the proposal development lifecycle
Minimum of five (5) years of experience in professional writing, editing, and proofreading, with proven ability to write with clarity and conciseness, using proper grammar, word usage, and sentence structure. Successful candidates will be required to pass a writing test.
Technical aptitude and familiarity with IT terminology and basic concepts
Flexibility and aptitude to work in a fast-paced, demanding, deadline-driven environment

Ability to communicate effectively with geographically dispersed teams and executive and senior-level personnel
Strong organizational skills with the ability to multi-task, prioritize, and manage multiple projects simultaneously
Self-motivated with the ability to work both alone and in a team environment
Ability to thrive in stressful conditions and handle challenging situations, such as unpredictable, last-minute changes and stringent deadlines
Positive attitude with a great sense of humor
Advanced Microsoft Word skills and experience using Excel, Visio, and Adobe Acrobat Professional
Ability to read carefully and comprehensively and follow instructions closely

Preferred Skills
Bachelor's degree with concentration in English or in technical or business writing

Proficiency in cybersecurity and/or information technology
Extensive experience in responding to federal RFPs
Experience working in a remote environment
Entrepreneurial mindset with experience working for small, fast-growing companies
Experience using RFPio (or similar proposal management software), ServiceNow, Salesforce, and/or OpenAir
Fan of the Oxford comma


Why GuidePoint?
GuidePoint Security is a rapidly growing, profitable, privately-held value added reseller that focuses exclusively on Information Security. Since its inception in 2011, GuidePoint has grown to over 400 employees, established strategic partnerships with leading security vendors, and serves as a trusted advisor to more than 1,000 clients.
Firmly-defined core values drive all aspects of the business, which have been paramount to the company’s success and establishment of an enjoyable workplace atmosphere. At GuidePoint, your colleagues are knowledgeable, skilled, and experienced and will seek to collaborate and provide mentorship and guidance at every opportunity.
This is a unique and rare opportunity to grow your career along with one of the fastest growing companies in the nation.
 Some added perks….
MacBook Air or Pro
Healthy mobile phone and home internet allowance
100% employer-paid medical and dental with generous employer family contributions
Eligibility for retirement plan after 2 months at open enrollment
Equal Opportunity Employer

In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.

Latest C++ / Visual Studio 2019

Minimum 3-5 years teaching experience
Teaching certification preferred
Minimum 3 years in related field of study
Must adhere to weekly class schedule

WHAT WE OFFER:
Competitive Salary
Flexible, Part-time hours
Faculty Development
Equal Opportunity Employer

WHY PROTRAIN?
Founded in 2004, ProTrain offers quality classroom and online training. We provide a CE-Turnkey Solution and partnership opportunities for institutions of higher learning to provide programs to various verticals such as Military Tuition Assistance (TA), Military Spouses (MyCAA), Wounded Warriors, Veterans, Unemployed (WIA), Corporate and Individuals.

ProTrain is an affordable solution for students seeking to prepare for an in-demand career that will help move them and America forward to achieve the goal of Education 2 Employment! Personal Training Assessment Managers will work with you throughout the entire process before, during and after to assist with the student’s program of study.

At ProTrain, we realize that learning is a commitment that we are all making to have a better future. Our clients’ needs (partners and students) are paramount. We are committed to your success and ours, one student at a time.
ProTrain is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

First Help Financial (FHF) is one of the fastest growing companies in the US. We help first-time buyers get a car by offering flexible financing options and native-language support. Our mission is to help overlooked consumers get access to financing and make smart financial decisions. Through flexible financing options and tri-lingual support, we offer consumers an easier way to finance their first car. From our Boston and Phoenix offices, we lend to and support our portfolio which has consistently grown 35% each year over the last five years. Our exponential growth also comes with financial stability as a company.
Here you will find hard-working coworkers that are experts in their jobs and dedicated to their customers. We hold ourselves to the highest standards of professionalism but also enjoy work with benefits that are geared towards making you successful in life and comfortable at work.

Your Title: Business Development Representative

Your Location: Atlanta, Georgia

You Report To: Regional Sales Manager

About the Opportunity:

We are seeking a highly motivated sales professional to serve as a Business Development Representative as we expand throughout the Atlanta, GA area. You should possess exceptional interpersonal communication skills and enjoy working in a competitive environment.
You will be the sole, key driver for growth in the state of Georgia achieving FHF's growth ambitions. You will have dynamic responsibilities that include developing new and old auto dealership business relationships, educate dealers on our services and driving quality auto loan volume through them.
This is a full-time work from home opportunity where you are the single manager of a business geography. If you do not aspire to the typical 9-5 job but enjoy meeting and dining business clients 40+ hours a week then this is an opportunity for YOU. This opportunity reimburses you for your extensive car travel within your designated geography. You will be available to manage your accounts via phone/text/email outside of traditional working hours.

Requirements
What you Bring:
Spanish fluency
High level of independence; detail-conscious and task-oriented mindset
Excellent consultative selling skills
Prospecting, planning, presenting and closing skills
Initiative, sense of urgency and passion for winning
Strong interpersonal and teamwork skills
Ability to develop and maintain effective relationships, including cold calling
Strong problem-solving skills and capacity to manage difficult relationship situations
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Strong computer skills (knowledge of Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and Word)
Bachelor's Degree
Benefits
This opportunity comes with a generous base salary, monthly bonus, medical/dental/vision insurance (among other health and welfare benefits) and a company match to your retirement plan!
Diversity and Inclusion
FHF is committed to building a culture that respects and embraces all walks of life, inclusive of all genders, race, culture, sexual orientation, age, and other identities. We will make accommodations when interviewing anyone with special needs.
About FHF…
Great Perks – We offer generous salaries, competitive health and welfare benefits, paid vacation, 401(k) match, tuition reimbursement
Culture - We are believers in maintaining a healthy work-life balance. While we work hard and care deeply about our customers and partners, we want our team to have room for their family, friends and themselves. Finally, we care deeply about ensuring every employee personal growth, so we engage each employee to build a career plan that benefits everyone.
