Hargray’ s Mission – To Envision and deliver customer delight
Are you passionate about making a difference in people’s lives? Are you motivated to learn and connect people with cutting edge technology? Do you go the extra mile to provide customer delight?
Do you enjoy a fast-paced work environment where time flies, juggling multiple priorities? Then you should join the Hargray Communications team as a Video Programming Manager!
The Video Programming Manager is responsible for all aspects of the video content strategy, reporting and remittance, and programmer relationship management. Works closely with the Senior Video Product Manager and the senior leadership to align the video programming portfolio with strategic business goals while managing/ coordinating the efforts of cross-functional teams – including Network Engineering, IT, Sales, Marketing, Finance, Legal, etc. – to bring new products and product enhancements to market. Ensures compliance with contractual obligations and reporting requirements.
The job location will be Hilton Head Island, SC. We are also open to considering remote candidates willing to travel to SC based on the project needs.
Duties & Responsibilities:
Develops and maintains Hargray’s long term video content strategy and roadmap
Manages the daily functions related to video programming, including linear services, on-demand, PPV, and OTT offerings
Develops/Manages/Maintains channel lineups for all markets leading the implementation of any channel lineup changes (i.e., new channel launches and removals)
Manages, tracks, and reports on monthly expenses and subscriber variances; assists in the budgeting process and monthly forecasting
Manages programmer relationships and responds to programmer inquiries
Assists with preparation for subscriber audits and settling contract/ invoice disputes
Leads all aspects of contract negotiation (financial analysis and forecasting, contract drafting, security requirements, amendments)
Manages and tracks revenue from advertising sales, upsell programs, VOD/PPV
Guides product pricing and content strategy by monitoring industry trends and developing competitive market analysis
Provides thought leadership and technical/development expertise for price adjustments and new product development.
Manages content change implementation, including project plan creation, project risk assessment and mitigation, issue tracking, and resolution
Works with Finance to create financial analysis and supporting business cases to determine market requirements relative to product price points, new bundles, and new features.
Evaluates and modifies business processes and procedures to improve efficiency, reduce expenses, optimize profitability, and maintain budget adherence
Job Requirements
Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
5+ years of experience in the telecommunications/cable/satellite TV industry
3+ years of experience in a similar role
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Familiar with intermediate to advanced functions with Microsoft Excel
EOE/ Disability

Job Description for Sidehill ConsultingOpportunity and ImpactSidehill Consulting is looking for a valuable 100% commission sales representative to join our team! We are looking to expand exponentially this year with an outside sales team who share our drive and motivation as well as our desire to serve our customers with the highest level of service.We are creating our 100% commission outside sales team who can work from anywhere in the world...We invite you to apply.We're growing like crazy and we need motivated and driven, take-charge salespeople to expand on this success.Our 100% commission-based team has a very clear and realistic path to make $100K+ per year ($80K+ in your first year); with a product that almost sells itself. This salesperson model has been created by life-long salespeople, not a CPA or CFO. Together, our team carefully crafted this role and designed it based on creating “the dream” sales role that you’d want to stay in forever.Our #1 goal for you as a salesperson is to help you live your ideal life, including:Uncapped Earning Potential- We want you to make so much money you don’t know what to do with it.Time Freedom- You need to have time to enjoy your financial freedom. What good does it do to make a bunch of money but have no time to enjoy life?Flexibility- We don’t believe in sales managers… We believe in mentors!!! You will have your own performance coach, accountability coach and onboarding specialist who will be there to support you as you grow. Get things done on your schedule… no more punching a clock.Industry and CompanyMany companies struggle with consistency in their revenue & sales. We uncover what’s broken and fix the infrastructure issues so your sales systems work and your revenue grows reliably. Each member of our fulfillment team has at least 25 years of successful sales experience (15+ years of C level leadership).We guide organizations to more rapid growth, breaking stagnant or erratic sales cycles, and achieving more consistency in new revenue.We have a ridiculous amount of support for our sales team including:Personal and group coaching… designed to take your skills and abilities to the next level.Technology tools and automation created to allow you to get rid of the mundane, repetitive tasks that bog down most salespeople.The time to dominate this market segment is now, and it’s time for you to come and show off what you can accomplish!Key ResponsibilitiesRespond in a timely manner to all leads.Initiate outbound efforts (call, text, email) each day to prospects.Qualify prospects, gauge interest, and schedule sales calls.Collaborate with the team on improving prospecting strategies.Ability to identify & source information on prospective clients.QualificationsStrong company culture fitAbility to receive inbound and make outbound phone calls via cell or internet (wired ethernet) in a quiet environment without interruptions.Strong listening skills and excellent phone demeanor.Technologically proficient; not necessarily an expert, but knowledgeableExcellent written and verbal communicationCRM experience a HUGE plusOther InformationCompensation: 100% commission - High Six Figures is achievable ($160K+), anything less than Six Figures would be considered a failure. (There is no ceiling to your compensation plan)Bonus opportunitiesWorking from anywhere in the worldJob Type: Full-timeWe appreciate your interest in joining our team!Job Types: Full-time, CommissionPay: $38,318.00 - $146,703.00 per yearCOVID-19 considerations:Position is 100% RemoteExperience:Sales: 2 years (Preferred)Outside Sales: 1 year (Preferred)Application Question:Can you please provide your Linkedin URL?Work Location:Fully RemoteWork Remotely:Yes

JobTitle: Sales, Territory Manager - Coronary Image-Guided Therapy Devices (Atlanta, GA)
Text:
Job Title
Sales, Territory Manager - Coronary Image-Guided Therapy Devices (Atlanta, GA)
Job Description
If you are a Colorado resident and this role is a field-based or remote role, you may be eligible to receive additional information about the compensation and benefits for this role, which we will provide upon request. You may contact 888-367-7223, option 5, for assistance.
In this role, you have the opportunity to:
Provide ongoing support and internal development of customers and customer organizations. Through cross-functional cooperation, the Territory Manager’s primary responsibility includes driving utilization, growth, customer training, and continuing education.
You are responsible for:
Achieving sales of all applicable disposable products and services in assigned territory; assisting in advancing revenue and market position
Growing and maintaining revenue volume in existing accounts, and cultivating opportunities within legacy and prospective accounts
Assisting in developing pricing strategies in conjunction with Regional Sales Managers, Zone VPs and Commercial Operations
Keeping tabs on new products in assigned subject area and of current and future company products
Partnering with customer contacts across the hospital or clinic, and discovering new opportunities for product expansion
Conducting monthly business reviews of assigned accounts
Understanding the strategic context of the customer and the markets in which they compete
Consistently working to improve clinical acumen, competitive product knowledge, and relationship/sales skills.
Providing primary clinical training and education to customers
You are a part of:
The industry leader in image-guided therapy, helping to improve treatment for every patient. Working together to realize this vision, we can save and improve lives and reduce the total cost of care by making therapy more efficient, more appropriate and more personalized!
To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience:
BA or BS in Business or similar field, or equivalent education/experience
5+ years of related industry experience including a successful track record in customer relationship and account management within the industry segment
Proven selling, relationship, and leadership skills with the ability to navigate a complex sales process to include stakeholders/partners
Strong clinical and technical knowledge, with the confidence to knowledgeably engage key partners to present a value proposition
Professional presence that influences desired results with both external and internal partners
Ability to effectively manage assigned accounts in terms of driving utilization, customer relationship management, problem resolution, and business planning
Proven effective verbal, computer, written, and presentation skills
Ability to quickly adapt and respond to job, environmental, and industry changes
Ability to travel
In return, we offer you:
The opportunity to play a vital role in the success of the Philips Image-Guided Therapy business. At Philips, you operate at the heart of a worldwide company that continues to transform itself, to become ever more market-driven and consumer-focused.
Why should you join Philips?
Working at Philips is more than a job! It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving 3 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across the health continuum. Our people experience a variety of unexpected moments when their lives and careers come together in meaningful ways.
To find out more about what it’s like working for Philips at a personal level, visit the Working at Philips page on our career website, where you can read stories from our employee blog. Once there, you can also learn about our recruitment process, or find answers to some of the frequently asked questions.
It is the policy of Philips to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities to all colleagues and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, ethnicity, religion, gender, pregnancy/childbirth, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability or perceived disability, genetic information, citizenship, veteran or military status or a person’s relationship or association with a protected veteran, including spouses and other family members, marital or domestic partner status, or any other category protected by federal, state and/or local laws.
As an equal opportunity employer, Philips is committed to a diverse workforce. In order to ensure reasonable accommodation for individuals protected by Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, the Vietnam Veterans' Readjustment Act of 1974, and Title I of the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990, applicants that require accommodation in the job application process may contact 888-367-7223, option 5, for assistance.

Equal Employment and Opportunity Employer/Disabled/Veteran

INDSales1
Contact
If you forgot your password, you can click the Forgot Password button on the Sign In screen to reset it.
If you have any other questions regarding the recruitment process please refer to our FAQs. In case of technical difficulties with the website, please send an email to careersite@philips.com.

Please do not submit resumes or applications to this email, as they will not be reviewed. Only applications received through the online application process will be considered.)

JobTitle: Virtual Cartoon Network & Adult Swim Insights Intern, Summer 2021
Text:
Opportunity Overview
The WarnerMedia Story

WarnerMedia is a leading media and entertainment company that creates and distributes premium and popular content from a diverse array of talented storytellers and journalists to global audiences through its consumer brands including: HBO, HBO Now, HBO Max, Warner Bros., TNT, TBS, truTV, CNN, DC Entertainment, New Line, Cartoon Network, Adult Swim, Turner Classic Movies and others.

The Job


Warner Bros. Entertainment Inc. seeks a CN/AS Insights Intern for the Global Insights and Analytics department.


The role of the Cartoon Network/Adult Swim Insights Intern is to assist the Insights team to deliver data analyses that help drive the strategies of CN/AS and Warnermedia. This position will work in multiple areas of the business, such as linear, streaming, digital, social, and more.

The Daily

Assist with research projects that help drive the business strategyTag social posts and work with data to identify and report on trendsAsset management of research studies and integrate with Warnermedia databases

The Essentials
Inquisitive and curious interest in data and the media landscape
Good understanding of social media platforms and emerging platforms
Solid comfort with Excel, experience with SPSS a plus
Education or experience with market research a plus

Internship Program

Students must be currently enrolled in a college degree program for full duration of the internship.
Summer 2021 program dates are June 7th - August 13th; must be available for full program duration.
Full-time schedule (40 hours/week) designed to work around class schedule.
Fully remote/virtual experience; company owned laptop provided for the duration of the internship program.
Salary based on office location; relocation is not provided.

The Perks

Hands-on work with passionate, talented team members in your field
Networking opportunities with industry-leading professionals
Engaging events including executive speakers sessions, professional development workshops, and more
Opportunity to join the WarnerMedia family of powerhouse brands
Warner Media, LLC and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity employers. Qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.

Warner Media, LLC and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity employers. Qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.

You have a talent for recognizing trends and aiming for bigger goals
You have an active interest in keeping up with trends, market needs, and your organization’s competitive standing, and you share your broad awareness to inform decisions and recommendations. Your overview will help inform our ability to innovate, adapt, and stay ahead of the curve. We will listen carefully to your observations and recognize and reward your contributions.
Overview:
Kimberly-Clark’s Global Talent Acquisition Team is seeking an innovative, game-changer who can build upon our solid TA Inclusion & Diversity foundation and past successes to further our I&D hiring ambitions. This role has a global reach and will require knowledge of the local and regional business priorities, diversity of the market, in order to enable the integration of talent acquisition strategies that deliver the best practices of hiring diverse talent.
The Global Inclusion & Diversity Recruiting Manager will be responsible for driving Kimberly-Clark's global hiring growth strategies within targeted functions and business units (BUs). This person will examine all areas of opportunity to realize our commitment to a workforce that reflects the diversity of our consumers in markets around the world. To accomplish this, the Global Inclusion & Diversity Recruiting Manager will build initiatives to create leadership accountability, process standards, data analytics, and prioritizations in partnership with the Talent Acquisition and I&D Teams. This role is for someone who is experienced in thinking big but also experienced in working granularly to build programmatic initiatives in partnership with the business and Human Resources functions, influence change and generate successful delivery of key programs.
Org Structure:
Reports to Director, Global Talent Acquisition
We will appreciate your collaborative style
You’re energized by the idea of weaving your efforts and ideas into even bigger ideas with others on your team. We applaud your collaborative spirit and your respect and responsiveness to the input of others. We greatly value diversity, and you’ll appreciate our inclusive, mutually respectful atmosphere that makes it safe and so rewarding to “think big” by working with others. Here, you’ll find a welcoming environment and equal opportunities for all.
Responsibilities:
Globally define and implement recruitment strategies, measurable goals, objectives and metrics (and execute through global RPOs) to develop robust, diverse pipelines that generate a top-tier talent community, including partnerships and engagement plans.
Manage, enhance, expand and measure effectiveness of programs to increase the representation of Women globally and POC in US. Included but not limited to expanding current programs.
Evaluate and implement new innovative programs, practices and tools that will challenge the way we attract, engage and market diverse candidates.
Drive the one K-C inclusive hiring philosophy and project enhancements throughout the candidate experience and in partnership with Regional TA leaders and outsource partners by:
Providing ongoing thought leadership and SME throughout all TA processes and practices.
Updating TA recruitment process documents (engagement meeting templates, diverse interview panel guidance, email templates, etc.) to reflect inclusive recruitment philosophy.
Developing systems to track adherence to diverse candidate slates, diverse interview panels and hiring manager/interviewer accountabilities.
Develop and deploy onboarding training/plans, highlighting the “Inclusive Recruitment” approach for all new recruiters in the Global TA organization (K-C employees and outsource recruiters).
Ensure best practices are shared and implemented across regions.
Oversee and set direction with outsource Diversity Recruiters, Analyst and Strategists to ensure strategies and actions are aligned to deliver results that achieve K-C goals.
Ensure the proper use of data to drive focus and direction.
Consult with Executive TA and Regional TA leader to advice on areas and/or functions where we should proactively hire and pipeline talent.
Create a collaborative One-KC TA / I&D approach with I&D team, HR Leadership, senior leadership, talent management and others throughout K-C.
Seamless partnership with I&D and TA team.
Partner and gain assistances from ERGs to help implement and execute programs.
Provide and present material to showcase diversity recruiting strategy to the organization.
Primary focus will be on Manager, Director and Executive level roles.
Metrics/Reporting: responsible for the management, production and presentation of monthly, quarterly global diversity recruitment reporting.
Bring your fresh perspectives to work
The world is changing before our eyes, and we are out there, ready to hit every curve ball that comes our way. Your input, insights, ideas, and perspectives will make you an important part of our success. We support diversity by empowering all employees to shape their futures and ours through promotion and personal growth. If you have an open, exploratory mind, get in touch.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree or requisite work experience required.
Minimum 7 years’ experience within talent acquisition, with at least 3 years of TA program management, project management or team leader experience.
Experience with developing and executing diversity recruiting strategy.
Experience in project management that incorporates change management and stakeholder communications.
Experience with using recruitment analytics, data and facts to drive decisions.
Exceptional client consulting and collaborating skills—active listening, effectively influence decision, translate issues into workable solutions that meet business needs.
High level of initiative—ability to fully own a process, self-starter who needs little to no direction to get things accomplished.
Experience with researching and implementing innovative and alternatives approaches to attract and select talent.
Demonstrative passion for wanting to do drive an inclusive and diverse mindset across the organization.
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with Continuous Improvement / Lean (Kaizen or Six Sigma events and processes).
Experience working in a matrixed, cross-functional company.
Develop global diversity recruiting strategy and programs.
Location: Open to any KC location / remote work
Kimberly-Clark and its well-known global brands are an indispensable part of life for people in more than 175 countries. Every day, 1.3 billion people - nearly a quarter of the world's population - trust K-C brands and the solutions they provide to enhance their health, hygiene, and well-being. With brands such as Kleenex, Scott, Huggies, Pull-Ups, Kotex, and Depend, Kimberly-Clark holds No.1 or No. 2 share positions in more than 80 countries. With more than 140 years of history of innovation, we believe in recruiting the best people and empowering them do their best work. If fresh thinking and a passion to win inspire you, come Unleash Your Power at Kimberly-Clark.
For Kimberly-Clark to grow and prosper, we must be an inclusive organization that applies the diverse experiences and passions of its team members to brands that make life better for people all around the world. We actively seek to build a workforce that reflects the experiences of our consumers. When you bring your original thinking to Kimberly-Clark, you fuel the continued success of our enterprise. We are a committed equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, pregnancy, genetic information, citizenship status, or any other characteristic protected by law. The statements above are intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by employees assigned to this classification. Statements are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities and skills required for this position.
This position may require a post-offer/pre-hire Physical Abilities Test (PAT) to confirm that individuals are able to perform the essential functions of the job.
K-C requires that an employee have authorization to work in the country in which the role is based. In the event an applicant does not have current work authorization, K-C will determine, in its sole discretion, whether to sponsor an individual for work authorization. However, based on immigration requirements, not all roles are suitable for sponsorship. This position is subject to drug and alcohol testing, including pre-employment testing.
Global VISA and Relocation Specifications:
K-C will support in-country relocation for the chosen candidate for the role. The benefits provided will be per the terms of K-C’s applicable mobility policies. The benefits/policy provided will be decided in K-C’s sole discretion.

USA-GA-Atlanta-Roswell

Are you a cybersecurity professional with 10+ years of both technical and risk management experience looking for a new challenge? Do you like discovering the pain points an organization faces due to cybersecurity challenges, then identifying a path forward to meet those needs? The Cybersecurity Pre-Sales Consultant does just that. They work with the Client Engagement (Sales) team to uncover cybersecurity challenges and identify Pratum's portfolio of services which will help solve those challenges based on risk, not fear. This role acts as the technical expert during the sales process to make sure the services we deliver meet the customer's needs and business objectives.Role: Pratum Cybersecurity Pre-Sales Consultants play a fundamental role in building and expanding relationships with prospective and existing clients. This position is responsible for collaborating with sales, marketing, and service delivery to ensure proposed deals include technical solutions that accurately address client needs. An ideal Cybersecurity Pre-Sales Consultant has the perfect mix of information security expertise and sales acumen.Tasks: Support Pratum’s Client Engagement Advisors by attending meetings to provide technical expertise and opinions.Understand customer needs and requirements to position Pratum’s services as a solution to meet those needs. The service portfolio includes XDR, vCISO, Risk Assessment, Vulnerability Scanning, Penetration Testing, Incident Response, Digital Forensics, etc.Work collaboratively with other Pratum Client Engagement Teammates, Consultants, and Technical resources to understand and create solutions that best meet customer needs.Prepare, review, and deliver proposals, Non-Disclosure Agreement (NDA), Master Service Agreements (MSA), Statement of Work (SOW), and other documentation to clients or prospects.Consistently engage with clients in maintaining relationships to ensure high levels of satisfaction.Establish professional and technical knowledge by attending education workshops, reviewing professional publications, and establishing personal networks. Examples may include ISSA, ISACA, etc.KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIESProven experience recommending and delivering cybersecurity, compliance, and risk management services.Excellent Professional verbal and written communication skills.Strong interpersonal and communication skills.Strong listening and presentation skills.Experience working with Cybersecurity and/or Information Technology markets and clients.Ability to work independently while following documented sales processes.Proficient with MS Office 365 suite of tools and other corporate productivity and web presentation tools.Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and manage time effectively.Education/Certification Preferences: CISSP, CISA, GIAC or similar cybersecurity certificationsJob Type: Full-timePay: $100,000.00 - $125,000.00 per yearBenefits:401(k)401(k) matchingDental insuranceDisability insuranceFlexible scheduleHealth insuranceHealth savings accountPaid time offProfessional development assistanceVision insuranceSchedule:Monday to FridaySupplemental Pay:Bonus payExperience:Cybersecurity: 10 years (Required)Company's website:www.pratum.com

You must possess a real estate license for this position.We also offer educational training in finance, accounting, and contract law, and encourage our employees to further their education by reimbursing their pre-licensing fees and courses after successfully closing three (3) deals in a calendar year.We also pay bonuses to high-performing agents who meet, or exceed, our predetermined sales target.We have a team-based approach and assist our agents with their transactions and deal-flow.ResponsibilitiesYou will operate as an entrepreneur of your own business and our office will provide you with a multitude of support functions to help drive your sales success; including, but not limited to, marketing and lead generating activities, administrative support, initial training, continued career development, and team-based selling and client support.Our real estate agents and broker associates are encouraged to do the following:Consult with a wide range of clients, ranging from renters to first-time home and buyers and sellers, to experienced real estate investors.Pursue on-and-off-market deals suitable for potential brokerage opportunities and enter leads into our proprietary CRM database.Build relationships with small business owners, advise business owners on how to increase their business’s net income and fair-market-value, then prepare and confidentially list their business in the MLS and in local, and national, business brokerage marketplaces.Prepare valuation reports and develop a tailor-made plan for each client and business.Prepare Comparative Market Analysis ("CMA") and advise real estate investors on the state market and their optimal purchase and selling prices.Oversee all negotiations and contracts through closing; and ensure that all files are correct and complete.Show properties and serve as a liaison with other real estate agents, real estate brokers, title companies, lenders, attorneys, and the like, to ensure that their deals are properly documented and close on schedule.Required SkillsThe candidate must possess a Georgia real estate license. About Neo4j:
Neo4j is the leader in graph database technology. As the world’s most widely deployed graph database, we help global brands – including Comcast, NASA, UBS and Volvo – to reveal and predict how people, processes and systems are interrelated. Using this relationships-first approach, applications built using Neo4j tackle connected data challenges such as analytics and artificial intelligence, fraud detection, real-time recommendations and knowledge graphs.
Our Vision:
At Neo4j, we have always strived to help the world make sense of data.
As business, society and knowledge become increasingly connected, our technology promotes innovation by helping organizations to find and understand data relationships. We created, drive and lead the graph database category, and we’re disrupting how organizations leverage their data to innovate and stay competitive.
We have an immediate opening for an Enterprise Sales Account Executive who will focus on expanding our footprint by hunting and closing sales of Neo4j products and services to new customers. As a quota-carrying, individual contributing member of our sales team, you will be a part of the expansion of our strategic Enterprise account business unit, supporting the growth of the North American East Region Sales organization.
Neo4j is a VC-backed, privately held, fast growing enterprise software company. We are recognized as the Graph database technology innovation leader, industry thought leader, and commercial market leader. Graph software technology is currently the most popular category in the database industry with broad applicability across industries and use cases, and Neo4j is the leading provider (see the line graph here: https://db-engines.com/en/ranking_categories)
Responsibilities:
Develop and execute a territory plan based on target agencies and applicable use cases, resulting in a pipeline of opportunities in the target market, that will help you achieve quarterly and annual sales metrics.
Develop expert knowledge of Neo4j solutions and applicability in target market.
Develop and present to customers a strong understanding of the benefits and advantages of graph technology versus alternative database approaches.
Execute sales cycles that employ Strategic Selling strategies and tactics.
Build and present proposals for Neo4j solutions that involve Neo4j products and Services.
.Work with Pre-Sales Engineering resources to scope and deliver on well-qualified POC’s
“Land & Expand” - Grow the business in accounts that you have landed
Provide guidance, direction, and support to your assigned SDR in their efforts to support your pipeline development.
Provide guidance and direction to your Field Marketing resources so they can target programs to your target accounts.
Provide guidance and direction to Channel Director so they can target partners and programs for your target accounts.
Maintain Neo4j Salesforce.com CRM system with accurate information about your pipeline, in accordance with Neo4j forecasting guidelines.
Ideally, you should have:
Coursework in database, SQL, computer programming, Computer Information Systems, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or similar, is desirable.
Experience selling information management tools to customers in the enterprise market.
7+ years of consistent success meeting or exceeding sales objectives selling technical solutions and software products into the enterprise market.
Demonstrable experience executing enterprise complex sales strategies and tactics.
Experience with the commercial open-source business model, selling subscriptions for on-premise deployments and/or hybrid on-prem/cloud deployments.
Previous experience and thrive in a smaller, high growth software company, where you have leveraged dedicated SDR resources, Field Marketing resources, and Pre-Sales Engineering helping build the business.
Strong conviction and approach to how and where graph solutions fit into the enterprise marketplace.
Be a hard-working, responsible, self-starter, with the ability to work remotely in a home-office environment, as well as travel to client sites to run meetings.
Excellent references, ideally from previous Sales managers.
Demonstrate attention to detail, ensuring accurate entry and management of lead data in our SalesForce.com CRM system.
Be proficient with standard corporate productivity tools (e.g., Google Docs, MS-Office, Salesforce.com, Web-conferencing).
Be a team player with the highest level of integrity.
Country
US
#LI-Remote
Why Join Neo4j?
Neo4j is among the 20 most popular databases in the world and the clear leader in the rapidly emerging Graph Data Platform category. We’re well funded and have an experienced management team focused on how organizations should apply data to solve challenging problems for decades to come. We have customers in every industry across the globe, and we build technology that has a proven product/market fit. Joining our team is an opportunity to define the future of data, analytics and automation.
We offer a competitive salary and benefits, engaging virtual events and a welcoming team. You will love your co-workers!
Neo4j is a privately held company with our U.S. headquarters in San Mateo, California. We have employees located all over the world, from Thailand to Canada, many of whom work remotely, and we have offices in Sweden (Malmo and Stockholm), the UK (London) and Germany (Munich).
More information at www.neo4j.com.
Neo4j Values:
Neo4j is a Silicon Valley company with a Swedish soul. We foster collaboration and each of us is empowered to contribute and put our innovative stamp on projects. We hire candidates who reflect the following Neo4j core values:
We value relationships
We focus on user success
We thrive in a culture that is open and inclusive
We assume positive intent
We welcome intellectually honest discussions
We deliver on our commitments
Diversity, Equity and Inclusion at Neo4j:
At Neo4j, we value relationships and that involves building an environment where everyone feels like they belong. We believe strong relationships involve being accountable, bringing our whole selves to work, valuing intellectually honest discussions and being receptive to new ideas and perspectives. One of our central goals is to provide an inclusive, diverse and equitable workplace for everyone to develop their potential and have a positive, career-defining experience.
Are you intrigued by this role? We encourage you to apply even if you don’t 100% fit the qualifications above.
Neo4j is committed to protecting and respecting your privacy. Please read the privacy notice regarding Neo4j's recruitment process to understand how we will handle the personal data that you provide.

Company: J2 Medical Supply
Job Title: Territory Manager
Job Description:
At J2 Medical Supply you’ll be joining a global team of hard-working and passionate hospital and non-medical B2B sales professionals to assist in our growing efforts to combat COVID-19. We are a collaborative, diverse culture that’s all about getting it done together. Here, anyone who wants to make a difference can create an impact. Joining the team means becoming part of something bigger.
Your Responsibilities will include:

The Territory Manager is responsible for achieving a sales quota through the selling of J2 Medical Supply PPE products within assigned facilities and departments in a defined territory.
Maintain current knowledge of competitor’s position in marketplace and implement selling strategies to combat them effectively
Demonstrate an in-depth knowledge of PPE, capital equipment, disposables, medical devices to include understanding of market trends and analyze customer buying patterns
Successfully introduce new products and indications to all staff members in the accounts
Ensure customers are trained on the safety and the efficacy of products in our portfolio
Responsible for being up to date on developmental goals set by Director of Sales and Sr. Management, sales territory objectives and administrative requirements.
Negotiate with and influence the decision-makers of the accounts about proposals, offers, terms and conditions needed to achieve relative sales objectives
Stay up to date on healthcare compliance to include hospital credentialing if required
Maintain standard rules and training around the code of conduct for all J2 Medical employees
Develop and maintain relationships with key physicians, department decision makers and/or administrators within assigned territory
Complete a Territory Business Sales Plan, prepare sales forecasting and review with manager / team monthly


Must Haves:

Minimum Experience: 1-2 years of medical sales
Preferred Experience: 3-5 years of demonstrated success in medical sales
Experience calling on hospitals, surgical Centers, Trauma, ED, OR, LAB, PCP
Experience working with PC based applications (Windows, Excel, Word and PowerPoint) is required.


More about us…
J2 Medical Supply has more than 30 years of manufacturing, distribution and logistics experience serving healthcare organizations, government agencies, and Fortune 500 companies including Microsoft, Disney, and SONY. During the COVID-19 crisis, we have narrowed our focus to assist medical professionals, government agencies and employers get the much-needed protective equipment they need to protect and serve.
With full-time staff in the USA & China, our team takes pride in physically inspecting, monitoring, processing, and shipping orders with expertise and precision. We are a trusted and reliable choice for large quantity clients interested in a proven and reliable PPE supply chain.

Commission Based / Remote position
1099 Contract Position

JobTitle: Head of Staff Technology Training and Support
Text:
Discover Your Career at Emory University:

Emory University is a leading research university that fosters excellence and attracts world-class talent to innovate today and prepare leaders for the future. We welcome candidates who can contribute to the diversity and excellence of our academic community.
Description:

Emory Libraries seeks a customer service oriented professional and problem solver to serve in the role of Head of Staff Technology Training and Support. Reporting to the Director of Digital Programs and Client Services in the Library Technology and Digital Strategies division, the Head of Staff Technology Training and Support will oversee the Libraries’ endpoint support functions, staff technology spaces, and the libraries’ help desk functions. The Libraries place high value on both individual contributions and teamwork, the Head of Staff Technology Training and Support will be an essential part of the Libraries overseeing and implementing creative and impactful uses of software, endpoint, and space technologies to improve the working experience for the organization’s staff.

JOB DESCRIPTION:
Provide general supervision to the Staff Technology Training and Support department, ensuring the performance of all personnel, services and/or technology. Establishes working relationships with others in the division, collaborates on new technology needs or expands uses for existing technologies to increase functionality or efficiency.
Provide project management support in collaboration with the Head of Project Management for small to medium size departmental projects, ensuring the proper and timely scheduling and allocation of resources, including staffing. Provide reports and communicate progress to manager.
Manages help desk functions and ensures staff respond to support requests in a timely fashion; manages and Monitors ServiceNow queue, and routes tickets to appropriate personnel; supervises student employees to assist in the day-to-day operations of the libraries’ help desk and the department.
Manages staff who oversee media technology and services, including presentation equipment, sound and assisted listening systems, and other technology related to staff spaces; responsible for all staff space audio/video planning, including training and documentation for end-users.
Manages a team that instructs and supports staff in the operation and basic maintenance of technology equipment, including training and documentation for end-users; develops an annual desktop refresh plan and budget in collaboration with leadership.
Coordinates the creation of documentation, training, and other programming related to technology used by the libraries’ staff.
Responsible for ordering equipment and software; manages software licenses and maintains records. Ensures compliance with software licenses, including compliance and license management.
Maintains up-to-date professional knowledge and skills in areas related to primary job assignment as well as maintains general knowledge of current trends in higher education, academic libraries, and information and educational technology.
Reviews and advises management staff on information technology issues to ensure coordination of administrative procedures and systems throughout a division.
Designs information systems and procedures to support division operations.
Manages computer software development.
Coordinates computer operations with other information technology support staff.
May hire, supervise and evaluate staff.
Performs related responsibilities as required.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
A bachelor's degree in computer sciences, management information systems or a related field and five years of information technology or systems support experience, OR an equivalent combination of education, training, and experience.

Excellent oral/written communication skills

Drive Results

Description:
The Channel Account Manager is responsible for delivering revenue growth with Channel Partners. The successful candidate will coordinate, implement and manage all sales activities with Channel Partners field, technical and inside sales teams in order to achieve the desired revenue and business goals with Channel Partners. This person will be the primary interface for field engagement activities between Channel Partners and Lifesize field, inside and technical sales teams in an effort to expand the business relationship between the companies.

Responsibilities:
Contributes and executes on the tactical initiatives outlined in the business plan in order achieve 100% of quarterly and annual sales objectives
Exceeds all revenue and business goals
Develops and manages inside sales team relationships at Channel Partners
Fosters and develops manager and executive relationships with Channel Partner managers and Lifesize management
Develops and maintains an accurate quarterly/annual forecast for SHI by team/vertical market
Initiates field engagements and planning sessions to drive attainment of revenue objectives
Develops and teaches operational "best practices" to Channel Partner teams
Develops training regimens that drive both proficiency and revenue growth
Coordinates and manages business reviews with Channel Partner teams, minimum of every 6 months
Drives revenue growth with identified “end users” through all means required
Implements a sales and marketing events calendar to generate new end user opportunities
Assists in closure of “key” end-user opportunities with respective Channel Partner's sales team
Coordinates resources required to close prospective “enterprise” opportunities
Identify and report on competitive trends (products, promotions etc.)
Escalate and resolve any account issues when appropriate
Qualifications:
5+ years of sales experience, preferably within the high tech industry
Consistent and proven attainment of revenue and quota assignments
Strong experience in consultative and applications sales of Internet products and services
Superior written and verbal communications skills
Able to multi-task and work in a fast paced environment
Results-focused, team-oriented and a strong work ethic
Sales experience in the areas of internet technologies, software/hardware technologies and videoconferencing is preferred
Ability to travel 50%+ or as required to meet and exceed objectives
Bachelor's Degree in computer science or business a must
About Lifesize
Lifesize delivers immersive communication experiences for the global enterprise. Our complementary suite of award-winning cloud video conferencing and cloud contact center solutions empowers organizations to elevate workplace collaboration, boost employee productivity and improve customer experiences from anywhere and from any device. To learn more about our analyst-recognized solutions and see why tens of thousands of leading organizations like Yelp, RBC, Yale University, Pearson, Salvation Army, Shell Energy and NASA rely on Lifesize for mission-critical business communications, visit www.lifesize.com or www.serenova.com.

Lifesize, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Lifesize does not discriminate against any applicant for employment because of age, gender, sexual orientation, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, veteran status, or disability.

The Sales Representative will be responsible for the growth of revenue by proactive sales of the product portfolio in its territory and developing strong customer relations according to the organizational strategy for its assigned customer base.
Territory: Southeast
Sartorius has an exciting opportunity for a dynamic, self-motivated, entrepreneurially spirited professional to help fuel the growth of our Bioprocess Solutions portfolio in the Southeast territory (Remote position). Due to the sales growth in the territory this is a newly created position. The incumbent in this key role will be a trusted business partner to our customers in the biopharmaceutical arena. If you are adept at identifying new opportunities and building productive customer relationships, please read on.

What you can look forward to accomplishing:
 Achieve annual sales target and fulfill corporate objectives within assigned territory
Manage and grow an existing sales base within the territory and develop new customers
Provide initial technical & sales support for new and existing customer inquiries, and as required, engages a range of more specialized in-house technical experts as needed to support these discussion
Identify key clients aligned with the strategic focus of the company and develop workable action and development plans to maintain existing business and seed future business opportunities
Meet with customers, make professional presentations, initiate the preparation of proposals, communicate proposals to customers and negotiate with customers to achieve a successful resolution
Generate and maintain record within a Customer Relationship Management (CRM) system to track customer contacts, proposal generation, and customer specific information
Ability to grow client business through understanding of the clients’ business programs and objectives
With minimal supervision, develop and implement plans to sell a broad range of products and services and grow revenues within clearly defined market
Present information as required at both customer and internal meetings
Manage multiple customer plans toward agreed sales targets
Prepare information as needed for customer meetings and discussions with management, including status, tracking and financial reporting
Support business initiation process at conferences and meetings as required
The position will report directly through Sales but will work closely with a range of internal stakeholder groups including Marketing, Technical Support, Operations, Legal, Finance, Process Development and other SSB Sales Groups
Implement assigned corporate objectives within the territory
Work with Sales Manager to develop proposals and set pricing for customers
Provide reports as requested by management and update CRM systems on a daily basis
Attend review meetings as requested by management to review current project and YTD sales
Attend trade shows and sales meetings as requested by sales management
Report sales performance to Sales Manager
Travel to customer sites on a daily and weekly basis as directed by sales management
Developing a deep understanding of your customers
Skills and experience that you need to bring to our company:
A good understanding of early stage drug development and more specifically experience of working with large molecules and biosimilar is desirable
Candidates must possess excellent presentation and communication skills (both written and verbal), in addition to good planning and organization skills
The candidate will possess a proven track record for developing productive relationships (internally and external), effective persuasion abilities, and a demonstrated a strong sales background
Experience utilizing a CRM is a plus
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree with relevant practical experience that demonstrates a strong ability and proven competency to work effectively as an Account Manager within the biopharmaceutical industry
3+ years of experience industry experience with products and processes involved in the cGMP manufacture of Pharmaceuticals/Biopharmaceuticals
Preferred Qualifications:
A post graduate qualification or equivalent experience in a relevant scientific discipline is desirable but not essential
Additional Requirements:
Frequent travel >50% of the time with some overnight travel required
Driving our future growth requires talented people. Sartorius is a dynamic organization suited to people who want to showcase skills, be recognized for expertise and thrive in a vibrant and innovative environment.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex or national origin. We are also an equal opportunity employer of individuals with disabilities and protected veterans.

JobTitle: Solution Consultant - Advanced Technology Group (remote option available)
Text:
Solution Consultant

This position may be filled at these alternative locations: Overland Park, KS / St. Louis, MO / Cincinnati, OH / Missoula, MT / Atlanta, GA / Virtual

ATG believes in advancing inclusion, acceptance, and understanding amongst our team by employing individuals who bring unique perspectives and diversity of experiences to the company. We encourage all interested individuals, including people of all races and national origin, people of all ages, people of all religions, people with or without disabilities, and/or people with any gender identity and sexual orientation, to apply.

Position Overview:
The Solution Consultant helps current and potential clients solve issues, create value, maximize growth and improve the business performance. The individual uses their business and analytical skills to provide objective advice, expertise and specialist skills which the client may be lacking. The individual identifies options for the client and suggests recommendations for change, as well as playing a key role in new solution implementations. Projects can vary in length depending on the type of consulting needed and the demands of the client. The project can involve an individual or a large team and may be based in one location or across various sites.

Key Responsibilities:
Collaboration: Carries out research and data collection to understand our clients or potential clients. Interviews clients’ employees, management teams and other stakeholders to assess the problem
Communication: Be a liaison to the clients to keep them informed of progress and to make relevant decisions. Provide regular status reporting to clients and internal stakeholders
Knowledge: Possesses a sound working knowledge of, and hands on experience with business/systems analysis

Key Experience:
Demonstrates success and experience in the following areas:
Entry level SC : Strong consultative and customer service skills; some knowledge of software development lifecycle preferred

Mid-level SC: Experience within IT Delivery type projects; some cloud-based implementations or relatable transferrable experience

Senior level SC: Proven experience working on multiple Quote to Cash(Q2C) platforms involving CPQ, CLM, CRM, Billing or ERP enterprise implementations (including e-Business, SaaS applications or cloud-based transformations/integrations) highly desired

Possesses the ability to work independently and in teams with a thorough knowledge and understanding of various operating systems and commonly used software applications, diagnostic tools and network utilities
Business analysis and requirements gathering abilities
Leads the end to end-to-end system development life cycles of SaaS software implementation projects
CPQ or Billing experience is a plus

Preferred Knowledge and Skills:
Exemplifies a high degree of personal integrity and interpersonal skills and abilities
Has a fundamental understanding of business practices and basic knowledge of information management systems, with the drive and ability to learn quickly
Sets priorities, goals, and timetables to manage time efficiently and achieve maximum productivity
Proves a willingness to commit the additional time and effort necessary during period of heavy workload in order to meet project milestones and delivery deadlines
Communicates with clarity and impact, understanding how the message has been received
Experience with Salesforce.com setup and user interface highly desired
Exhibits high energy and drive, brings enthusiasm and the ability to engage with people at multiple levels on projects and meetings
Is firm and decisive, willing to make unpopular decisions when necessary
Excellent verbal and written communication skills

Education:
4-year degree in a technical or business field of study preferred

Knowledge of Quote to Cash process (CPQ, Order Management, Billing, and CRM) a plus

Location and Travel:
Willingness and ability to travel up to 50% (subject to change at any time based off project demands)

Position Overview
As an Associate Analyst, Human Resources Data, you will be responsible for updating and maintaining employee data in the Human Resources Information system (Workday) ensuring data integrity, implement daily, weekly and monthly audits, correct data discrepancies, provide reporting support to the business, and test new Workday configurations. Act as a team player who is extremely detail oriented, has a passion for problem solving and analytics and can drive process improvement.
Job Description
** Seeking to fill 1 role, can be based remotely anywhere within the U.S.. **
Description
Create and automate audits in Workday, Monitor existing audits and design a cadence to ensure data integrity.
Proactively identify data dependencies in Workday, partnering with the business to identify and fix root cause. Fix may be completed at the employee level or by an EIB upload for large populations.
Deliver routine reporting and respond to ad hoc requests for data analysis, charts, and/or dashboards. Reports will vary from compensation, benefits, demographics, auditing, etc.
Partner with HR Technology on configuration testing to establish accurate changes to employee population in production.
Provide excellent customer service to the business by proactively identifying reporting needs and data process improvements.
Handle an array of highly confidential information with integrity and confidentiality.
Maintain an in-depth understanding of HR workflows, business objectives, regulatory requirements, etc. to identify needs for new audits and/or requirements.
Travel Required: No
Skills
Specialized Knowledge : 1-2 years of experience in Workday preferred; Strong, professional verbal and written communication skills
Special Skills : Proven ability to juggle, multi-task, and manage competing priorities without sacrificing quality or deadlines; •Detail oriented with a passion for automation and process improvement; Ability to maintain confidentiality; Proficiency in Microsoft Office including Outlook, Excel, Word, and PowerPoint.
Years Of Experience
0-2 : in human resources, functioning in a technical role, data analysis and/or data reporting.
Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree - Business, High School Diploma - General Studies
Shift

Take your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.

At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.
ABB’s Electrification business is a leading provider of a full range of protection, control and measurement solutions - enabling safer and smarter electricity flow from substation to the point of consumption. We deliver products and systems designed to connect, protect and control electrical systems, ensuring reliability, efficiency and safety for equipment and personnel.


For our Marketing, Sales and Product Management team, understanding the full potential of our technology and the trends in our markets is highly rewarding. In addition, helping customers all over the world improve efficiency, save resources and reduce emissions gives our work a powerful sense of purpose.

The role reports to Sales Support Manager and located in Atlanta, Georgia. As a Business Development Proposal Specialist for ABB (Electrification, Distribution Solutions Services) will provide support to the Regional Commercial team Business Development Sales Managers in the development of field services proposals for power delivery, power utilization and automation systems. In this role you will identify and propose value-added service solutions to a broad range of Industrial customers including Preventive Maintenance, Power Distribution upgrades, parts and Arc Flash Mitigation Solutions. In this fast paced, end-customer facing role, you will require a strong field service background and highly effective communication and organizational skills.
Your responsibilities
Be a key member of the North America Field Services commercial team in support of achieving the region's orders, revenue and margin plan by owning and driving the development of a high volume of professional services proposals for the commercial team.
Partner with Business Development Sales Managers and the technical support team including application engineering and field services to provide cost and price for services and equipment needed to develop work scopes and create timely, professional customer-ready proposals.
Work with the Region sales team to understand customer requirements, develop deal strategies and analyze the competitive landscape and market pricing.
Manage the entire opportunity and proposal screening, development, approvals and pricing processes, working in salesforce.com for all active opportunities.
Demonstrate strong ability to balance multiple priorities and opportunities.
Be able to manage deadlines and set the correct expectations concerning cycle times and milestones, working with end customers, sales reps and distributors.
Understand terms and conditions and how they impact risk profile and costs.
Support regional platform operating metrics, centered on offerings and individual productivity, to promote proposal throughput, yield, cost and efficiency.
Ensure process adherence to all government contracting requirements.
Manage order-booking requirements and own handoff process to the execution team.
Your background
Bachelor's Degree in preferably in Engineering, Business or a technical discipline .
Minimum 5 years of experience in Sales, Commercial Operations, Engineering and/or Field Service roles.
Candidates must already have a work authorization that would permit them to work for ABB in the US.
Ability and willingness to travel as required (up to 5%)
Experience with industrial power delivery and technical experience with industrial and utility customers and processes desired
Ability to interface closely with internal & external customers.
Previous contract terms & conditions, or execution experience desired.
Strong negotiation, influencing, and communication skills.
Demonstrated leadership, organizational, and planning skills.
Proven ability to produce results.
Demonstrated clear thinking with effective communication at all levels.
Position may offer possible remote work opportunity.
More about us
We look forward to receiving your application. If you want to discover more about ABB, take another look at our website www.abb.com.

Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action at ABB

JobTitle: Technical Product Support (REMOTE)- Global View Time
Text:
THIS POSITION IS REMOTE

ADP is hiring a Techinical Product Support position. In this position you will be responsible for ensuring the Payroll Specialists are applying consistent methodologies and meeting GlobalView's SLA. The GV Tech will ensure activities are performed in a manner that meets ADP and/or client requirements while adhering to ADP standards. The Technical Lead will as needed review and define methodologies or processes and ensure Payroll Specialists are trained following GV requirements, including Stellar Services.

At ADP we are driven by your success. We engage your unique talents and perspectives. We welcome your ideas on how to do things differently and better. In your efforts to achieve, learn and grow, we support you all the way. If success motivates you, you belong at ADP.

We strive for every interaction to be driven by our CORE values: Insightful Expertise, Integrity is Everything, Service Excellence, Inspiring Innovation, Each Person Counts, Results-Driven, & Social Responsibility.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Ensure that the implementation teams deliver clients defect free and in compliance with the template.
Mentoring the new team members coming on-board
Managing the incoming T2S from Project Services/Implementation.
Managing client escalations and urgent/critical tickets to provide stellar service to clients.
Team player and assisting all our team members for any technical / non-technical / process / functional related questions or queries
Helping and assisting our teams such as MS, PS with any questions or queries they have (technical / non-technical). This will in-turn educate them with our processes and provide stellar services to our clients.
Creation of work schedule rules.
Work schedule variants and selection rules according to business requirements.
Dynamic work schedules as per requirement
Absence quotas and attenance quotas
Over time hours and Comp off.
Excellent skills on schemas TM00TW15, and PCR's TR10, TO20, TO16, TE30.
Created various Time Types according to business requirement.
Time Wage Types for regular & O.T hours
Time related features
Excellent in PCR's for various business requirement.
Knowledge of MX pay rules and regulations
Performs other related duties as assigned.
Participate as required in cross regional activities, workshops etc. aiming at sharing and improving on current processes and practices.

QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED:

Over 2 Years of Directly Related Experience configuring GV Time.
Bachelor's Degree or its equivalent in education and experience.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS: Preference will be given to candidates who have the following:

Process driven / experience in deploying process across multiple teams

Strong client service orientation

Good analytical skills

Ability to work in a team environment

Excellent verbal and written communication skills

Strong initiative and enthusiasm

PC literate (Windows, Excel, Word)

Very good understanding of ADP applications, payroll procedures

We believe in good faith that compensation for a successful candidate based in Colorado would be between the range listed below.

In the state of Colorado, we are offering the following benefits (subject to change):

Salaried and hourly workers who work on average 32 or more standard hours per week:

Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, 401(k), Charitable Contribution Match, Holidays, Personal Days & Vacation, Student Loan Repayment Program and Paid Volunteer Time Off

We're designing a better way to work, so you can achieve what you're working for. Consistently named one of the 'Most Admired Companies' by FORTUNE® Magazine, and recognized by DiversityInc® as one of the 'Top 50 Companies for Diversity,' ADP works with more than 740,000 organizations across the globe to help their people work smarter, embrace new challenges, and unleash their talent. "Always Designing for People" means we're creating platforms that will transform how great work gets done, so together we can unlock a world of opportunity.
At ADP, we believe that diversity fuels innovation. ADP is committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, genetic information, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, lawful alien status, national origin, age, marital status, or protected veteran status. We support an inclusive workplace where associates excel based on personal merit, qualifications, experience, ability, and job performance.
