We are currently looking to hire a talented Territory Sales Manager who will manage our users and dealer accounts in Georgia. This person will become a sought-after expert and the main point of contact for Franchise and Independent Dealers.

This is a fantastic opportunity for the right person to become part of the globally growing team right from the start. Find yourself working with an exciting startup right from the beginning and share our journey to the top.

The Ideal Candidate

The ideal candidate will be someone who loves sales and working with automotive dealers. You will need to have previous automotive account/sales experience as well as outstanding communication and customer service skills. You must be willing to take ownership and responsibility for your region while building relationships in the field. The ideal candidate will also be required to build and nurture relationships with an existing customer to secure brand loyalty and increase business. The role requires someone who isn’t afraid to roll up their sleeves and lead from the front, is this you?

Who we are

We are Win360 - a digital merchandising company that is empowering dealerships to accelerate their businesses online. Our products were created to bridge the gap between the offline to online experience, helping our partners increase engagement and drive sales in the digital age. We are launching with our digital imaging product, which utilizes cutting-edge technology to help our dealers create a 360-degree dealership online. Visit Win360.io to learn more.

Our culture

Our team of determined experts are passionate about creating a strong brand and securing the leading position in the market. We combine traditional values with a modern environment to offer continuous challenges and development opportunities in a friendly yet professional place. We recognize that people are our greatest asset and we value each individual contribution. We want to share our successes by recognizing and rewarding the highly skilled, like-minded people for their ideas and achievements.

What we are offering


Competitive base salary
Highly attractive commission structure
Bonus structure in addition to commission
Travel allowance
Work from home office subsidy
Health Insurance


Responsibilities


Know our product inside-out, becoming an expert in its functionality and features
Identify, build and continuously grow new accounts using professional and excellent sales techniques and strategy
Visit key accounts and auto dealers and assist them to maximize the use of our digital merchandising solutions while providing excellent customer service
Networking, setting up new accounts, answering questions, training/ instructing users, creating a well-connected network of customers
Passionately promoting Win360 to automotive dealerships and other buyers
Broadening your knowledge of the current automotive industry, markets, trends, etc.
Providing continuous sales and support to existing users
Identifying, managing and following up on leads generated through our website, trade shows and referrals
Creating and keeping records of all activity with clients and prospects up to date using our CRM
Ensuring all issues indicated by our clients are dealt with in an efficient and professional manner
Other ad hoc duties may be required


Requirements


3+ years of experience managing client accounts (preferably multiple accounts) in a target driven environment
Previous automotive or vehicle software sales industry experience highly preferred
Passionate & professional sales personality, with outstanding negotiation and communication skills
Analytical, strategic thinking and ability to identify opportunities in the market based on existing trends, changes and implications
Experience in dealing with clients in all situations with diplomatic and professional manners
Strong reporting skills
Self-driven, team player with startup mentality are all pluses

About Guaranteed Rate:
Guaranteed Rate is the 5 th largest retail mortgage lender in the U.S. By offering industry-leading tools, low-rate mortgages and unparalleled customer service, we’ve become the Home Purchase Experts®. At Guaranteed Rate, we think big—pushing beyond what most people believe is possible. We strive to work with the best of the best, building business with the best referral partners and hiring the best employees—allowing us to deliver world-class customer service. Our goal is to make sure every customer has a great experience. Headquartered in Chicago with 5,000+ employees in 300+ offices across the U.S. and licensed in all 50 states, we’ve helped thousands of homeowners with more than $37 billion in home purchase loans and refinances in just the past year alone.

What's the Role?

The Production Manager (PM) position was created to effectively manage the processing pipelines of VPs (LO) who have achieved a predetermined volume threshold based upon the VP’s previous year’s loan volume. Working alongside the Regional Operations Manager (ROM), the PM will be responsible for ensuring the movement of VP units from the Sent to Processing milestone through funding. The PM, with the guidance of the ROM will manage the capacity of the VP’s processing team (POD), interact with Guaranteed Rate support departments as needed, ensure the continued education of the POD regarding performance and adjustments to compliance and company policy; engaging the ROM as needed. The PM will work alongside their ROM, VP, and Sales Management to fulfill Regionally coordinated strategies.

Delegation of loan tasks to POD members:
Identify owners of tasks based upon the skill sets within the POD.

Clearly communicate expectations.

Outline the task that needs completing.

Outline the timeframe in which it must be done.

Follow up with the delegated party until the task is satisfactorily completed.

Operational ownership of the VP’s transaction:
Utilize the functionality of Guaranteed Rate’s YBR to audit loans daily.

Utilize tools like the YBR and HotList to track loan progress: determine opportunities and trends for team improvement.

Monitor the tasks performed by the processing team, utilizing the YBR (pipeline report) to ensure that loans are happening within set timeframes.

Follow up immediately with POD members on tasks outside of expected turn time.

Support Management and Performance Connection:
Closing Department

Underwriting Department

Appraisal Department

Compliance Department

Escalation oversight

Personal Growth:
The Production Manager will remain up to date on all relevant training, updates to investor guidelines, and internal communications which affect both Sales and Operations.

Customer Satisfaction and Experience

Customer escalation point

VP escalation point

Additionally, the Production Manager will provide valuable input to their Regional Operations Manager in all areas involving:

Training & Performance Management

Compliance training

New hire training

Continuing education

Performance/deficiency training

Training Content Feedback

Peer Review

Guaranteed Rate is an Equal Opportunity Employer that welcomes and encourages all applicants to apply regardless of age, race, sex, religion, color, national origin, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital or parental status, ancestry, citizenship status, pregnancy or other reason protected by law. #LI-MT1

JobTitle: Dealer Concierge - Customer Service Account Support
Text:
Overview:

Workforce Logiq is seeking a Dealer Concierge (Customer Service Account Support) for our Top Notch client REMOTE within commuting distance to Atlanta, GA ONLY. Please do not apply if you are not within commuting distance to Atlanta, GA.
Responsibilities:

You should be tech-savvy, adapt quickly to change, and enjoy making good things happen for other people. You will need a strong desire to learn and be able to leverage your knowledge of products, processes, and technology as a curious investigator, a strong communicator, and a champion for the experience of our Dealer Clients.

 Problem Resolution: As a Dealer Concierge, you will need to be a great listener as you work to troubleshoot and understand issues. You will work to resolve issues upon initial contact (i.e. "first call resolution") and prevent future issues whenever possible by educating our Clients and reviewing their accounts. You will oversee all problems to resolution, even when delegated to other teams.
Effective Communication: You will provide engaging, responsive, timely telephone and email support to Dealer Clients, Sales, and other internal team members. You will be the point of contact for the Dealer and Sales team member as you keep them informed of the status of open issues while actively working on troubleshooting and resolving them. You will play a role in retention as you communicate collaboratively with Sales to address any Dealer issues.
Automotive sales knowledge preferred: Dealer Concierge must maintain a strong understanding of the products and services of both Autotrader and Kelley Blue Book. Adhere to all policies, procedures, and guidelines and understand the organization (departments, personnel, and their responsibilities).
Customer Service Focus: As a Dealer Concierge, you will need to be empathetic with a client-first approach while solving and handling complex issues by having (active listening, show genuine interest, effective communication, and clarifying the problem). Understand retention efforts and have account management/relationship experience
Qualifications:

Minimum Qualifications
Minimum of 2+ years of customer service experience
College degree preferred
Demonstrated excellence for high-quality customer service
Proven experience with customer-service, help desk or technical support, account management and Business to Business support
Strong computer skills, exceptionally proficient in Microsoft Office, Outlook, and other Internet-based tools.
Strong understanding of business operations (spreadsheets, trends, data)
Demonstrated ability to adapt in a changing environment
Ability to type a minimum 40 WPM

VezTek USA (https://veztekusa.com/) is an information technology and services company based in Los Angeles, CA. VezTek provides expert services to clients all across the US, helping small & medium size businesses tackle their most important technology initiatives. VezTek’s software developers, designers, product managers, and project managers are trusted by leading brands and startups alike.Our sales representative team has a very clear and realistic path to make $100K+ per year ($80K+ in your first year) with proprietary technology that almost sells itself and a creative team that can meet any volume of production. This salesperson model has been created by life-long salespeople, not a CPA or CFO. Together, our team carefully crafted this dream sales role that you’ll want to stay in forever.Our #1 goal for you as a salesperson is to help you live your ideal life, including:Uncapped Earning Potential- We want you to make so much money you don’t know what to do with it.Time Freedom- You need to have time to enjoy your financial freedom. What good does it do to make a bunch of money but have no time to enjoy life?Flexibility- We don’t believe in sales managers, we believe in mentors! You will have your own performance coach, accountability coach and onboarding specialist who will be there to support you as you grow. Get things done on your schedule. No more punching a time clock.Personal and group coaching designed to take your skills and abilities to the next level.Technology, tools, and automation created to get rid of the mundane, repetitive tasks that bog down most salespeople.Key ResponsibilitiesInitiate outbound efforts (call, text, email, LinkedIn) each day to prospects.Qualify prospects, gauge interest, and schedule sales calls.Respond in a timely manner to all leads.Collaborate with the team on improving prospecting strategies.Identify & source information on prospective clients.Oversee demo requests and fulfillment.Participate in negotiations of contracts.QualificationsStrong company culture fit.Strong listening skills and excellent phone demeanor.Technologically proficient; not necessarily an expert, but knowledgeable.Excellent written and verbal communication.Web-Cam enabled computer or laptop, Ability to receive inbound and make outbound phone calls via cell or internet (wired ethernet), in a quiet environment without interruptions.CRM experience is a plus.Working knowledge of Technical Recruitment or Software Development is a huge plus!Other InformationCompensation: 100% commission - High Six Figures is achievable ($160K+), anything less than Six Figures would be considered a failure. There is no ceiling to your compensation plan.Work from anywhere in the world.Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, ContractPay: Up to $160,000.00 per yearBenefits:Flexible scheduleSupplemental Pay:Commission payEducation:Bachelor's (Preferred)Experience:Sales Experience: 1 year (Preferred)Contract Length:VariesFull Time Opportunity:YesWork Location:Fully RemoteHours per week:Less than 1010-1920-2930-39This Job Is Ideal for Someone Who Is:Achievement-oriented -- enjoys taking on challenges, even if they might failAutonomous/Independent -- enjoys working with little directionCompany's website:https://veztekusa.com/COVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processVirtual meetings

Southeast Direct Manager, Direct Sales
Remote - Southeast
From developing brand new accounts to driving expansion across existing accounts, our Direct Sales team transforms opportunity into action every day. Whether focusing on a geographical area, product line, industry, channel or market segment, their goal is the same: to develop relationships with the end-users of the organization and generate meaningful sales. They are the direct line between our ground-breaking portfolio of product solutions and the desks of satisfied customers.
This Is What You'll Do as Southeast Direct Manager on the East Enterprise Preferred Team
Take ownership of the South East sales targets; lead the account teams covering the district across all verticals for client accounts
Develop plans and strategies for developing business and achieving the company’s sales goal
Inspire, lead, coach, set expectations, and motivate the sales team to build and grow their territories
Accurately forecast monthly, quarterly, and annual targets for assigned district
Effectively manage districts by considering each and all accounts collectively; establish accurate plans and forecasts; prioritize efforts; generate short-term results while holding a long-term perspective to achieve overall results
Provide leadership and oversight to ensure the team demonstrates and deploys resources expertly and for the highest impact, collaborating with All BU’s within DELL Technologies, Channels/Alliances, WSG, DCCS, SPS, Vmware, to create a flawless customer experience
Manage key customer relationships and participate in closing strategic opportunities
Understand product and competitive products to be able demonstrate our value proposition effectively to clients
Develop and maintain relationships with decision makers in the local market
Engage meaningfully with C-level and Executive decision makers at the enterprise levels
Key Responsibilities
Need motivated leader to work in accounts with low/declining spend to reverse and grow revenue
Our accounts in EP are built up of None Buyers and we need to turn them into buyers
The Core Account Managers on your team will have ownership of the account plans for every account in their territory
Will need to execute in a world where not every account has existing relationships and we will need to find a way into accounts via any path available
Attains team revenue and margin targets
Provides direction, development and inspiration to team members
Manages the hiring, staffing and maintaining of a diverse and effective workforce
Drive sales strategies and sales promotion campaigns that align to divisional and area responsibilities
Work across all BU’s to ensure alignment and execution to dive WSG, SPS, WSG, Services, and VMware business
Mine existing relationships as well as comprehensive sales and product plans to further grow DELL Technologies key relationships
Understand customers’ businesses to be able to explore opportunities in underpenetrated accounts
Take the first step towards your dream career
Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role:

Essential Requirements
12 to 15 years of outside sales experience and 4+ years of managerial experience
Ability to drive training and developing plans for the organization
High level understanding of customer/industry climate
Moderate to high level of solutions and technical knowledge
Desirable Requirements
Bachelor’s degree
Here’s our story; now tell us yours
Dell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. We’re proud to be a diverse and inclusive team and have an endless passion for our mission to drive human progress.

What’s most important to us is that you are respected, feel like you can be yourself and have the opportunity to do the best work of your life - while still having a life. We offer excellent benefits, bonus programs, flexible work arrangements, a variety of career development opportunities, employee resource groups, and much more.

We started with computers, but we didn’t stop there. We are helping customers move into the future with multi-cloud, AI and machine learning through the most innovative technology and services portfolio for the data era. Join us and become a part of what’s next in technology, starting today.

You can also learn more about us by reading our latest Diversity and Inclusion Report and our plan to make the world a better place by 2030 here.

Dell is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Dell are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Job ID: R082858

Want to enjoy the flexibility of working from home with the leading virtual assistant provider in the United States? BELAY is a top-ranked virtual solutions company looking for highly-motivated virtual assistants, who have a passion for serving others. Come join us and experience the freedom of working virtually with the ideal work/life balance to match your professional pursuit.
WHY BELAY?
Entrepreneur Magazine ranked BELAY the number one in Best Culture for Small-Sized Companies and the Top Company Culture for a Small Business Award for having "productive" and "high-performance" culture.
Recognized by Inc. Magazine as one the Fastest Growing Companies in the United States in 2015.
Received the 'When Work Works' Award from the Society of Human Resource Management, recognizing "companies that offer effective and flexible workplace strategies, empowering their organization to rise above the competition."
Atlanta Business Chronicle (BELAY's headquarters) named BELAY one of the "Best Places to Work."
ARE YOU LOOKING FOR:
A remote position where you serve as your client's indispensable partner?
An opportunity to use your talents and skills to build your client's success?
A community of contractors to share ideas and best practices?
Regular support and guidance from your BELAY team?
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS/RESPONSIBILITES:
Maintain executive's appointments/calendar.
Email management and organization.
Prepare presentations and/or spreadsheets.
Social Media management.
Create structure/workflow/processes.
Research technologies and make recommendations.
CRM administration: updates and data entry.
Make travel arrangements, such as booking flights, cars, and making hotel and restaurant reservations.
Project Assistance/Coordination.
Event planning and coordination.
Provide assistance with personal tasks as needed.
KEY ATTRIBUTES:
Detail-oriented, organized, and efficient.
Extremely self-motivated with strong time management.
Proactive, pragmatic, and resourceful problem solver.
Trustworthy and reliable.
Friendly and professional communicator.
Ability to manage multiple priorities and meet or beat deadlines with no errors.
Tech-savvy and quick to learn new concepts.
Ability to anticipate the needs of others coupled with a strong desire to serve.
Adaptable.
KEY QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor's Degree and experience working remotely preferred.
Available daily (Mon-Fri) during business hours, and able to dedicate at least 20 hours/week.
Experience in an administrative support role.
In-home office setup including Mac or PC Computer (including webcam) with minimum 1.0ghz dual-core processor, 8gb, and the most recent version of MS Office installed (all programs; Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint).
A fast and reliable internet connection.
Smartphone with email capabilities.
Designated professional, quiet space.
NOTE:
This is a 1099 contractor role.
You MUST be available during regular business hours. This is not a job that can be partnered with your other full-time job. No evening hours.
All applicants may be subject to a background check prior to an offer of employment or contract being issued.
BELAY Participates in E-Verify.
We are currently accepting application for residents of all states EXCEPT California, Montana, New Jersey, New York, and Pennsylvania. Applicants living in these states will not be considered for contract opportunities at this time.

The Grants Specialist is responsible for planning and administration of grants and special projects at LYRASIS. Thisrequiresa broad understanding of the operations of LYRASIS and the organization's position in the field; identification and evaluation of projects or programs that are good candidates for financial investment including, but not limited to, granting programs; and prioritizing which will benefit most from increased financial support.
In addition, this role will be responsible for the identification of funders, including grant-making agencies that are mission-aligned; leading development and submission of proposals (which may include gathering data and research on the subject/topic); administering awarded projects to ensure compliance with terms/conditions from the funder; coordinating and managing award revisions; oversight of funderperformance andfinancial reports; ensuring that organizational policies and procedures are in place to comply with funder terms/conditions, and management of related project or program documentation. The Grants Specialist also participates in and supports organizational business planning initiatives at LYRASIS that intersect with the Innovation Process and the Catalyst Fund(C$F) program.
Duties/Job Responsibilities:
Maintain an organizationalgrantsunit for LYRASIS, serving all parts of the organization.
Review and/or solicit ideas for proposals
Lead planning, coordination, development, and submission of proposals
Establish and maintain organizational policies and procedures to ensure compliance with grant award terms and conditions.
Provide oversight in organization-wide grant administration to ensure compliance with approved project plans, approved budgets, and contractual terms and conditions.
Establish and maintain grant management procedures for reporting (financial and performance).
Provide oversight for financial administration and reporting for all grants. Approve and submit financial reports as needed.
Serve as Institutional Grants Administrator for federal grants.
Manage processes for revision of grants, including budget reallocations, extensions, personnel changes, and changes to the scope of work.
Identify granting agencies (public and private) with compatible interests and keep informed of grant opportunities.
Assist staff to establish and maintain positive relationships with potential granting agencies and partners.
Maintain LYRASIS grant records to comply with grantor and audit expectations.
Manage specific grant projects as needed, which may include staff supervision.
Support LYRASIS staff with writing, planning, and grant advice/insight as needed.
Participates in and supports organizational business planning initiatives.
Perform any other additional responsibilities as assigned.
Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
Required
Requiresworking knowledge of the library, archive, and/or museum fields;
Requires knowledge of business planning;
Good analytical skills for planning;
Literacy in word processing and spreadsheets;
Ability to plan and manage projects and coordinate the efforts of others;
Knowledge of grant application and management processes and procedures, including federal OMB guidelines and circulars;
Excellent writing skills;
Ability to interpret financial reports and manage budgets.
Grant preparation and administration experience is required.
Experience in research,including survey design and administration,and business planning is required.
Preferred
Knowledge of federal grant administrative guidelines is preferred
Project Management and coordination experience is preferred
This position is part of a geographically and institutionally distributed team, and, as such, applications from candidates interested in telecommuting are welcome.
To Apply: All applications MUST be submitted with a cover letter for consideration
About Us:
LYRASIS is a 501 c 3 non-profit membership organization, with an organizational history dating back to 1936, LYRASIS is home to more than 1,000-member academic and public libraries, museums, archives, and other collections-holding organizations located in 28 countries.
LYRASIS was created by its members to help them tackle wide-reaching challenges with a collective strength, including the development and selection of new technology solutions; fostering community-wide projects that help deliver better outcomes and services.
At LYRASIS, one of our core values is to provide an inclusive environment to all who are employed here. Therefore, the company is intentional in providing fair and equitable employment opportunities to all applicants, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or genetics.This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring,placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

Company:
LG Electronics Alabama Inc. (LGEAI) - Service
Job Function:
Field Service and Support

At LG, innovation is the foundation of everything we do. We make products and services that make lives better, easier and happier through increased functionality and fun. Put simply, we make “Life Good” – from home appliances, consumer electronics, vehicle components and mobile communications to business innovations in digital signage, air conditioning, solar and LED lighting.

We are currently seeking a Field Service Technician to join our dynamic team. All candidates must be able to work coverage in the Atlanta, GA area.

POSITION SUMMARY:

Under Field Service supervision, this remote role will coordinate development and implementation of specialized field training and development programs of a highly technical or sophisticated nature, aimed at improving individual and organizational performance within the assigned area (See location requirements below). Conducts needs assessments and designs, develops, tests, delivers and evaluates technical field training programs for Direct Mobile Service Technicians (DMST) and service providers on all type of products. .

RESPONSIBILITIES:


Accountable for KPI improvement for the assigned technicians they advise for; RTAT, FRFT, Reclaim, NPS, QoS and injuries.
Mentor techs on techniques to improve performance metrics.
Provide company support by planning/executing reclaim reduction and difficult repairs.
Service riding with field technicians and provide phone support - 40%
Plans, designs, develops, and delivers sustainable strategic field training (including technical training) and instructional programs, health and safety programs using instructor-led and/or train-the trainer.
Evaluates effectiveness of training and development programs, utilizing appropriate data collection instruments and procedures. 30%
Attend weekly quality meeting and report new field product issues and defects.
Provide factory support by riding with factory engineers and knowledge sharing.
Identify parts issues and forward to Q&E and Parts teams.
Inspect new models (IQC) by factory guidelines and submit weekly report. - 30%
, OT %)

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:

A.S. degree
Minimum 3 years of experience directly related to all appliances and responsibilities specified, which includes at least 1 year of experience conducting hands-on technical training.
Extensive working knowledge in designing, developing, implementing, and evaluating training plans, curricula, and methodology.
Proficient in productivity tools for PC's
Project management and presentation skills and the ability to resolve complex problems and issues.
Strong verbal and written communication skills with a focus on rapport building, listening, and the ability to deliver effective training programs.
Demonstrated ability to train technicians and learners and novice computer users required.
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a complex environment.
Moderate physical activity. May require physical effort including lifting up to 50 pounds and some extended periods of standing or walking and bending
Ability to travel up to 75% within the assigned Region

Further, the Company takes affirmative action to ensure that applicants are employed and employees are treated during employment without regard to any of these characteristics.

Alcumus ContractorCheck is an innovative software company. As an independent third-party, Alcumus ContractorCheck provides contractor management and compliance for clients, and awards health and safety pre-qualification accreditation to contractors across Canada. Our mission is to be the risk management company most committed to its innovation, people, and dedication to client service. Our people feel a strong sense of purpose by keeping other people safe. At Alcumus ContractorCheck, we want you to enjoy coming to work so we are dedicated to building a fun and inclusive company culture.

Upholding the Company Values

Know your stuff -Ensure you have the technical knowhow you need. Keep building and improving on it every day.

Be brave -Speak up, find a way and dare to try. Take accountability for the part you play.

Be a team player -Be inclusive, both within your immediate team and across the business. Help your stakeholders to achieve their potential.

Enjoy the journey -Work hard, keep perspective and have fun along the way. Take a positive and constructive outlook to help drive change.


The Position

The Account Executive - USA role reporting to Business Development Team Lead, the ideal Account Executive will be joining a 100%+ growth company, who will bring high performance levels and complementary skills to our growing team. The role will be responsible for creating, qualifying and closing new business by demonstrating how our SaaS platform enhances, save dollars, and builds our clients’ businesses across North America.


Responsibilities

Building industry knowledge on our target markets through structured research and exploration
Uncover and diagnose problems, identify value creation opportunities for prospects with cold reach outs and inbound leads
Use Salesforce.com to manage all of your sales activities
Conduct web demonstrations, site visits and attend industry events
Work closely with the marketing and BDR teams at all times
Work closely with Customer Services team to ensure our clients are achieving their goals
Be a learner, teacher and leader in our continued training programs


Qualifications:

3+ years as a self-starter, proficient individual contributor with a proven track record of success
Experience and success both in the new business realm as well as managing a group of clients
An organized professional with the ability to plan, organize, schedule and follow through. We want those who plan to win through strategy and hard work, not luck.
Strong ability to work up and down an organization
Creative Problem Solver who can interpret and uncover complex needs in complex organization. We must simplify complex situations and find opportunities for improvement that are actionable.
Confidence & comfortable to cold call and engage in meaningful discussions. We are just scratching the surface in our market.
Strong presentation skills both in person and via webinars
Genuine communicator who can empathize with our clients’ challenges and articulate actions to build safer and stronger businesses.
Mastery of creating presentations and using PowerPoint as a tool to become a better business professional
A true team player with an openness to growth and professional/ personal development for him/herself and others around them.
Passionate about a product with purpose and being a key contributor to a fast growing company that is striving to takeover the #1 spot in its niche


Bonus:

If you have contractor management experience within the industry under your belt, this would be a definite asset!

The CC Advantage:

At ContractorCheck we encourage inclusiveness, purpose and innovation. We offer flexible work hours, full health and medical benefits, team socials, happy hours and career progression in a high growth environment.

How to Join the CC Team:

If you want to join a company that strives for a purpose and makes an impact in the lives of others we encourage you to apply to Alcumus Contractor Check today. All candidates will be afforded equal opportunity through the recruiting process. Please be advised that only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted. References will be requested for those candidates selected for an interview. Alcumus Contractor Check welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Are you a full desk recruiter looking to make a change for the better?Contract to W2 Employee - Straight CommissionVirtual- Work from homeNo travel requiredDogwood Services Inc. is a 12-year old staffing and outsourcing firm with a stellar track record of recruiting and placing highly skilled people for our clients. We are veteran-owned and veteran-led. We have a great brand, our own team of experienced recruiters, excellent internal processes, strong financial strength and a great leadership team and are a company of 60+ people. We are the sister company to Dogwood Management Partners, who is focused on federal outsourcing. In short- we have developed an excellent brand with an excellent reputation.We are looking for a few more account execs to join our team. We don't care where you live-- as long as you can do the job. We don't care how young or how old you are, what citizenship, sex or color you are, where you went to school or what kind of degree you have-- or if you even have a degree. We DO care about things like ethics, honesty, excellent communications skills, client relationship management, and a habit of doing the right thing because it's the right thing.... and RESULTS. This is a virtual position, and we currently have associates working under this model in four time zones.There are NO caps on your income at Dogwood. We expect the right person for this job to bring home $200,000+ per year after a year of hard work-- followed by more years with even more income, because our commission program is set up to reward achievers. We don't re-assign accounts to others, we don't re-align territories, and we don't put hindrances in your path. You would be working directly for our Managing Director, who would serve as your coach and mentor. Your response to this advertisement will forward to him; see below.WHAT KIND OF SKILLS and EXPERIENCE ARE REQUIRED?Extensive business to business (outside sales) sales experience and skills. Those without this experience will not be considered.Solid experience within a vertical market (such as technology, finance, healthcare, engineering, aerospace, logistics, manufacturing)WHAT ARE WE ALSO LOOKING FOR IN YOUR RESUME (And listening for during the interview) ?Values and ethics. We're transparent. We want you to be as well.Personal maturity and a stable lifestyleA track record of working on successful, high-performance teamsA desire to succeed married to a habit of hard work. (Slackers tend to weed themselves out pretty quickly here.)A desire to learn and try new things and to grow personally and professionallyA proven track record of closing business with other businessesTenacity. An ability to plan your work and work your plan-- every DAY.The energy and ability to work through the inevitable issues and challenges.An ability to think creatively.A deep understanding of the vertical market(s) in which you prefer to operateDogwood is a 100% "work remote" company. This presents both opportunities (for those who thrive on working in an unstructured environment) as well as challenges. We don't care where you live, but we DO care about results. You will be expected to have a home office, to provide your own laptop, phone and an internet connection. We provide basic online tools and full support-- and of course, an excellent compensation plan. Our goal is to help you build your book of business.The hiring process: - We review resumes and cover letters for completeness- We email back those who interest us and may ask a couple of email questions- We call back those of interest to us- Once we've made up our mind, we can bring you on board in short orderThis position is straight and significant commission on a 1099 basis to start. As soon as you demonstrate you're what we have been looking for, we'll look to convert you to employee status, with benefits to include vacation, medical, dental, vision and 401(k).We are veteran-owned and veteran-led, which makes us a very good place to work because we know how to build winning teams, how to take care of our people and how to get results for our clients. Want to know more about us, our past successes and our leadership?All resumes and cover letters will be personally reviewed; if you meet all of our qualifications, expect an email back. JobTitle: Energetic OUTbound Appointment Setter - Flexible Hours (B2B)
Text: About The Role: Our company is seeking a driven, enthusiastic, and high-energy individual with a proven track record in working VIRTUALLY (remote) from home.IMPORTANT! This is for cold calling (outbound) to real estate investors - it is mandatory that you have outbound appointment setting experience in the past. If you took INbound calls for a doctor's office, car dealership, etc. to schedule appointments, that is unfortunately not what we are looking for at this time, and it is simply a waste of your time to enter our hiring system, answer questions, etc. - your application will be deleted automatically by our system since we get tons of applicants for each position.But if you do have outbound appointment setting experience, read on, because this position pays well above the industry average and gives you incredible flexibility with a choice of either part-time or full-time work. Your job will entail phoning and setting appointments with Real Estate Investors to meet with our Consultants.If you are a stay-at-home parent, have recently graduated from college, or are just searching for a job that will allow you flexibility, this job could be a perfect match for you. Our company will also be an excellent fit for anyone looking to develop a long-term career in sales. You will be joining a team of very fun people in a growth-focused company that rewards you for all of your accomplishments!Our company will provide you with everything you’ll need for success, including:** A proven, success-backed script that will allow you to start achieving exciting results on your very first day!** A list of target Real Estate Investors for you to call that may be interested in working with our company. You will have the unique opportunity to speak with, qualify, and schedule appointments with business owners that will set them on the path to growing their business in a new way.** You will receive training in simple and effective prospecting methods which will allow you to avoid common obstacles and start booking appointments with interested businesses in the first 20 minutes of your day.** If needed, a company-provided smartphone app or web-based softphone from which you can manage all of your calls.** A valuable opportunity to learn, grow, and become an even more successful sales professional with a company that was founded on the values of continual learning and growth.** The opportunity to have fun every day with a team of passionate, hard-working people just like you!!COMPENSATION: This role comes with excellent opportunities to grow within our company as a result of your performance. Monthly income potential for part-time work is $2,000 to $3,000, with full-time work offering a potential of $3,500 to $5,000, transitioning into a sales position comes with an income potential of $100,000+ per year.TASKS YOU'LL BE PERFORMING: ** Management of a basic sales pipeline CRM or Google Sheets: Each day you will update and manage CRM notes and call sheets.** Calling: 15-20 dials to prospects every hour will be expected.** Appointment Booking: You will be responsible for booking decision-makers for appointments in available time slots. A calendar application for this purpose will be provided.REQUIRED SKILLS: To qualify for this job with our company, you must possess the following skills:** Great Communication Skills: You will be representing our company and sales team during your conversations with target businesses. A love for conversing with people as well as ease when talking on the phone is vital.** Great People Skills and Positive Mindset: In addition to a genuine enthusiasm for talking to people, persuasiveness and the ability to alleviate potential clients’ concerns while booking appointments will make interactions exciting and a positive outcome for all involved.** Coachable: You will learn and master your role by working with both our company’s Founder and Operations Manager. An open mind and desire to improve will propel your performance forward.** Team-Oriented: Our team thrives on close collaboration and good-natured competition. As part of the sales team, your positive working relationship with your assigned sales rep will mean your success – more kept appointments and more sales closed!** Self-Starter: Because you will be working from home, it is essential that you be adept at time management and efficient handling of your own schedule.** Previous Sales Experience: A proven history of success in setting appointments is required.ABOUT US: Mass Attention is an industry leader in helping Real Estate Investors grow and be more successful.We believe in “Always Learning & Growing.” Every one of us is continually striving to improve ourselves, gain new skills, and level up our lives. This ideal is why invest in supporting each of our employees’ development and growth. And because we are always seeking to promote from within our company, there will always be ample room for career advancement with us!We appreciate your interest in this position with Mass Attention!Job Types: Full-time, Part-timePay: $25,000.00 - $60,000.00 per year

As a Collections Specialist, you will perform collection follow up on delinquent and/or non-delinquent accounts for medical facilities in a high volume, inbound and outbound, call center environment. You will utilize excellent communication and customer service skills to resolve patient accounts.


WHAT YOU WILL DO IN THIS ROLE?
You will refer calls/accounts to appropriate parties based on customer inquiries.
You will identify problem accounts and escalate as appropriate.
You will update the patient account record to identify actions taken on the account.
You will work with patients and guarantors to secure payment on outstanding account balances.
You will maintain minimum production and quality standards.
You will achieve passing quality review scores per unit requirements.
You will produce acceptable unit collection volumes.
You will work within company attendance guidelines.
You will provide excellent customer service.
You will practice and adhere to the Parallon “Code of Conduct" philosophy and “Mission and Values Statement".
You will attend Privacy and Security Training as required by the HIPAA Awareness Program and comply with all guidelines, policies and procedures to assure sensitive or confidential information is protected in accordance with the HIPAA rules and regulations.

Qualifications

High School diploma or GED preferred
Minimum one year related experience preferred, preferably in healthcare

GuildQuality is looking for part-time Bilingual Customer Experience Representatives (CERs) to join our team! This role can be done remotely and is approximately 20-25 hours per week during the following times: Monday – Friday 9:00am – 11:00pm, Saturday 11:00am – 9:00pm. Our bilingual surveyors start out at $11.00/hr with the ability to earn more with tenure and performance.

Required Equipment:


Must have access to a desktop or laptop computer (a tablet will not work for this role)
Must have access to reliable internet


About Us:

GuildQuality is the nation’s leading provider of customer satisfaction performance measurement tools for the home improvement and home services industry. We provide a robust and automated customer survey plus real-time trend reports and promotional tools to over 2,500 members. GuildQuality’s family of companies includes Best Pick Reports and Five Star Services, two leaders of the home services industry, connecting homeowners in need of home service projects with independently researched and recommended local home service providers.

Where:
Our office is in Midtown Atlanta, but our CERs work primarily from home. This position offers great flexibility. You will need to provide your own computer and candidates must have a quiet work environment with a secure internet connection that is not shared.

What you’ll be doing:

Our surveyors are brand ambassadors for both our company and our member clients. Our survey team has conversations with homeowners to assess their satisfaction level in working with their builder, remodeler or contractor. As such, our surveyors must have a friendly, professional disposition and enjoy interacting with people on the phone. Previous experience in customer service is a plus. Each Surveyor will be provided a phone script to follow and is responsible for accurately recording responses to the survey questions.

Desired Skills & Experience


Fluency in French and English - this role will require interaction with French-speaking and English-speaking customers
Friendly, professional disposition
Verbal and written communication skills
Listening skills
Knowledge of customer service principles and practices
Ability to type a minimum of 50+ words per minute
Strong phone presence
Comfortable working with technology applications
Great understanding of English grammar
Adaptability and flexibility


Work Environment/Culture/Benefits


We’re profitable and growing rapidly.
We have very few meetings, but lots of communication.
We’re open-book. That means everyone has a clear understanding of how the business is performing.
We don’t monitor sick days or vacation days. When someone needs time off, they take it.
Regardless of the job description and requisite skills, we only hire folks that are motivated, friendly, and team-oriented.


Our Values


Deliver value in every interaction
Don't be afraid to make a mistake
Don't just keep doing it: do it better
Do everything with integrity
Always be authentic and transparent
Have fun while working hard
Know the "why"
We are better together


Our Mission: We strive to elevate the home services, contracting, and building industries by creating trust and fostering remarkable experiences between homeowners and quality professionals.

GuildQuality and EverCommerce is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. If you are looking for a company that is truly focused on empowering small businesses with superior technology, come join a company that rewards authenticity and supports energy with a passion.

JobTitle: Sales Consultant - Inside Sales Team - Remote
Text:
What is a Sales Consultant at Assurant?
The Sales Consultant on our inside sales team will generate business opportunities by identifying prospects, evaluating prospects' position in the marketplace, developing and closing business opportunities, and researching and analyzing solutions. In this role, you will achieve sales objectives by identifying and pursuing market and niche opportunities marketing our risk solutions services products. The position entails identifying, qualifying, contacting and scheduling initial consultations with targeted prospects, leading proposal development efforts, making sales presentations, and closing new business accounts, along with managing the subsequent contracting and implementation process. You will keep management informed of industry developments by monitoring competitive products and reaction from customers. The successful candidate will continue meeting targeted growth objectives driving our business to success.
Why You Should Consider This Role
You are a relationship builder
You love sending emails and closing deals
You keep a smile on your face with a strong phone presence
You dial for value for our clients, making dozens of calls a day.
You have an innate ability to solve problems for your clients
You treat others with dignity and respect while driving business deliverables
You are a go-getter
You’ve got that can-do attitude
You believe in helping to protect what matters most
Persistence is your middle name
You go above and beyond in your role because you want to, not because you have to
Great at time management
You work independently and on a team for the best results
Excellent at lead generation by effectively managing a sales territory
Ambitious and like to grow within a big organization
Did we mention that you’ll be making a lot of calls per day?
What You Will Like
The people – we care
The diversity - every day is different
The excitement – we focus on ‘What Matters Most’ to our customers
The difference in the value Assurant places on strong leadership
The opportunity to learn, grow and advance within our Fortune 500 global company
The Details
Generate sales by cold calling, prospecting and cultivating relationships across the multifamily industry and bringing in new accounts by identifying customer needs, participating in the development of client plans and introducing new products and services.
Influence prospects to partner with Assurant to offer our products and services by controlling the sales process and identifying and pursuing market opportunities.
Enhance relationships with clients by providing support, guidance, and innovative ideas to differentiate from competition.
Research and recommend new opportunities and profit/service improvements.
Serve as a resource to others in the resolution of complex problems and issues.
Provide in-depth knowledge of the industries affecting the business.
Understand financial trends and fluctuations with assigned clients and effectively communicate issues and resolutions to clients and internal business team.
Develop sales strategies and execute account plans in support of goals/objectives.
Assist in product development by providing client insights into wants and needs for their consumers.
Financial responsibilities to include responsible for bringing new revenue from prospects defined within our ecosystem and pre-tax requirements
***This is a 100% remote, work from home position offering a competitive base salary + commission + full benefits.***
The Ideal Candidate Will Have
Minimum Associate Degree or equivalent work experience; Preferred Bachelor’s degree
Minimum 2 years of experience in financial services/insurance industry preferred multifamily (property management) industry
Inside sales experience, or property management and leasing
Excellent time management, written, verbal and presentation skills.
Effective negotiation and closing techniques to secure profitable business.
Ability to demonstrate an immediate, positive impact on sales.
Proficiency in MS Office
Knowledge in CRM preferred Salesforce.
Note: This is a remote position.

JobTitle: Jr. Sales Rep - Fast-Growing FinTech Startup - $70K-170K (Remote)
Text: Please Read Carefully: Position: Junior Sales ManagerCompensation: $70-$170KCompany & Context: Enhancify is a fast-growing fintech startup with a clear mission: to help home improvement contractors (roofers, general contractors, remodelers, etc) build the American dream for themselves, their teams, and their communities.Specifically, we are disrupting the home improvement lending industry through an innovative point-of-sale tech platform that helps contractors seamlessly turn expensive projects into low monthly payments, while giving homeowners the ability to complete their dream projects and build value in their homes.The problem we solve is dealer fees. Traditionally, today’s old-school financing companies require contractors to pay a percentage of their project in exchange for financing. This results in an average loss of 20-40% of the profit margin, while rejecting many homeowners who don’t have excellent credit.We’ve built a software solution that empowers contractors to win more jobs by offering attractive payment options to homeowners, without paying dealer fees, and while being able to serve a large community of customers.Performance to Date: We launched about 30 months ago and are profitable. We have 1,500+ paying customers (unlike most startups) and are completely bootstrapped. We’ve built partnerships with top lending networks of America (Goldman Sachs, LendingClub, SoFi, etc.) as well as banks and credit unions and are currently sitting on ~$30B in capital to deploy through our platform.Our lean but scrappy team consists of experienced industry veterans in the digital credit, B2B SaaS, and enterprise-software spaces, as well as folks who are from the trades/home-services and get it. As a team, we are solving difficult problems, working hard, and successfully competing against billion-dollar publicly-traded competition.The Opportunity: We are seeking exceptional, "A" players to add to our core team in the form of a Junior Sales Manager. In the last few years we’ve validated a need the market is starving for, demonstrated an ability to sell, and are now obsessed about creating an industry-changing customer experience. We need the right people to help us put fuel on the fire.- This is an entry-level sales position. We are looking to mold and create closers, not hire them. We're looking for raw ingredients.- You will be cold-calling every day. If the idea of making 150 dials a day is something that makes you nervous, this is not for you.- Unlike most Junior sales positions, you will also be closing. We will mold you into someone who can not just sell, but close. You will be leading an end-to-end sales process yourself, generating opportunities, developing relationships, and generating revenue as a Closer. You will also have accountability as an individual contributor.- You will generate revenue, be evaluated by your ability to do so (and have fun while doing it)- You will be helping contractors grow their businesses. You will be their champion, relentlessly focused on providing more value and learning about the market. Aside from closing clients, you will also ensure your customers are successful over the long-term.- You will be a multi-channel sales practitioner, selling on the phone, over email, and video recordings- You will be trained and molded by a successful team. This is a difficult, challenging, "slog-filled" role. However, if you are successful here, you will develop a lethal skillset that will serve you well for the rest of your life.- You will get hands-on experience working in a high-paced startup environment. That means together we will make decisions, make mistakes, and make improvements.About You (Personality): - You're hungry as hell. You're extremely results oriented. You don't make excuses and find ways to get the job done, period. You have a clear and powerful reason why you need to succeed right now.- You have Grit. You can take damage day after day. Working in an early-stage company is hard. You have a demonstrated ability to slog through difficult situations where most others would quit. You won't give up because of bad days, weeks, or months. Once you have a vision in your mind, you will make it happen.- You have a relentless commitment to Excellence. You're obsessed with not just becoming the best at what you do (you love to compete and win)...but with pulling your best out of you. You can always improve. When you hit your goal, you know it's time to raise your standards.- Above all, you are Trustworthy. While you love to win, your core desire is to help people. You have an unshakeable sense of ethics. Your core values are honesty, loyalty, and integrity. You take complete responsibility when you screw up.- While you love to win, your core desire is to help people. You have an unshakeable sense of ethics and are trustworthy. Your core values are honesty, loyalty, and integrity. You take complete responsibility when you screw up.- You're smart and systems-minded. You have self-awareness and improve your approach based on new information.About You (Ideal Experience): - You have a competitive athlete background- You had top grades in school or similar (objectively intelligent)- You have cold-calling experience- You have been an SDR and were told you can't close your own deals yet- You have a background in the trades / construction and "get" the space- You speak Spanish- You have previous client success / account management / client-relationship experienceWho this is NOT for: - You're looking for a "job". You want to punch the clock, do the bare minimum, and chill.- You've been in sales for more than 3 years- You have more than 5 years of professional experience (out of school). We're looking for people just out of school / beginning their careers.- You need a lot of structure, hand-holding, or accountability. The words, "That's not my job" has ever crossed your lips.- You think working remotely means working less hard- You're not coachableOtherHigh-performing reps will be on track to move up in the sales organization and substantially higher compensation. At or exceeding quota: Tier 3 (Junior) reps - $70K - $140K. Tier 2 - 80K - $200K. Tier 1 - $95K - $240K.There is a small base salary and most compensation is commission.There is a paid 30-day training / evaluation period. We will likely hire 2-3 folks and have you compete.You will be expected to have a quiet, professional setting to work remotely.References are mandatory and will be called.Please only apply if you are a high-performer and you are willing to work hard to earn more than the industry average. We want "A Players".Job Types: Full-time, ContractPay: $70,000.00 - $170,000.00 per yearEducation:Bachelor's (Preferred)Experience:Sales Experience: 1 year (Preferred)

GuildQuality is looking for part-time Customer Experience Representatives (CERs) to join our team! This role can be done remotely and is approximately 20-25 hours per week during the following times: Monday – Friday 9:00am – 11:00pm, Saturday 11:00am – 9:00pm. Our surveyors start out at $8.00/hr with the ability to earn more with tenure and performance.

 Required Equipment:


Must have access to a desktop or laptop computer (a tablet will not work for this role)
Must have access to reliable internet


About Us:

GuildQuality, an EverCommerce company, is the nation’s leading provider of customer satisfaction performance measurement tools for the home improvement and home services industry. We provide a robust and automated customer survey plus real-time trend reports and promotional tools to over 2,500 members. GuildQuality’s family of companies includes Best Pick Reports and Five Star Services, two leaders of the home services industry, connecting homeowners in need of home service projects with independently researched and recommended local home service providers.

Where:
Our office is in Midtown Atlanta, but our CERs work remotely. This position offers great flexibility. You will need to provide your own computer and candidates must have a quiet work environment with a secure internet connection that is not shared.

What you’ll be doing:
Our surveyors are brand ambassadors for both our company and our member clients. Our survey team has conversations with homeowners to assess their satisfaction level in working with their builder, remodeler or contractor. As such, our surveyors must have a friendly, professional disposition and enjoy interacting with people on the phone. Previous experience in customer service is a plus. Each Surveyor will be provided a phone script to follow and is responsible for accurately recording responses to the survey questions.

Desired Skills & Experience


Friendly, professional disposition
Verbal and written communication skills
Listening skills
Knowledge of customer service principles and practices
Ability to type a minimum of 50+ words per minute
Strong phone presence
Comfortable working with technology applications
Great understanding of English grammar
Adaptability and flexibility


Work Environment/Culture/Benefits


We’re profitable and growing rapidly.
We have very few meetings, but lots of communication.
We’re open-book. That means everyone has a clear understanding of how the business is performing.
We don’t monitor sick days or vacation days. When someone needs time off, they take it.
Regardless of the job description and requisite skills, we only hire folks that are motivated, friendly, and team-oriented.


Our Values


Deliver value in every interaction
Don't be afraid to make a mistake
Don't just keep doing it: do it better
Do everything with integrity
Always be authentic and transparent
Have fun while working hard
Know the "why"
We are better together


Our Mission: We strive to elevate the home services, contracting, and building industries by creating trust and fostering remarkable experiences between homeowners and quality professionals.


EverCommerce is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. If you are looking for a company that is truly focused on empowering small businesses with superior technology, come join a company that rewards authenticity and supports energy with a passion.

Discover Your Career at Emory University:

Emory University is a leading research university that fosters excellence and attracts world-class talent to innovate today and prepare leaders for the future. We welcome candidates who can contribute to the diversity and excellence of our academic community.
Description:

JOB DESCRIPTION:
Identifies, contacts, corresponds with and interviews research study participants, either in person, in a clinical setting, at a subject's residence or by telephone to obtain data for an assigned research project.
Collects, codes and enters study information into database and may assist in data compilation.
Edits completed interview questionnaires for completeness, legibility and accuracy.
Obtains missing or questionable data.
Maintains complete and accurate records and files pertaining to one or more research studies.
Performs related approved non-clinical responsibilities as required.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
A high school diploma or equivalent.
One year of administrative support, customer service or other relevant experience.
Data entry experience.
Note - In the clinical setting, this research role is limited to no more than casual physical contact with the research subject and no invasive or diagnostic procedures.

NOTE: This role will be granted the opportunity to work from home regularly but must be able to commute to Emory University location as needed. Emory reserves the right to change this status with notice to employee.

NOTE: This role will be granted the opportunity to work from home regularly but must be able to commute to Emory University location as needed. Emory reserves the right to change this status with notice to employee.
