Data Engineering Software Intern, Assurant Global Data Analytics
Assurant is seeking Computer Science or Engineering undergraduates, graduates and PHD’s to join the ‘Data Engineering’ team under its Global Data Analytics organization for its internship program.
What We Bring to you:
A welcoming and energetic environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. We consistently explore new technologies and tools to be agile.
Workplace flexibility and an environment that welcomes continued professional growth through support of positive coaching and mindful mentoring.
Assurant’s culture encourages our people to hone current skills and build new capabilities, while discovering their genius.
Impact You'll Make:
Help continue to build hyperscale data engineering platform
Implement data centric web applications to implement Machine Learning and AI solutions
Assist with development and deployment of ‘Data as a Service’
Create user process documentations and operational instruction material.
What You'll Bring:
Basic Qualification
Undergraduate, Graduate or PHD in Computer Science, Systems Engineering or related field
Knowledge of modern enterprise data architectures, design patterns, and data toolsets and the ability to apply them
Strong problem solving, conceptualization, and communication skills
Basic understanding of Big Data, Machine Learning and AI technologies
Knowledge of Cloud Service Platforms such as: Microsoft Azure (preferred), Amazon Wes Services, Google Cloud Platform or any other.
Desired Skills
Knowledge or Experience as full-stack application developer: backend database, web services, and UI
Knowledge or Experience on distributed data platforms, like Spark (highly preferred), Hadoop, and HBase
Proficiency in Python or Java, and working knowledge in one or more languages, such as .Net, C#, SQL, Unix/Linux Shell Scripting, PowerShell
Expertise designing and building Data APIs and RESTful APIs
Ability to use front-end development frameworks, using HTML, CSS, JavaScript or Angular
Familiarity with containerization in Docker and hosting platform such as Kubernetes
Implement data centric web applications through operationalization of Machine Learning and AI solutions
Logistics:
Commitment: Minimum 20 hours per week; Preferably 40 hours per week
This is a paid internship and most often applicable for university credits
OPT and CPT Candidates are welcome to apply
This is a remote position
Work Locations: Miami, FL-USA, or Anywhere in the US
Organization: Assurant – Global Data Analytics

Description
About this role
Hello there!
We’re Aladdin WealthTech. We are a FinTech company with a start-up vibe but some big-time resources. We are part of BlackRock, the largest asset manager on the planet … that is also a $1B annual revenue enterprise software company. We create products that help financial advisors and their clients build financial plans and portfolios to achieve some of life’s most important moments: buying a home, sending your kids to college and retirement. We believe in the power of BlackRock’s world-class portfolio analytics AND the importance of the human connection between advisor and client.
We are looking for an experienced UX/UI designer to lead design on a high-growth product area: SMA (separately managed accounts) and Model Portfolios. You may have heard about BlackRock’s acquisition of Aperio, a Bay area leader in SMAs. Our belief is that the SMA space is an area full of potential to be disrupted by world-class design, service and technology. We are looking for a designer interested in the opportunity to lead design for our product team tackling the SMA/models market.
This is a hands-on designer role: you will be a hands-on designer for some projects, partnering with product management to craft product roadmaps and define future product directions, working with engineering and product management to realize designs, working with other designers in the Aladdin WealthTech team to improve the craft and process of design @ BlackRock.
You will be joining a product team with a start-up feel and a global impact. Aladdin Wealth provides wealth managers with an integrated suite of experiences for users that range from front-line financial advisors to the Chief Investment Officer at the home-office. You will be working with some of the original pioneers of SMA and model products inside BlackRock, financial service veterans and newcomers from technology companies, large and small. We work hard, enjoy each other’s company during and after work and are passionate about the potential of our technology to improve financial outcomes for clients. We like our mash-up of finTech start-up and market-leading financial services company … and we think that you might like it, too!
Interested in learning more? Reach out to our recruiting team and let’s get to know each other!
Location: San Francisco (SoMa), Princeton (NJ), NY (Mid-town Manhattan) or Atlanta. Our teams are currently working remote through at least March 2021. We expect our future to be a hybrid office/work from home mix.
What you will be doing:
Lead product design for an emerging product family focused on SMAs + model portfolios.
Be a partner with your peers in product management and engineering to craft a product roadmap for BlackRock’s SMA and model portfolio products, own the health of the experience and create the environment and processes for great designs to come to life in our released products.
Be a hands-on designer for SMA + model portfolio projects, ranging from UX to UI design.
Be a key contributor to the definition of a design system across Aladdin Wealth, working with designers in Aladdin WealthTech and the Aladdin Product Group.
Be an expert on trends in wealth management product design … and to bring that expertise into the craft of creating Aladdin WealthTech product designs and our product roadmaps.
What we’re looking for:
6+ years’ experience as a product designer of software applications (web, preferably)
2+ years mentoring and coaching designers
Experience across multiple release cycles leading product design for a complex product; including representing design as part of a triad (design, development + product management) and coordinating the work of multiple designers
Experience as a design lead in scrums and agile projects
Experience integrating user feedback in the design process and across multiple product releases
Exceptional UX design skills combined with strong UI design skills. You are as comfortable and proficient designing experiences for complex user journeys as you are sweating the details on visual hierarchy and flow
Highly proficient in design delivery tools and workflows, including Sketch, Abstract and InVision
Exceptional communication skills with a proven ability to work down, across and up
An interest in wealth management and investing
BS/BFA degree in human-computer interaction, visual communication or a related field
A strong portfolio of creative product design solutions to complex problems
What we would prefer (think rainbow unicorns):
Prior experience creating products in the wealth management space, with a track-record of designing innovative solutions that improve business and portfolio outcomes for financial advisors and help investors achieve their financial goals
Experience working with and evolving design systems used across a product family
Experience designing products that are part of complex user journeys and working on problems that involve service design
Our benefits

To help you stay energized, engaged and inspired, we offer a wide range of benefits including a strong retirement plan, tuition reimbursement, comprehensive healthcare, support for working parents and Flexible Time Off (FTO) so you can relax, recharge and be there for the people you care about.
About BlackRock
BlackRock's purpose is to help more and more people experience financial well-being. As a fiduciary to investors and a leading provider of financial technology, we help millions of people build savings that serve them throughout their lives by making investing easier and more affordable.

BlackRock is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, and other statuses protected by law.
BlackRock will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records in a manner consistent with the requirements of the law, including any applicable fair chance law.

Acara Solutions is helping our aerospace manufacturing client in the Atlanta region find a sales manager to join their organization as a salaried direct employee. They are open to having someone work from home out-of-state. The salary range is $110K - $120K.

You must have experience selling turbine aircraft engines and experienced in US Defense Aerospace technical sales (ideally including APU &/or UAV).

The organization is a 50 year old European company with growth plans for the U.S., including manufacturing within the next few years. They have a small office in Atlanta and need an aircraft engine sales expert to join their U.S. sales team.

They expect it to be a fast-paced team environment. The ability to multi-task, while maintaining complex schedules, is essential in this position. The ideal candidate is first and foremost a professional. He/she will be resourceful, a good communicator, a problem solver, well organized and display integrity at all times. Bring your ability to analyze details and identify the correct approach.

They are targeting candidates with US Defense Aerospace technical sales experience. DoD fixed-wing, rotary and/or expendable air vehicle propulsion system and/or Auxillary Power Unit integration engineering and application principles.

There is substantial growth available for the right individual as they bring manufacturing over and develop their U.S. presence in the near future.

The individual will primarily source sales via email, cold calling, and lead follow-up calls unless ready for person to person deals.
The Sales Manager will be responsible for developing new leads, communicating with customers, understanding their needs, and ensuring a smooth sales process. The SM should be able to close sales and meet targets. Successful SM should be able to build instant rapport and achieve customer satisfaction.
Generates revenue by soliciting and obtaining orders, understanding and interpreting technical requirements, providing technical information, and developing accounts.
Communicating with customers, making outbound calls to potential customers, and following up on leads
Understanding customers' needs and identifying sales opportunities
Answering potential customers' questions and sending additional information per email
Assesses competitors by analyzing and summarizing competitor information and trends and identifying sales opportunities.
Develops sales opportunities by researching and identifying potential accounts, soliciting new account, building rapport, providing technical information and explanations, and preparing quotations.
Closes new accounts by answering telephone, fax, and e-mail inquiries and verifying and entering information.
Creating and maintaining a database of current and potential customers
Fills orders by transferring orders to fulfillment, communicating expected delivery date, and explaining stock-outs.
Develops accounts by checking customer"s buying history, suggesting related and new items, and explaining technical features, Researching and qualifying new leads.
Maintains and improves quality results by following standards and recommending improved policies and procedures.
Updates job knowledge by studying new product descriptions and participating in educational opportunities.
Explores opportunities to add value to job accomplishments.
Personal meetings and meetings with customers and potential customers
Presents the product portfolio, services, complex solutions, development and production capabilities
Represents the company and its values
Drafts and prepares the conditions for the implementation of the trade, including product specification, price, delivery terms (according to firm rules, instructions and regulations)


Required Skills / Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Business, Engineering or similar
Min 5 years of experience selling aircraft engines or gas turbines to DoD directly or its prime contractors
Min 4 years of experience in sales, pricing and market analysis
Min 3 years of MS Office experience & CRM Software (e.g., Salesforce, MS Dynamics)
Preferred Skills / Qualifications:
Aerospace engineering technical experience
Gas Turbine
Exceptional organizational, written and verbal communication skills
Self-starter and finisher

At Liberty Mutual, our purpose is to help people embrace today and confidently pursue tomorrow. That’s why we provide an environment focused on openness, inclusion, trust and respect. Here, you’ll discover our expansive range of roles, and a workplace where we aim to help turn your passion into a rewarding profession.
Liberty Mutual has proudly been recognized as a “Great Place to Work” by Great Place to Work® US for the past several years. We were also selected as one of the “100 Best Places to Work in IT” on IDG’s Insider Pro and Computerworld’s 2020 list. For many years running, we have been named by Forbes as one of America’s Best Employers for Women and one of America’s Best Employers for New Graduates—as well as one of America’s Best Employers for Diversity. To learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion please visit: https://jobs.libertymutualgroup.com/diversity-inclusion
We value your hard work, integrity and commitment to make things better, and we put people first by offering you benefits that support your life and well-being. To learn more about our benefit offerings please visit: https://LMI.co/Benefits
Liberty Mutual is an equal opportunity employer. We will not tolerate discrimination on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, age, disability, veteran’s status, pregnancy, genetic information or on any basis prohibited by federal, state or local law.
As a Bilingual Inside Sales Agent you will be handling inbound calls and warm transfers driven in by other Liberty Mutual Agents. You will consult customers on their insurance needs and match the correct coverages, products and benefits to convert leads into customers. As you quote and bind policies for customers on the behalf of other Liberty Mutual Agents you will be building a relationship with both customers and internal agents.
Pay Details:
$45,700 - $46,700 base
Uncapped Monthly Sales Incentive with average monthly range of $500-$1500
Total Average Earnings:50k-$65k (first year)
Schedule Details:
We are offering work from home options along with traditional in office positions depending on location.
We offer Remote Inside Sales positions in 16 states- AL, AZ, CO, FL, GA, ID, KS, MN, NC, NV, OK, OR, TX, UT, VA, WA. Please visit our website to apply to an opening in one of these other states: https://jobs.libertymutualgroup.com/careers/css/inside-sales/
During the first 6-8 weeks of training, your schedule will be Mon-Fri, (9-5:30pm CT).
During the subsequent a 8 weeks of onboarding, you schedule will remain the same.
After onboarding is completed and you transition to your regular position, your schedule will start between the hours of 12:00pm and 2:30p. Weekend shift starting times typically vary between 10:00am and 1:00pm (based on your assigned site’s hours of operations). One weekend day (Saturday or Sunday) will be required with an alternate day off mid-week every other week.
You can expect to work this schedule for a minimum of 9 months before consideration for another shift.
Why Liberty Mutual?
Positivity. Flexibility. Determination and a persuasive personality. Qualities like these cannot be taught. But they can be sharpened, strengthened, and appropriately compensated when you join Liberty Mutual Insurance as a part of our Contact Center Sales Organization. Bring your unique talents to our Fortune 100 company and receive paid-training, licensing in all 50 states, and a dynamic role that directs only warm leads your way (no cold calls) – because we believe in supporting your success, not holding it back. Join our team and realize the rewards of a career with unlimited earning potential, uncapped commissions, and a portfolio of benefits that start on day one.
You’d be a great fit if you are:
A Passionate Seller: When a lead comes in, you skillfully pick up the phone and use your sales expertise to turn prospects into happy, confident Liberty Mutual customers.
A Front Lines Liaison: You rise to the role of representing the Liberty brand, you believe in what you’re selling, and you enjoy connecting customers to the right products for their individual needs.
A Reliable Teammate: Whether you work at the office or from home, you adapt well to different environments, schedules, and the varying needs of our customers.
A Customer-Centric Closer: While “sales” is in your title, integrity is in your nature. That means you sincerely care that customers get exactly the quality products and services they need to embrace today and confidently pursue tomorrow
At least 1 year of experience in sales and customer service
An engaging, outgoing personality and passion for helping customers
Ability to communicate well to both prospects and customers
Excellent analytical, decision-making and organizational skills
Strong typing capabilities and PC proficiency
Must have ability to communicate written and verbally in English and Spanish

Description & Requirements: MBCard Account Executives are at the forefront of our organization. They are the individuals that have helped MBCard become a leader for cash discount processing. Because of our explosive growth, we are seeking proven, successful sales people for numerous business-to-business sales positions. These individuals possess an entrepreneurial mindset and prefer working comfortably and efficiently from home. They offer a unique and developed skillset that has created success in business, relationships and other endeavors, and are looking to create more pathways to that success. Someone who sees the bigger picture and understands the substantial long term value of continuous, passive residual income.This role will acquire new merchant business partners through prospecting, cold calling, and building networking relationships with associations, chambers of commerce, bank partners, board members and decision makers. We offer very high split for a highly capable individual, and all the business resources and infrastructure from training to closing, and provides substantial residual income. It's a fully functioning business with no start up cost, a vehicle in need of a driver.This is a commission only position.MBCard Account Executives enjoy: · A very real opportunity to acquire wealth and advance your career· Training videos with in-depth, comprehensive training (6-week course)· A financially sound payments leader committed to integrity and transparency· A family atmosphere where employees are cared for and valued· Entrepreneurial approach to the business based on technologyJob ResponsibilitiesAs an Account Executive with MBCard, you will identify customer needs in terms of electronic payment processing services and suggest MBCard’s solutions that best meet their business needs.Develop and maintain strong business relationships with business owners in your area or anywhere in the US starting with small to medium-size businesses and working your way up to larger businesses.· Collaborates with your Sales Manager to prepare and present competitive sales proposals.· Work closely with the MBCard teams and its processors to help your customers.Job Requirements: · At least 2 years of business-to-business (B2B) experience preferred. Experienced merchant service rep’s welcome!· Proven outside or field sales experience with a track record of hitting or exceeding sales goals.· Ability to self-source your own leads through a combination of cold calling, networking, advertising etc..· Excellent verbal, written, interpersonal, relationship building and presentation skills.· Strong work ethic with a drive to excel.· Experience in merchant services or payment processing is beneficial, but not essential.· Executive level marketing and sales, debt collector or collections related, and real estate experience are exceedingly helpful and preferential.· Self Employed/Contractor/Business OwnerBenefitsAt MBCard, we offer a superior opportunity massive growth potential! We provide sales training videos to get you up and running within days, extensive support and comprehensive training, so our Account Executives can hit the ground running and continue to succeed. Our unique offering gives Account Executives an edge in the field that our competitors lack with support and pay well ahead of anything done in this industry to date.Additional benefits for the Account Executive include:· Strong commission plans in the credit card processing industry; uncapped earnings with upfront cash incentives· Monthly production bonus and quota bonus· Superior online management tools including CRM and virtual office environment for client account management· Recession-proof, growing industryTake control of your future and build your own book of business and get paid what you are work.Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, ContractPay: $75,000.00 - $200,000.00 per yearThis is a commission only position.Job Types: Full-time, Part-timePay: $75,000.00 - $150,000.00 per yearSupplemental Pay:Commission payExperience:B2B Sales Experience: 5 years (Required)Education:Bachelor's (Preferred)Work Location:Fully RemoteHours per week:30-39Company's website:https://mbcarddifference.com/reps/COVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processVirtual meetings

Outside Sales Job DescriptionJob title:  Business Development ManagerBase Salary: Starting at $50,000Commission Expectation: $20,000 to $40,000 is the expectation, however the sales structure is uncapped.Overview:  Our growing company is seeking an ambitious, high energy, outside sales professional to acquire new business accounts. Successful candidates will focus on outbound, proactive outreach to attorneys, paralegals, and legal practice managers, and will include following up on leads, activating new customers, and staying current with trends in the healthcare and legal industries. If you are an experienced salesperson with a desire to work with a great team at a fast-growing, highly respected company, we would like to hear from you.About the Company:  AccuMed Healthcare Research provides transparent data on local healthcare costs to personal injury attorneys across the country. This detailed analysis provides both plaintiff and defense attorneys with evidential information that helps them settle their cases. AccuMed has identified a legal niche that provides services that no other company in the country has created. We have over 200 clients across 26 states and have grown our revenue over 50% per year. The services that we provide look at both the cost for future surgeries as well as analyzing past medical bills. Our new sales hire will focus on our Future Needs product.Job Responsibilities: · Learn the about the legal process and when AccuMed gets involved in a case· Understand how attorneys currently get estimates for future medical surgeries· Document all sales processes through the Pipedrive CRM· Build a network of attorneys through networking, conferences, cold calls, warm calls, and emails· Understand our Future Needs report and every piece of information contained in it· Learn what goes into building our reports and how our Operations team produces them· Meet monthly sales goals and expectations· Maintain company culture and values while selling· Understand sales cycles and what our clients’ expectations are after they purchase our product· Grow our presence through other attorneys in the firm through introductions and referralsQualifications: · Minimum 2-3 years of successful, outside sales experience· Background in the legal industry – helpful but not necessary· Demonstrated success at meeting and exceeding sales goals· Confident with a sale focused on data and services· Self-motivated, organized, confident, high-energy work ethic· Excellent communication and interpersonal skills· No fear of cold calls and contacting potential clients· Reliable, personable, conscientious team playerLocation:  Southeastern United States preferredJob Type: Full-timePay: $70,000.00 - $90,000.00 per yearBenefits:Dental insuranceFlexible scheduleHealth insurancePaid time offVision insuranceSchedule:10 hour shiftMonday to FridaySupplemental Pay:Commission payEducation:Bachelor's (Preferred)Experience:Sales Experience: 2 years (Required)License/Certification:Driver's License (Required)Work Location:Multiple locationsPaid Training:YesManagement:Key LeaderThis Company Describes Its Culture as:Aggressive -- competitive and growth-orientedOutcome-oriented -- results-focused with strong performance cultureStable -- traditional, stable, strong processesPeople-oriented -- supportive and fairness-focusedTeam-oriented -- cooperative and collaborativeCompany's website:www.accumedintel.comBenefit Conditions:Only full-time employees eligibleWork Remotely:YesCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview process

Text: Ready to join the Filterbuy team? Filterbuy is a family-owned company and have been for THREE generations! Filterbuy is seeking a motivated, self-driven individual as Territory Sales Representative to increase new account sales in a protected local market territory. As an Territory Sales Representative, you will grow existing accounts, identify new opportunities and follow up on potential leads utilizing an award-winning sales process.As an Inside Sales team member, you’ll receive industry leading paid training, salary + commission, excellent benefits, unlimited earning potential, and the chance to be part of a winning, supportive culture. We treat our employees like family too!Diversity:  At Filterbuy, you’ll find an environment packed with different cultures, personalities, and backgrounds because we know it takes many kinds of people to make us successful.Work-Life balance:  At Filterbuy, we believe promoting a healthy work/life balance is one of the keys to success at home and work.Company Overview: Filterbuy is a leader in the air filter industry. About Guaranteed Rate Companies:
The Guaranteed Rate Companies, which includes Guaranteed Rate Inc., Guaranteed Rate Affinity, LLC, and Proper Rate, LLC, has more than 8,000 employees in over 700 offices across the U.S. Headquartered in Chicago, Guaranteed Rate Inc. is one of the largest retail mortgage lenders in the United States funding $37 billion in 2019. Founded in 2000 and licensed in all 50 states and Washington, D.C., Guaranteed Rate Companies has helped homeowners nationwide with home purchase loans and refinances. The company has established itself as an industry leader by introducing innovative technology, offering low rates and delivering unparalleled customer service. 2017 marked the launch of Guaranteed Rate Affinity, LLC, a mortgage origination joint venture between Guaranteed Rate, Inc. and Realogy Holdings Corp. (NYSE: RLGY), a global leader in residential real estate franchising and brokerage. In 2020, the company launched Proper Rate, LLC, a mortgage origination joint venture between Guaranteed Rate and @properties, one of the nation's largest residential brokerage firms. Collectively, the companies have earned honors and awards including: HousingWire ’s 2020 Tech100 award for the company’s industry-leading FlashClose SM technology; Top Lender for Online Service for 2018 by U.S. News & World Report ; No. 3 ranking in Scotsman Guide 's Top Retail Mortgage Lenders 2019; Top Lender 2016, 2017 and 2018 by Chicago Agent Magazine ; Chicago Tribune 's Top Workplaces list for seven consecutive years; and Best Online Mortgage Lender, Best Mortgage Lender for VA loans and Best Conventional Mortgage Lender by NerdWallet in 2019. Visit rate.com for more information.

Would you like to grow your career and help build an amazing team?

Are you feeling supported at your current company? Do you have the ability to grow your career and increase your earning potential? At Guaranteed Rate we believe investing in our employees and creating new opportunities to help grow your career. Our leadership will help guide you and ensure you have the tools and technologies to succeed. We value our employees and believe in the culture we created. Are you ready to change the mortgage industry!

About the role:
You will work closely with our Loan Officers to ensure a timely and accurate experience for our clients, from first time home buyers to refinancers throughout the entire mortgage process. As a loan processor you will help customer Scheduling and tracking of closing dates, contingency dates and loan lock expirations.

Review loan approvals and address all conditions required for underwriting and closing.

You will receive on-going, comprehensive training and become an expert on home loan products and the mortgage process. Prepare and submit timely and accurate loan files to the Closing Department. Use state of the art technology to manage your loan pipeline as well as conduct credit and underwriting analysis.

Best of all you will provide world-class customer service and respectful, consultative guidance to your clients.

We're excited about you if you have:
Must have 3+ years of processing experience.

Must know guidelines.

Jumbo loan experience.

Experience using Fannie Mae’s Desktop Underwriter and Freddie Mac’s Loan Prospector.

Excellent disposition, mindset, communication skills and work ethic.

Ability to multi-task with strong attention to detail while meeting deadlines in a fast-paced environment.

Strong listening, problem solving skills and out of box thinking.

An inherent love of and desire to serve clients and create something unique and fantastic.

A commitment to integrity and customer service.

Guaranteed Rate is an Equal Opportunity Employer that welcomes and encourages all applicants to apply regardless of age, race, sex, religion, color, national origin, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital or parental status, ancestry, citizenship status, pregnancy or other reason protected by law.

JobTitle: Executive Account Manager - Inside Sales Representative
Text:
Overview:

We are seeking a driven candidate to join IST Management's marketing team at our corporate headquarters as Executive Account Manager - Inside Sales . The Executive Account Manager is mainly responsible for prospecting and nurturing sales leads in order to help facilitate our continued growth. Ideal candidates for the Executive Account Manager will have around 1 year of experience in inside sales and be ready to grow in their career!

Who We Are
IST Management is a business process outsourcing company. We have over 1,800 employees and have been in business for over 23 years, with operations in over 50 cities across the U.S. IST Management is one of the fastest-growing e-Discovery and facilities management companies in the U.S. We’ve been honored as one of the Nation’s Best & Brightest Companies to Work For, awarded the HR Professional Excellence Award from the Society for Human Resource Management, and we’ve made the INC 5000 list. We’re a proud partner of the Military Spouse Employment Partnership through our nation’s Department of Defense, and have committed to Hiring Our Heroes mission to hire 100,000 active and former service members.

We pride ourselves on commitment to excellence for our clients, the passion we put into our work each day, and upward mobility for our talented front line employees.

You can check out istmanagement.com for more info on us!

Benefits Include: Medical, Dental, Vision, STD, LTD, Life, 401k, Paid Time Off, and Bonus Incentives!

Compensation: The base compensation for this role is 16.83 USD per hour, with additional income through bonus incentives. For each lead resulting in a first appointment with one of our sales representatives, the Executive Account Manager will receive of a bonus of 250.00 USD. For each lead resulting in a B2B contract with IST Management, the Executive Account Manager will receive a bonus of 2500.00 USD.

Schedule: Schedule will vary between regular business hours Monday - Friday, usually 9am to 6pm. Overtime eligible. While this position is based out of our corporate office in Atlanta, GA, a remote or partially remote work schedule may also be permitted.
Responsibilities:
Adhere to communication plans with supervisors to ensure goals are met, and contribute to IST Management's growth through supporting our sales team
Prequalify leads via email – no cold calling required!
1 to 1 email contacts, press kit mailings and following up at intervals with clients
Maintain a high level of contact volume in order to pass qualified leads to senior sales team
Accomplisheone-on-one nurturing and determine if leads merit assigning a senior sales team member
Educate and develop prospects
Work with sales and marketing teams and leadership to execute strategy for regional sales growth
Maintain leads and ongoing reporting within CRM
Develop and continuously improve business processes
Tasks as assigned
Qualifications:
Proven ability to use excellent written and verbal communication and best practices when interacting with customers is required
1+ years of experience in inside sales
Willingness to work varied shifts
Ability to establish rapport and transfer warmed leads to outside sales for closing
Strong analytical skills
Ability to work with little or no supervision
Diploma or GED equivalent

IST provides reasonable accommodations to individuals with a disability in accordance with applicable law in both the application and employment stages. If you require any accommodation in completing your application for employment, please inform the National Director of Talent Acquisition, Sydney Ayers, by following this link http://www.istmanagement.com/talent-acquisition-team.html for direct contact information.

Our Remote Call Center Agents are at the core of our virtual services business. Our agents serve as liaisons between our company, our partners, clients, and ultimately the customer. A successful agent must possess a multitude of traits and accept ownership for simultaneously providing support to both clients and their customer's issues, complaints, and inquiries while keeping client satisfaction at the core of every decision and behavior.

 General Responsibilities
Serve on the front lines of customer experience.
Interact with customers via phone, focusing on questions related to client-related products and services.
Provide consistent, high-quality support to all customers
Research, navigate, and locate answers to customer questions and concerns.
Leverage client website, internal web-based knowledge service, system tools, and other resources to independently respond to inquiries
Document all calls, detailed resolution, and follow up to actions.
Provide status updates to customers calling after the initial request for assistance was processed.
Responding to billing clarification as well as claim status questions and inquiries
Facilitate three-way conferencing and scheduling between customers and service providers.
Place outbound calls to a list of client service providers to secure appropriate resolution.
Possible outbound calls to the client, client’s customers, and/or client account representatives for status and clarification purposes
Transfer inbound calls or outbound calls to other client-designated internal support departments or client account representatives
Outbound coordination to client’s service providers & possible follow up calls for clarification and/or additional calls for secondary services.
Requirements
A high school degree
Eligible to work in the United States
Previous experience in a customer support role, preferably retail, sales, or call center.
Track record of exceeding quotas and baseline metrics.
Strong phone and verbal communication skills along with active listening
Customer focus and adaptability to different personality types
Ability to multitask, set priorities and manage time effectively
All agents are hourly paid 1099 contractors with pay rates based upon the client Opportunity you choose to serve. Visit our website for more details and the hiring process. Regardless of the client, there is an expectation of professionalism, and personal responsibility from each CSP for KPIs established as a part of the client contracts.

Customer Success Associates (CSA) work closely and collaborate with Customer Success Managers to strategically target opportunities for growth within the PipelineDeals customer base. The CSA will develop a deep knowledge of the accounts they support, as well as their business needs, to drive revenue growth for PipelineDeals.

Our Customer Service hours are 5am to 5pm Pacific Time, Monday through Friday. This role will work a 8 hours per day Monday through Friday within those hours. We are a 100% remote office. We are looking to hire one person who is already located in one of the following US states: CO, GA, IL, MN, NC, OH, PA, SD, TN, WA or WY. Because we take the time to thoughtfully review all applicants, we ask several required questions during the initial application process. We'll select those who are the closest fit for our interview process via Zoom.

Responsibilities:

Serve as the primary interface to manage and resolve any critical situations
Work closely with the Customer Support Managers to build your pipeline and strategically expand customer accounts
Make outbound calls and emails to you SMB customer base
Recognize growth opportunities within client accounts, identify and qualify key decision makers, and provide training and condensed EBRs to SMB accounts
Work with a strong sense of urgency to meet and exceed daily/monthly expansion/churn Key Performance Indicators
Use usage patterns to gain insights, provide guidance and increase customer satisfaction
Exceed all performance targets, including maintaining high renewal percentage for your key customers


Requirements:

Previous customer success experience and/or customer support in the Software as a Service industry
Ability to build credibility and trust by understanding and addressing customer requirements
Must be dependable, outgoing, positive and work well in a team environment.
Strong communication skills (written, verbal, presentation), with the ability to explain technical subjects to non-technical end user personnel
Ability to build a solid rapport and develop professional relationships with customers and colleagues
Creative and well-reasoned problem solver with a demonstrated ability to think on your feet
Experience with Customer Relationship Management (CRM)
Familiarity with help desk tools like HelpScout

At Liberty Mutual, our purpose is to help people embrace today and confidently pursue tomorrow. That’s why we provide an environment focused on openness, inclusion, trust and respect. Here, you’ll discover our expansive range of roles, and a workplace where we aim to help turn your passion into a rewarding profession.
Liberty Mutual has proudly been recognized as a “Great Place to Work” by Great Place to Work® US for the past several years. We were also selected as one of the “100 Best Places to Work in IT” on IDG’s Insider Pro and Computerworld’s 2020 list. For many years running, we have been named by Forbes as one of America’s Best Employers for Women and one of America’s Best Employers for New Graduates—as well as one of America’s Best Employers for Diversity. To learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion please visit: https://jobs.libertymutualgroup.com/diversity-inclusion
We value your hard work, integrity and commitment to make things better, and we put people first by offering you benefits that support your life and well-being. To learn more about our benefit offerings please visit: https://LMI.co/Benefits
Liberty Mutual is an equal opportunity employer. We will not tolerate discrimination on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, age, disability, veteran’s status, pregnancy, genetic information or on any basis prohibited by federal, state or local law.
As an Inside Sales Agent you will be handling inbound calls and warm transfers driven in by other Liberty Mutual Agents. You will consult customers on their insurance needs and match the correct coverages, products and benefits to convert leads into customers. As you quote and bind policies for customers on the behalf of other Liberty Mutual Agents you will be building a relationship with both customers and internal agents.
Pay Details:
$45,700 - $46,700 base
Uncapped Monthly Sales Incentive with average monthly range of $500-$1500
Total Average Earnings:50k-$65k (first year)
Schedule Details:
We are offering work from home options along with traditional in office positions depending on location.
We offer Remote Inside Sales positions in 16 states- AL, AZ, CO, FL, GA, ID, KS, MN, NC, NV, OK, OR, TX, UT, VA, WA. Please visit our website to apply to an opening in one of these other states: https://jobs.libertymutualgroup.com/careers/css/inside-sales/
During the first 6-8 weeks of training, your schedule will be Mon-Fri, (9-5:30pm CT).
During the subsequent a 8 weeks of onboarding, you schedule will remain the same.
After onboarding is completed and you transition to your regular position, your schedule will start between the hours of 12:00pm and 2:30p. Weekend shift starting times typically vary between 10:00am and 1:00pm (based on your assigned site’s hours of operations). One weekend day (Saturday or Sunday) will be required with an alternate day off mid-week every other week.
You can expect to work this schedule for a minimum of 9 months before consideration for another shift.
Why Liberty Mutual?
Positivity. Flexibility. Determination and a persuasive personality. Qualities like these cannot be taught. But they can be sharpened, strengthened, and appropriately compensated when you join Liberty Mutual Insurance as a part of our Contact Center Sales Organization. Bring your unique talents to our Fortune 100 company and receive paid-training, licensing in all 50 states, and a dynamic role that directs only warm leads your way (no cold calls) – because we believe in supporting your success, not holding it back. Join our team and realize the rewards of a career with unlimited earning potential, uncapped commissions, and a portfolio of benefits that start on day one.
You’d be a great fit if you are:
A Passionate Seller: When a lead comes in, you skillfully pick up the phone and use your sales expertise to turn prospects into happy, confident Liberty Mutual customers.
A Front Lines Liaison: You rise to the role of representing the Liberty brand, you believe in what you’re selling, and you enjoy connecting customers to the right products for their individual needs.
A Reliable Teammate: Whether you work at the office or from home, you adapt well to different environments, schedules, and the varying needs of our customers.
A Customer-Centric Closer: While “sales” is in your title, integrity is in your nature. That means you sincerely care that customers get exactly the quality products and services they need to embrace today and confidently pursue tomorrow
At least 1 year of experience in sales and customer service
An engaging, outgoing personality and passion for helping customers
Ability to communicate well to both prospects and customers
Excellent analytical, decision-making and organizational skills
Strong typing capabilities and PC proficiency

Discover Your Career at Emory University:

Emory University is a leading research university that fosters excellence and attracts world-class talent to innovate today and prepare leaders for the future. We welcome candidates who can contribute to the diversity and excellence of our academic community.
Description:

JOB DESCRIPTION:
**This is for a three-year residency program.**
Conducts clinical physics and dosimetry training rotations designed to support radiotherapy patient care and the quality assurance program within the institution.
Attends didactic courses and seminars designed to further educate and enhance the clinical rotations.
Learns the practice and responsibilities of a board certified medical physicist.
Gains practical knowledge and skills regarding electron, photon, and neutron radiation transport, particularly as related to dosimetry protocols, shielding design, and computer dose algorithms.
Gains practical knowledge and skills regarding treatment planning computers, both software and hardware.
Gains practical knowledge and skills regarding linear accelerators, teletherapy units, and their accessories.
Gains practical knowledge and skills regarding treatment planning, simulation, and treatment techniques.
Gains practical knowledge and skills regarding nuclear instrumentation, radiation monitors, dosimetry equipment (particularly ionization chambers, film, and thermoluminescent dosimeters), and automatic data acquisition systems.
Gains practical knowledge and skills regarding quality assurance of radiotherapy equipment.
Gains practical knowledge and skills regarding radioactive sources used for brachytherapy.
Gains practical knowledge and skills regarding brachytherapy devices such as manual and remote afterloaders.
Gains practical knowledge and skills regarding radiation safety applied to radiotherapy and general hospital environment.
Performs related responsibilities as assigned.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
A master's degree in Medical Physics or related field of study.
NOTE: Position tasks are generally required to be performed in-person at an Emory University location. Remote work from home day options may be granted at department discretion. Emory reserves the right to change remote work status with notice to employee.

We have relationships with attorneys and other providers, which can serve as a network to effectively manage your personal injury patients.Furthermore, we are attuned to the nuanced nature of personal injury and understand the physician/attorney relationships in the markets in which we operate. Description
About this role
Hello there!
We’re Aladdin WealthTech. We are a FinTech company with a start-up vibe but some big-time resources. We are part of BlackRock, the largest asset manager on the planet … that is also a $1B annual revenue enterprise software company. We create products that help financial advisors and their clients build financial plans and portfolios to achieve some of life’s most important moments: buying a home, sending your kids to college and retirement. We believe in the power of BlackRock’s world-class portfolio analytics AND the importance of the human connection between advisor and client.
We are looking for an experienced UX/UI designer to lead design on a high-growth product area: SMA (separately managed accounts) and Model Portfolios. You may have heard about BlackRock’s acquisition of Aperio, a Bay area leader in SMAs. Our belief is that the SMA space is an area full of potential to be disrupted by world-class design, service and technology. We are looking for a designer interested in the opportunity to lead design for our product team tackling the SMA/models market.
This is a hands-on designer role: you will be a hands-on designer for some projects, partnering with product management to craft product roadmaps and define future product directions, working with engineering and product management to realize designs, working with other designers in the Aladdin WealthTech team to improve the craft and process of design @ BlackRock.
You will be joining a product team with a start-up feel and a global impact. Aladdin Wealth provides wealth managers with an integrated suite of experiences for users that range from front-line financial advisors to the Chief Investment Officer at the home-office. You will be working with some of the original pioneers of SMA and model products inside BlackRock, financial service veterans and newcomers from technology companies, large and small. We work hard, enjoy each other’s company during and after work and are passionate about the potential of our technology to improve financial outcomes for clients. We like our mash-up of finTech start-up and market-leading financial services company … and we think that you might like it, too!
Interested in learning more? Reach out to our recruiting team and let’s get to know each other!
Location: San Francisco (SoMa), Princeton (NJ), NY (Mid-town Manhattan) or Atlanta. Our teams are currently working remote through at least March 2021. We expect our future to be a hybrid office/work from home mix.
What you will be doing:
Lead product design for an emerging product family focused on SMAs + model portfolios.
Be a partner with your peers in product management and engineering to craft a product roadmap for BlackRock’s SMA and model portfolio products, own the health of the experience and create the environment and processes for great designs to come to life in our released products.
Be a hands-on designer for SMA + model portfolio projects, ranging from UX to UI design.
Be a key contributor to the definition of a design system across Aladdin Wealth, working with designers in Aladdin WealthTech and the Aladdin Product Group.
Be an expert on trends in wealth management product design … and to bring that expertise into the craft of creating Aladdin WealthTech product designs and our product roadmaps.
What we’re looking for:
6+ years’ experience as a product designer of software applications (web, preferably)
2+ years mentoring and coaching designers
Experience across multiple release cycles leading product design for a complex product; including representing design as part of a triad (design, development + product management) and coordinating the work of multiple designers
Experience as a design lead in scrums and agile projects
Experience integrating user feedback in the design process and across multiple product releases
Exceptional UX design skills combined with strong UI design skills. You are as comfortable and proficient designing experiences for complex user journeys as you are sweating the details on visual hierarchy and flow
Highly proficient in design delivery tools and workflows, including Sketch, Abstract and InVision
Exceptional communication skills with a proven ability to work down, across and up
An interest in wealth management and investing
BS/BFA degree in human-computer interaction, visual communication or a related field
A strong portfolio of creative product design solutions to complex problems
What we would prefer (think rainbow unicorns):
Prior experience creating products in the wealth management space, with a track-record of designing innovative solutions that improve business and portfolio outcomes for financial advisors and help investors achieve their financial goals
Experience working with and evolving design systems used across a product family
Experience designing products that are part of complex user journeys and working on problems that involve service design
Our benefits

To help you stay energized, engaged and inspired, we offer a wide range of benefits including a strong retirement plan, tuition reimbursement, comprehensive healthcare, support for working parents and Flexible Time Off (FTO) so you can relax, recharge and be there for the people you care about.
About BlackRock
BlackRock's purpose is to help more and more people experience financial well-being. As a fiduciary to investors and a leading provider of financial technology, we help millions of people build savings that serve them throughout their lives by making investing easier and more affordable.

BlackRock is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, and other statuses protected by law.
BlackRock will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records in a manner consistent with the requirements of the law, including any applicable fair chance law.

JobTitle: Finance and Commercial Transactions Paralegal (Remote Considered)
Text:
Latitude is seeking a paralegal with finance and commercial transactions experience, especially preparing, filing and reviewing liens and UCC Article 9 filings, for a full-time, long-term engagement with a large law firm. The position will initially be remote, but the candidate will ideally be based in Atlanta; Houston, Washington, DC and New York will be considered.
4+ years experience in a large corporate law firm or sophisticated boutique firm is required, as is prior experience preparing and making commercial and secured transaction filings. This engagement is full-time.
Minimum Qualifications for the Finance and Commercial Transactions Paralegal Position
4+ years as a paralegal at a well-respected full-service law firm or sophisticated boutique firm
Prior preparing and making filings in support of commercial and financial transactions, including liens and UCC Article 9 filings is desired
Am Law 100 experience is a plus
Experience with a variety of financial and commercial transactions is a plus
Stellar organizational skills
Outstanding attention to detail
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Successful experience working independently and with a team
Licensed to practice law and in good standing
Outstanding references are required

Position Details of the Finance and Commercial Transactions Paralegal Position
Type of role: Engagement (W2 employment with Latitude serving on a contract assignment with a global law firm)
Schedule: Full-Time
Location: Remote
Compensation & Benefits: Highly competitive and commensurate with experience

Confidentiality
Latitude will not disclose your identity or propose you to prospective clients without your prior consent. Candidates selected for further consideration will be contacted.
Only qualified applicants should apply.
About Latitude
Latitude offers life-changing engagements and permanent positions with companies and law firms to outstanding attorneys and paralegals.
Latitude Engagements
Great attorneys and paralegals looking for contract engagements or consulting roles choose to work with Latitude due to our law firm-level compensation and benefits, sophisticated and engaging work, a chance to work with great clients and peers, and a refreshing blend of freedom with self-designed boundaries.
Our attorneys and paralegals have the level of skill, experience, and judgment as would be expected in a permanent corporate counsel or law firm paralegal, and the versatility to step into challenging environments and hit the ground running. If you have the right skills, personality and experience, Latitude helps you do what you are good at in a more rewarding way.
Latitude attorneys and paralegals serve on a full- or part-time engagement basis, and work remotely or on-site at the client office.
While we are able to work only with a select few of the most outstanding candidates, our customized approach results in a high success rate for those candidates we choose to recommend.
For more information about Latitude, please visit us at https://latitudelegal.com.
LATGA

Overview of Position
The Digital Patient Experience Sales Executive has a unique opportunity to join a fast-paced start-up like team that is backed by Change Healthcare leadership. This individual should be a self-starter with an appetite to be the subject matter expert- not only of the Connected Consumer Health solutions but also digital patient experience industry trends. Experience with consultative sales and educating clients on emerging trends and evolving business models is a must.
What will be my duties and responsibilities in this job?
Sourcing and identifying opportunities to sell solutions into net new and/or existing customers in assigned geographic territory.
Making initial contact with prospective clients and managing customer relationships until execution of contract. Develop and initiate new business growth plans, managing customer relationships from prospecting to execution of contract.
Conducting sales presentations and demos
Collaborating with other sales channels and account management serving as subject matter expert
Collaborate, coordinate, and communicate across all disciplines and departments as well as all levels of decision-makers (departmental and C-Suite)
What are the requirements needed for this position?
Bachelor’s Degree or related equivalent experience
Minimum of 8 years value-based Healthcare IT Sales Experience
Experience selling into Hospitals, Health Systems, Providers, Payers, Physician Groups.
Digital Patient Technology Sales Experience in the areas of Revenue Cycle Management, Patient Access, Marketing, Pre-Collections, Medical Price Transparency, Patient Scheduling/Patient Check in and/or Collections
EMR Sales experience is a plus
Demonstrated sales track record, new sales track record & proven quota performance.
Experience prospecting new business opportunities, new market development, retention and upselling existing clients
What other skills/experience would be helpful to have?
Proven track record of new business sales acumen (hunter vs. farmer) with ability to develop integrated solutions based on contract offerings and client needs.
Experience selling SAAS solutions in Healthcare
Experience delivering engaging product demonstrations and drive thought leadership discussions to prospects ranging from Director level to SVP/C-Suite
Experience working in a team selling environment (specialists, account management, etc.)
Experience with Strategic Enterprise sales cycles as well as driving land and expand sales strategies to shorten sales timelines
Proficiency with account planning, territory management, generating leads and providing timely and accurate revenue forecasting.
What are the working conditions and physical requirements of this job?
General office demands
How much should I expect to travel?
Willingness and ability to travel up to 50% of the time / Current State: We are all working virtually. This is a remote/virtual position.
Territory: TBD
Employees in roles that require travel will need to be able to qualify for a company credit card or be able to use their own personal credit card for travel expenses and submit for reimbursement.

Itential provides powerful multi-domain network automation software to companies worldwide, from Fortune 500 telecommunications and financial service companies to enterprises of all sizes. We are committed to building world-class products that accelerate the move toward software-driven networks and next generation, agile network operations. Our corporate headquarters are in Atlanta with additional offices in the UK and we are growing fast!
Itential is looking to add a Technical Trainer and Course Developer. This will be a hybrid role with the selected individual serving as the primary instructor for remote and in person classes delivered to our customers and partners. This person will also assist with the design and development of e-learning and ILT courses. The successful candidate will be technically adept and an experienced trainer who enjoys learning new technologies and delights in teaching others about them.
Responsibilities and Duties:
Serve as Itential’s primary classroom and remote delivery technical instructor
Partner with Itential’s Documentation and Training team members to design, develop and implement e-learning and ILT technical courses that support our customers’ learning requirements.
Partner with Itential’s Technical Training Engineers to support the design, development and implementation of virtual training labs
Collaborate with Itential’s Marketing organization in the delivery of technical webinars to support and promote sales enablement
Collaborate with Itential’s Product Management and Engineering Teams to identify key use cases for new product or software version releases that should be highlighted across the training curriculum for course delivery to customers and partners
Develop and maintain an annual budget for training development and related materials to support in-person and remote course deliveries
Function as an Itential Academy Technical Advisor and Itential Subject Matter Expert (SME) to customers, partners and employees
Qualifications and Skills:
7+ years of direct experience as an instructor or classroom facilitator delivering complex technical courses. Experience in delivering networking or software scripting focused courses highly desired
Excellent presentation skills across broad audiences
Solid understanding of modeling languages such as JSON, YANG, YAML and XML
Familiarity with Virtualization, ITSM, CI/CD, configuration management and other emerging automation technologies
Familiarity with a mix of cloud, datacenter/wireless networking and virtualization solutions in the marketplace such as:
Public Cloud Platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform, etc.)
SD-WAN Technologies (Meraki, Velocloud, Fortinet, etc.
Data Center Technologies (Cisco ACI, VMware NSX-T etc.)
Network Applications (F5 Load balancers, Palo Alto Firewalls, NGFW, etc.)
Automation and DevOps tools (Ansible,Terraform, GIT, etc.)
Container Technology (Docker, Kubernetes, ECS, EKS, Fargate, etc.)
Hands on experience with course development software such as Articulate Storyline, Adobe Captivate or Tech Smith Camtasia.
Good organizational and time management skills
Enthusiastic self-starter with eagerness to continuously research and learn about new enterprise networking concepts and technologies
Willingness to travel up to 30% (per CDC Guidelines), with ability to work remotely
Location:
Primary location is Atlanta, GA, but remote applicants within the US will be considered. The Atlanta headquarters has not reopened and local candidates will not be required to come into the office immediately.
Benefits and Perks:
A 401(k) plan, partially matched by Itential
Excellent medical, dental, and vision coverage
Flexible work time to promote a healthy work-life balance
Career growth and a friendly office culture
Volunteer and community engagement opportunities
Find out more at www.itential.com
This is a direct hire position. No third parties, staffing agencies, or recruiters accepted. No S-Corp or Corp-to-Corp.

About Latitude
Latitude offers life-changing engagements and permanent positions with companies and law firms to outstanding attorneys and paralegals.
Latitude Engagements
Great attorneys and paralegals looking for contract engagements or consulting roles choose to work with Latitude due to our law firm-level compensation and benefits, sophisticated and engaging work, a chance to work with great clients and peers, and a refreshing blend of freedom with self-designed boundaries.
Our attorneys and paralegals have the level of skill, experience, and judgment as would be expected in a permanent corporate counsel or law firm attorney, and the versatility to step into challenging environments and hit the ground running. If you have the right skills, personality and experience, Latitude helps you do what you are good at in a more rewarding way.
Latitude attorneys and paralegals serve on a full- or part-time engagement basis, and work remotely or on-site at the client office.
While we are able to work only with a select few of the most outstanding candidates, our customized approach results in a high success rate for those candidates we choose to recommend.
Permanent Positions
Great attorneys and paralegals who are seeking permanent positions choose to work with Latitude because of our deep market knowledge, career advocacy and extensive client base. Our own practice experience and client relationships enable us to effectively tailor our candidate proposals to the specific practice strengths and interpersonal attributes that matter most to our clients and to match our candidates with the opportunities that will be most fulfilling to them.
For more information about Latitude, please visit us at https://latitudelegal.com.

JobTitle: Product Line Manager - Tanzu App Services - Opportunity for Working Remotely Atlanta, GA
Text:
Ready to build? So are we. Come join VMware’s new and exciting Modern Applications Business Unit (MAPBU) team, made up of products and services under the Tanzu portfolio to help customers build, run, and manage their most important applications. We build VMware Tanzu Application Service (TAS), which is used by many of the world’s largest companies.
Tight feedback loops drive our processes. We value test-driven development, pair programming, retrospectives, continuous integration, data-informed decision making, and working at a sustainable pace. We nurture psychological safety within teams and empower them to drive the changes necessary to obtain successful outcomes. We build software and solve problems collaboratively. Teammates are always accessible to lend a helping hand. The TAS teams are distributed around the US and Canada and try to overlap their hours of work between 9-3 PST to ensure in-person and real-time communication.
About You
As a Product Manager of the Tanzu Application Service, you will be responsible for a product that’s purpose-built for developers to boost feature velocity and for operations teams to deliver world-class uptime. You have seen the power of empowered, balanced teams and believe in Outcomes over Output. You have strong product instincts, but more importantly have an appreciation for and understanding of data-informed decision making, lean startup, agile and user-centered design values, principles, and practices. You are excited by the user and business value that technology can unlock. You thrive in a complex ecosystem, collecting, sharing, and synthesizing input from many directions and enabling the teams that you work with to continuously deliver customer value. You believe in doing the right thing and doing what works. To learn more about Tanzu watch this video. #TeamTanzu
Interested? Here is what we look for:
Excited to build developer-focused tooling that streamlines the software deployment process, enabling enterprises to focus on their core business.
A strong collaborator who actively fosters safe and inclusive teams. You enjoy mentoring others as much as you like learning from them.
You work well with others to jointly define and drive product strategy, vision and roadmap while evangelizing to internal stakeholders, partners and users of our product.
You are well versed in methods to discover customer problems and create valuable, desirable and feasible solutions.
You enjoy writing user stories and helping the dev team prioritize the backlog in order to continuously deliver measurable value towards the vision with your team.
You are excited to innovate and iterate on agile PM processes.
You are excited to engage with customers and the larger open source community of users.
The following are attributes we see in successful candidates, but they are not “requirements.” You are strongly encouraged to apply even if you don’t tick all the boxes because we want to hear from you and learn about what you can bring to the role:
5+ years of Product Management experience, especially with large scale, distributed products.
Previous experience in a Release Management role.
Ability to break down technically complex customer needs into simple solutions.
Strong leadership and communication skills and the ability to teach others.
Focused on data-driven approaches to solving problems, and accelerating the learning process to validate solutions.
Ability to collaborate well with engineers, designers, and other partners.
Experience with Lean and User-Centered Design methodologies.
Experience with agile development methodology, ideally Extreme Programming.
Understanding of the IT operations or software development space with a passion for understanding the life of Enterprise IT Operators and Application Developers.
Experience working on enterprise software is a plus. Experience with Kubernetes, Cloud Foundry and platform automation is a plus.
Experience with our technologies and processes is a plus (Ruby, Go, Kubernetes, Cloud Foundry, Linux systems, Agile, TDD, XP).
Professional experience with relevant domains, such as distributed systems, API design, and release engineering and automation practices.
Interested in working in diverse and highly collaborative environments.
Past contribution to thriving open source communities.
Familiarity with common development tools/stacks, such as Unix, command-line interfaces, and CI/CD.
This position is eligible for JoinTeamTanzu referral campaign

Discover Your Career at Emory University:

Emory University is a leading research university that fosters excellence and attracts world-class talent to innovate today and prepare leaders for the future. We welcome candidates who can contribute to the diversity and excellence of our academic community.
Description:

Research in the Hecker laboratory is broadly focused on lung injury-repair responses related to fibrotic and acute lung injury in the following areas: (1) understanding how normal physiologic repair responses “go awry” in aging, (2) how this contributes to the pathogenesis of age-dependent lung diseases, and (3) the development of novel treatments that target age-associated pathological mechanisms to ultimately promote repair. The ideal candidate is a highly motivated individual that wants to join a team-oriented lab carrying out research in these areas.
JOB DESCRIPTION:
The Associate Academic Research Scientist performs a wide range of highly technical and complex research duties and has documented scientific achievements and increasing technical, management, leadership, and professional expertise necessary to advance basic and/or translational research programs.
Demonstrated knowledge of research and experimental platforms for analyzing, design and interpreting results Investigates and recommends potential alternative approaches to improve the quality of results of basic and/or translational research.
Demonstrates increased responsibility through management of teams and leadership of scientific projects by applying advanced knowledge, skills, and input necessary for protocol development, as well as facilitating in some training aspects of other team members.
Aids in writing IACUC, IRB, Biosafety and other approval documents.
Oversees quality assurance of research conducted by other team members.
May assist in grant and other funding applications as necessary and appropriate, or with approval of the responsible faculty director, may have their own research projects and/or have full responsibilities for specific areas of instrumentation or methodology development and user support.
With the approval of the responsible faculty director, may be principal investigators on funded proposals.
Performs other responsibilities as required.
Conduct research in molecular, cellular, and/or biochemical experimental biology including: PCR, protein analyses (western blotting, protein purification), cell culture, ELISA and genetic manipulation of cell lines to modify endogenous proteins or introduce modified proteins.
Prepare technical reports and recommendations based upon research outcomes
Intellectually and technically drive research efforts by developing, optimizing and executing cellular, biochemical, immunological, and molecular assays to meet project objectives.
Troubleshoot protocols, adapt new protocols and probe the scientific literature to identify new assays as needed.
Assist with supervising undergraduate students in the lab.
Maintain detailed records of studies conducted, organize data and prepare data for manuscript

submissions
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
PhD or MD and five years of professional level experience OR Master's degree and ten years of professional level experience in a technical or research lab.
Laboratory experience will be based on area of assignment.
Internship experience or experience prior to attaining the qualifying degree is not considered eligible work experience for this job classification.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Significant prior experience with cellular/molecular biology and biochemical assay techniques will be needed.
The ideal candidate will help to intellectually and technically drive projects, can troubleshoot effectively, and can work independently with minimal supervision and as part of the team.
Able to solve problems and make decisions.
Very high level of experience with cellular/molecular biology and biochemical assay techniques.
Follow protocols and function with minimal supervision
Effective work and communication with group members in a dynamic and fast paced environment to accomplish goals
Team player with the ability to thrive in a fast paced, multi-disciplinary environment.
Learns fast, grasps the "essence" and can change course quickly when needed
NOTE: Applicants applying with a M.D. or equivalent degree must be eligible for a Georgia medical license to meet the minimum qualifications.
NOTE: Position tasks are generally required to be performed in-person at an Emory University location. Remote work from home day options may be granted at department discretion. Emory reserves the right to change remote work status with notice to employee.

JobTitle: Product Manager - App Stack Platform - Opportunity for Working Remotely Atlanta, GA
Text:
VMware is looking for a Product Manager to join Tanzu and the Modern Applications Platform Business Unit (MAPBU) product team. VMware customers are increasingly deploying containers as the foundation of their application modernization efforts. The MAPBU team delivers best-in-class enterprise cloud-native solutions – supporting container frameworks such as Kubernetes.
This Tanzu team is chartered with providing application teams with a “native” Kubernetes experience that complements our existing Tanzu App Service (TAS) offering. They are a fast-paced, startup-like team where you will have the opportunity to make meaningful contributions to the product roadmap while developing skills in cutting-edge technologies. You will be part of an action-oriented team that has a culture of open communication, empowerment, innovation, teamwork, and customer success. We are looking for someone with a strong technical background to help define and evangelize the core capabilities of our next-generation app development and operations solution.
Given the current state of the program, we are looking for Product Manager’s that thrive and excel in the early phases of product definition, are not scared of large, complex problems, are truly passionate about users (developers & platform teams), knowledgeable about the Kubernetes ecosystem (or willing to learn!) and work well in fast-moving, quick-adjusting, and collaborative environments.
Job Role and Responsibilities:
As a Product Manager, you are a member of the Product team and in charge of product definition, roadmap, and direction of a specific area of the Tanzu feature set. You will work cross-functionally with user experience, engineering, and open source communities to create innovative solutions that build on top of a healthy ecosystem of internal and OSS tools.
You will be responsible for customer and market research that you will use to define the strategy for your area of responsibility and present that strategy to internal stakeholders and customers.
Working collaboratively with engineering to execute on the product roadmap through proper prioritization.
You will work to bring the customer and their needs closer to the development team through research, customer engagements, and involving customers in the incremental progress of the development team.
 Partnering with users, customers, and account teams to facilitate successful customer proof of concept deployments.
You will present technical presentations to customers, partners, and the field, and also gather feedback to influence product and solution offerings.

Required Skills:
 Able to breakdown complex problems into simple solutions
Obsess with customers, users, and their needs
Passionate technologists, ready to evangelize within and outside of VMware, not scared of going deep and broad and straddle OSS and commercial worlds
Positive attitude and strong team players
Strong communications skills
Some experience as a systems engineer, product manager, technical product marketing, technical marketing or experience working in a customer environment as a practitioner.
Experience working with and understanding the needs of enterprise IT executives, CIOs, system administrators, and cloud infrastructure providers
Good technical skills and comfortable in front of internal solutions architects, customers, and partners
Understanding of agile software development methodologies and tools.
Strong propensity to drive for results as part of a high performing team
Willingness to travel approximately 10% of the time
Experience working with Kubernetes and its ecosystem a plus
Hands-on development experience with distributed application concepts, SaaS and SysAdmin/DevOps tools a plus
Applying
If you are interested (or would like to nominate someone else), please fill out the application here. We believe diversity is important at all levels. We encourage everyone who is interested in the role to apply! #teamtanzu
